Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourism”
Reviews.Author: szynka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is full of tourists. No fancy business environment. The location is just great. With Hollywood Blvd around the corner, Kodak Theater in close walking distance and easy access to many attractions. We upgraded our room to window view of the Hollywood sign at the reception at extra cost. The sign is quite far away and may not be visible on a foggy day. There is Starbucks in the lobby and good life music in the evening. Generally the hotel is OK, not much more, but I gave it a 5 because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; cold, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: graftongirl
Reviews.Content: Family with two young men(16, 22) wanted a centralized location for sightseeing opportunities. Although the hotel rooms were clean, but nothing out of the ordinary and we received an upgrade to a junior suite( no real suite, just a bigger room), I found the attitude of staff members to be cold and unhelpful. Moreover, the lobby tries too hard to be what it isn't, namely the center of Hollywood and plays grating, monotonous music at all times. Not worth the money. The close-by attractions are rather honky tonk and seedy. My husband prevented my 16 year old son from being accosted by some creeps as they walked out of a souvenir shop across from the Grauman Theatre. I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “No Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: Israel C
Reviews.Content: $12.95 for an internet connection, including for Marriott Elite Members. Any hotel that is still charging for an internet connection is just nickel and diming their customers. Even mom and pop hotels offer them for free now and those who don't are simply in it for more profit, and not to provide value to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kansri
Reviews.Content: it was our first trip to Hollywood and we stayed at Renaissance. Its located next to some of the most interesting and popular sightseeing places for LA like Ripleys, Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame. the rooms facing the main street have a good view of the Hollywood sign. Overall a good above average experience..could do better with its breakfast room...and choices.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mc141663
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the heart of many Hollywood attractions and we could see the Hollywood sign from our window. Our room was alright, but nothing special, just a typical hotel room. It was a little dusty. It was a good choice to stay there as it was close to the Kodak Theater and the Hollywood walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sammy_p82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the renaissance (Hollywood) for 11 days and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is in a great location, right next to the Kodak theater and in the heart of Hollywood. The staff were also very pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood chic / Hollywood dirty”
Reviews.Author: floricuse
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in Hollywood. Large, comfortable, chic rooms...lobby / bar area is also abuzz with lots of people milling around / enjoying cocktails, etc. Unfortunately, the actual area around the hotel is still a tourist trap and still kind of grungy...hasn't really changed in years. However, no complaints at all about hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleM50
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting L.A so we decided to choose a hotel where we would be within walking distance to the major sights on Hollywood Boulevard - and we were! This hotel has access to the Hollywood highland centre, a few minutes away are the metro, a bus stop, the Kodak theatre, Grauman's chinese theatre and Hard Rock Cafe. We arrived at our hotel well before the check in time, it was around 9.30 am and we were given our room immediately. The check in process was so quick, the staff are friendly. They have Chilled Fruity water in the reception area, which is nice after a long flight from Australia! Our room had two queen beds and an excellent view of the Hollywood sign and LA city. the bed and pillows were very comfortable, the room was spacious, had a flat screen tv and a sitting area. There is a pool which was heated. We got a great deal for this hotel on Hotel Club website. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at its finest.”
Reviews.Author: Timmeronline
Reviews.Content: After spending some time in sleepy Santa Monica and Venice Beach, Hollywood was like stepping into a different world. Although it was my first time, I think I couldn't have had a better introduction to Hollywood than in the Renaissance. A few extra bucks gave me the view of Hollywood Boulevard and the hotel is practically part of the Kodak Theatre and its massive mall around it. In front of the hotel are the stars of Michael Jackson, Steven Spielberg and Charlie sheen. Soon after 10 PM the place transforms yet again into a party heaven with limo's and lots of VIPs everywhere. Couldn't recommend it more for a good Hollywood time.

Reviews.Title: “a lot of oscar going on”
Reviews.Author: RnWSydney
Reviews.Content: Well this is the closest marriott hotel to main hollywood area. If you want to know about the king room is depend on what you paid for, very nice service i can check-in 12pm noon. As the room ready maybe because i get the low floor and the cheapest one. The view is nothing but the pilar and back building of Kodak theater. The Bathroom is quite old, so is the room, thats why they called it renaissance. I would love to stay here again because its just so close to everything. During our stay a lot of Oscar prep going on in and outside the hotel, because its just next door KODAK theater you can access from level 3. On the main street which is hollywood blvd, its just so busy you will find a lot of entertainment such us Museum, Madame Tussaud, etc. Even the supermarket, its so cheap i cannot believe it. But the Pharmacy is open till late some 24 hours, and they sell Alcohol Drinks, otherwise they cannot survive.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Samuel O
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is simply the best. I travel to California for business in regular bases. I've stayed in different hotels prior to the Renaissance Hollywood, however this new experience changed everything and it increased my level of expectations for the hotels I have yet to stay in the near future thought the world. From the moment I arrived until checkout, I can only describe the Renaissance Hollywood and its staff as First Class and a Five Stars hotel. My first interaction with the front desk personal was delightful and unforgettable. I have yet to experience the level of professionalism received from the two very polite, helpful and caring receptionists, Ms. Aricele (pardon if I misspelled the name) and Mr. Kyle. Ms. Aricele has the best attitude for the industry, a great personality with a welcoming smile. No matter how late or how tired you are when you check in to the hotel, after your interaction with Ms. Aricele, you will be certain that you will experience a very pleasant stay. In addition to Ms. Aricele being the best, all staff members are very polite and happy to assist and answer any questions you might have. At the concierge desk, I was able to obtain a wealth of information about restaurants popular destinations, in addition to the many facilities the hotel has to offer. The hotel itself is modern, very clean and it has all the amenities you would need without leaving the premises. Its location is perfect for every occasion. With all the amenities the hotel has to offer, in my opinion what really makes the difference and a memorable experience, is the extraordinary customer service skills received specifically by Ms. Aricele but all staff members are DELIGHTED TO ASSIST. For most travelers, the service you receive from the staff, being attendant to in a timely manner, the welcoming smile is the finishing touch and the icing on the cake. Thank you for making that a reality. Room Tip: The rooms in the higher floor allow you to view the beautiful architecture of the inside of the building, it is amazing. There are many elevators which allow the traffic to flow easily without delays.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Central”
Reviews.Author: cookers96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Renaissance Hollywood the week before the Oscars. There was a definite buzz in the air. We were around the corner from the Kodak Theater, and preparations were underway. This was the middle of kitschy Hollywood, with Ripley's and Grauman's nearby. It was a fun place to visit - trendy by night and touristy by day. The hotel was modern and pleasant with a nice bar. I felt a bit out of fashion with my New England style barn jacket amid all the black clothing and skinny jeans tucked into boots. I'll have to upgrade my wardrobe next time I stay! All in all, a good experience. I'd definitely go back if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best location if staying in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MarcotheRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Hands down,the best location if you need to stay in Hollywood. The shopping center is connected to the hotel. I had a room with a view of the Hollywood sign. It was nice having a Hertz car rental on site. I took a taxi from LAX, and rented a car on the day of my check-out, and they allowed me to return the car to LAX at no extra charge. This saved me some money on parking, as I didn't really need my car once I got to the hotel. As I mentioned earlier, a lot of offices and attractions are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun Here!”
Reviews.Author: rtdFirenze_Italy
Reviews.Content: This is a first for us....Hollywood. Sure it is a bit crazy and lots of people, but in a strange way it represents Americana and the cinema world and as such it is an amusing place to visit....at least once! We arrived early on Sunday and were able to check into our room courtesy of a wonderful young man at the front desk Alex. He did something special for us when he found out we were on the Executive Level BUT near the elevators (which we really do not like). He said "wait a few moments" did some kind of magic and before we know it we are happily in a gorgeous suite with wrap around windows all sides, corner room, and HUGE! separate, kitchen, dining table, living room, etc., but all open and furnished in 1930's Movie Style. Really a very nice surprise and greatly appreciated. The food in the lounge for breakfast is wonderful and we stopped in for some tea early afternoon and they even had some food then for munchies, but the things for the 5-7:30 portion are not very nice at all. Potato Chips and peanuts and cheese with rasperry jam and Macaroni and Cheese! Odd really. Saw that they had a very nice honesty bar set up though. The Navigator (Concierge) here is very good, got us dinner/lunch reservations and suggestions in the Beverly Hills area easily and we found on our own a WONDERFUL place to hike to the top for the vista looking down on this city. It is Runyan Canyon and is less than l km behind the hotel and an easy walk. The only downside is that dogs are allowed to run leash free and if this is a problem, save your walking for other areas. We always seek out something in every area that is a bit of a challenge since we enjoy outdoor activity and walking alot. The hotel itself as others have pointed out is situated in the best location for being here. But it is quiet in the rooms. If you have never been here and have the need or desire to visit Hollywood, this is the place for sure. We have been treated very well at all times. Housekeeping is efficient and there is turn down in the PM.There is a small gym which could use a little improvement, several pieces of equipment were not working and the weights are outside by the pool. Speaking of that, there is a nice pool area with some cabanas. Would recommend this if you have children/grandchildren who wish to visit Hollywood or perhaps just two BIG KIDS who decide to have a little fun once in a while!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: jemandy
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance, staff at checkin were very helpful and we were upgraded to a nice room with club lounge access - which we found very handy, unfortunately - I am sure this must have been an isolated case -I was bitten by either bed bugs or fleas on the first night - I have no other explanation for all the bites I received on my arm, shoulder and leg, it was not pleasant. Location of this hotel on Hollywood Boulevard is great - we stayed there on the weekend of the Grammy Awards with large party's being held in the reception area on the Saturday night there was no problem with noise or inconvenience - this hotel very handy to all the tourist attractions with the subway right next door. Hertz rent a car agency next to the lobby was also handy. The chilled water in the reception is a nice touch but unfortunate it disappeared on the weekend.. we still enjoyed our stay, but I would perhaps think twice about staying there again given the bites I received.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill C
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a four day trip with my three college roommates. We were celebrating turning 50 and hadn't had a girls' weekend in six years. From beginning to end, this hotel did not disappoint. Granted, I am a Platinum Elite member, but every staff member we interacted with went above and beyond. In addition, it is very conveniently located. We had a wonderful view of the Hollywood sign. The beds are very comfortable and the room was clean. I highly recommend staying at is hotel and look forward to staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bacong F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. One of my favorite hotel Brands to stay at. It has never disappoint. Came here to be close to the shopping, restaurants, and the night club. You can walk back to your hotel after a late night party. During the weekends there are a people dressed up as characters to take pictures with kids/tourists on Hollywood Blvd. Please tip them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hollywood Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRAZY4TRIP
Reviews.Content: Hotel is next to Hollywood attractions and happenings. Hotel has hollywood vibe. You can walk to different attractions. Enjoy food, take pictures with Hollywood Characters, watch a movie at Mann Chinese theatre. If you are lucky you can get a room with a view of 'Hollywood' sign. Room decor was eclectic and adequate. Check out the nite lites, very soothing. Everything at the hotel was great except 'check-in'. Felt a bit snobbish reception. Maybe it is something to do with Hollywood location. Definetly can improve on that. Valet were great in prompt service and direction help

Reviews.Title: “Wooww”
Reviews.Author: JORGE5854
Reviews.Content: I loved being here one week before the Academy Award took place. I saw how everything was changing in the area and I was feeling the "heat" of the Award as they were getting closer. I was checked in by Araceli (GREAT!!!) she made us feel at home and to all our questions, there was not even a hesitation. She said YES. My mom was vsiting from Argentina and I was taking seom time off at work so I really felt special. They have a great Starbucks in the Lobby (Since we all love it..!) Parking was expensive, but we had the option of self parking for $ 10.00 a day, a great deal, just next to the hotel. The Concierge was really helpull and assit us in getting around and even mention places we shoud stay away from. I will be back very soon. THANKS to MARRIOTT once again for not letting me down. My mom was thrilled and that is the bottom line!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sight-Seeing Spot”
Reviews.Author: TravelSecrets78
Reviews.Content: I am mostly here for big corporate events and find the hotel staff to be very helpful. I also like this location for the sight-seeing options that don't require getting in the car and looking for parking. Also, if you don't have a car it's central to many of the spots that cab fare won't be so bad, especially if you weigh the hefty parking fees that come with the hotel.... and it is so easy to get lost in that parking garage! I guess what I'm saying is that usually I say you need a car when in LA, but at this hotel you could get by without one. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance or a short cab ride, tons of shopping and theaters. Also, close to the Hollywood Bowl. The lobby bar is a fun meet-up spot and you never know who you might see!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to See All the Sights!”
Reviews.Author: hangdog
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at The Renaissance Hollywood the week before the Oscars. The primary reason for our trip was college visits but the first few days were sightseeing and the Renaissance couldn't have been better! I booked my stay using Marriott Rewards Points and I couldn't have been treated better. Check in was quick and friendly and we got a great room on the 16th floor with a view of the city and the Hollywood sign. The valet was superb. They said to call 10 minutes ahead of time but we probably went to the lobby after 5 and the car was waiting for us. Friendly service with offers for directions each time. Be forewarned, valet parking is a steep $29 per night, but you do get unlimited in and out privileges. We ordered room service for dinner the first night as we had a 14 hour travel day from the east coast. Normally I don't care for room service food but both meals were outstanding. Our food was delivered promptly and the gentleman who delivered it was so friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast at the buffet in the restaurant. The full buffet was about $27 per person but we were so full we were able to make it through to dinner. The omelettes were the best I've ever had. Light and fluffy! The service was great. Oth days. I'm a tea drinker and usually I have to beg for a second cup of tea but here I got my own pot of water and a nice selection of teas. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the LA area. It was convenient to everything we wanted to do. Rodeo Drive was only about 10 minutes away. Same with Warner Bros studios in Burbank. Even the drive out to the PCH was easy. I can't think of a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Jillypepper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Renaissance for one night during the week of Feb 20th. The front desk staff is very friendly, accomodating & professional. The same for any housekeeping or maintenance workers who might be walking through the hotel. The pool overlooks the Hollywood sign as well as the heart of Hollywood --it is a great pool deck. As Platinum members, we were able to access the concierge lounge. The food was pretty good but the staff in this concierge lounge is arrogant. We felt uncomfortable approaching them about refilling the EMPTY COFFEE in the morning and the night before, my kids wanted to ask if there were any more chocolate chip cookies and milk but they felt uncomfortable asking the gentleman sitting at the desk who had his head buried in a newspaper. We were there around 7:30 so it wasn't like they were about to close. We normally feel comfortable when we go to a concierge lounge at Marriott but we did not feel this way at all at this one -- the staff there did not smile at all. Not a deal-breaker for us but definitely not in line with our other experiences with other Marriotts. We love to stay at this hotel when we have to spend the night in the LA area so we will still return. It is a very clean, attractive hotel with easy access to restaurants and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but not very family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: ABUPALACESUCKS
Reviews.Content: This Renaissance Hotel is in a great location right in the middle of Hollywood. It is very noisy and the location is not very friendly family after dark. Parking is very expensive. The staff and management of the hotel are top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not for those who like peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: psycprof97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and in a great location for shopping, dining, and sightseeing in general. Many things are within walking distance. The hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was nice and clean. Parking is quite expensive to valet but only $10 per night in the garage next door. This is reasonable by Los Angeles standards. We did so much sightseeing that we got back to the room very hungry at 11pm. Fortunately, room service was still available. Although there were plenty of choices on the room service menu, the prices were expectedly high for what we were getting. Additionally, there was a $3.00 delivery fee as well as a 17% room service charge in addition to the food and sales tax. This is good to know before you order if you are on a budget. The most negative thing about this hotel is that it is literally feet away from a very busy street. In fact, if the windows opened, I could have thrown a ball across the street from our room and I am not a gifted athlete! The problem with this is that we could hear horns honking, sirens from emergency vehicles, and other traffic related noises all night. Speaking of emergency vehicles, I had no idea there could be that many emergencies all night long. It is too bad they can't pick up this hotel and move it several hundred yards away from the street. My verdict: stay here if you get a good deal but bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: housekeeping30
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and was disappointed somewhat. Place was packed and full of teenagers and not the hip cool location we thought. The lobby is nice as is the pool area (though no where near big enoigh for the size of this hotel), had a great view from the executive level. The lobby was always busy and check out a nightmare, no breakfast for Marriott Gold only a coffee coupon for a starbucks. Had a party going on the room next door at 3 am-walls very thin, sounded like 10 kids had polled their money to stay here-security was there however promptly and dealt with the situation. The location is in the heart of things, however very touristy and feel there are better parts of LA to be-though some may like the tackiness of it all....... For the price thought it was an overrated property and would stay elsewhere next time, really felt like just a number there, lots of bling little substance

Reviews.Title: “Better than you said”
Reviews.Author: terrychinohills
Reviews.Content: I read your reviews-Great Location- Super Clean Room- King size bed with extra pillows was like sleeping on clouds- View from room 1514 was great! It was overlooking Hollywood/Highland ,swimming pool , Kodak Theater, Los Angeles etc. We were far from the elevators so it was very quiet. Staff surprised us with champagne and chocolate for my husband's birthday.That was a nice surprise! Breakfast buffet had a lot of healthy options and the regular breakfast foods. Attentive staff all over the hotel. I'm looking forward to my next time here.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient if you are interested in the extreme tourist experience around Graumans and Kodak theaters. Hotel itself is lovely and quiet. Very large windows offering views of LA. Marriott beds (need I say more?). Flat screens. Staff is very effective.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Freije
Reviews.Content: Checked in early without any hassle, and they upgraded me to an executive suite, which I think was really a larger room with a sofa. I thought it was very nice, great view of the Hollywood sign. Connected to a decent outdoor mall, which made finding something other than hotel food a snap. If you're a Marriott Elite member, the lounge is nice,breakfast there was as good as anything you could get inside the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location In The Heart Of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MichelleWill
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Renaissance was my first ever trip to California and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The rooms were clean and spacious and featured modern, new (comfortable) furniture and decor. Comfortable bed with a not too firm/not too soft mattress - with plenty of pillows. Amazing views from the windows - which covered the entire wall. (even great views of the Hollywood sign) Wifi ($12.95/24hrs) was reliable and fast. iPod dock on alarm clock, plenty of plug ins on lamps, etc. The location is simply the best. It's literally right next to the corner of Hollywood & Highland. (and all of the attractions like the walk of fame, kodak theatre, grauman's chinese theatre, etc). So you are smack in the heart of the energy and excitement. There's a CVS just a few blocks down and also a gas station right next door. There are plenty of cheap places to eat and drink near the hotel if you're looking to save some extra money. So much to do within walking distance. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond to make you feel comfortable and welcome. I needed to FedEx some things back home and the front desk helped me out without batting an eyelash. Magnificent room service. Everything I ordered over the three days was beyond all expectations. Delicious, fast, and VERY reasonable for room service at such a great hotel. In a nutshell: Friendly staff, beautiful room, excellent food, convenient location, amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself and feel a star!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Bren_248
Reviews.Content: First trip to celebrate youngest daughters 21st, second trip because we loved the first! Staff are friendly and helpful without making you feel they need to be tipped for looking at you. If on a budget this hotel is still worth booking if you check the deals. Rooftop pool a big bonus. If bored with shopping and Hollywood, Runyon Park is less than 15 minutes walk and the views are worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Totham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central to Hollywood within a short stroll to Chinese Theatre where tour and public buses leave, shops and restaurants.We had a club room on 19th floor with views of Hollywood sign. Spacious, with comfortable beds and excellent club breakfast room facility on same floor- recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in a busy location”
Reviews.Author: cujo31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for several days for a conference with about 450 of my "closest friends". I am a Marriott gold but don't think that had any influence on the great treatment I got during my stay. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The food at our meeting was really good - I have been going to these kinds of meetings for years and this is truly the first time I can honestly say that! The meeting facilities were nice and the hotel staff there also genuinely nice, helpful. There is a small concierge lounge on an upper floor for a quiet evening beverage and snack, once again the woman managing that lounge was very gracious. The hotel is "connected" to a small shopping mall and just through the mall you will find yourself amidst the crazy Hollywood Blvd area. It is jam-packed with tourists and, well I would call them oddballs, that roam the streets in costume or passing out CDs or selling tours. It is a cacaphony of everything Hollywood represents. I guess everyone has to experience it once. ?? There are any number of restaurants within a couple minute walk from the hotel, as well as a CVS drug with a Fresh and Easy grocery next door, aabout a 5 minute walk. Spa Luce was nice, not spectacular. The hotel has a small fitness center and a rooftop pool with food service. My only complaint was with the elevators that I think are possessed. They never seemed to do what you wanted them to do. They often completely skipped your floor and when a light would go on above one, indicating it was going to stop on your floor, it would never show up. A small detail but probably made the folks not with our group want to kill us when 400 of us would need to go to our rooms at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel, Nice Rooms although Bathrooms could use some work, great pool although gym had no weight or resistance machines. Great free M&M's in the Lobby. I would reccomend staying here if you want to be in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Squish0904
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, it is in the perfect location to see and enjoy Hollywood and it is right next to the subway stop to get to Universal. This is my new favorite LA property.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeanneEM
Reviews.Content: Felt very special staying at th Renaissance. Loved the fact that we could see the Hollywood Sign from our motel room. The location was perfect - very close walking distance to the "Hollywood Stars", Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Hard Rock Cafe. Lots of cheaper food options available close by. Close to all of the tours etc.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and still great, highly recommended..”
Reviews.Author: Zeus30167
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel from the 2nd Jan 2012 to the 7 Jan 2012 and it is still great everything from the location to staff make this a must stay hotel in the Hollywood area. We hired a car and the valet parking staff were very helpful with directions and free bottled water for the trip. The hotel is situated right next door to the Kodak theatre and Hollywood Boulevarde so a quick walk took you to the action. The rooms are large, very clean and comfy. The bar staff deserve a pat on the back they are so friendly. We look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in LA”
Reviews.Author: TravelMatt27
Reviews.Content: I often go back to Los Angeles to continue my tattoo work and this hotel is located right in the heart of all the action. The rooms are great and views are even better. Especially on the upper levels. Restaurant is okay but there are so many choices right outside their doors in the Highland Complex. Can be a little bit pricey but its worth it for a great hotel in a great area!

Reviews.Title: “Hooray For Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Dstory
Reviews.Content: A very chic, modern hotel. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The room and ameniteis are first rate. The location is hard to beat, at this location is within walking distance of tourist attractions such as the Kodak Theater, Hollywood Highlands mall, the walk-of-fame, etc. Using public transportation to get aound is a breeze. The Metro Red Line is within walking distance (1 block). From there, you can hit other attractions along Hollywood Boulevard. If you are coming or going directly from LAX, take the FlyAway transport. For $7.00, you can ride from LAX to downtown Union Station and hop on the Red Line for $5.00. A great deal that is hard to beat!! The only down side to my experience was the amount of street noise (emergency vehicles and such). Other than that you will enjoy visit. PS eventhough there was some street noise, I had a great view of the Hollywood sign in the hills!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: BettyAbu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel recently for 2 nites. The best thing about this hotel is the great location. It is smack in the middle of the tourist attractions like the Kodak Theater, Hollywood Highland Mall and Walk of Fame. To get to the Universal Studio was very convenient too as we only had to take the metro which was 1 stop away. For Muslim travelers, there is one halal eating outlet that sells hotdog just across the street (same row with the metro station). I would highly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Jenjenkay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very conveniently to all things Hollywood. You can take the Red Line Metro up to Universal City Walk or to Downtown LA within minutes, beating the horrendous LA traffic. That being said, regardless of whether you fly into LAX or into Burbank, if you didn't rent a car, Taxis aren't cheap [then again, parking at this hotel isn't cheap either - you can park daily at the Hollywood/Highland parking structure for less - i think about $10 - but there's no in/out access]. The Super Shuttle generally makes a lot of stops, some of my guests took about 2 hours to get to the hotel from LAX to Hollywood. If you're looking to get to the beach, you can either drive, take a taxi [again, pretty costly], take a bus, or take the Hop on/Hop off tour bus [You have to take a transfer bus in Beverly Hills]. Having a meeting at the Renaissance was fantastic - work hard during the day, play hard during the evenings! It worked out to be the perfect balance!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms could use updating”
Reviews.Author: Pickles84
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great for tourists- it is next to the Hollywood Highland Mall, walk of fame, kodak theatre and the 1st hop on hop off bus stop. There is a metro station under the mall which makes the hotel only 1 stop away from Universal Studios aswell. I found the room itself to be noisy and a bit bland (everything was beige or light wood). After staying at the Renaissance in Times Square I had high hopes for this hotel and found it missed the mark. The first day we arrived our 'do not disturb' sign was missing, however as it was around lunchtime and the room had already been serviced, we didn't think there would be any disturbance and decided to take a nap after a late night followed by an early flight. We soon discovered that the walls were paper thin so we could hear people talking in the hall way and we also had three different staff knock on our door over the course of the afternoon (mini bar, house keeping and turn down service). We also couldn't work out whether it was the heating, aircraft or metro noise, but there was a noise that seemed to come and go every ten minutes no matter what time of the day or night. The staff we dealt with were all friendly and helpful and we found the check in/check out to be quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wenjj
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom room facing the Walk of Fame, very quiet 9th floor. The location was brilliant as we stepped out straight into the mall next to the Kodak Theatre, with the Hop 0n Hop Off buses right out the front as well and the subway station underneath us which was only 1 stop to Universal Studios, We would stay there again, very friendly helpful staff and great location. The only odd thing was the paper cups with the Coffee pod machine, I guess ok if you need to take your coffee with you however not OK if you drank tea and had to reuse the paper cups, we found this in all the hotels we stayed in during our stay in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: PFirst123
Reviews.Content: Good location: 1) if are visiting Hollywood for the first time 2) Near Universal Studio 3) Hertz is in the same building Other then that: 1) Front desk is very rude and unhelpful, unless you are Brad Pitt coming with Agelina Jolie. 2) The rooms are very tired and old, i think it requires refurbishment 3) The breakfast staff are very friendly and helpful, but food choice is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: travelsinger97
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here. Great location, just steps from Hollywood Blvd. Right next to the Kodak Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: david h
Reviews.Content: If Location is paramount then it may well be worth staying here as its a very nice hotel but be aware of: Low ceilings (6'8") on some rooms on the fifth floor and it was particularly small room. Internet charges of $12.95 for 24 hours seems exorbitant after the price you are paying for a room here. that apart we had a good two night stay here and the leisure facilities do make up fopr some of the negative points.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: durie
Reviews.Content: Visited here 2009, better late than never. Hotel location is in the heart of the city. Hubby forgot driving lience but this never stopped us traveling around LA on the buses or tubes, in fact it was the best way to get around and we felt very safe at all times, even though we come across a few characters : ) Venice beach was WOW and we visited Beverly Hills through a tour bus, we spent 5 days here and loved every minute. Hotel was clean and great views from our room. Only downside was our first night there and after being very tired from our 11hr flight from the UK we were woken by screaming teenagers having a party in the opposite room with blaring loud music. I called the front desk and security was called, things seem to calm down after a 15mins or so. All in all fab time .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: an amazing hotel right in the middle of it all. attached to the hollywood and highland center, adjacent to the kodak theater and around the corner from grauman's chinese theater. we stayed on the 19th floor, with amazing views of downtown LA, griffith park, and the hollywood sign. the service was wonderful. the rooms are modern, clean, large, and have floor to ceiling windows. it was a great value; especially as we were on the 'elite' floor, and we had access to the lounge, evening hors d'oeuvres, and free cooked breakfasts. i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: kamcarthur
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room on the 7th floor that had an amazing view of the Hollywood hills including the famous Hollywood sign. This was the best part of the room. We stayed in a king room with a pull-out bed. The king bed was very comfortable, but the pull out bed was substandard and the matress very old for the quality of the hotel. The staff is helpful and attentive, but they annoyingly call you every single time you request anything (such as towels or pillows) no matter what time of day or night. I realize they are trying to make sure they are providing service, but I found it bothersome. Also, they charge for EVERYTHING...which I always think is ironic for expensive hotels. You would think that for what they charge they could at least provide free WIFI. That is a very big negative for the hotel since it is 2012. The room was clean and roomy, but nothing spectacular. The decor was a bit drab. Overall I would say it's not really worth the price unless you are staying specifically for the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler87354
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here multiple times over recent years for business travel and have found the property adequate. While the physical property is clean and well-maintained, the overall experience leaves something to be desired. While some of the staff is attentive and professional, I can't say the same about the staff overall. Parking is also a challenge - there are only two options: either park yourself at a nearby public lot under a shopping mall, or valet-park. The public lot requires taking a series of elevators, escalators, and walkways to return to the hotel property, which is not ideal when you are travelling with a lot of luggage. The valet parking is not only expensive, but the service is unreliable, as it can sometimes take a while for the staff to retrieve a vehicle when they are busy. Another drawback is the location - it's essentially planted right next to a large shopping mall. It's also located near an entrance to the 101 freeway, so traffic outside the hotel can build up considerably during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Start”
Reviews.Author: carbonsa
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend the Renaissance Hollywood from a location point of view. However having reserved two rooms and after 4pm checking in didnt go as smoothly, as only one room was made available. We finally got the second room at 8pm which was exhausting after coming in from the UK (body clock 2am). However the manager (Alex) gave us an extension on our check out time. The hotel is clean, presentable and central to all attractions. The elderly chap Ron on the concierge was most helpful on giving advice to Universal Studios (he's a credit to the hotel). We didnt eat in the hotel restaurants but chose the Rolling Stone restaurant across from the hotel and California Pizza company. There are many eateries close by. Under the hotel is the Metro line which takes you straight to Universal Studio and for a 1.50cents one way, much much cheaper than a taxi. We also took 2 buses down to Santa Monica beach which made a pleasant change from the bustle of Sunset Boulevard, which was heaving most days. A small grumble, was there were no shower caps in the bathroom but other than this, the rooms were spacicous and clean. Staying at the Renaissance, you dont need a car to see LA which was our biggest concern as everything was accessible. We would definitely recommend the Renaissance again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with an amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Luvthatdogface
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night for two adults and two teens. We arrived in the evening and were given an upgrade to an Executive Suite. (My husband travels a lot and is elite with Marriott) When we walked in the room, we were stunned by the view. An entire wall was a window overlooking the Hollywood Hills! In the morning we were able to see that the iconic Hollywood sign was part of our amazing view! Considering we had the kids with us, we were very grateful for the extra room. There was a pull-out couch and we called for a roll-away that was promptly delivered. There was plenty of room for the additional bed in the room. The bathroom was very well set up. A dressing room was first complete with a vanity stool, sink and plenty of outlets! Then in another door was the shower/tub and toilet. With four people getting ready at the same time, this was perfect. We made use of the Concierge Lounge for breakfast. It was staffed by a lovely hostess who greeted us and welcomed us to the breakfast and went through what the lounge would offer throughout the day. She was very polite and polished and made a great first impression! The breakfast was very nice and got us off to a great start. Again, the view from the lounge is really lovely! After breakfast we went out and enjoyed the Hollywood Walk of Fame that is steps away from the hotel! We saw the sights for a bit and then had to be on our way to the airport. We stopped at the Starbucks in the lobby on the way out. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again! We usually stay out at the airport, but this was a welcome change and I think this will be our first choice in Los Angeles from now on! PS....every staff member, from the front desk on, was professional, polite and polished! Kudos to the manager at this property and all of the great folks who made our stay special!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbrock_21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family in late December and it was worth the money. It was really nice to be able to take the lift and walk around the corner and have restaurants and shops. After staying in budget hotels in other parts of the US it was our little bit of luxury. We had a double Queen bed room which was a great size. The staff were friendly especially the girls at the hotel bar at night. They gave us some great information and were happy to have a chat about things. As we didn't use our car while we were here we parked our car next door at the hollywood and highland centre which was heaps cheaper than the Valet parking. Oh and as my son said the bed was the best he had ever slept in, they were very nice ...

Reviews.Title: “Family loved hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely fantastic. So easy to access all tourist sights in Hollywood. Subway also close so good base for visiting other parts of LA. Kids loved the pool and being able to swim while seeing the Hollywood sign (from one side of the pool). Used the parking of the linked shopping mall which worked out cheaper than the valet parking even though it is necessary to pay for each entry/exit. Highly recommended for a visit to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay here but it was beautiful and can't beat the location. (April 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Good and conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaydreamin
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel located very close by to the walk of fame and hollywood boulevard, it is connected to the Hollywood Highland shopping mall. Takes just 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the shopping mall and walk of fame. As we arrived in the morning, there were no rooms available yet, however, the front desk staff advised that she will rush out the rooms and obtained our mobile phone number so that we could walk around while waiting for the rooms and they would call us when the rooms were ready. I requested for a room with a view and was given a room with partial views of the Hollywood sign and city view. The room was clean, well furnished and bed very comfortable. The hotel even had a navigator (just in front of the front desk) who will tell you how to get to certain places of interest and what buses to take. If you do not drive, it is very convenient to take bus no. 217, with the bus stop located just outside the Metro station to get to The Grove and Farmer's Market, which in my opinion is worth visiting. Check out was a breeze, and the front desk staff were friendly and charming. I will definately recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to stay at the Hollywood Boulevard area. A great location and the area around the hotel is safe to walk around at night as well as it is always busy, even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at Renaissance Hollywood last week. If you want to do the touristy stuff then it's in a fabulous location. It's right next to the Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood & Highland complex with heaps of shops and restaurants. Most of the tours depart half a block up from the hotel and the subway stop is right on the corner of Hollywood&Highland too so it's easy to get around (which was handy as I did not have a car). The hotel itself is huge, modern and clean. I got a room on the 18th floor with a view of the Hollywood sign and the hills. The room was a good size, very functional. The tv had plenty of free channels (I had read a review of someone saying there were no free channels on the tv which was completely incorrect). The bathroom was an Ok size, but the shower was over the bathtub. I had problems with the drainage in the bath/shower so that by the time I had finished washing my hair, the bath was half full with water as the drain was very slow - but it did eventually drain all out. The bed was very comfortable, but I had problems each morning with hearing noises from either the room above or the room next door - I couldn;t work out which. It sounded like someone walking in high heel shoes on tiles. This happened every morning around 6-6:30am and it went on for at least half an hour each time. This was annoying, although not really the fault of the hotel, although perhaps their walls are really thin. The check in & check out were very efficient and friendly, as were the "navigators" (concierge) who helped find supermarkets and laundries close by and even recommended a good bookshop within walking distance. The restaurant in the hotel (Twist) has reasonably priced breakfasts and they even let me substitute the bacon for fruit in my meal as I do not eat pig. Staff were very friendly. The room service was actually also reasonably priced too although the choices were not always that appealing. I also got a massage at the Spa (Spa Luce) that is part of the hotel. The cost seemed a little expensive - but I was on holiday so decided to go for it. It was enjoyable and relaxing and they try to make sure you are completely comfortable through the experience. The thing I loved the most about the hotel is the location though. There is so much to do close by, and if you want to travel a little further away, there is Hollywood Bowl, Universal Studios and Griffith Park all within about 10miles of the hotel. If you are more into Santa Monica or the beaches, then this hotel is probably not for you as it is a fair distance from them, but for my purposes it was fantastic and I loved the convenience of the location. The only "gripe" I have is that it costs $13 a day for internet. Yes I was a tourist, but I still want to have internet available to check up on things and to help with planning my days, so $13 a day was a bit steep considering many hotels now offer free internet. All in all I would definetely recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Tourist Epicenter”
Reviews.Author: sinaasappelsap
Reviews.Content: I tried to stay in downtown LA for a business trip, but everything was booked and I found decent enough rates here. The location is fine, near to the Metro, even though it is right in the thick of things at Hollywood and Highland (which could be a perk for some). The rooms were nice, as was the staff (except for one creepy guy cleaning the elevator who was a bit TOO friendly).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mariejolie
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best location to see Hollywood. We were in the middle of almost all of the attractions. The hotel itself was very clean and pleasant. We ate a great meal in the hotel restaurant which we were surprised was not better advertised. The hotel's directory stated that the restaurant closed after 2:00 but it was open during dinner. The staff of the hotel and restaurant were fabulous. Everyone was friendly and conscientious. We went during the second week of October. Our room had of view of the famous Hollywood sign which was really nice to see every day. the hotel pool was pleasant and warm so it was enjoyeable to swim even though it was sometimes a little cool outside. All in all, a really nice stay. I would absolutely come back to this hotel if we visited L.A. again!

Reviews.Title: “Safe option in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: El_Pago
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great and the rooms are not bad! However, i did have a few mishaps when visiting a while back. The wait at the check-in desk was way too long and frustrating. I understand that there are times when things get busy, but this was just out of the ordinary! We were very tired and just wanted to lie down! On top of that, we got into our room and realized that the mini bar had not been cleaned from the people before and there was left over food waiting for us in there! YUCK!! We reported this straight away and were not impressed. Later on that day the mini bar was cleaned and we were given a complimentary bottle of wine and a sorry letter. This little touch really meant a lot to us and totally made up for the inconvenience. The hotel is well maintained and is a good stay in the Hollywood area. The fruit water in the lobby was addictive and i would go all the way back to LA from Melbourne, Australia, just to have myself another cup!! I would recommend this hotel in Hollywood. It's a safe option and central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great views! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Vatechchef
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean and modern. Location is convenient and attached to Kodak and highlands mall. We got a room with great views of Hollywood sign and hills! Only con is expensive daily parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tuddys4
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in Hollywood. Right on the Kodak Theatres doorstep. Easy access to Hollywood Blvd. Rooms nice and big, only disappointment was the size of beds, possibly smaller than Australian double beds! Bathroom nice and big and everything clean. We did have a problem with our room safe, which we reported on the first day, but it was never fixed. It was also our daughters 12th birthday while we were there and we asked if they could do something special for her & we were told they would, nothing happened! Funny, this was the same lady who said they would fix our room safe! Overall would definitely stay here again if visiting LA!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room Service - Otherwise Great”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location. Neat view of the Hollywood and Highland Center from my room on the 14th floor. Less than a block away from the Kodak Theatre and Grauman's Chinese Theatres. Sleeping rooms have nice, modern decor; large flat screen TV with many channels; but awkward uncomfortable "armchair" (form instead of function). Room service selections for dinner were quite disappointing. Everything is a stretch, and not in the right direction. You can't get a normal club sandwich - you have to get a "Classic Club Sandwich" with avocado, marinated chicken breast, and a heavy garlic taste. Instead of a normal house salad, you're stuck with a "Potpourri Salad" that kind of tasted like the potpourri you put in your bathrooms. The pizzas are odd combinations, and not to my liking. Service itself was good, though. I have no problem staying here again, if this is the part of town where I need to be. I just wish they would do something about the food. I guess I'll have to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for our last 4 nights in LA. The check in process was nice and quick and the staff friendly. The first night the room next to us had a party and I could here everything through the walls. I had to call security to come and tell them to be quiet. They eventually left and it was quiet. That is is my only complaint, the walls are thin. Other then that the rooms are beautiful, and we had a gorgeous view of the LA city skyline and the Hollywood and Highland centre. We got the Escape package which included a bottle of champagne on arrival and chocolates, valet parking each day and buffet breakky each day. The valet staff were fantastic and quick and the buffet breakky was so yummy!! The staff in Twist Restuarant are very friendly. The hotel is right next door to the Hollywood and Higland centre. You don't really need a car as the train station is next door and buses out the front. We hired a car as we were going for a few drives, lucky we had valet parking included as the parking is extremely expensive. I think its around $25 a day. Overall I will stay here again but I would hope I have quiet neighbours. The staff were friendly and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rebbie14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in November. The hotel is excellent. It is right next door to the Hollywood and Highland centre which has many great reasonably priced restaurants and some shops. Close to the buses and train station. The rooms are big and very comfortable with plenty of storage space, a flat screen TV, mini-bar and safe. I had a view of the Hollywood sign. The bathroom is a good size and has good lighting. The buffet breakfast is great. The staff are very helpful. I will stay here again if I go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location if without car”
Reviews.Author: Ash756
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Location can't be beat, especially if you don't have a car - hop on/hop off bus stop right outside, as is local bus stop. The hotel is adjoined to a shopping mall (with many eateries) which is very convenient. No problem checking in at 8am, spacious and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: FairCityFrasie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days and nights, accompanied by my wife and son (8), to sample Hollywood for the first time. The choice of hotel was perfect...its joined on to the Kodak Theatre and next to the Gauman Chinese Theatre and heart of the Walk of Fame...and is in the centre of everything that's going down in Hollywood. Great thing is you can park your car (but you don't really need to have a car here) in the parking lot underneath the hotel and shopping mall and leave it until your ready to leave (10 Dollars per 24 hours). You can then walk to most things around Hollywood Boulevard and environs or otherwise grab the plentiful regular transport for Hollywood Sign (which you can see from the hotel), Hollywood Bowl, Beverly Hills Residences Tour or Sunset Strip and Universal Studios is a short taxi ride. Great thing is you can easily return to your room for respite, rest or to drop purchases. Plenty of good restaurants in the vicinity too. The hotel itself looks much grander than it actually is - its fresh and clean in general and bedroom was well serviced, equipped and had great views of the hollywood hills from our bedroom on 15th floor. It is a big hotel with excellent SPA facility and the outdoor swimming pool on fourth/fifth floor is open day and until late at night and overlooks the shopping mall. I would certainly recommend this place, particularly for the convenience, for a family, couple or group of friends visiting Hollywood for a few days - we paid 300 dollars total per night (B&B for all 3 of us)....not the cheapest but I thought it just about worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AnaBt
Reviews.Content: I have picked the hotel based on its location. It's on the Hollywood Bldv, in the Highland complex (shopping yey!), near Kodak Theather, Walk of Fame, Mdme Tussauds Wax Museum, Hard Rock CafÃ©, and not very far from Universal and Paramount Studios. However, at night it can look a bit weird with drunk people and liquor shops around the area (nothing too bad though). Rooms were spacious - I got standard room and it was good enough. I just didn't like the shower curtain (give me glass box!) and the water had no good pressure (not the best showering experience). Breakfast buffet was very good- it had a station were you could get your eggs, waffles and pancakes done in front of your eyes! Staff was friendly and helpful. For the 1st time in LA, I really liked this hotel, location saved me from the traffic jams! Maybe next time I'd pick another hotel, because now I don't need to explore Hollywood area that much, but I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bland”
Reviews.Author: drumaville
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like the Renaissance, but it was very average. The room was plain, the bathroom was a little Motel 6 with Aveda products. Great location and great staff, but not enough though for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing the Academy Awards, premiers or just visiting Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: rexaboyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all the amenities in a location adjacent to the Kodak Theater. There's shopping, restaurants and entertainment all in one block. The Hollywood Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theater and Madame Tussauds Wax Museum are all here, as well as sightseeing busses to the rest of Hollywood. Outside of the immediate area, it gets seedy pretty quickly but that's Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Contemporary & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: SWlawyer
Reviews.Content: I traveled to L.A. with adult family members. The hotel was very accommodating to us because we wanted rooms next to each other. They made it happen. The rooms were huge. We stayed on the 16th floor. The rooms were clean and decorated in a contemporary style, which I love. The location was perfect! It was connected to the Kodak Theater, down the street from the Hollywood Bowl, and parallel to Hollywood Blvd. And, the hotel is connected to an outdoors mall! Great restaurants in walking distance! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, friendly staff, clean and near Hollywood attractions”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last month on business trips to LA. The rooms are quite large (or perhaps just the upgraded rooms, but I was upgraded both visits) and the staff is friendly, helpful and nice. The hotel is near all of the Hollywood attractions and there are lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: mom2aredhead
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a whirlwind trip to Southern California and stayed here our first night. This was our "splurge" hotel for the trip. We wanted to do all of the touristy things in Hollywood without having to worry about what neighborhood we were staying in with 2 kids. In a word, this place was FABULOUS! The location cannot be beat, and was the main reason we chose it - nowhere else can you go down the elevator and be at the Kodak Theater and right in the heart of Hollywood and Highland. My advice when booking is to do your research - We booked a package that included parking and breakfast at Twist, which was an expansive buffet since it was a Sunday morning, for only $30 more than the AAA rate. The parking alone made the package worth it and the breakfast was delicious. The room was clean and had a "city view" which if you looked to the left included the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign. The beds and pillows were very comfy, and the room was bigger than I would have expected it to be for a hotel in the heart of the city. Now lets face it - we are a suburban family that included 2 kids vacationing in the heart of Hollywood, and I was a little concerned about how comfortable I would feel staying in the heart of glamorous Hollywood. The staff there is either very well trained, or are just really nice people - from the front desk to the valet guys they could not have been any nicer, more helpful, or pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Dermandtegs
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and facilities. Rite in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very very good”
Reviews.Author: jennyfury
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2011 for a work conference. I got a great deal and was surprised at how spacious and clean the room and bathroom were, and how well stocked the mini bar was. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the TV was also large. I had a view of the hollywood hills which was so great, it made all the difference. I found the staff very hospitable and although i didnt eat at the cafe, i heard that Blue Ribbon were setting the menu and i like Blue Ribbon menu's. The room had a bath, it was small but it was welcome after 3 previous hotels in NYC did not have them. Its not the most flash hotel, the corridor carpet made me feel like i was in Vegas, but i found it pretty faultless at on the things that really count. Also the location was right in the heart of Hollywood and next to a shopping centre to easy to get a quick retail fix. I recommend Loteria for Mexican dinner which is just down the road. I haven't stayed anywhere else in LA so cant give a comparison, but i would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel that has good location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: abitoheaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2011 for a conference. My gripe was that internet access was $12.95 per day and staying multiple nights, that adds up. I stayed at the Holiday Inn at Lax the night before with larger room and free wifi for less than half the price I paid here. The check in process was smooth and they were able to let me check in early at 11 am instead of 4 pm. The lady at the desk was nice and smiled. The bell man was prompt in storing my bags and getting them on the first day. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is really what you are paying for at this hotel with the walk of fame with the stars a block away from the hotel. My room had a view of the Hollywood sign on the 16th floor. It has shopping mall right outside and the Cirque de solie Iris right next door. So, great location! I was less impressed by the size of the room but it has all the comforts that I would expect from the hotel. Comfy bed, soft pillows. I was not impressed by the room since there was a dirty patch on the carpet that seemed like it was not cleaned and there was some funky green stuff growing on the right sink handle. I really didn't like the eco save toliets- maybe because I'm used to the lever to push down to flush instead of a button to press down. It didn't flush very well unless you press the button all the way down. The pool is smaller than it looks in the pictures. I didn't really get to enjoy the pool because I was busy with the conference. LA is colder than I thought it would be this time of year with lows in the 40s. The pool was nice that it was heated but still too cold to enjoy since it was outside. The food at the conference was good- I loved their desserts and their cheese snacks. The sandwiches were not as impressive. I liked their chimes as they reminded participants to go back to the sessions. Temperature was comfortable at the conference. Overall, conference services were good. (except lack of internet) I had the bell man store my bags again because the conference did not end until 5 pm and check out is at 11 am. It took me 20 min to get the bellman to get my bags. A lady who worked at the hotel kept on telling me it would a few more minutes because they were busy. The two bellman mainly ignored me until I was able to flag one of them down and request he get my bag. The only one good thing was that there were free M&Ms near the bell station to calm my ire. Also for your info, taxi from hotel to lax runs around $60 with tip. You may be better off doing the flat rates if you go at traffic times. There is lots of traffic in LA.... (traffic at 6:30 am when I arrived at hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “A great location to see Hollywood etc but a bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in transit back to Australia. We have not stayed in Los Angeles on previous trips into and out of USA and we were right to avoid it. Hollywood is a bit of a dump overall! The hotel is very well placed to see the sights and is a well appointed and modern hotel. It seems to be oriented towards business guests rather than tourists. There were several conferences on when we stayed. The rooms are good with sufficient space and the facilities satisfactory. There is no fridge (mini bar occupies this space and it is a "move it and you own it" version). A fridge is available at request and additional cost. The cost issues were the negative. WiFi was $12.95 per 24 hr period. This is mean when the room price is already up there! However, our cost was refunded following my objection. The staff were mixed in performance. Our initial reaction was very negative when the driveway attendant slammed the shuttle bus door in my wife's face. No help with luggage or any assistance through the door! A similar reaction to the front counter person who was detached and, I felt, a bit officious. I did not mention the driveway incident as I felt it would be a wasted complaint. Other staff were excellent. The Navigator counter staff were pleasant and very helpful and the front counter person on checkout was equally pleasant and concerned about our experience. Unfortunately she received the complaint about earlier poor performance and the WiFi charge. She responded well. We left our bags after checkout and collected them later when heading for the airport. Again a good experience with helpful staff. Maybe the only poorly trained staff were working when we arrived! Unlikely to return to Los Angeles but would consider this hotel if the situation arises. Not the best introduction to Marriott Rewards Program.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but really nice”
Reviews.Author: LongSleeves
Reviews.Content: Good location for walking around Hollywood (which is a bit of a disappointing dump to be honest), very helpful and friendly staff. Good fitness room and great outdoor pool. Room was large with all the necessities. To cut costs just park in the multi-storey at the side of the hotel rather than valet parking which is expensive. My only gripe would be the lack of free wi-fi - for the high price of the room you would expect it to be included.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good :)”
Reviews.Author: worldtour2000
Reviews.Content: Pretty good experience staying here. I was in town for a conference, though, which took up the majority of my time, so I can't really evaluate the hotel independently. I'll just say that the hotel was modern, clean, and comfortable, and there were no noticeable issues. I think you'll be fine if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Second time lucky”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience booking a 2-star hotel we found this one by luck: the guy in the airport shuttle had got off there and we were impressed with the service stright away. Valets and other hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet and very clean. Great bed linen and comfy mattress. The hotel navigator very helpful and lknowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: czardas
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and booked purely for location. The hotel is ok but I have two gripes, the first is that I can't see why you get charged for wifi when paying these rates, when Starbucks can offer free wifi. This hotel is $12.95 for 24 hours. The other is that if you want to watch tv, then you will be charged and there aren't any free channels besides a lame travel promotion channel. Catching up with world news is impossible, as there aren't any news channels on offer, charged or otherwise. I prefer booking a city view room, why pay extra for the sign when you can see it for photos at the mall? We checked in early and knew we wouldn't get our rooms, so we instructed them we would return at 4pm, when we finally came back at 6pm, they still didn't have our rooms ready. Not too happy about that, as I had booked connecting rooms and ended up with rooms apart.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: canesgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a charity cancer run October 30th. Let me tell you, this hotel is wonderful for it's service and people. The rooms are pretty standard to any 4 star hotel, but the people make the difference. Everyone from the bell staff, to the Navigators (concierge) go above and beyond. I think his name was Tyler (long curly hair), he rocked!!! The beds and incredible too!!! The location is great, you are in the middle of everything. The only draw back, this hotel is in the middle of everything. If you are looking to sleep in peace and quite, don't stay on the weekend or a holiday weekend. We did not know this was a party like hotel, we did not sleep for three days. When the bars close, all the people come back to the hotel to continue the party, and it was Halloween weekend, so we should have known better! The staff goes out of their way to control the noise, so if you have a problem, call down to the desk, they will take care of it!!! So, if you are looking for a nice hotel, great staff, wonderful beds, and in the middle of Hollywood, this is the place to stay! Thank you to the staff again for your wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ali24
Reviews.Content: We thought when we booked this hotel that it would be in a great location - and it is if you want to be in a very busy, mad, noisy crazy part of town that is like that 24 hours a day! But we didnt - so after 3 days we moved hotel! However the views of the Hollywood sign are cute and it is right in a shoppping mall with food outlets and great shops and is right on the Hollywood walk of fame and next to the Kodak Theatre - but once you have seen them its enough. So good for a 2 - 3 days stay but that it. The bathrooms need updating and were poor - I like a shower cubicle and dont expect to have to stand in a bath with a shower curtain and water spraying on the floor in a modern city like LA and in a good chain like the Renaissance. But the staff were nice and helpful. However when we arrived I did have to dust the room myself as the cleaner was not tall enough to clean the pictures on the wall and they were thick with dust, which wasnt very pleasant! So I asked her for a cloth and did it myself!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: kalenacole
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September for a combo work/Birthday weekend. The Renaissance is pricey, but an excellent hotel that is right next to Hollywood and Highland and the Kodak Theatre. You walk out one door and your in Hollywood & Highland and multi-level outdoor mall/trendy tourist spot in Hollywood. It's also a part of the Kodak Theatre (The Oscars & now Cirque's Iris). While there we took advantage of Spa Luce. Comfortable and relaxing in a cave like setting. On Sunday morning we went to Twist, the hotel restaurant where they host the Jazz Sunday Brunch. Wonderful music and good food. Great experience in Hollywood (and that's from a former resident).

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dmishesq
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for an awards event that I was attending. Stayed on the "concierge" level and assumed that there was a lounge or some other benefit to staying on that floor. Other than having to insert a key into the elevator in order to get to the floor, I could not ascertain any difference for the extra nightly fee that I paid. The hotel is in a great location and the service was very attentive and professional. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the center of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: isis080
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights at this hotel two weeks ago. The hotel is excellent from rooms, to service (the staff is both extremely friendly and efficient), to amenities. Even the food is quite good for an hotel. Top Hollywood location close to the Kodak theatre. You can even see the Holywood sign from the hotel!! Great food court right next to the hotel with choices from sushi to pub fare. Tip: the hotel is a bit far from LAX ($60+ taxi ride), so if you are travelling alone you may want to use an airport-hotel shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of it all...”
Reviews.Author: florriemay06
Reviews.Content: This is a big corporate hotel but very pleasant despite that. It really is right in the centre of everything in Hollywood, something we needed as we were here for only two nights (27 and 28 September). The room was plenty big enough with a very comfy bed, didn't realise what a great view we had of the Hollywood sign until the mist cleared later in the day! Also a mention must be made of the wonderful buffet breakfast on offer. Masses of choice with a chef ready to cook your eggs any which way you desire, plus the best cup of tea I've ever had in the USA, all in all a great start to any day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sun4oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on first leg of USA trip. Arrived at the hotel before 9am and they gave us a room staright away which we were very thankful for after travelling for 14 hours. You could see the Hollywood sign from our room which the kids loved.The room was perfect for what we needed. Central location for what we were doing. Breakfast was really good as it set us up for the whole day. Loved the shops and restauants around the Highland Centre. Great way to just spend an evening after sightseeing during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: babygemini
Reviews.Content: why we recommend this hotel. First, for the good and accessible location. it's just beside the kodak and Chinese theater, hollywood walk of fame, mall, restaurants, subway ride to universal studios.Second, they have a cozy and comfortable lobby , they even have a refreshing welcome fusion drink! Third, they have excellent service. we even got a free upgrade to a suite and a fruit basket to make our honeymoon more memorable! =) Fourth, the rooms are well maintained, so nice with a breathtaking view especially at night. =) Fifth, the price is reasonable =) thank you for a wonderful experience! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: bigGNorthVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights from the 14'th of October . The hotel is in a fantastic location close to all the action. The hotel rooms are a but dated but well maintained and clean. The service at the hotel is fantastic. Everyone from the valet to the pool bartender was fantasticand most helpful. Overall a good hotel in a great location with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood in a Minute”
Reviews.Author: Deborahsister
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment was that we did not get the Hollywood hills view that we requested - they had over-sold those rooms. Other than that, all was really great. We had water issues the first day but they fixed it right away. Breakfast at Twist was yummy, best huevos rancheros ever. We didn't use the pool or spa, too busy seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon hotel - stop 6”
Reviews.Author: Fats25
Reviews.Content: Firstly a review about LA. We were told before we went that LA was not that great, but we wanted to see it, and gave ourselves two nights, and two days here. We ended up staying in one of the nights, and left early on the 2nd day. West Hollywood/Sunset Bvld is really like a rubbish Leicester Square. Very touristy (as expected), but even within this, not much to see. LA seems very spread out, and I suspect you need to know where to go. Unlike other places we stayed, where there were lots of bars and restaurants in a small area, outside of the tacky tourist spots, there was no congregation of areas to go. I suspect a bit like London you need to know where to go. So onto the hotel. Not much really to write for me here. We have between us stayed in lots of Marriott hotels over the years, and actually redeemed points to stay here, rather than spend on another couple of nights accomodation. We considered 3 nights here, but so glad we decided to spend a night at Hermosa Beach (read other review). It was standard Marriott fare. Clean, large, and comfortable. Points I can add:- Check in lady was very polite, and helpful. Bell boys/car valet were very polite and helpful Concierge did not seem to know much more than a good bar/restaurant within the local area despite us being willing to travel further to find something we were looking for. Car parking was $10 a day, or over triple that for valet. Park the car yourself - is cheaper and not very difficult! There are three platforms to take a photo of the Hollywood sign from - in the outdoor part of the shopping complex. Marriott guests can go to the third floor, but are not allowed to stand on the walkway to take a photo, they are only allowed to access the Spa and Pool (which looked nice, but we did not use). No idea if this is Marriott or building management stopping you, but seemed a bit petty. A bottle of water from your room was $6.50 Nothing wrong with the hotel, it is Standard Marriott fare.
