There is Starbucks in the foyer of the hotel also if you like Starbucks coffee One of the greatest thing about this hotel is the location. It is on Highland Ave which is one street back from Hollywood Boulevard . This is where the main Hollywood Walk of Fame is, Graumanâ€™s Chinese Theatre, The Kodak Theatre, Madam Tusauds, El Captaine Theatre. So you are literally in the middle of the main tourist area of Hollywood. The Highland shopping centre/Mall is connected to the hotel so this adds allot of convenience for shopping and meals. There is a Metro station underneath the Highland Centre which makes for easy transportation to Universal Studios (one stop away) or the other direction Downtown LA. We will stay at this hotel again when we are back in LA and thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Special Every Year for me and my kids!”
Reviews.Author: singdancemomma
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter, my young son and I stay at the Renaissance for one night every year. It's a tradition and it's our special night together to treat ourselves! We've stayed here every summer for at least the last 8 years in a row and we just love it! The location is fantastic and the view is great from either side. Either you see the Hollywood sign on one side or on the other side you see the pool below, the Kodak Theatre and the shopping theatre next to it. You can also see Hollywood boulevard from that side and everyone hurrying around down there. There is so much going on in this area and many times there will be filming of some type or a ceremony going on! It's bustling and heavy with tourists but you can walk to just about anything you want to do. Graumans Chinese Theatre is right there as well as a great shopping complex. You walk out the back door and within steps you are walking down the stairs where the red carpet lays for many Hollywood events. If you don't like lots of activity then you may want to pick another area even though you leave all the noise behind the minute you want into the Renaissance. My kids always feel like they are getting the star treatment (they are 17 and 9) and we just cannot break this tradition. One word on safety, however. Unless my husband is with us, we do not go down onto Hollywood Boulevard after dark. It gets a little weird down there at night!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: George92677
Reviews.Content: Incredible location mixed in with Kodak Theatre, Graumans, & Mall of shops & restaurants. Hotel itself was nice but not great & the 5th floor pool area was too small to get a chair and no Jacuzzi. But all worth it for the surpurb area location!! Had a great dinner 3 blooks away at Musso & Franks.---- & a cocktail at the Hollywood Roosevelt lobby bar just across.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has everything you want!”
Reviews.Author: 1kitkat1
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with this hotel! You could see the HOLLYWOOD sign from the pool and/or your room if it was facing in that direction. The shopping center is litterally attached to the outside of the hotel property and is accessed through the pool area/walkway. Tourist were taking photos on the balcony that is just below the pool deck, so we had better photos! Just beyond the awesome shoping experience are THE STARS, walk of fame. The rooms were great. ROOM service was great too! I indulged and had a bacon burger with sweet potato fries...BEST MEAL and relaxing in the room.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID: staff steal and management do not care”
Reviews.Author: Vicdubai
Reviews.Content: A great stay at the hotel was destroyed by the discovery that my Rayban sunglasses were stolen out of the bottom of my handbag by the maid and the management simply do not care. I arrived at the hotel with the item in my bag, when I went to take the sunglasses out of the bottom of my zipped handbag (that had remained in the room throughout) on the last day of my stay, they had gone. I did not want to accuse staff of stealing until I was 100% sure the item had definitely not been left at home. I contacted the manager on my return home to inform him of the theft, even asking if he could ask the maid if the item could 'turn up'. I was informed, after chasing for a response, in a very short email, that the sunglasses had not been found and they no reason to suspect the maid as she had worked for them for over 20 years - something I cannot prove. No apology. I responded to the manager again asking him to discuss the issue further with the maid - zero response, zero apology. I am sorry, but I am a honest and decent person and the item was stolen from my personal handbag. I am upset the item was stolen but I am more upset that an apology was not even offered and (what I view as) an excuse in terms of the maid's length of service was given for not following the matter up further. I contacted the hotel manager directly as I wanted to avoid this, but their lack of care has made me want to alert other people that if you stay at this hotel, lock EVERYTHING in your safe, because the staff cannot be trusted and the management simply do not care.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Allis0nB
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here on the 3rd and final stop of our tour after San Francisco and Vegas. The Renaissance was recommended to me by a friend who stayed here 3 years ago and I was very impressed indeed, having never been to LA before and not sure which area to stay in. This was definitely the best place to stay as there was so much going on. The best thing about it is the location - I could not believe how near to the walk of fame and Kodak and Chinese Theatre we were! Also seeing the sign from the hotel was brilliant. The rooms are rather basic (maybe only to us after leaving a luxury Vegas suite) but had everything we needed. Liked the make up mirror and complimentary Aveda toiletries in the bathroom and the Starbucks coffee and coffee maker. We had a view of the H&H complex which was very private. Housekeeping good and we had clean towels and more coffee every day. Great to have free air con and safety deposit box. All the staff we dealt with in the hotel were lovely, the concierge was especially helpful. We went to the jazz brunch on the Sunday in Twist Restaurant, what a treat! All the (delicious) food you could want and unlimited mimosas (bucks fizz!). Our server was lovely, the music was fantastic and it really was the perfect start to any day. We also had a couple of drinks and coffees in the bar downstairs, enjoyed the free nibbles with the cocktails and beers. One night they had a Frank Sinatra tribute singer who was great. The pool is really nice, however when we went up there were only 2 free beds (in the shade) which we grabbed for half an hour or so just to chill out. The others (prime spots in the sun) were all covered in towels and no-one to be seen. Grrr. Whilst in LA (only for 3 days) we went on the hop on hop off bus tour on one of the days which was very good. We stopped off at Beverly Hills and Venice and Santa Monica beaches, fantastic. We spent the rest of our time in Hollywood, we loved it. On the Sunday there was a movie premiere of Legend of the Guardians and the place was buzzing, it was really exciting. We had lots of lovely food but in particular loved the Hard Rock Cafe which was on our doorstep. We ate there twice and had lots of drinks in there too (both top notch). The interactive stuff is so cool on the walls and as you would expect the music is great. All in all, a fantastic trip. We really loved LA and found it to be a very friendly, cool and trendy place with fantastic food and shopping. We found it cheaper than San Francisco and Vegas. Would love to return and would highly recommend this hotel and area.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the location and that's it...!”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas_Simard
Reviews.Content: Nice location in the hearth of Hollywood... but, very pricey if you compare to other Renaissance that I consider better. You pay for the location but you gotta know that Hollywood is not the sweetest spot in town. I would rather pay for a more expensive hotel in Manhattan Beach of Santa Monica than Hollywood. Of course Hollywood Blvd is nice but this is a real touristic spot and you will not spent more than an afternoon in this location. The room at the Renaissance are good but I've seen better. Pool is average and the staff is ok. Definitely you pay for the location. I would not comeback.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, in the heart of all the action.”
Reviews.Author: AliciaCofRM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids before going to Disneyland. Our room was on the concierge level which served us appetizers and dessert in the evening, and breakfast in the morning. The room had a fantastic view of the Hollywood sign and Griffith Observatory. There is an entrance to the mall from the hotel. Lots of great food and shops to go to. The kids loved going on the Walk of Fame and into the Chinese Theater Forecourt. This hotel is within walking distance of so many fun Hollywood things to do. We used the self park at the mall to save a few bucks on parking. Overall a nice place to stay right in middle of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful respite in a crazy city”
Reviews.Author: GirlMakesSense
Reviews.Content: After a few nights at a Hilton our travels brought us here. The staff was outstanding and helpful - never pushy. Room was quiet, clean and luxurious. The hotel is in walking distance to lots of Hollywood sights. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Aimed to please”
Reviews.Author: Busylady56
Reviews.Content: I was a late arrival.....long trip and really wanted to rest. I was a bit upset that night and not very pleased with my accommodations,but happily I was switched to a new room in AM with help of staff (Sandra, and another young lady.sorry can't remember the name .but very nice too) it was the 20th floor with limited access and the 19th floor where I could get breakfast and munch at 5pm......loved it! My room was large and comfortable.......location excellent and Frank from engineering helped me with my Internet. The staff is friendly and very helpful.Inspite of a full booking,phones were answered on time.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: Rik411
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location (directly across the street from H&H -- Hollywood and Highland -- Mall), and plenty close to many other great Hollywood attractions. Area very hustle/bustle, but rooms were very very quiet. My colleagues and I had 3 "cityview" rooms - 2 had incredible views, one was atrocious (see next paragraph). All nice sized rooms (both the "standard" and the "executive" suites). Valet service was stupendous. SpaLuce is AMAZING - Get a Swedish massage at SpaLuce (HIGHLY recommend "Nathakan" for your massage therapist) - incredible experience. Cons: All of the staff were incredible, EXCEPT for "Kevin" who checked us in. He was rude, dismissive and distracted beyond belief. Not at all what I would have expected at a four-star hotel. However, ALL other staff were marvelous. Paid 3 different prices for rooms: $229/night; $269/night and $329/night (no rhyme or reason to rates as far as I could tell). The $329/night was an Executive City-view Suite and it was lovely. The $229/night was a "Standard' city view room, and it too was very very nice. The $269/night room, however, had horrid view of adjacent roof, and horrid room layout. Probably should have asked for a different room, but was too tired upon arrival. So - all in all, I would absolutely stay there again, particularly if traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jofoo
Reviews.Content: Large clean room, clean bathroom with shower and bath. Very comfortable beds. in room safe very handy as well as the air conditioning! Lovely view of the Hollywood hills from our room on the 16th floor. Pool was excellent, though get there early to get a lounger by the pool. Had the buffet breakfast one day, was very nice but extremely expensive, ate at Mel's drive-in just down the road for the other 5 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; lovely hotel; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Crossbill
Reviews.Content: We were put in here by Priceline and found it an excellent all round hotel. We especially enjoyed the pool. The children were delighted by the veneer of glamour and celebrity that the hotel seems to have. It is located close to lots of nice places and we could see the Hollywood sign from our window. Parking in the Mall next door was cheap and safe. Note to management: make the internet free for guests - everyone else does. It costs you almost nothing and creates goodwill.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: ci1705
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location. Friendly check in staff, room was available early which was great after a long flight. We had a room with the Hollywood sign view. Very clean, nothing negative to say about it really.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome 21st!”
Reviews.Author: SuriHappyTravels
Reviews.Content: You can only turn 21 once, and I felt that this is a great alternative to an exquisite stay at one of LV's posh casino hotels. Wonderful rooms with wonderful views is enough to make me return. Modern furniture and accommodations complete the good life vibe. Bathrooms are spacious and charming, and the foam pillows and mattresses make you feel like you're sleeping on a plush cloud. Only ordered room service once and the food was just average. We stayed in a standard on the 10th floor. Absolutely gorgeous view of the pool and the entire Hollywood block and city at night. We found that we didn't have to wait on elevators to arrive; they have a very efficient elevator system. The hotel is literally in the center of Hollywood, so you're never too far from any action. Main concern: parking can become very stressful and expensive. We had to pay about $10 daily to just park the car in the $2.00/4 hr. Hollywood and Highland lot. Reason for 4 stars. However, there was an easy checkout and the staff was overall nice and accommodating. We will be returning to the Renaissance Hotel to relive what we fell in love with.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Pleco
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, great view of the Hollywood sign, rooms clean, staff friendly and attentive. Fabulous location with shopping, restaurants, Walk Of Fame, Graumans Theater all within short walking distance. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ElevenBus
Reviews.Content: It's a nice enough hotel, but nothing about it stands out especially, except maybe location. Typical large chain hotel, everything is just fine. It is connected to the Kodak Theater, as well as a large mall, and you are right next to the walk of fame if you want to see the touristy side of Hollywood. Not much of a nightlife, but packed during the day, especially during the Oscars. You can practically see the entrance to the Governor's Ball from your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoP1973
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel on march 2009. The hotel is in a great location, just behind the Kodak Theater. From the window we could see the Hollywood sign. The room was very big, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a little bit expensive. When I'll be back in LA I'll stay in Renaissance Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLMac16
Reviews.Content: Positives: Perfect location, right next to Hollywood walk of fame, Graumanns and Kodak theatres. Also one stop on the metro from Universal Studios. Rooms were typical 4 star standard, clean, no balcony but we had great views of Hollywood sign and hills from room. Gym was good, as was pool (although nowhere near enough loungers). Bar staff at pool were very friendly and attentive - especially 'Snake'. Negatives: Front desk staff - often no-one on duty and had to wait for someone to show up. Not very friendly. Charged for internet access ($5.50 an hour) - a bit cheeky I think given room rate. However WiFi was free if you brought your own lap-top. Tips: Park at Hollywood and Highland shopping mall for $10 a day (much more for valet parking and they use the same car park!). Try Mel's Drive-In 100 yards down the road for great service, a fantastic breakfast and lovely atmosphere. Overall would definitely stay here again. Need to improve their reception/front-desk staff through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: AUA10
Reviews.Content: I had originally reserved the Doubletree Guest Suites in Santa Monica. I decided to cancel that when I found out about the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. I am very happy I changed to the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. The location couldn't be beat. Right in the heart of what we wanted to see and do. Shops and restaurants all within walking distance. Hollywood was better than expected and fun. Wished I could have stayed an extra day or two to use the pool and other facilities. Very nice and helpful staff. We did the Starline Tours all route Hop On Hop Off bus the first day and The Warner Brothers Studio Tour the second day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hollywood Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNYC74
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I love this hotel... probably my favorite hotel in Los Angeles. Rooms are clean and appointed well. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our last stay we had an awesome view of the hills. My only complaint is parking. Very difficult to park in this VERY busy neighborhood, but also really expensive to park at the hotel. At $300 a night, I shouldn't have to pay an extra $29 a day to park! But over all, very comfortable and great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: SENCO
Reviews.Content: Large room, 2 huge comfy beds and superb views over Hollywood from 20th floor. NEVER had to wait for a lift. Breakfast buffet very good. Grill restaurant excellent. Pool area superb plus the extra entertainment put on at the pool and in the lobby was a bonus. Outstanding location; always something going on at Hollywood/Highland Centre, easy to use Metro to get to Universal, Dodgers Stadium, Pasedena and Downtown. Used bus to get to Brea tar pits, Farmers Market etc. Walked to Pantages theatre. Good value for money. Only slight issue was Conceirge staff need better training at giving directions to places by public transport perhaps using the Metro planning link rather than relying on Google. We had a fantastic weeks holiday and will return if we visit LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: monksWales
Reviews.Content: Great location - steps away from Chinese theater, El Capitan, Hollywood Boulevard etc but found the front desk staff unfriendly and cold. Rooms were very modern, clean, contemporary, but soulless. The rooftop pool was very glamorous and my son enjoyed watching a movie in the pool on the Saturday night!! The Hollywood and Highland mall is just through the hotel doors. Ask reception for an Elephant card - gives discount on places to eat and some shops. Valet parking is 27 dollars a day plus tip - but we self parked for 10 dollars a day in the same car park. No fridge in the room but if you ring housekeeping they will bring one free of charge - friendly and efficient person brought our fridge within half an hour. Good location but not particularly child friendly. Staff need to take a chill pill.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: mmlc
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to California, and booked this hotel based on a recommendation. We checked in later in the evening, and it took forever. The staff was nice enough though. The rooms are wonderful - comfy beds, spotless bathroom, nice view, not too noisy, etc. However the absolute best thing about this hotel was the location. It is mere steps from the walk of fame, Kodak theater, etc. For a family traveling as "tourists" (wanting to see the tourist traps) it was perfect! We didn't use the valet and instead parked ourselves at the parking garage in the mall next door, saved a fortune and didn't have to wait for the car to arrive. If I was going to Hollywood again, I might not stay here only because we've already seen everything around there, but we would definitely stay based on the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place, but I'm not coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Boomstar
Reviews.Content: Made my first trip to California this summer for 4 nights. The original plan was to spend 2 of them here but after spending the first night here, I canceled the 2nd night and went elsewhere....and this is why... The service at this hotel is bad! Some of the worse I've ever seen! When arriving at the property for the first time, the first person I met that parked my car was decent, but it went downhill from there. Check in was on the slow side and when I asked questions she was quite rude with her responses. The room was clean, not too small and had a nice view, but for what I paid I did expect more. The biggest problem however was the fact that I paid extra for a package that included sparking wine and strawberries upon check-in and after a quick search of the room....neither of them were present. Made the first call to the desk and was told rudely that the staff that was responsible for them didn't operate till 5pm...what the......?? And I was supposed to know this how? 5:30pm...still nothing. I make the 2nd call, this time I'm told that they will be someone up right away to deliver them. At least this person had a nicer attitude about it, but still was not impressed. Finally got tired of waiting and went out at 6:30, talked to someone downstairs and once again, they told me they would take care of it. Got back at 9pm and you guessed it, still nothing to be found! This time however there was a voice mail left saying that I would be getting them shortly...this msg was left at 7:30... A 4th call made at 9pm got me the response that there were sending up someone right now with them......and at 10pm I finally got them. Didn't even have the nerve at this point to argue and question the delivery guy, he probably had nothing to do with this anyways. Also just in case anyone is wondering, the wine and the strawberries were actually good. Aside from this, the valet parking was decent....not once were they accurate with there timings but I never waited more than 15 mins so I'll overlook it The one good thing I can say about this place was the breakfast. Had the breakfast buffet and all of the food was excellent, everything was fresh, tasty and the made to order omelets were excellent. The guy working at the bar was the only friendly employee I met on the whole property. This place aint cheap neither, so my expectations were pretty high and boy was I ever disappointed. At the end of the day it did provide a place to sleep and the location was good but it didn't do much else, the next night I just decided to stay at a best western, it was 1/3 of the price and had far better service. Overall if I'm ever back in the Hollywood area I won't be spending my nights here and if you value high customer service, anyone considering going here shouldn't neither!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Shazza72
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at the Renaissance Hollywood, we also stayed here 2 years ago. Its location is great, right next door to the Hollywood and Highland, Kodak theatre, Hollywood walk of fame etc. Univeral Studios is a short drive away. Room was lovely with flat screen TV. work station area. good size bathroom. Hotel staff are very friendly. We booked a package which included valet parking, internet access, $25 a day room credit & breakfast. We were there for the premiere of Angelina Jolie's new movie "salt" and it was good just to be able to walk over and join the crowd's of people waiting to see her (and she did not disappoint us) I can not highly recommend this hotel enough and will probably stay here when we come back over to LA

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in W. Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Ludkiewicz
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, great service and rooms. I like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Truely enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: can37
Reviews.Content: We traveled through California for 10 days and stayed at Marriott's all but 2 nights. We stayed at the Renaissance for 2 nights. We had no trouble with the valet or getting our car in a timely fashion. The concierge desk was very helpful when we needed directions. Being right next door to the Highland shopping area was great. We could eat breakfast, lunch and dinner all right there. The food was great and we enjoyed all the people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bidderman9
Reviews.Content: Pro's- Great Location. The hotel is literally attached to the Hollywood and Highland center. Very convenient. Greta views nice hotel Con's - $31 valet parking or $10 self park at Hollywood and Highland Center with no in/out. The Hollywood/Highland garage is huge! Easy to lose you way back to the hotel or your car. No community computer available for use in the business center. I would have to agree about recent reviews of the service

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no service whatsoever. Did they get rid of the entire staff?”
Reviews.Author: socal_999
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel many, many times and I'd have to say that this trip was probably the last. We checked in for a friday/saturday nite stay so that we could attend a show at the Hollywood Bowl. Let me list the service slights. 1) Pulled our car into the hotel, gave it to the valet. A bellman rolled our luggage from the door of the hotel to the front desk, and advised us that someone else would be taking it up to the room after we checked in. And then he stood and waited..... for a tip. 2) Another bellman took our luggage upstairs, sat it inside the door. No offer to get ice, directions. Didn't even turn on the AC. 3) When we checked in we valet parked at $29 per day. We called for our car 1,2,3 times. No answer. We decided to walk to dinner. 4) After returning to the hotel after dinner, we called housekeeping to get a set of sheets for the sofa bed for our 8 yr old. 3 calls before someone actually picked up the phone. Then after we requested the sheets, 1 hour later, no sheets. We called again, and the sheets arrived 45 mins later. By that time our child was fast asleep. 5) Saturday at the pool, one single waiter for the entire pool. I placed an order for a sandwich - a variation of a BLT, except it was a Salmon, Bacon, Tomato Avocado. I asked for no bacon. 1 hour and 30 minutes later it arrived ..... but it had bacon. The waiter took it back and said he would bring a new one. 1 hour later, still no sandwich. The kitchen refused to make another one. Really? Is that supposed to happen? I spent the entire afternoon starving at the pool. 6) Valet parking, NO ONE PICKS UP THE PHONE. For $29 per day, someone absolutely has to pick up the phone. At checkout the hotel removed the valet charges, but the entire stay was such a disappointment, for what should be a really nice service experience. We have always loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Hapiness”
Reviews.Author: BobMc
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a a truly great location with plenty of interesting things to do and see nearby, including a trip to Griffiths observatory which is only a short drive away plus of course Universal Studios. The rooms were a good size. The staff friendly. The beds comfortable. I could not think of a single complaint other than the fact that they did not give the rooms and the food for free!!!!!! What more could you want? Bob.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended with reservations”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that tries too hard. The rooms are on the smallish side and the trendy furniture is not functional...uncomfortable chair, poor surface areas. The location is interesting...adjacent to the Kodak theater and the walk of fame. There are many tourists during the day but the area clears out at night. Staff is pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, conveniently located in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Olivia4381
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on our trip to Hollywood. Great hotel, very friendly staff. It is conveniently located to all the attractions in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location - Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: luvdisneyengland
Reviews.Content: If you plan to go to Hollywood please stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel at Hollywood and Highland! The hotel itself is very classey, and quiet beautiful really, as it is joined onto the Hollywood and Highland shopping centre, and on the door step of all other Hollywood Attractions, and with Starline tours just steps away from the hotel you can also arrange for tours around Los Angeles! The rooms here are lovely, they are cleaned everyday to a high standard, and the views from the rooms are excellent with a choice at check in to over look the Hollywood sign or a view of LA which is gorgeous aswell! I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hollywood or around LA! Service are good, the staff are nice, and rooms are lovely. I hope to return there really soon!!!! As I loved this hotel and Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Canes428
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of Hollywood, this is a great location for tourists, as everything is within walking distance. The front desk is very helpful and friendly, which is typical of Marriott. I would not even think about staying somewhere else if I was in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Teens and families finally agreed, loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: Vintagebydesign
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be in the middle of it all, shops, restaurants, Graumann's Theater. Even though it is a large property, service felt personal and accomodating, even when the teens locked themselves out of their rooms for the third time. Great upper floor pool felt glamorous in Hollywood style, could see the Hollywood sign from our room. Rooms were well furnished, large windows with great views.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASIC HOLIDAY, FANTASTIC HOTEL, FANTASTIC LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: warrense18
Reviews.Content: I couldn't praise this hotel more. The location is unbeatable right in the centre of Hollywood. The rooms are very modern with LCD TV and ipod station and great views. The staff are friendly, efficient and always happy to help. I previosly stayed twice at the Hollywood Roosevelt and thought it couldn't be beaten until I stayed at the Renaissance, I have already booked to stay again in November 2010 and can't wait to get back there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and gaurantee you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It covered it all.”
Reviews.Author: KarenSue
Reviews.Content: The hotel was upscale. Inside desk personel ... abit cool. Housekeeping great. Door men bent over backwards to accodomate us. Beautiful pool. Perfect location, 1/2 block off Hollywood Blvd. Easy walking for 76, 70 and 15 year olds. The near by attractions were perfect for the location. We did not rent a car; found plenty of resturants, shopping, tours,and site seeing w/ walking distance. Felt very safe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Ã–lli
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in the Renaissance Hotel at the beginning of a US roadtrip from June 25th to June 28th. Knew the hotel from an earlier visit six years ago and liked it very much. We got a good rate back then in I was suprised how expensive the hotel got since then. Finally I found something like 400$ for three nights which is really a good value. Stayed in a room facing Hollywood Hills. Great Look at the Hollywood sign but the closer vacinity is not that nice a view. Windows won't open. Our last room was better, facing Highland Ave with a view on both Downtown and the Hollywood sign. Spacier and better design either. Anyway, room was fine for the stay, but it was LOUD almost all night having loads of party people around. So do not expect to get too much deep sleep. But you won't go for this location to seek quiteness... Besides the location, almost anything is "normal upscale hotel chain" as a former reviewer said. They do not have stairs (for other use than emergency), so be prepared to wait for the escalators quite some time in rush hours. Everything was clean, no complaints about that. Quite expensive valet parking (but quick and nice people) and not even complimentary internet in the business center. As a summary, maybe a little personal touch is missing but the hotel is quite big so you probably cannot expect that...

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is nice, conveniently located to the Hollywood/Highland Center, their customer service sucks. I had to make multiple phone calls to have them arrange airport pick up and they never called back, and in the end screwed up and didn't get the car service to pick me up at the airport. It reflects poor customer service training from the management and you can expect that type of treatment from the staff . They really didn't care. When you pay $300+ a night for an average Marriott room you expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: AussieChickSydney
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a tourist trip to Hollywood then this hotel is in a good location, just off Hollywood Boulevard, next to the shopping centre and very close to the starting point for many tours. I would describe the hotel as a standard 5 star chain hotel, clean and comfortable. The rooms were a good size, I stayed in one with 2 double beds and there was still plenty of room for our suitcases and to move around. The room was very dark in the evening, the hotel needs to invest in more lighting.The pool deck is pleasant and the water is heated, great after a long flight. There is also a standard gym next to the pool which is free. If you don't have a room with a view of the Hollywood sign you can get a good photo from the terrace of the shopping centre next door and also the pool deck. I had the continental buffet breakfast one morning, very filling and it kept me going all day. I went on the movie star homes tour while there, (if you are keen to see their homes you'll be let down, unless you get a thrill from seeing gates and obsure windows). It is however, a very pleasant drive through the rich areas in LA and if you are into gardens you'll see plenty of nice ones. If you have a car I wouldn't bother with this tour, you can do it yourself. I also went on the hop on hop off bus tour. I wouldn't recommend this either, I'd take public transport. This service only runs every half hour to 45 min depending when you go and we got stuck in Santa Monica due to a timetable error and had to catch the local bus back to the hotel, which was easy. Madame Toussaud's is also located just around the block from the hotel. I got a free ticket with one of the tours. I thought there would have been more statues, I went through the exhibit quite quickly. The Grove shopping centre is very nice and upscale (the Abercrombie & Fitch store had a good 'sale' area when we were there), the Farmers Markets next door to The Grove were a let down. We caught the local bus there with no problems. If you are into lingerie make sure you visit Frederick's of Hollywood on Hollywood Boulevard, it is cheaper than Victoria's Secret and they have really nice things. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hollywood Experience, New & Modern”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_life072
Reviews.Content: Used AA Points and stayed at hotel for Anniversary (1 night). The location of the hotel, allowed us to see all the Hot Spots of Hollywood by foot. Customer Service Great! Stayed in Executive King Room overlooking Hollywood Sign, generous room size. Bathroom had a nice Sink/Makeup area, but main bath pretty standard, nothing special. Pool and Spa located on 5th Floor. Pool is good size for Adults, not really a kid atmosphere. Bar located next to pool with small gym too. Pool atmosphere was upscale. For a one nighter to see Hollywood, being an Orange County Native, the hotel and convienence exceeded our Expections. Would recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood hip, great location for first timers”
Reviews.Author: lozandjlo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - pretty much behind kodak theatre. If you've never been to LA before - it's so spread out that this location is not for everyone but I loved it. Perfect for the "typical LA experience" close to walk of fame, universal, beverley hills etc & the famous hollywood clubs like viper room etc. If you're not there to do the tourist stuff then you may want to consider somewhere else but having stayed in LA a few times before this hotel was awesome. I found rooms great & spacious though I had a suite. Staff were really helpful - especially the valet & always smiling. I spent a long time in the spa & it was heavenly & a great way to relax after a big day. Some people balk at the price but if you want to stay in the hollywood/beverley hills area and you want to be near the walk of fame you hafve to expect to pay. If you don't want to pay but want the same standard you can stay in down town much cheaper but it's definitely not as nice. Tip - get a rental car it just makes life so much easier and parking isnt that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money - Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: jcmlasvegas
Reviews.Content: The front desk customer service is the worst with bunch of rude and unprofessional pieces of ******. This hotel is not worth the money. I was on a business trip and my room had already been paid for by a company weeks prior to check in. I verified everything the day before by calling the hotel and was confirmed and emailed the receipt. Upon check in, they told me they didnt have a room for me and that i had to pay using my own card. I showed them the receipt and confirmation email they sent me with proof of payment from the company that clearly shows the credit card info on there with payments authorized. They still refuse to give me a room and made me wait another 30 mins. I had no choice but to pay for my own room that has already been paid for by the company that flew me out there. I have been to so many business trips and have never encountered this problem before. Never will i stay or do business with this establishment again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but wouldn't stay ever again”
Reviews.Author: foxyboo
Reviews.Content: We really ummed and ahhed over where to stay for our first time in LA and this hotel was recommended to us for the location. And the location is GREAT, if you want to shop till you drop, there are shops just downstairs and within minutes you are standing at Graumanns Chinese Theatre and The Kodak Theatre. There was great energy, always people about and it was the hot spot if you are a tourist. The hotel service was basically lacking. Check in was lacklustre, though quick. Upon entering our room the first thing i noticed were the big windows which overlooked the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign! I was so excited but on closer inspection it was kinda hard to see anything as the external glass was so dirty. After travelling for some 23 hours from Australia we were jetlagged and dehydrated and desperate for water. No complimentary water and the mini bar was LOCKED. In desperation we drank the tap water which can only be described as soapy dishwater, it was disgusting. So we purchased water externally but it's the little things like this that can make a stay unpleasant. As the jetlagged kicked in our heads hit the pillows like bowling balls, so imagine our distress at hearing some sort of machinery??!! We couldn't pin point whether it was coming from above us or perhaps beside us, but the noise was ridiculous!! It wasn't overly loud just incredibly tortuous, like a slow water drip on your head. It would crank up every few minutes and last 10-15 secs, between midnight and 6am was especially busy. I'm convinced it was some sort of conveyor belt or dumb waiter for room service. I complained to Reception but they assured me there was no machinery near us. And they were heavily booked so they couldn't move us. This really put a downer on our stay. I just felt the staff had a bit of attitiude, we didn't feel like a valued guest, it's not a hotel we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TeriTravels74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a large sales meeting, and for this it was a PERFECT location. This hotel is attached to a great mall, had a nice gym and pool, and is central to a lot of great attractions in Hollywood (I could see the "Hollywood sign" from my room as well as the Hollywood hills.) The Chinese theatre, Rooseveldt hotel, and Kodak theatre were all within walking distance. My guest room was upgraded to an executive suite so it was large with a living area, and extra large bathroom. Very comfortable accomodations. The food at this hotel was fantastic for a business meeting. I dined in the restaurant as well and had that was also a good experience. I did not get a chance to use the pool but it looked quite nice. I did use the gym. It had a nice selection of cardio equipment but was light on weights. Overall I would say this hotel was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel for our Association”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: Property is conveniently located and has lots of appeal and ammenities. Changed owners since 2007 and the "We own the problem until it is resolved" philosophy has tapered off. Rooms are very nice. Our members were happy. Only one restuarant in hotel (many, many others as you step outside...... We didn't feel quite as catered to as the group giving them substantial business as we did in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but in a hip and trendy way!!”
Reviews.Author: MulhollandP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Hollywood. Its right in the heart of Hollywood Boulevard and great for Chinese Theatre and surrounding areas but not much else is nearby. Saving grace is that its right by a subway station which gets you to Universal, or downtown LA but the trains done run like London in terms of frequency. Hotel charged lots of money for not much - it was clean and comfortable but most staff came with an attitude, apart from Valet guys and girls who were tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteHolden
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group/on my own and stayed in the Renaissance as we were relocatedat the last minute before travelling, so I had not had chance to look online. Beautiful complex, amazing food, very helpful staff. Located behind the Kodak Theatre and ideal 1 minute walk to the Walk of Fame, shopping mall, Chinese Theatre and a 20 bus ride to Rodeo Drive. Clean, fairly quiet, and extremely large rooms. Would highly recommend even travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: roselilycat
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights from 12 to 17 May. After a horrendous trip by shuttle bus from LAX we finally got to the hotel about 9.30pm. Check in was smooth and we were given a room on the 14th floor. The room was large, clean and comfortable. We were not disturbed by any noise from other rooms and I think for most of our stay none of the rooms surrounding us were occupied. After our first night my daughter found the pillows too soft and even though she requested firmer ones, they never appeared. We had a view out over the Highland Centre and across towards (I presume) downtown LA. It was great being able to access the hotel through the Highland Centre without having to walk to the lobby and through that way although on our first night after we went out to get something to eat the doors which had been locked were jammed and we were unable to swipe our card to get back in but that was the only time it happened. We checked out the pool and fitness centre but didnt make use of them. We were thinking of using the spa facilities but we ran out of time! The location was excellent, easy access to lots of attractions we wanted to see and within walking distance of Sunset Blvd and public transport. It was great to be able to get the subway to Universal city right at the doorstep. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hollywood hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: raznboyz
Reviews.Content: Treated my husband (anniversary) to the Hollywood Bowl to see James Taylor/Carole King. We don't like the parking/traffic at this grand venue so I thought a hotel stay would be sweet. The Renaissance was recommended by a friend and I am SO glad I picked up on it. It is a beautiful place with impeccable service, located at the corner of Hollywood & Highland right next to the Kodak Center. It took us only 12 minutes to walk to the Bowl. We didn't use the valet service because it was $29 per day to park. Directly connected to the hotel is Kodak's parking garage (with security personnel) for only $10 per day and can be parked overnight (big savings). I got a good price on the room using my AAA discount as well as adding addition points for Marriott. We were given a 5th floor room close to the elevator and permitted to check in earlier than the 4 PM check in time. Our room was large and decorated tastefully. We had a view of Highland Ave. which was interesting to watch the traffic from the Bowl stack up while we enjoyed the comfort of our room. We did not use the pool nor the gym but they were right ourside our room. Very quite - we never heard anyone going to and fro. It was fun to walk Hollywood Blvd. and see the historic sights (I was using my copy of "LA Access" which gives a brief description of what you see). Even though we live in Orange County, we seldom go up to Hollywood, so this was really fun. In the morning I went down to the restaurant to see if they had a "smoothie" on their menu. They didn't - it was more of a buffet at "Twist". The hostess told me to go to the "fruit bar" on the buffet lineup and pick out the fruit I wanted and they would make my smoothie to order (how kind and accommodating was that)! We loved this place and it worked well for what we needed. We would return as well as recommend this hotel to everyone. The close proximity to the Kodak was great for shopping as well as picking up some good snacks.

Reviews.Title: “One of my two Hollywood favorites”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at either the Renaissance or the Roosevelt while I'm in Hollywood. This time we chose the Renaissance and it was a great experience as usual. The common areas/lobby/bar are nicely decorated, elegant without being stuffy; check-in was welcoming and friendly. There are two bars: one in the lobby, which closes at different times depending on what guest activity is like, and one upstairs in the restaurant, Twist. We love the lobby bar as it's very comfortable. Be aware that drink prices are high by many people's standards, not unusual in Hollywood, but it's easy to run up a $100 check on appetizers and cocktails for two. The rooms are very clean; the decor is that almost-generic sleek modern style that isn't remarkable but works fine while you're there. A room with a view of the Hollywood Hills is well worth the upgrade charge, especially if you can get a higher floor. The concierge lounge isn't open on the weekends so it may or may not be worth the upgrade charge there; when it's open, it's got a fantastic view of the Magic Castle, and the continental breakfast is a nice selection, nothing too fancy but good pastries and bagels and lots of coffee. Food service tends to be quick, efficient and tasty, again priced a little high but at least you get some nice giant prawns on your $17 prawn appetizer. Breakfast at Twist is usually a good experience; we had less than attentive service on our last visit but nobody's 100% I suppose. My only "caution" with this hotel is that it attracts a LOT of partiers. Weddings, bachelorette parties, conventions, guys' weekends, you name it. We had an early flight and left at 6:30AM, right when a cab full of clubbers was coming home to sleep. The common areas do get a lot of traffic late at night; don't be surprised if the elevators are full and slow at 3 in the morning. The guests sometimes get a little rowdy--- I've had to call hotel security on two different trips to ask them to quiet down the neighbors--- security handled these requests gracefully and promptly. Considering I've stayed there about 8 times, this isn't a good average but at least they take care of the problems quickly. Also be aware that a cab from LAX is going to run you $70 (more if there is traffic and that doesn't include tip) so you may want to arrange a car service or super shuttle to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back to the Renaissance Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: 888Main
Reviews.Content: I found myself staying at the Renaissance Hollywood again in April, and my thoughts about the hotel have not changed since posting my review on my stay here last year. It is a convenient hotel for all those who wish to visit the Hollywood tourist attractions. The rooms are clean and the staff is always willing to help. The concierge even got me a seat for the taping of Jimmy Kimmel Live. There was a loud concert in the adjoining Highland Complex one night, and I was afraid it would keep me up all night because my room was only on the 7th floor and it faced the complex area. However, once I got to my room, I heard nothing, so the rooms must have some great soundproofing. I always recommend the Renaissance Hollywood to anyone I know visiting the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: Hendricks1977
Reviews.Content: After having FINALLY arrived in Hollywod we got to the hotel, and had a wonderful week-long stay. The location is absolutely ideal, and it was a short walk to Mann's Chinese Theater. Tons of shops and movie theaters. The musicians aggressively selling music CDs on Hollywood Boulevard get old real quick. They should pass laws or something to curb that. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. It was a bit noisy on some nights, with wild Hollywood partiers, but we were not too bothered by that. Would hightly reccommend this hotel, if you like a big city atmosphere. This was a sharp departure from the family motels we stayed at on the way. Overall, great

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: JackieBSurrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week from Easter Monday with my 16 yr old daughter. We had a fabulous room with 2 double beds on the 13th floor and the view was spectacular towards downtown L A in front and the hollywood sign to the left. The room was a good size with a very clean and roomy bathroom, which had the usual complimentary toiletries and also a proper hairdryer for you to use. Large mirrored sliding doors opposite the bathroom housed a good size wardrobe which contained an ironing board and iron and a small but adequate safe. There was a large flatscreen TV showing a number of digital channels on top of a unit containing 4 good size drawers. Next to this was a desk and chair for business users where u could plug in your laptop. There is a charge for this although I'm not sure how much as I didn't use it. There was a nice little coffee maker and we managed to adapt it to take our PG tips t-bags by removing the coffee bag and replacing it with the t-bag. Creamer,sugar and sweetners are also provided. There are no overhead lights but 3 lamps are provided and these were more than adequate. There is also a very efficient air con system which was good as the large size picture window does not open. Between the beds there is a bedside table which had a clock radio on it that also played/charged your ipod, which was very handy as the daughter had forgotten her charger! The beds were very comfortable and each bed had 5 pillows on it which were very soft and comfortable. The location of this hotel is excellent with a direct exit onto the Hollywood and Highlands shopping centre and barely a few minutes stroll to Hollywood Boulevard and its attractions. Thankfully we had excellent weather with a short heatwave in the mid 80's F so we were able to take advantage of the pool area. The pool didnt seem to be heated but was really refreshing after a hot day sightseeing. There are lots of sunbeds to lounge on if u just want to relax and there is a pool bar serving anything u want from cocktails ($10)to mocktails and soft drinks. ($4) There are also a few gazebos with sides and seats and tables if u want to keep out of the sun.There is also a spa offering a range of treatment for a fee and a small gym which is free to guests. Another thing I was pleased with was a computer at the concierge where u can check into your flight home and print your boarding pass, something I was worried about before I went. In the foyer there is a small bar and a small starbucks coffee counter. There are 2 drinks dispensers by the check in desk which contains iced water which if flavoured with fresh fruit pieces. Very refreshing after a long flight and hot drive from the Airport. All in all we had a very nice holiday, thankfully returning a day before the volcano erupted, although i wouldnt have minded a few extra days here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mindwurkz
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for a little over 2 months now and have no issues to continue coming back. The hotel is conveniently located in the Hollywood and Highlands area and you can walk from the hotel to the shopping and dining options next door. This is a plus since I found the room service menu to be somewhat limited in terms of options that appealed to me. Rooms are clean and nicely finished and for the most part pretty quiet. I'd avoid rooms near the elevators especially near the concierge lounge since that tends to have a lot of foot traffic. The rooms are nicely sized, I wouldn't consider them to be spacious, but I've never felt cramped in them. I only have a few minor annoyances with the hotel, first being that $29 to valet park overnight is really expensive and I don't know if I would spend that much if I had to pay out of pocket. Second, the key slot for the concierge floors in the elevator is too low. Third, the key slot outside the concierge lounge is too flaky, often involving 4 or more swipes to get it to work. Other than that, the hotel does tend to get overrun by conference groups on occasion, but that's just a sign that the hotel is popular and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Star!”
Reviews.Author: queenmalley
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel seems like it's made for Movie Stars. Very customer service orientated, lots of Old-Hollywood photos around. I was on one of the top floors, concierge level; more money but I felt the free breakfast and free happy hour snacks worth the extra $ (only offered concierge level). My view was spectacular, ask for the Hollywood Hills view. Very large room with high ceilings. Good size bathroom with spa amenities. Great pool area. The free breakfast was loaded, including hot items. My bed was THE most comfortable bed, ever. Lots of comfy pillows. VERY clean room. Great TV, but I was out and about a lot. There is a charge for internet. The Happy Hour snacks are almost a dinner. Hotel connects to Kodak Theater and the Highland Mall. I did not eat at the hotel, as the Happy Hour snacks filled me up. Check out the awesome water, yes water, near the front desk. Best ever, filled with soothing ingredients. Friendly check-in staff. Spa in the hotel, I didn't have time to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Location. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Socalac83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February. Staff was very polite and attentive from the second you walk in to the hotel. I think I paid $215 a night or somethign, which I thought was a good deal. The hotel is in great location. Seconds from the Kodak Theatre, shops, restaunrants, clubs. etc. Rooms were very nice very standard for a Renaissance. Ate breakfast @ there restuarant one mornig and it was good. Can't really screw up eggs and toast. The buffet was a typical hotel breakfast buffer and priced as so... I think $19.95, might of been higher. Also had a drink at there lobby bar. This isn't the place to mingle, juust a very simple lobby bar. Although there small plates were good and the band playing was pretty cool too. Enjoyed the gym one morning and it wasn't bad. Very typical for a hotel gym. Valet was $29 a night, which actually isn't to bad for Hollywood, still a lot to park a car. Hotel was very clean. Staff was nice, courteous, knowledgebale of the area. Great location, nice new hotel, good size rooms, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: Ixplore2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom for her 60th birthday. We wanted to be complete Hollywood tourists, and this is the place to be. Our room on the 18th floor had a great view of the Hollywood sign. You are steps from the shopping and dining center at Hollywood & Highland, so you don't have to go far for Starbucks and good dining. We did not have a car, but the Metro station is right around the corner where you can catch buses and trains. You CAN see LA without a car! The hotel is clean, the service is great, and everyone was helpful, especially the bell men and the doormen. Very safe and convenient. One small gripe is that they should include some sort of breakfast for the price. I would give it five stars if it was included.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel but a bit clinical”
Reviews.Author: Mylovelylady
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip we took to Hollywood & the hotel was exactly as the brochure described. It was super chic, clean, room was spacious, also had a view of the Hollywood sign - no issues at all a lovely, lovely hotel! Also, staff were polite & efficient - all I would love from a holiday hotel however there was no atmosphere & felt more like a business trip accomodation! Regardless of this a holiday is what you make it & my Husband & I enjoyed our time in LA very much. Hollywood Boulevard is not quite what we expected & I avereage about 500 yards of interesting shops or attractions & then nothing but tat shops! We spent most evenings at Universal resort in the Howl at the Moon bar or one of the various restaurants as there was far more holiday vibe here. Hotel backs on to a small shopping precinct & the best bit of Hollywood & is conveniently located for Universal, metro to Beverley Hills & any one of the movue studios for a tour. My advice is to pre plan your activities before you come & just view the hotel as a beautiful but matter of fact bed & board.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent to visit Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: This is a great big hotel that does a great job making their guests feel welcome. I stayed here during a conference and was pleased at how well the staff handled our large group. Everyone was pleasant and always very helpful. The hotel has a very large inviting lobby, with a nice cafe, complete with Starbucks coffee. Luckily for me I was able to get upgraded to a room with a view of the Hollywood sign. My room was nice, well appointed and I always appreciate it when I get extra pillows. Overall, the room is great, but as most big hotels, the bathroom is just plain average. Nothing fancy and not even a great sized shower. My other small complaint was no room service during the day. There's breakfast and dinner, but nothing in between. The hotel is connected to a mall, which is near the Kodak theater and the walk of fame. Anyone who wants to see the sights of Hollywood couldn't pick a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadsDave
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is fantastic. On Highland Ave right on the corner of Hollywood Blvd attached to shops and restaurants. As Australian's we had never tried California Pizza Kitchen before and loved it! The hotel is lovely and well presented. The rooms are a good size and bed was extremely comfortable. We did have one problem on our first night. With about 20 floors we were unlucky enough to be put in a room next to a big suite full of women celebrating a hens night and it was so loud. I went down and complained and the first guy I spoke to behind the counter told me rather rudely that no one else had complained (no one else was in the room next to them!). The second guy (at the Bellman desk) was fantastic and after I explained that I didn't want any action to be taken except for a room move he was very reasonable. However when he turned me over to the next guy behind the counter he was very sour and seemed quite put out over our room change request. We were changed rooms 6 floors up and it was very quiet and peaceful with a great view of the Hollywood sign. The guys at the front doors were always polite and friendly. I guess it depends what you want in a hotel. We stayed for four nights and I think that was enough. We had already travelled to Hawaii and Anaheim and had stayed in places with free internet access (not here, I think it was about $13 per day), a fridge to put things in (the fridge is stacked here and to buy anything out of it was expensive) and no washing facilities (except expensive drycleaning). On the hotel map it says there is a little shop (which was in other places we stayed) but going there it was a Hertz office. So if you want little incidentals during your time there you have to walk to a little shop in the Highlands complex. We were out nearly all day every day making the most of our time in Hollywood and if you want a place to come back at the end of the day and be comfortable then this is it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference brought me here, but I enjoyed every minute!”
Reviews.Author: ttreadway
Reviews.Content: I was here at a conference with 5 of my colleagues and the hotel was great. You could not ask for a better location & the accomodations were nice. The beds were very comfortable, the conference facilities were ample & equipt. the pool area was very nice, not a great time of year to go because the poolside bar & eminities were not open. The location is what sells this place. Walk two steps to a wonderful open air mall, a few more steps you will be right on Hollywood Blvd & the stars. The spa also looked nice, but I did not have time to go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Moosherella
Reviews.Content: Our family just loved this hotel! Our son, 17, and daughter 14, enjoyed the restaurants and stores that were right outside our door at the Hollywood and Highland Center. It was a heartbeat away from the Chinese Theatre, the Walk of Fame, and the Starline Beverly Hills Homes Tour. We felt like we were in the center of all the action at all times. Universal Studios, Warner Brothers, Rodeo Drive, and the Sunset Strip were easy, quick car rides. The staff could not be any nicer or more professional. The rooms and lobby had a cool, Art Deco feel that added to the experience. The gym had great cardio equipment and some weight machines. We didn't go to the spa or the outdoor pool, but it did look inviting. My one complaint is that we had to pay $30 dollars a day for valet parking and tip the guys every time we took the car out and brought it back. It certainly adds up! However, the parking attendants were such nice guys that we it did not change our feelings about being at this wonderful hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the full Hollywood vibe!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rubissaphir
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 12 day holiday in California and this hotel was really the best (much better then the Bellagio, Las Vegas for example). We booked two classical rooms and we got an enormous room with a connecting classical room for the children. For that big room we were probably uprated but they didn't say anything at check in. (So I'm not sure about that) When I say big I mean really huge. Very quiet also and very comfortable beds. Location is great as other reviews say, that we knew. We rented a car and we used the parking next door, much cheaper then valet parking. This hotel is just perfect if you're looking for a great, easy hotel to visit Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance for first time on a to Hollywood in July. I had stayed at Roosevelt on every trip I've taken to LA/Hollywood area (5 times before) and while I've enjoyed most stays there I have to stay the Renaissance blows it out of the water as far as rooms and service. Maybe not as "hip" as the Roosevelt, but had a great three night stay at a alright price (your gonna overpay for anything in area of course). Stayed in a 622 square foot suite and room had nice decor and was very clean and room service was great as well. Also cool to stay there since it's a 5 minute elevator trip and walk to Hollywood and Highland for shopping and food. If you need info on anything in the area the front desk staff were incredibly helpful as well. Also have rental car right there in the hotel, was nice and easy to set up. Have a really cool pool area too. Had a great stay and would highly recommend the hotel for your next or first trip to LA/Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malfie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a family trip travelling around America with my mum, my mum's partner, younger brother, sister and cousin. My sister was only 6 at the time so she was still quite young. We all found this hotel AMAZING! It was literally 40 seconds walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the walk of fame, the Kodak Theatre were the Oscars are held and Mann's chinese theatre were the stars' handprints are. We could see a fab view of the Hollywood sign from our room and the church where Sister Act was filmed was rght next door! The hotel had an amazing roof top pool to catch the rays and was attached to a huge shopping mall which had loads of shops in - everything from Victoria's Secret, Sephora and even higher end shops like Louis Vuitton. The hotel was decorated beautifully - all modern and sleek with bright colours. The lobby was plush and felt luxurious and the bar in the lobby not only served amazing cocktails but had one of the most friendly, helpful barmaids in - she became a friend to our family and it became a nightly ritual when we arrived back at the hotel after the day's activities to stop by the bar and chat to our new friend who gave us lots of recommendations for shopping, sightseeing and exciting things to do in LA. The rooms were modern, very clean and spacious and had lovely floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Hollywood hills so had a great view. We also ate at the hotel restaurant one night. Admittedly the food wasn'y the best and we all thought it was way overpriced for what we got but it was pleasant enough. The hotel also has car poarking facilities which was great for us because we had hired a ca to drive onto Vegas and it was good to be able to park it safely on the complex. We also liked the fact the hotel had room service - we ordered a beatifully tasty birthday cake for my ister's 7th birthday while staying at the hotel and we ordered breakfast to our rooms every day - all were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!...”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: but if you are staying here for a certain type of atmosphere, look somewhere else. The location is great!, right off of Hollywood Blvd in the Kodak Theatre complex. This is the place to be if you want to experience that side of Hollywood. The rooms though, left a little to be desired. Cleanliness could have been at a much higher level (I would expect this at a Renaissance).. and the rooms, although the decor and furnishings are designed to be sleek and modern.. felt a bit boring and uninspired. Quite bland. So I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location but if you are looking to be wowed by your room, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: I debated where to stay in Los Angeles; Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, or Hollywood? We made the right decision when we chose the Renaissance Hotel. My husband, our 3 kids (ages 10,12,14) were upgraded to an executive suite (room 901) that overlooked the Hollywood sign. The suite had 2 king beds and one sleeper sofa. It was huge! The service was amazing and the breakfast buffet was excellent. They had everything imaginable at the buffet, including a person standing there making fresh carrot juice. You are right in the middle of all the action and still close to Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. Being in Hollywood is like being at Times Square in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great room, great shopping, great eateries”
Reviews.Author: Alioopo18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location for Hollywood. Very close to MRT station to get to Universal Studios. Local buses and sightseeing buses stop just in front of Graumans Chinese Theatre, right next to the hotel. The shops in Hollywood and Highland are great as are the restaurants. Our room was really nice, had a great view of the Hollywood sign and was very quiet. We felt quite safe walking around at night, I had my 70 year old Mother travelling with us and she felt quite OK to walk back to the Hotel on her own when she was getting tired. We thoroughly enjoy staying here and if had the chance would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: C21A3
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in California for vacation and we wanted a hotel with a great location - this one definitely fits the bill. The customer service was outstanding and the rooms were great - clean, quiet and big enough to allow teenagers to have their own space. We were close walking distance to Hollywood Blvd and Graumann's Chinese Theater. The only negative comment that I would have about this hotel was the cost of the valet parking. $29 per day seemed pretty steep to me - but we solved this by parking at the mall next door and paying $10. I would highly recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: see-more-do-more
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. Luxurious rooms (I stayed with my two teenagers in an Executive room which had 2 beds and a pull out sofa bed). The staff are amazing. The location is perfect for all sight seeing, restaurants, shows etc. They helped with tour bookings, restaurant bookings, maps/directions etc. All services were superb and surprising well priced (laundry/room service etc). I would definitely stay there again and with my teenagers. It is a long way from Disneyland and from Magic Mountain. About 45 - 90 minutes depending on traffic. Cab fare would be $130 or more. There are no public transport services to either destination easily accessible for a day to either theme park. The Doorman (not the concierge) is the go to guy. He negotiated a Town car (chauffeur) for the day for us cheaper than a cab. We ended up hiring the guy twice and we created our own private tours of everything for about the same price as standard tourist operator. It is safe to walk around the neighbourhood. You can see the Hollywood sign from your hotel room. The Hollywood bowl is one block. The Kodak theatre is part of the hotel and Stars walk of Fame is around the corner as are all the major Hollywood attractions. Universal studios is one 10 minute subway ride away for $1.25 and perfectly safe and clean. And if you are that way inclined you will be able to see a few celebrities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Don't get Adjoining Room”
Reviews.Author: lcat77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was decent, great location and the staff was AMAZING. The concierge had great restaurant recommendations! The gym was amazing - 5 treadmills with tv's, bikes, elliptical machines, water, towels, weights, apples! My only complaint - I agree with the reviewer that mentioned not to get an adjoining room. We had one and we found our neighbors VERY loud.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Exceptional Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SeaTravelTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November and enjoyed every bit of it. The hotel's location is the best. You can walk to everything and/or take a quick cab. The staff was always attentive and professional and made sure everything was taken care of from the Housekeepers, Housemen, to the Front Desk and Valet staff. Way to go! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms weren't great”
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: I was so thrilled to stay at this hotel because it looked so very nice on the outside and in the lobby however the rooms were extremely dirty. Bodily fluids on the walls. Bathroom wasn't cleaned very well. Carpet was old and dirty. No real amenities in the room. The only real pro of this hotel was the proximity to everything in Hollywood. You could walk anywhere. It is directly attached to the Hollywood & Highland center that has many restaurants and shops. You can also get directly to the Kodak theater from the hotel. As far as room quality, this wasn't my worst but definitely didn't live up to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...pity about the noisy air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: md200910
Reviews.Content: I recently picked this Hotel due to its location. After 4 days in Vegas and about 2 hours sleep I was looking forward to relaxing in LA for 3 days at the end of my holiday. I booked on line at US $150 a night and arriving in the evening was given a room on Level 3. After trying to go sleep I soon found out that the A/C plant and equipment was directly located outside my window and noise so loud it was like trying to sleep on a 747 airplane! After an hour of this I asked reception to change me to another room and after telling them I was on Level 3, was immediately given another room (obviously I wasn't the first person to do this). I was given a room on level 20, larger room, cleaner and quieter! Whilst this is listed as "4 star hotel" has pool & gym, the rooms don't really live up to a 4 star rating. For one the air-conditioning is thru a wall vent that runs up the middle of building not ducted ceiling a/c which made the room a/c rather noisy. The bathrooms are average (white tiled floor and combined bathtub/shower). The one plus is the widescreen HD TV. The Hotel charged $174 to my credit card which I have asked them to remove (I did not use any additional facilities) just another anoying thing - I am yet to receive a response. Overall except for its location, this Hotel was somewhat of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: KBaldemi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend. The rooms were tidy and service was good too. The only thing I didn't like was the flashing in-room smoke detector and the sound of the elevators nearby. Earplugs can drown out the elevator sounds, but he flashing smoke detector was like having a flashing beacon in your bedroom - yikes. The flashing wasn't apparent during daylight hours, but as soon as you turned off the lights for bedtime the light show would begin. The location is awesome too , walking distance to the El Capitan Theatre, historical Roosevelt Hotel, Mann's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Jimmy Kimmel Live Studios, Madame Tussaud's Wax Musuem and the shops and restaurants of the Highland and Hollywood Complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist location; be sure not to get an adjoining room”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location for the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and to see Jimmy Kimmel Live taping. The check in experience was a wow. Even walked me to the elevator. Room has a cool 2 piece desk - the lower portion on rollers - and good quality desk chair (even the arms adjusted). Great light fixtures. LG flat panel TV. Attractive large art prints on the walls. Gold tones throughout the room - with a darker gold accent wall. I had a fabulous view of the Hollywood sign. A bar-fridge is free upon request (and there's a bit of room to put your own stuff). Hot water was an issue both at night and the next morning. The metal garbage cans once filled with ice make great coolers - although there is a neat ice bucket. Side tables have room under the glass to store your items. My disappointment is the sound from my neighbours. I could hear the actual conversations; I forgot to request a non adjoining room - as suggested in other reviews here. The 24 hour fitness room has 4 each of elliptical, bike, and treadmills. The best built in TVs ever. And the treadmills have built in fans. Just outside - in a tented area - is other cardio equipment. The outdoor heated pool is a good depth; I had it to myself at 5pm. There's a "Fresh & Easy" grocery store about 4 blocks away. Hertz onsite is open 7 days a week. The attached mall is very modern with an emphasis on the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: Melbourneguy
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood has a fabulous location at the junction of Hollywood and Highland. The hotel is quite large - its obviously popular with the conference market - but its perfect for the leisure travellers too. The rooms have been recently refurbished so they feel new and fresh - we also had amazing views toward the Hollywood sign, the Griffith Observatory and the Capitol Records Building. From the Renaissance you take access the subway rail network which is a quick and efficient way to get you places such as downtown (for a Saturday morning Conservancy Walking Tour) or to Union Staiton to connect with regular bus service to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: Were here for five days and nothing bad to say. Everything went fine, staff was amazing and location is the best there is. Rooms were clean and everything in the room seem to be renewed. Breakfast was good too. Absolutely nothing bad to say. Two thumbs up. Rented a car at the hotel (Hertz) and there is a Hollywood Highlands parking lot just a few steps away, if you don't want to use vallet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: NixNix
Reviews.Content: Location just right to see everything easlily, many trips leave from Chinese Theatre nearby. We had view of Hollywood sign from room & the Walk of fame is just a few steps away. The Metro to get to Universal is also very close by. The shopping centre has restraunts too so lots of places to eat. The Hotel is large & very modern. The rooms comfortable but the double beds in triple room were too small, 4 feet perhaps? Ok for one person, not 2. (And we are not big!) The pool area is small but clean and pleasant.
