Could see someone famous as they do stay here, we saw the Village People going off to Hollywood Bowl from here!

Reviews.Title: “Location was the selling point”
Reviews.Author: czardas
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the location when travelling and aren't hiring a car. You literally have the Hollywood walk of fame on your doorstep, Gruemans Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre, not to mention being attatched to the Highland shopping complex. Our room was large, with a city view which personally gave your more to look at, views of the Hollywood sign can be seen from the Highland Mall for free, so why pay more for it with your room. The bathroom was clean and the beds soft with excellent linen. Although I didnt' use it, the pool area looked large and was buzzing with people on a Sunday afternoon. Looked like all the "in" crowd were gathered there. The price is a little steep but in the end I couldn't of come up with a better hotel for the location. Would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: Luckyjoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel locate right beside the busiest street of Hollywood blvd. It has great views - you can have view over the street (facing the LA downtown far away) or have view look directly to the 'HOLLYWOOD' sign on the hill. I guess this is the best part of the hotel. The stars walk, Chinese Theater, Kodak Theater, all just right outside the hotel. The hotel also link to a outdoor shopping mall. The pool is great too. My only problem with this hotel is that Internet is not free -- even motel 8 provide free internet access in nowadays -- you need to pay internet for 24 hrs access - unfortunately, once you check out, your internet expired as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location and Style!”
Reviews.Author: Louis B
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel! It is a pleasure to come back to the Renaissance property! What a great location! Right by all the Hollywood attractions! Great for sightseeing and shopping! Great dinning around! I recommend lemon soufle pancakes for breakfast! The rooms are stylish, and all have amazing views of hollywood! The pool on the roof is the best, with great view of the hollywood sign!

Reviews.Title: “This is what you get for $300 a night?”
Reviews.Author: TravlnMan
Reviews.Content: First, the pluses... The location is great if you want to explore Hollywood. The hotel is literally half a block off Hollywood Boulevard. Everything you could ever need is within walking distance. The place was mostly spotless, and I certainly have no complaints in regards to cleanliness. Where I can complain is in the service department. While folks were nice enough, the competence level was lacking. The hotel could not find my reservation (which was made over a month in advance) and did not want to give me the government rate for which the room was reserved. They wanted to charge me the full $299 rate for the same room. The guy working the desk seemed to have difficulty understanding that I didn't think I should have to pay full price since I was there for a conference being held in the very same hotel, and I had reserved well in advance at the lower rate. Eventually the matter was resolved, after I had already been charged for the full price, and the difference was refunded to my credit card. When I got to my assigned room, I could not believe they actually charged $300 a night for THAT. The room was little more than a standard hotel room, with a bed, a desk, a television and a bathroom. I have had one bedroom suites, with full amenities included, for one third of the $300 nightly rate for this room. Granted, they were not in Hollywood, but is Hollywood really an excuse for such exorbitant rates? The view from my room was also horrid. The window looks out onto the roof, and all of the air conditioning equipment for the third floor. My view was of the hotel wall and a roof access door, with several soggy cardboard boxes strewn about. Someone obviously didn't consider that the area could be seen from the room windows. Also, the flea-bag motel next door had me concerned that I might be witness to a crime if I watched long enough. The fact that the hotel charges $13 a day for high speed internet access, which most hotels I have stayed in provide for free these days, was just an added insult. It seems that this hotel caters to people who have plenty of money and don't mind parting with it quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel,the rooms,staff and location were all perfect,the only bad thing i could say is having to pay $12 for use of the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: iluvla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a month and had a wonderful time. The staff were friendly and very helpful. View from our room was good. Nice to see more plants around the pool -made it less stark. the lobby came alive at night .love people watching. Staying over 4 weeks you see all types come and go and we noticed those who were pleasant and the few who treated the staff badly. 'Always treat a man as you would wish to be treated yourself' comes to mind. We had no problems with room service who were quick to answer if we needed anything The room was serviced every day to a very good standard. We look foreward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_2206
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in every way. Friendly staff, luxurious and clean rooms, superb location, great shopping precinct, nearby restaurants were fantastic, there really isn't anything that I can fault it on. It is a little expensive, but then you are in Hollywood. If I get back to Hollywood I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Renaissance standards.”
Reviews.Author: JB2go
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Marriott Renaissance hotels in the UK and have consistently been delighted. These hotels felt like true luxury accomodations. The staffs, rooms, restaurants and surroundings made us feel really special. The Renaissance Marriott fell far short of what we have come to expect -- and enjoy -- in this class of hotel. Where to begin? The rooms were fine. the service was fine. But this is the point. It was all 'fine,' but never exceptional. Some particulars: - the rooms lacked any information about what the hotel offered, how to obtain needed services, what the neighborhood had in store, local maps, etc. - the hotel charged a $29!!! daily fee for 'valet' parking, which was the only type of parking available. This meant a delay every time we needed the car (a 'must' in LA) and also required a tip every time we wanted to drive somehwere. - you'd think that a luxury accomodation would offer some, er, luxuries. But everything -- from Internet access to daily newspapers to parking (see above) cost extra. Bottom line: the hotel is fine, but not a Marriott Renaissance. We expect better from this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly average for the price - service lousy”
Reviews.Author: mountaineermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Location is good if you need to be in the heart of Hollywood. Highland Center gets old after a few days, and the neighborhood around it would be scary if I was alone at night (I went places with a group of people). I was not in the room much, thank goodness. Every day I had to call and request washcloths--none in the room--and wait 90+ minutes for them to arrive. It became like a game to see if I'd get any after my room was cleaned or not. Several days the trash was not emptied--I ended up setting it out in the hall and someone took care of it. The bartender at the ppol had a foul mouth and talked loudly. Several families were at the pool and if I had my family there, I would have been offended. I had to stay at this hotel for a conference, but would try somewhere else for more charm and courtest. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: I'm a lifelong SoCal resident and this was my first time staying overnight in Hollywood. This hotel is AWESOME! We are able to check-in at like 1PM without any problems, parking was never an issue and cheap ($10 overnight). The staff was great! The beds were way comfortable and the shower was great too! Well worth the price I paid!

Reviews.Title: “once again, good stay”
Reviews.Author: fizzengland
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay here, first in 2006, once again, a good stay, no wait at check in, very polite, infact our checkin clerk took us over to the elevators, called the lift for us and pressed the button for our floor!! how is that for service, we were only staying in a regular room this time, not club!! room good, very bright and new, large well equiped bathrom, nice to see new ,very large flat screen tv, but the location cannot be beaten in this area, ajoins the large shopping mall, everything you want there, good food etc, direct access on to hollywood blvd, walk of stars, Graumans chinese theatre, a few mins to hollywood bowl, griffith park, santa monica mountains, Mullhulland av, lv this area, pleas e feel free to contact me privatley as we have extensive knowledge of this area regarding things to do, luv to help

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Beach_Baby
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights last month. Hotel is in a great location..very close to all the "touristy stuff". With the amount of money we're paying for the stay, I can't believe we were charged $ 13 for WIFI and $ 29 for valet parking every night! And also, when we booked our room on Marriott.com, we are suppose to get $50 credit towards a spa service @ Spa Luce but we never got a voucher! Front Desk didn't know about the promotion. And on the day that we're checking out, the hotel was super busy because Lebron James and his entourage were staying there. But the usually efficient valet service came to a halt for regular hotel guests! We waited almost an hour to get our car after check out because the valet attendants were busy attending to high profile guest. very disappointing!!!! I wonder if this is in their "Marriott Policy"!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room and location”
Reviews.Author: cindybelm
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Hollywood or traveling to other parts of LA. Bus and metro right around the corner. Kodak Theater, Graumann's Chinese and shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: This is a nicer than usual, upscale hotel for the Marriott family. My room on the 12th floor was very spacious, had floor to ceiling windows and great views of the city. Check-in was efficient and very friendly; I was made to feel welcome. The room was quiet, though street noise was occasionally heard, due mostly to the large windows. Internet (wired) is $13/day and includes long distance telephone service. Large screen HD TV present, but missing some of my favorite channels (Comedy Central, no functioning PBS). Stayed here for a conference, so really didn't look elsewhere. Temperature controls functioned well and were quiet. The bathroom was average in size and design, and had good lighting. I did get a chance to use the spa -- very nice facilities, with a large steam room and locker room. As is typical, this is included with spa services or can be accessed separately for $15/day for hotel guests. A small fitness room and outdoor pool are free, but there is no changing or shower areas unless you pay for spa access. Location is 1/2 block north of Hollywood Blvd at Highland; an upscale mall is adjacent. It took about 45 minutes on SuperShuttle to get to/from the airport. There is not much else to do in the neighborhood that is walkable, though as mentioned elsewhere, it is "tourist central" and a walk down Hollywood Blvd to look at the stars is easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Very Over-Rated!”
Reviews.Author: dmdifalco
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Tinsel Town lies the very over-rated Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. It was ok but I wasn't thrilled with anything about it. The only thing I found that was an asset about staying there is that it is within walking distance of many of Hollywood's main attractions. The building is old and the decor is very plain. If you are a smoker...you have to ride the elevator down and go outside. Nothing plush or very exciting about the hotel. Hard to believe that actors and actresses flock here for the Oscar's. Maybe I expected too much?

Reviews.Title: “Connections...”
Reviews.Author: TC1968
Reviews.Content: On the positive side: this hotel enjoys a great location, just on the corner of North Highland and Hollywood Boulevard, right where all the look-alikes hang around doing their stuff. The windows are pretty well soundproofed, so the 24 hour traffic isnâ€™t an issue. Rooms on the north side of the hotel enjoy a great view of the Hollywood sign. The rooms are quite sizeable and well appointed with flat screen TVs with a very handy gizmo that allows you to easily play portable DVDs/laptops/MP3, through it, if you canâ€™t find anything better to do with yourself, in Hollywood. So, why so few stars? Well, the room that I was in had connecting doors, which afforded absolutely no sound insulation. Now I hate these. If you are staying with family members, and theyâ€™re in the next room you can get hold of them fairly easily, via the corridor. Connecting doors arenâ€™t used by 99% of guests, but mean that you can hear what next door are ordering from room service. Sadly, my next door neighbours were highly excitable (and loud) fratboys and some hired â€œfriendsâ€� on an LA weekend, which made life a bit of a misery. My other half put in a call to security and they showed up pretty quickly and asked our neighbours to move the part-ay out. Sadly, and possibly predictably, this made them worse and they started trying to knock the connecting door in. By now itâ€™s about 3:30am. I went down to reception and they put us into another room, we just left our stuff in our old room â€“ planning to return and pack (we were flying back to the UK the next morning). I reckon in a one star Hollywood flop-house youâ€™d be kicked out if you tried to attack a fellow guestâ€™s room, having already had a warning from security. Not here, though. When we got back to our original room our friendly neighbours were still bellowing banal rubbish at one another. Not a massive issue as we were packing up and leaving, but I would question whether they really know how to run a hotel. I always think you can tell a lot about a hotel by taking a look at the lobby in the middle of the night. In this place there were parties of squealing girls running around with bottles. In the lobby itself there were a few guys crashed out on the sofas. I guess itâ€™s Hollywood so they think itâ€™s OK, but itâ€™s not a place that Iâ€™ll be back to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Samax
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our trip in the USA and one of the Hotel we enjoyed mostly was the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. The location is just perfect for a short stay like our one was in L.A. Just attached at the Kodak Theatre, the Walk of Fame and the hustle und bustle of Hollywood. Rooms are pretty large, very clean, though the bathroom is a little bit small fot the category. As usual, on higher level Hotel (and cannot understand why) you have to pay for the Wifi in room around 13$ per day (from noon to noon) or at the business center it cost you 0,30$ per minute. You can get a very good service in the lobby, right at the concierge desk, where there is a Computer which gives you the opportunity (free of charge) to check you flight, make on lone chek in and print the boarding passes. Guest service at the Hotel is outstanding: really great, and not only because they gave us a late check out unitl 3pm free of charge. As well we arrived quite early (at 10 am) and they gave us the room immediatly. Valvet parking is 29$ per night , at least not cheap but not expensive as well. Excellent service, car was there immediatly when requested. Very easy to reach and easy to go to the main attraction of LA (Beverly Hills, Universal, Santa Monica), must say an excellent choice for the city.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Ann_H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights during a multi city break for our 20th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel is perfectly situated right on Hollywood Boulevade and attached to the Hollywood Highlands centre with all its shops and resturants. We checked in with no wait upon arrival and our large room was clean and wekk equiped overlooking the street at the front of the hotel with a nive view of the Hollywood sign. All staff were helpful with advise and organising trips etc. There is a very nice pool on a roof level some 5 floor up. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood: if you want to be a tourist, this Hotel is for you.”
Reviews.Author: JillDerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4 person room. Positives: spacious comfortable room. Great view right over Hollywood with a clear view of the Hollywood sign from the large windows along one wall. No fridge but provided one free on request. Very central: in most of the tourist tours take you round places/exibits within 300m of the Hotel! Near the Pantages, the El Capitan Theater, Mann's Chinese, the walk of fame etc. Free gym, with apple provided each visit. Negatives: None really, except cost of taxi to airport- $70- from Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed for one night on business”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueGin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance last weekend on a quick one night business trip. We got it on Priceline for $125, which we thought was a fair price. This hotel had everything we required, including efficient (although cold) check in service at the front desk, nicely appointed lobby, lobby bar and a rather expensive, not very good restaurant. The service in the bar, the restaurant and the room service were all friendly and fast, however the food at the restaurant was left wanting. The lobby is, as others have pointed out, more posh than the rooms, and especially the hallways, but once in the room it was adequate, with excellent sound proofing, very comfortable bed and linens, nice new flat screen TV, in room wireless internet (for a fee). The parking was easier with the valet, for only $5 more it was worth it, and we found it friendly and efficient. I saw a business center but never went into it as we had internet in our room. It was only a few minutes to the beach in Santa Monica which wasnâ€™t as crowded as we thought it would be so all in all we had a great stay and didnâ€™t break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fun with Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: NLockwood
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood several times. I love the hotel and the location. Great views of the Hollywood sign. Near a mall, the Pantages, the El Capitan Theater, Mann's Chinese, the walk of fame, etc. Hollywood is a lot of fun with teenagers; the double-decker hop-on, hop-off bus picks up right next door at the Chinese Theater. A very safe adventure for my 17 year old daughter and her friend. They went all over and never asked to use the car! My sisters and I took a Movie Star Home Tour, which is unusual for local Orange County people, but it was well worth the 2.5 hours and $39.00 price tag. If you are a local, and have never done the tour DO IT! It picks up near the Double Decker. Helter Skelter fans would love the Dearly Departed Helter Skelter tour too. I am disappointed to read such negative comments about Hollywood being dirty, etc....It's a big city, and although it may not be the cleanest city in the area, if you are at all star struck, it is a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Like Holywood - Cheap, Nasty and Lacking in Class”
Reviews.Author: RastusJones
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately used this as a stopover hotel. 1st mistake - stopping over in disgusting Holywood (why would anywone willingly go there?) and second mistake was staying in the Renaissance.... Crude, ugly and 3* at BEST. When asked concierge for nice recommendation for a good dinner in a classy restaurant - he told us about a "classy" burger restaurant around the corner where they "let you make your own burger".......no comment. Dont waste your cash. Some nice hotels in Beverly Hills.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gggpack
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and could not have found a better hotel and location. The staff treated us very well even though we booked through a 3rd party. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best !”
Reviews.Author: Asphaltkid
Reviews.Content: From the front door in....you're treated like royalty. Beautiful lobby. And the room WOW We splurged and went for a coner suite. Just beautiful. Tenth floor over looking the Kodak Center and the hotel's pool. The king sized bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Down comforter and pillows and plenty of the later. We had a relative who lived in the area and he showed us the town. So much to see. Get a guide book and pick your favorites. We took in a musical, "Legally Blond", went to the Planitarium, the Queen Mary, Venus Beach, Chinatown, Little Mexico and more. And the restaurants are to die for. Such variety. All personal are top notch. I know that when we plan an event the Renaissance will be tops on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, on the Mall”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: My 18 y.o. daughter and I stayed here for three nights, our last hurrah before she leaves for college. I was a little apprehensive at first; Hollywood Blvd is SO sleazy and this area is really rough. However, the hotel is very nice; the rooms were nice and the service was pretty good - the only problem we had was that they said they didn't have the double room I requested, but after I insisted we needed two beds they magically found us a room. Valet parking is expensive, but worth it because the fee includes unlimited in and out, and they bring your car in a jiffy. Graumann's Chinese (Kodak?) Theatre is right next door and the location is in the heart of the Hollywood Blvd stroll. It's attached to a four-story mall with decent shopping and restaurants (the Grill on Hollywood was excellent), which was very nice for us because we came to shop! We spent a day bicycling around Santa Monica and Venice (fun!!) and did the VIP tour at Universal Studios (expensive but worth it), also went to Rodeo Drive (fun to look, but who would buy that stuff??) and cruised Beverley Hills, Brentwood, Malibu, etc. A great trip, and this was a good central location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Roof-Top Pool, Bar, Nice Rooms, Central Location...What More Could One Ask For?”
Reviews.Author: elouise82
Reviews.Content: The main highlight for me was the rooftop pool which also had a great photo-op as it looks over the famous "Hollywood" sign. Another highlight was the bar food that was served on the rooftop, which consisted of classic American dishes such as the Aberdeen Angus Beef Burger! This hotel is great for children, with the swimming pool and being attached to the Kodak Theatre. However, if you are travelling to Los Angeles I would recommend hiring a car- yes the hotel is in the hubbub of Las Angeles, located next to the Kodak and Chinese Theatre's and also next to the walk of fame. However, if you want to get out of 'tourist central' you would need a car to travel to destinations such as Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive and Universal. Whilst staying in LA I went on the Kodak Theatre tour (recommended) and discovered that the Renaissance hotel is the place where all the interviews are held after the actors receive their OSCAR's - which I found quite interesting. Not much else to say other than the service was great, the pool was relaxing and the rooms were squeaky clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Hollywood and has a shopping mall next door. On our arrival the reception staff claimed that there was no record of our booking. However we do not haave any evidence who is at blame here - the hotel or the tour company. My complaint with the hotel is the attitude of the reception staff during this incident. Their solution was to put 4 adults in a double room to share beds stating that the hotel was fully booked! I therefore telephoned the tour company to note my extreme concern and following this we were upgraded for no extra charge to a suite with sufficient beds for all. Not bad for a hotel that was fully booked!!! The room that we were finally given was clean, large in size and even had a view of the Hollywood sign. We also spent time in the pool area which was lovely. Following an upseting arrival at the hotel, an excellent time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “great location / nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpn7330
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an evening with my teen daughter. Location was fantastic, just around the corner from Kodak Theatre, and Grauman Theatre. Right on Hollywood Blvd. Nice place, great staff. Very attentive. Metro ( subway ) is just outside and makes travel to Staples ( Pico stop) very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to center yourself in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: For the July 4th holiday, we decided to "keep it local" and flew down to Southern California for a three day holiday. For the Renaissance, we combined two different packages for two separate days. Our first impression upon arrival was a little mixed. When we walked into the lobby, there was a band in the lounge area playing exceptionally amplified music to an adoring crowd. But the concierge (or "customer wrangler"?) was there to guide us to the front desk, where both the desk person and I had to pretty much shout in order to talk over the loud band. Most likely your arrival won't be nearly as loud, though. One of our package deals included room service "pizza, two soft drinks" (10" turned out to be just the right size for two people to share), an in-room movie and breakfast. The other packaged included a 50 minute spa treatment (upgrading to an 80 minute massage would've only cost another $40 or so) and lunch. Both deals included valet parking, which was quite a relief not having to worry about hunting for parking or paying extra fees for stashing the car in self parking. The front desk provided me with a discount card (typical discount was 10%) for a number of the eateries and shops in the mall between the hotel and the Kodak theater. Right now, new reservations at Renaissance also come with a $50 discount off any Spa Treatmentâ€¦. which my girl ended up using on a pedicure she was happy with. In the room, there was no minibar, no room fridge and no room safe (which I would have loved to have had, since I like to lock up un-needed credit cards from my wallet or my computer or passports or whatever). Closet holds an iron and ironing board and also plastic laundry bags. There's a complimentary overnight shoe shine service but the first night I called for the bell guy to pick up my shoes and he never dropped by. They did a fabulous job on my shoes the second night, tho! Room had a flat screen TV and an interesting box next to the TV where one can plug in various cables (like a stereo connector cable from an iPod, a VGA import port from your laptop), presumably so you can stream music or movies into the flat screen TV. In room movies were included in one package, but the audio / video quality of this in demand service were remarkably terrible for the big screen TV (the first screen you'll see of any movie is "This movie has been edited for size" screen; big screen TV's don't matter much when the resolution being displayed is bad). Twist restaurant is open only for breakfast and not for lunch or dinner. Sandwiches and salads are catered by Wolfgang Puck's kitchen and are available at lunchtime by the pool. Don't worry about dinner options within the hotel. If you're not up for doing room service, just walk next door to the mall and there are a number of semi-formal and informal places to dine. The fitness center (next to the Spa, just indoors from the 4th floor outdoor pool) has a very nice collection of equipment. One neat little feature is that you can plug your iPod into a number of the exercise machines and watch full screen movies or stream music from your iPod through the machine. Internet is available via either WiFi or Ethernet cables within the room but once you buy it, you'll be set for 24 hours and it'll also enables unlimited domestic Long Distance on the phone so you can keep in touch with family/friends via a cordless landline instead of relying on your cell provider. All in all, we were really happy with how our Renaissance stay turned out and we felt the $620 we spent (inclusive, for the two packages on two separate days) came out to be a relatively good value for all that we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision For Budget and Area”
Reviews.Author: WelshbabeSingapore
Reviews.Content: Before I booked this hotel I read and re-read so many reviews and web pages on areas and hotels. I had planned on booking the Hilton Universal but it was fully booked, this turned out to be good for us as there didn't seem to be a lot to do in that area. Anyway, the location as many other reviews have indicated is excellent. Seriously, just a hop skip and a jump from the walk of fame, Grauman's, metro station, Kodak ..... The whole area became so familiar to us. The lobby area was nothing special but there is a side entrance to the Hollywood and Vine shopping area where all the other attractions lead off. This is a huge convenience. We had a double queen room - we were two adults and two kids (age 8 and 16). The room was larger than 'normal' queen rooms and it certainly made a difference. Room was very clean and fresh, nice and bright with a great view of the Hollywood sign. Bathroom was fine. Breakfast in the Twist Restaurant was an excellent start to some very busy days. There is also a fab doughnut shop opposite for early morning coffee - Highland Doughnut was a great hit. I think that the best thing about staying here was that because we were in the middle of it all we found that we weren't rushing round and could take more time to explore at leisure. Universal Studios is only one stop away on the Metro train and there is a tourist office outside the Kodak Theatre that is very helpful. Hollywood Bowl is within walking distance and Warner Bros a short cab ride away. Aside, this is the hotel where much of the stars get ready for the big Oscar night, where the Governor's Ball is held and many of the press conferences take place following the event. it is also where the American Idol Hollywood week competitors stay. Having said that don't expect something fancy, it's just clean, modern, pleasant and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in L.A. !!”
Reviews.Author: Honestly-2-U
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want a location. Everything you need is within walking distance. The beaches are a short drive away as is Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive etc. Park in the shopping center to save the valet charges, it really is no big deal to do. (cost is $10 a day if self parking, valet is $30) If less than 4 hours have the ticket stamped at one of te stores and it is just $2. There is a great coffe shop accross the street from the main entrance for baking and food, really good and reasonable prices. (Highland Coffe and Donuts ??) Great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrsungrules
Reviews.Content: I wanted to travel close to home for some R&R and I decided on a two night stay at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel. The location of this hotel is amazing in terms to the close proximity to the famous Hollywood landmarks. Plus, the hotel is connected to the Hollywood and Highland center with lots of restaurants and shops with the grand Kodak Theatre connected right next door. However, the hotel itself is lacking customer service and basic full service. I am a young traveler and the hotel staff gave me a lower standard of service compared with older/business guests. I believe, I deserve the same quality of service in terms of greetings and manners as other guests since im paying for the same service if not more. The room went through a renovation with the usual flat screen tv and a new bed, but its old Hollywood themed furniture/sofa does not match with the new interiors. The size of the rooms/bathroom are normal Marriott standards. The highlight of the hotel was the extremely helpful/friendly housekeeping staff at this hotel. They are terrific~!!!! HOwever, i would only recommend this hotel to older clientel rather than a younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Hollywood, Rodeo Dr., Beverly Hills, Walk of Stars, etc.”
Reviews.Author: YborJoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an exceptional good location for our family vacation stop in Hollywood. Located very close to Grauman's theater, walk of stars, etc. Also connected to outstanding shopping mall with good restaurant choices. Above all, the service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Great standard”
Reviews.Author: garry5880
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location (taxi from lax will cost between 50-80 dollars depending on traffic). Hotel is right on hollywood boulevard and next to the kodak and chinese theatres.Opposite and down the road about 300m is ripleys believe it or not and hollwoods guiness book of records. The hotel is also joined to a shopping centre called hollywood and highland which has a number of shops including restaurants and fast food places.Sunset boulevard and rodeo drive are close by too. The rooms are a good standard, modern but not the decor described on the website. Some rooms have a view of the hollywood sign. Breakfast buffet definately worth the money. Would recommend the famous peoples house tour by starline (outside chinese theatre), you get too see lots of great houses and also good to take you through beverly hills,bel air and hollywood hills

Reviews.Title: “It's Hollywood, baby!”
Reviews.Author: Parsky
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled together and wanted to be in the center of Hollywood even though we are not really big celebrity watchers. This really fit the bill. All of the sights of Hollywood are right outside the hotel, and many big name celebrities frequent this hotel. With a little prodding, we could have stayed much longer. The pool is fantastic, super views, but many locals try to crash the party, and security has to clear them out. I did not find the hotel's restaurant worthwhile for the exorbitant price with so many alternatives at the mall nearby. You need a car in LA, without a doubt, and the self park for $10 was really a bargain. San Francisco parking is three or four times the price easily. My only complaint--we were promised a room overlooking the Hollywood sign, and that promise was never delivered, but our view of the El Capitan theatre with its nightly premieres was probably better anyway. I learned that the Hollywood sign is not lit up at night. So, a definite thumbs up for this celebrity mecca Renaissance hotel, a definite cut above and I will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: selrahc1967
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here in May 2009. Hotel Connects with Graumans Theater and a small mall type shopping area and is also adjacent to the Hollywood Walk of fame and the Kodak theater. I tend to always stay with Marriott as I am never displeased. The rooms are nice, typical Marriott setup but as always clean and comfortable. Valet is typical for a large city at $25 a day + tip, there is a parking garage next door that you can park at for $10 a night but this is not a good idea if you plan on taking your car out as after 120mins it is $10 to get out and then you have another $10 price after another 2 hrs if you want to remove the car. Price was decent but it can get pricey at peak or weekend times for the location. The lobby was nice, the staff was pleasant and they leave your bill in a awesome envelope with movies quotes. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: I LOVED THIS HOTEL! From the moment we walked in, I knew it would be great. The valet was friendly and nice, our bags were taken care of right away, and the bellhop gave us a tour and explained about the area and hotel all the way into the room. The view of the city and pool was amazing and the room in general was so roomy, extremely clean and comfortable. We never heard our neighbors. Everyone was just so nice. The only regret I have is not being able to use the pool. If I were ever in LA again, I'd definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “fun”
Reviews.Author: Priya_T
Reviews.Content: in the heart of hollywood, adjoining the world famous kodak theatre. hotel is luxurious, room and bath too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Service and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: joslync
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here and knew about the price, but we paid for the location. You are in a perfect setting, close to all the night life and shopping. When we arrived the hotel staff was very courtesy, assisting us with luggage and even asking my husband if they could get him a drink. We got to our room and it was nicely decorated, very stylish, until we got to the bathroom. My husband was about to take a shower, when the faucet exploded from the wall and water was every where. I have to admit I was a little pissed since we paid so much for the room and to have this happen. I immediately went to the lobby and got the manager's assistance. The manager was calm and did everything to assist me. He was perfect, even upgrading our room to a deluxe room for our troubles. I know many would say that because of the incident why would I give them a high rating. It was because of the immediate service I got that calmed me down and actually made a great weekend out of it. I would definately recommend staying here because of the great service we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: donalmca
Reviews.Content: My trip to LA was for a conference but I was joined by my wife for the last couple of days and I needed somewhere that suited both a business and tourist itinerary, The really good thing that I would say is that the location is excellent for the buzz of Hollywood. If you stay in Downtown areas they can be a bit quiet but just a stones throw away from the hotel you have all the sights and sounds of the famous Grumman Theatre etc. Also, a lot of the tours of Movie stars homes etc start in this area so it is very convenient. Another big plus is the metro station which is located just beside the hotel and links you directly to the Downtown and conference area as well as being just one stop away from Universal studios. The cost of hotels in LA is not cheap so my gripe is not specifically directed at this hotel which is clean, modern and efficient. The staff were accomodating and professional and as someone who travels a lot I can say that I could not find any fault with service provided.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: susieOldham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, it is expensive, but worth it. The hotel is in a fantastic location with many bars and shops in the complex. I would definately recommend paying extra to stay here as it is the best hotel in hollywood

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne35
Reviews.Content: We found the service at the hotel to be OK, but not of the quality you would expect in a hotel of this category - for example it took them 2 hours to check us in and we wanted to change our clothes etc after the flight but were forced to go out in the Midday LA heat for 2 hours instead!! Once we were in the room though all was fine we could see the Hollywood sign from our hotel room which was fun and it is very close to the Kodak Theatre and the Chinese Theatre which is great for sightseeing. The Hotel is situated beside a shopping centre with restaurants so there is plenty there for the evenings. We went to Universal Studios which was very easy as it is just one stop on the metro. One other tip there is a parking garage as part of the shopping centre on Hollywood and Highland right nextdoor to the hotel, if you hire a car, it's a good idea to park your car there - it is $10 for a night as opposed to three times that for the hotel. We would recommend this hotel for a stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: juliet83
Reviews.Content: Pretty touristy location and unremarkable hotel. I stayed here because it was only two metro stops to my office in LA, but what I saved on cabs staying in hotels elsewhere in the city, I spent on the internet access in the room. $13 a day, which feels a little unrealistic these days. Also, I fail to understand why the hotel's website has rooms decked out in funky, bright colours. No pictures posted here, nor the room I stayed in, has decor in anything but white and cream. Where are these rooms?? If you want to be in the thick of Hollywood - Walk of Fame, touristy shops everywhere you look, right next to a mall etc - this is for you. As a business hotel, I'm not sure it makes the grade next to other places I've stayed in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Walk of Fame!”
Reviews.Author: dawnso
Reviews.Content: Had initial problem when we arrived, due to our travel agent not advising hotel of room upgrade that we had paid for but thankfully hotel honoured upgrade and gave us a lovely suite on 13th floor, which had great view over the city. Room was really clean, apart from large men's underpants that had been left in dressing room. Location of hotel is great for a base to explore the city, right next to subway and also stop for city tour buses. We did private cadillac tour, which took us all over city up into hills and down to Santa Monica/Venice Beach, tho didn't get to spend much time at these places. Hotel is built above Hollywood & Highland complex, which has great range of shops & few restaurants. Highly recommend Johnny Rockets for an amazing burger and the California Pizza place, which does take-out too. No mini-bar in the room, but there is a liquor store at the back of the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, we initially requested room facing Hollywood sign, but ended up with room overlooking city, which was more impressive especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrin820
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the action - next door to the Kodak Theatre and steps away from the Walk of Fame. It's a short drive to Universal and the WB studios, to Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive, or to the Santa Monica pier. However, it is very very busy in the surrounding area! Valet parking isn't worth the cost - park in the Hollywood & Highland parking garage to the left of the front of the hotel and it's a $10 max (you can leave your car overnight!). Rooms were clean, spacious. Request a room facing the Hollywood sign - it's a great view! The 24-hour gym is small but nice. Overall, a great hotel for the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modern but average.”
Reviews.Author: dazman69
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. This hotel is located in the Highland retail/entertainment complex which includes the Kodak Theater used in the academy awards. The 'tourist' part of Hollywood Blvd. (Chinese Theater etc.) can be accessed through the hotel complex. We had a city view room which overlooked Hollywood and Downtown LA in the distance. I believe the back facing rooms overlook the Hollywood sign and hills. The hotel is very modern and clean nice pool area etc. Staff are professional and friendly. The problems I had with the hotel are as follows. No in room safe!!, Hotel restaurant not open for dinner! and a very basic room service. This hotel is quite expensive for the amenities but the location cannot be beet for access to Hollywood. Most of Hollywood sightseeing trips depart from in front of the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Boom with a view”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcfly1985
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Renaissance in early April after previously staying here in 2007. I asked at check-in if they had any rooms with a view of the Hollywood sign available, which they did. The view was great - unfortunately this was almost immediately spoiled by the blaring noise coming from the other side of the adjoining door. After being kept awake by this dance "music" on the first night, the receptionist offered to relocate us. I explained, after 20 hours traveling, we did not want to move, just for them to stop the noise. When this continued on the second night, the same receptionist explained that because we had refused the offer to move on the previous night this was no longer an option and instead offered us coffee vouchers! Again I hadnâ€™t asked to be moved, or for any sort of compensation, only for something to be done about the noise. Eventually a security guard did visit the room and the last two nights passed without incident. It seems the compensation culture is so embedded that it gets in the way of a simple resolution. Despite the noise issues, the room was a good size (1 x king bed) and clean. There was no in room safe but complimentary boxes available behind reception. It was also my fiancÃ©eâ€™s birthday on the third day and the concierge arranged a cake to be waiting in the room. The hotel was a perfect base for the Hollywood attractions. It is part of the Hollywood & Highland complex with the Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre and Starline Tours all on the doorstep. Universal and Warner Bros are only short cab rides away (10-15 mins) with Sony Pictures around 30 mins away. Based on the location, we would definitely stop here again, only asking for a room without an adjoining door next time!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for 3 nights in December 2008. I chose the hotel based on its proximity to where I was doing business. If I was going on vacation, I probably would not stay in the Hollywood area. Check in was fast and friendly. I asked about a late check out and was told that for a small fee I could check out as late as 6:00. I can't remember what the cost was but it was reasonable. The hotel itself is very well maintained and the room was in excellent condition. There was no peeling wallpaper or disturbing stains on the carpet. Everything looked very new and well kept. Both the bathroom and room were immaculate - I even tried to look for dust but I couldn't find any. Everything in the room worked, the bed was comfortable and it was extremely quiet. The security at the hotel seems to be good. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by a staff member asking if I needed anything. While walking to the gift shop I was stopped by someone who I'm sure was just checking to make sure I was a guest. The only concern I would have is that the hotel is connected to a shopping mall and from what I could see anyone could walk off the street and into the mall right to the 2nd floor elevator lobby. The area is fine during the day and I felt very safe walking around. At night you need to be a little more guarded. I didn't have any trouble, but there are fewer people on the streets. There are some good places to eat within walking distance too. Just west of the hotel on the south side is a place called something like "Burgers & Wine". One of the best burgers I've had in a very long time. For snacks, you can walk across the street to a liquor store that has everything you will probably need. I'd be more than happy to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: ajcph
Reviews.Content: A very location, and pool was nice.. Concierge was very very helpful and friendly to us and I was impressed he could remember us the next day and asked us how was our trip to Beverly Hills.. The rooms were unique but the curtain wasn't drawing well.. Plus the windows need to be cleaned. Overall I am very pleased with this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place , Bang in the center of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: sourav76
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Hollywood, a stones throw away from the Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. Great location , superb rooms and even better service. A bit pricey but you get your money's worth. Prompt room service with a wide range of choices. You can also get food deliverd from the local chinese,indian and lebanese joints Parking available for a cost Wi-Fi also available at a cost Well equipped business centre Has a swimming pool and SPA to chill out You can see the Hollywood sign from most rooms. Would highly recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan151
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Facilities excellent. Great views. Excellent location. Parking a bit pricey but otherwise recommended for a Hollywood stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: phidias1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the night before through Priceline and paid $150/night including fees/taxes. It was a great deal for this price. We stayed two nights. The hotel is clean and convenient for the Hollywood and Highland Center (a random and unpreposing spread out group of stores/shops. You feel as though you are walking in the subway, very unattractive. However there is a Starbucks and CPK there which are great if you have kids and want a quick and affordable meal. The hotel also has a coffee bar which serves excellent if pricey coffee and pastries and a restaurant which we didn't try. The staff are helpful and friendly. You basically have to use the valet parking ($28/day). They have a ridiculous system of having to bring the car up for you to get one item from inside. I just wanted to go down and get it from the car, instead spent twenty minutes waiting for them to bring the car up. Of course they expect a tip for this.... Our room on the 8th floor overlooking pool, compact and clean. Comfy beds, nice duvets. Two small towels only. Had to ask for more. Room was noisy due to elevator noise but heard no noise from other guests at all. Ask for a room away from the elevator. It is a surprisingly intrusive 'whooshy' sound! Breakfast was very expensive and not worth it (room service). Go to the coffee bar or Starbucks. The pool was cool and there is no hot tub (disappointing). The pool is also only 4 feet deep. Lots of beds though and plenty of towels. They are a bit slow cleaning up though. We were there to visit American Girl, La Brea Tar Pits and teh mission our daughter is studying. Convenient for all three (though my GPS didn't recognize 'The Grove' as an address...) One major problem which was resolved: I was waiting to ask the concierge about a place to eat. The people in front were asking about "Mam Mia' tickets. I thought I had somehow missed that this show was in town. When my turn, asked if there were tickets available for tonight. 'Yes' said the concierge and proceeded to book them through Ticketmaster. She printed out and as I walked upstairs I noticed they were for 2 weeks away. Went back down, concierge was gone. Explained problem to another. He said he would 'look into it'. Half an hour alter he appeared at our door with $190 in hand. Said his colleague had made a mistake and the show didn't open until the following week. Apologized and gave me the money. I wouldn't hestitate to stay here again at this price. By the way, the area gets pretty seedy within a few blocks. Yet another hotel which charges for internet ($12.95/day) Outrageous. If you sit on the terrace by the pool you can pick up Starbucks internet free if you have the Starbucks code (buy a card for coffee and it comes with it). Business center charges $3 for ten minutes internet.

Reviews.Title: “What! No hot water?”
Reviews.Author: AnonLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, spacious with excellent facilities. Its located right next door to the Kodak Theatre and Graumans Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Boulevard in the Highland Centre. I must say that all the staff were very helpful and attentive. I must single out the Concierges for particular praise. However, during my stay, the only place I could get any hot water at any time of day or night was the shower. I could have left both taps in the basin running for minutes and one would be stone cold and the other barely any warmer. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, somewhat pricey”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business. Its very well located in Hollywood if you want to see the "walk of fame" & all the standard Hollywood stuff. Staff are very friendly and the valet service is lightening fast ; they always had my car out withing 5-7 minutes of calling them before taking the elevator down. The rooms are clean, but nothing fancy ; ask for a room with a view of the Hollywood hills. You will see the famous Hollywood sign from your room ; very nice! The price is a bit steep, but have no real complaints beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - less than average rooms”
Reviews.Author: MelD0202
Reviews.Content: I was most disappointed with this hotel. For what we paid I expected more. Firstly there was a mix up with our reservation however after much wrangling this was resolved and we were offered room service by way of apology. Secondly the bathroom was very grubby. Tiles needed grouting and the towels were no longer white but grey and fraying. There was no fridge or mini bar in the room and you had to pay for internet access. The only good thing about the hotel is its location. From the hotel we had a clear view of the Hollywood sign and at night the Hollywood hills looked amazing all light up. The shops, Chinese and Kodak theatre are literally round the corner. We were going to hire a car but it was not really necessary as buses and the Metro Rail were close by. Also we thought it unreasonable to charge $30 a day to park the car.

Reviews.Title: “Cost too much for a mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: skopit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice hotel. It wasn't great and it wasn't terrible. It was mediocre. The placement of the hotel is the best part- it's right next to the walk of fame and the Kodak Theater. Just don't try to find a working soda machine in this hotel. Also, there is no continental breakfast. I had to go to the attached mall and get a outrageously priced sandwich. Everything here is very expensive. You even have to pay for the in-room internet. $12.95 a night at the time of my stay. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but I've had both of those things in much better priced hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: TravelThom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Friday evening and was treated like a celebrity. When I checked in I was upgraded to an Exec. Suite based on my platinum status. The room was spacious and overlooked the Hollywood Hills and the HOLLYWOOD SIGN. The entire hotel is tastefully decorated and staff is very outgoing. The internet is for a fee, but $12.95 gets you unlimited long distance as well as internet access. All in all it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Oscar watch! Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ImSlayer
Reviews.Content: Came just to be near the Oscars and be on Oprah for the after show. This was a perfect location. Saw several celebrities. Wish room had frig. Room service was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: danidagirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Feb. I went with my parents and siblings. Since we didn't hv a car we wanted to find a place easier to travel. Oh boy wasn't this the best place!!?! It had the perfect location! Because the Kodak theatre is literally right next to the hotel, you don't even hv to get out of the hotel to get there. There is indoor pathway and I mean you can go there 24/7 even at night time! My family was honestly very pleased with the hotel. The service wasn't bad but when we wanted to book for another night they could not help cuz they only do "online booking". So the ppl at the reception could not even look up whether they had any rooms or not! We had to make a call to do that which I thought was really dumb to be honest (cuz they charge you for making that phone call!). Overall this is the best location if you are new to LA and want to visit the kodak/chinese theatre and wax museum etc. Oh it's very close to universal studio as well! I highly recommend it. It totally made our trip 10 times easier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Honey4u2dip
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the Academy Awards. The hotel is very pretty. The front desk ishelpful and they treat everyone like a celebrity. Be prepared to tip. I stayed on the 18th floor in room 1840. The room was big and beautiful. 1840 is located in the front of the hotel. I could see the Hollywood sign from my room. The beds are soft and comfy. I did not get a chance to use the pool, but it was very pretty to look at. The hotel is attached to a mall the mall has plenty of places to choose from if you are feeling hungry. I had room service one night, I think I waited about 15 min for my dinner. They are very fast. The grilled chicken club was very good. I don't have any complaints. Very clean too!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay for an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: cestella
Reviews.Content: Positives â€¢ Room was spacious filled with modern furniture. â€¢ Prime location direct access to Kodak theatre. The Metro line is also just under the theatre and all buses stops and pick up passengers in front or near by the theatre. â€¢ Can see Hollywood sign from room â€¢ Information booth in front of Kodak theatre therefore could also organise tours and access maps of area â€¢ Close to clubs, restaurants and tourist place of interest â€¢ 24hr access to their gym â€¢ Coffee machine available in room to make your own coffee. Rooms were replenished with instant coffee every day â€¢ Room was serviced every day â€¢ Internet service available in rooms at a fee â€¢ We booked room through expedia therefore paid for room in advance. When my husband checked his credit card a few days later Renaissance charged him again so my husband called to clarify the charge. Person he spoke to did not have the authority to rectify his query and said someone will contact him back. Within 10mins my husband got a call back and was advised his amount will be refunded back to his credit card. Negatives â€¢ No safe in the room to keep valuables â€¢ No bar fridge. I say this is a negative cause when we travel we use bar fridge to store and keep water we purchase outside of hotel cool â€¢ Buffet breakfast was only available on weekends which were useless to us as we checked in Sunday night and checked out Thursday morning. Surprised this hotel would not offer this service every day â€¢ Cost of internet connection was $35 per 24hrs which was pretty steep and connection was not even that fast Observations â€¢ Lobby lacks character, seemed very gloomy and dark â€¢ Seemed like hotel was empty. Hardly anyone was staying when we were and staff never seem to be at the front desk when we would walk out of the lobby. Nothing stands out nor does the hotel offer anything for me to want to stay at Renaissance. Maybe I was expecting it (the rooms the hotel itself) to be a bit more glamorous cause it was in Hollywood. It felt like a nice hotel with nice rooms â€“ a very expensive nice room. The location of this hotel is great but there are other hotels within the vicinity as well. If you are looking for a clean hotel at the heart of Hollywood to just sleep at I guess Renaissance would suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: aussiefam34
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is probably the best thing about it. You can see the best sites Hollywood has to offer right out the front door. The rooms are clean(very important to us) and the beds are very comfortable. The service could haven been better.Maybe we were there at a busy time but seemed to take a little long to get into our rooms, especially after a very long flight. Thought the check in could have gone quicker. But,overall, this hotel is a good value. we did not have to pay extra for taxis since everything we wanted to see was so close by. We also really enjoyed the nearby shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service; Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: writerguy33304
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Renaissance Hollywood. From the standpoint of the facility, everything was more than adequate. The room was spotless and the the lobby was well taken care of. The service levels, however, were horrible. I arrived at the hotel on a shared van shuttle. The driver pulled onto the driveway and jumped out. Immediately, the doorman/valet approached the driver and told him he needed to move the van because he was blocking someone. The driver began to argue with this guy. The argument developed, which drew the attention of the other valets. The driver ended up using obsenities with the doorman. While all of this was going on, I got my own bag from the van and went into the hotel. (I had pre-paid the driver.) I was rather disappointed that none of the Renaissance doormen/valets seemed to be concerned with me, their guest. I was able to check in early (which was a blessing after my 5.5 hour flight). The woman at the Front Desk, however, was horrible. She didn't welcome me (or more acurately welcome me back). Additionally, she didn't tell me anything about the hotel. The only reason I knew about the restaurant is because I walked past it. No mention of the pool, fitness center, or spa. I found this lack of information to be inexcusable in a hotel of this level. To be fair, however, things got better. Without fault, every employee I saw in the hallways stopped and said hello to me. Additionally, when I was checking out, I was asked about my stay. When I said, "it was okay", the Front Desk Manager wanted to know why. When I explained my issues, she offered me Marriott Reward Points. (My stay was a rewards stay, so her offer was a type of rate reduction.) I appreciated the offer as well as her concern. I'd still recommend the hotel. The room was great. Additionally, it seems as though I ran into an unusual hiccup with the service. If I'm back in the area, I'd most likely return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definite plush hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights, loved it! Hollywood wasnt as glamourous as its made out to be, but the Hollywood Highland Centre literally next to the hotel is lovely and has resturants etc. Also right next to a metro, bus stop and hop/hop off bus route. Hotel was lovely, really helpful staff, lovely room, even ordered room service and loved it! Hotel offered to order us a cab back to the airport and a fancy black town car pulled up and we had the nicest driver. it couldnt have gone smoother, view from our 18th floor window was amazing as well! the only thing was we panicked with the 20plus people helping with our two bags 9ok i exaggerate!) but a bell boy, porter, doorman etc, but not being skilled on who to tip when we panicked and didnt tip anyone...!! terrible!! but we know for next time! :-D Loved the hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: mmwwmmww
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip. I arrived before check-in time, but was put up in a room immediately. Construction was going on in the "zen" rock garden in the lobby the entire time I was there, so that part was not so "zen." Otherwise the front lobby area was great--plenty of comfy seats to wait for friends or just decompress. First off, I would recommend when booking a room that you request to be on a high-up floor. I was on the 6th floor and my view was of a concrete roof, not of any of the beautiful Hollywood skylines you've seen in other pictures. It wasn't such a big deal to me, seeing as how I was not spending my own money to stay there, nor was I going to be in my room very much. The room was very spacious and contained a king-sized bed. The furniture style was modern, but not the most stylish. For some reason it felt like it had been decorated by someone in their 70s trying to pick out furniture that they thought was cool. The television was a big tube television, which surprised me, I thought they would have flat screen TVs by now, but not a big deal. The bathroom was nice, with a crescent shower rod and nice toiletries from Lather (The facial soap was LOVELY.), and a vanity mirror and hairdryer plugged in ready to go. Unfortunately, no bathrobes were to be found! Some local magazines were left on the table for my use, and a book of photographs of the area which was a nice touch. I was disappointed that there was no mini bar in the room, all food requests had to be made via the room service, which tacks on a 18% gratuity to your order. However, ordering room service was a pleasant experience. They greet you by your last name when they answer the phone, which is simultaneously nice and creepy at the same time. I ordered room service several times throughout my stay, and orders always came much quicker than I would have expected them to. The servers were courteous, always asking if they could enter the room before doing so. I ordered a variety of items during my time there: BBQ chicken quesadilla, berry parfait, eggs, roasted potatoes, a boxed roastbeef sandwich with chips, macaroni salad, and apple, seafood pasta (from Twist restaurant), mixed berry bowl, breakfast bento box. The food was satisfactory, but not spectacular. Portions were not huge, but not skimpy. My favorite item was probably the BBQ chicken quesadilla. A USA Today paper greeted me outside my door every morning, the wake-up call service was sufficient, as well as requests for the cleaning service to come later in the day during a specified time. The meeting rooms were fine, nothing to write home about but clean and serviceable. On the day I was scheduled to check out, my flight was not until the evening. The hotel allowed me to keep my bags in the luggage room no problem. (That night I ate at The Grill, which is in the Highline complex and is affiliated with the hotel. Ordered the chicken pesto penne, it was WAY too salty. Again, food was not spectacular.) I found the bed comforter way too warm--I actually found myself waking up in the middle of the night, back completely covered in sweat--but otherwise the bed was lovely. The pillows were a bit too soft for my liking though. The in-room internet package was great- around 13 dollars for 24 hours worth of access, complete with free local and national calls. The location was fantastic. The fact that the hotel was connected to the shopping center was fabulous for non-drivers like me, and the fact that I didn't have much time between meetings to explore. The fact that I could just step outside my hotel and be right on Hollywood Blvd was pretty spectacular. The Mann's Chinese Theater was great, and there was an adorable women's clothing store called Varga where I picked a great jacket. All in all, I found the customer service to be excellent and the rooms clean, roomy, and pleasant. Would recommend staying here if you have the cash. Not as much glamor or history as some of the other LA hotels, but a nice efficient place in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in centre of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: HGDLondon
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Hollywood. Down the road from the famous thearte and walk of fame. Connected to a shopping centre (quite small but nice). We had a view of the hollywood sign from our room. The beds were the best I've ever slept in. Overall I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: IAMSPIN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family this past December. Many things make this a great hotel. First of all the location can't be beat. If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of everything ,this is the place for you. Second, but most important to me was the way I was treated when I first walked in. I have been to many hotel's and resorts . I have been through the check-in process over and over again. This time I was really amazed. I felt like I was being checked in by a close family relative. This hotel has had many celebrities stay with them and I felt I received the same VIP treatment as they do. At the front desk was Mirelle. I think management should really be happy that she is on the team. I work for a major airline in Canada so I know how important customer service is. My family was very happy with the service and care from Mirelle and this hotel. The hotel is right beside the famous Kodak Theatre and other great attractions on Hollywood Blvd. I was looking for a getaway with the family and this was perfect. We went on the Hollywood bus tour and then to Universal Studios. From there we went to Beverly Hills and ate at the Cheesecake Factory. This really was a great getaway ! All so close to the hotel. We were out day and night and I can tell you the area is safe. There were a few homeless people at the McDonald's nearby but no one bothered us at all. The LAPD had officers in the area and one officer ( badge number 35899) and her partner were just fantastic with us and other tourists. I needed to find a store near Dodger stadium and I was given hand written directions from the officer to get me there. She and her partner were real diplomats ! What else can I say , just go ! I'm sure you will love it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here along with our three teenage kids. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is in the heart of Hollywood, near Beverly Hills and all of the touristy sites. The rooms are comfortable and roomy (We were given a large, corner room that looked west directly toward the Hollywood sign). The best feature of this hotel is its location which is central to so much of the great "LA scene". But in addition to that, you have a really helpful staff and a great restaurant in the hotel. The only complaint I have is that one of the concierge's was indifferent and was more interested in staring at his computer than looking up and helping me out. The second concierge was very good as were the check-in and baggage folks. Make sure and try the breakfast at Twist, the hotel restaurant. The breakfast was fairly expensive, but excellent. You've got to love that fresh squeezed OJ in southern California.

Reviews.Title: “old and tired property”
Reviews.Author: mdterp
Reviews.Content: This property in need of a major updating. The rooms have old style televisions and furniture that look like it was purchased at a yard sale. Our room had a "terrible odor of cigar smoke", they moved us to a second room directly above and it had the same odor. Finally we were moved to a room that seem to be a party room because it only had a murphy bed. This place is seriously overpriced for what you get. It's like an old Holiday Inn (1960's style) but in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but busy location.”
Reviews.Author: denise_islove
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. Very nice hotel, fairly new. I loved the rooms, they were very spacious and cozy! The beds were incredible and the service was good. Parking isn't as much if you park at the Kodak Theatre parking. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: travelmore149362
Reviews.Content: Just got back from six nights at this hotel. This was a sightseeing trip with my family; I chose this hotel because I wanted something that was in a good location for touring around, and where we could sleep comfortably. I booked the hotel a couple of months ago, on the hotel website. At that time I requested the club level. I was willing to pay a bit extra for the convenience of the continental breakfast; I could not find a rate that included breakfast otherwise. When I got to the hotel, I learned that the lounge would not be open for 3 of the 6 days we'd be there. At my request, we were moved to a non-club level room, at a lower rate. They did not reduce the rate for our last night, however. (The rate was going to go up because of the New Year). Thankfully, however, the hotel is connected to the Hollywood and Highland Mall, and we did not need to have breakfast in the hotel. My husband brought up coffee from the Starbucks each morning, and we did not pay the outrageous prices for the hotel breakfast buffet. There was no minibar, but we did not miss that. I did notice that there was no in-room safe. We did not use room service, and housekeeping was adequate. The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing- we went all over L.A. and had a great time. There is an on-site car rental (Hertz) which was convenient. We parked in the mall for $10 a night rather than pay the $29 for the hotel's valet parking. The hotel was functional and served its purpose as a base for sightseeing, and a place to sleep and shower. It was in no way luxurious, but it met our needs. I would recommend it to a friend who was going on a similar kind of trip.

Reviews.Title: “"It's just ketchup"-???”
Reviews.Author: GinAndTonic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for a online travel industry conference. It's held here every other year, so this was my third time at this hotel. Things have definitely gone downhill. I'll start with the pluses: The spa was nice. The room service veggie burger was really good. The bed was comfortable. My room was relatively spacious. I requested a refrigerator and they brought it within 5 minutes. But let's talk about the bad stuff. First of all, there was no minibar. Well, actually there _was_ a minibar-- it was just empty, with a note on it that it was "being renovated" and that one should call room service for food and drinks. Not exactly what you want to see when you're arriving very late and just want a Diet Coke. I was grateful my flight hadn't been delayed-- at least I got there before room service closed for the night. Why would you leave the minibar in the room if it's empty? Room service was also hilariously bad. I'd seen some reviews that said the homemade granola was good, so I figured I'd give it a shot one morning. When the guy brought up the food, he lifted off the silver platter to reveal... 2 boxes of Kellogg's granola! I said that I thought it was homemade, and he said oh, sorry, we ran out so I just brought you this. I'm glad I didn't order an omelette-- I probably would've gotten something from McDonald's. (They did eventually bring me the real granola, and it was pretty good-- nothing to write home about, though.) But the worst thing was the housekeeping. I noticed a nasty-looking red stain on the bedskirt and left a note for housekeeping asking them to please change it. When I got back to the room that night, all the sheets had been changed, but not the bedskirt. I ran into the maid the following day, pointed out the stain, and asked her to change it. She looked at it, shrugged, and told me, "It's just ketchup." I was dumbfounded. Um, 1) it wasn't MY ketchup, 2) even if it _is_ something innocuous, I don't want to look at it! I asked her to please change it anyway and she made a big deal out of having to _call_ someone for a new bedskirt. Anyway, while it was convenient to be at the conference's official hotel, I would seriously consider staying down the street at the Roosevelt next time. There may be some urban legends running around about the cleanliness of the Roosevelt's pool (google it), but at least you can get a Diet Coke from your minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel using Marriott points, in November 2007. The check-in was good and fast, and our room seemed to have been recently updated, with interesting decor and furnishings. The Valet parking was fast and convenient, if a little overpriced, we felt. We didn't eat in the hotel, but used the adjacent HIghland Center for several meals, which were very good, and even went bowling there. The area is very touristy in and around the Hollywood & Highland Center and on Hollywood Boulevard - but you can walk to several attractions including Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Hollywood Museum. It is also a pretty good location for driving to other areas for sightseeing. However, get more than a few blocks away from the Hollywood & Highland Center and the area gets pretty seedy. We used the pool each morning and in November it was deserted but very warm and with a great view of the Hollywood sign. Overall a decent location for a sightseeing trip. We combined it with a few nights at a different hotel which I think made the trip better - I wouldn't have wanted to spend the whole trip at this one very touristy location. But had a good stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Outdated Hotel... and Quesitonable Security”
Reviews.Author: Deontas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was attending a convention at the hotel. Upon arrival I was greeted by a nice gentleman who checked me in. Something that was a bit unique about check in was that the desk agent actually came out from behind the desk to hand be the key to my room and pointed me in the direction of the elevators. Nice touch, but that's where the 'niceness' of the hotel ended. MUSTY SMELLING ROOM I was checked into a room on the 13th floor which faced north and had a nice view of the Hollywood sign. However, the smell in the room was overwhelming. Before getting settled I called the front desk and asked if I could change rooms because the room really smelled musty and dingy. I was told 2 or 3 times by the front desk person that there were no additional rooms available however, when I insisted that the room I was in stunk too bad for me, he placed me on hold for about 5 minutes and when he came back on the phone said he found another room for me. I went to the front desk and received the key for room 1823. ROOM CHANGE When I arrived in room 1823, it had a little of the same smell but not nearly as bad as my room on the 13th floor. However, I had been traded from a larger sized room with a view of the Hollywood sign to a room slightly larger than the hotels storage closet. It also had '6-7' foot ceilings so I felt a bit claustrophobic. After a while I got used to it and at least it didn't smell as bad as the first room. QUESTIONABLE SECURITY On my second night at the hotel, I was sitting on the bed watching TV when I heard someone swipe their key in my door. I jumped at the sound of the door opening while hitting the safety latch. I quickly ran to the door and peeked through the eye piece and saw a gentleman's back as he rounded the corner.
