I called the hotel operator who patched me through security. I was asked if anyone had announced themselves prior to opening the door and I said definately not. The security officer came to the room and did an audit on my lock. After a while, I received a call from the front desk to let me know the attemped intrusion was by one of the hotel bellman who was delivering messages from the conference host. I actually never received the notice however, I did receive a verbal apology for their bellman not following the policy of announcing himself prior to opening the door to the room. DATED DECOR While the lobby and main areas of the hotel were rather hip and trendy, room 1823 was very 90's and need of a Hollywood facelift. For instance the TV in the room is still the regular old TV. You'd think when you pay $229 a night in a 4 star hotel you'd at least have a flat screen HDTV with a nice selection of hi-definition channels... not at the Renaissance Hollywood! I expressed this concern at check out and the front desk person said they get that complaint a lot and are trying to get it fixed. You have to ask yourself how long should it take? Many 2 and 3 star hotels already have HDTV's! ROOM SERVICE I ordered dinner room service one night and the food was very good. A couple days later I tried to order breakfast room service, however, I was told it'd be over 1 hour to have a bowl of oatmeal delivered to my room. I was encouraged to go to the restaurant on the 5th floor where I could get oatmeal from the buffet. Also as mentioned in a couple other reviews, not sure what the 80's looking mini bar is doing in the room since it's not stocked. I guess at this point I was really questioning why this hotel is considered a 4 star hotel! SUMMARY Overall, in my opinion, the only real thing this hotel has going for it is the excellent Hollywood location and it's Renaissance name. However, don't expect 4 star service at this hotel... it simply doesn't measure up to it's 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and View - Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 6 nights. The room was lovely and we had a great view of the Hollywood sign. The room was clean and stocked well. The amenities were plentiful ~ they left us great toiletries every day. The hotel has several restaurants and a food court attached from the mall - the Kodak center. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. The Hotel is connected to the Kodak center and on the walk of stars - very easy access to I101 which will get you anywhere. The pool area is very pretty and an amazing view of the Kodak center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xvicx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a twin centre trip to LA and New York. This was our first time in LA and we loved it! However we did not like the Hollywood area, at night, its scary, sleazy and not to safe and Im from a big city! however in the day its lovely to walk along the walk of fame, go the kodak and see all the famous sights! the hotel is great check in staff were most helpful and upgraded our room to a suite as I was with my family and celebrated my 21st birthday while we were there. we also got a suprise with a cake and drinks sent to the room on the day of my birthday which was lovely. The room was spacious and had a king size bed, sofa bed and we got a roll a way bed. The bathroom was great, HUGE it was like 2 rooms with a dressing area and then the bath, shower etc. we were very impressed and had a lovely time. Rooms were very clean, we had plenty of towels and the likes. I would deff stay here again however I wish it was in a better area because the Beverly Hills area is alot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Marvelle
Reviews.Content: This place looks great but is not as nice as it seems. The service is pretty lazy and there's all kinds of weird things wrong with it. First of all, check out is at 11 a.m. and a late checkout is 1. For $50 you can get 6 (which is actually kind of nice). But, they never cleaned our room on the late checkout day even after we called several times. Another day, the maid showed up at 6 a.m. asking if we needed towels. Their keycards work once before they don't let you in your room and you have to go down and wait in line to get them rebooted. The elevators take forever (literally, like 5 minutes to catch one). The pool area is very nice but was filled with loud drunk people when we were there. Oh, and there was absolutely nothing in the mini-bar. Not sure what that's all about but was a) inconvenient and b) seems like a stupid business model. Totally underwhelmed, go find a better boutique hotel in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: maggie1111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the renaissance for three nights. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Requested a fridge and received one within 5 minutes of entering our room. Staff at reception were very helpful and so were conceirge. Had a wonderful view of the Hollywood sign which was great. The fitness centre was excellent and the pool area was a great size. The location of everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. Walk of fame, shopping and eateries. Ate at johnny Rockets hamburgers. Best hamburger I ever had puts our hamburger places to shame in Australia they serve theirs half cold. The metro station was within walking distance and easy to use to get to Universal Studios. Felt quite safe in the area but would take a little caution at night times. I would definetly recommend this hotel for a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sppw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October. The hotel is in a great location, easy to get to all attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a view of the Hollywood sign. The room was of good size and clean as well as the bathroom - but agree with the comment about not having a fan in the bathroom. We had breakfast in the hotel once which was $20 per person. I would recommend Bobs Donut Stop - opposite the hotel - looks quite shabby but the breakfast was good..as well as the donuts...for less than half the price! The Crepe place in the Hollywood & Highland centre was also good. We hired a car and valet parking at the hotel was $30 per night. Overall had a great stay and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: luggage_lass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the middle of everything in downtown Los Angeles. We could see the Hollywood sign from our room. The hotel has a walk way right to the Kodak Theatre, with its surrounding shops and restaurants. (Try the Koji rest.--yum!) The staff was very friendly, and the room was good sized and very clean. Easy to get to the highway and go to other places. Be prepared for $30/day to valet park, there is not much parking in the area. If you can stay on the club lounge floor, we had delicious breakfast every morning. The gym was adequate but small.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Renaissance Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Vegas411
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive and are greeted by the valet, you know your in for a good stay. The Front desk and Concierge were very pleasant. Our room a spacious oversized Executive Suite that overlooked the famed Hollywood Hills sign. The room was a very clean, modern neo-trendy furnishings. Allergic to feathers, one call and housekeeping promptly replaced bedding. For the price paid nightly, the room lacked in a couple of items, by having a vend refrigerator that was empty and a conventional TV as opposed to a flat panel. The bathoom was well appointed with granite counters, a sitting room but no fan for the toilet area. Walking distant to the Hollywood area and Kdak Theatre a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: reggie218
Reviews.Content: This place is right by everything! Our room was on the 15th floor and it looked out to the Hollywood & Highland complex and has fabulous city views in the AM and PM. I liked how at the concierge desk, there is a computer and printer you can use to do check yourself online and print out your boarding pass. I stayed in this hotel for a work event that was held in the hotel's Grand Ballroom, I thought that was pretty cool, and the food they served was really yummy. My only grievance was that when the concierge made reservations for an airport shuttle pick-up, he made it for the am instead of pm. We found out when the lobby called at 2:15 am telling us our shuttle was there, good thing we were just getting in the room and weren't sound asleep yet. Other than that, I wish I got to stay longer but I really didn't want to pay $300 for a room. It was perfect for a free (company-paid!) room though. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott Rewards for a very nice, two night stay at this hotel in the middle of Hollywood. Location is a key selling point, as the hotel is part of the large Hollywood and Highland complex with restaurants, the Kodak Theatre, Grumman's Chinese Theatre, etc. There is a huge underground parking deck for the complex, which we found to be a better deal than using valet parking at the hotel. The deck, which is a short, in-door walk to the hotel, charges a max of $10 for each in and out, whereas the valet parking is $29 (plus tip) for each night. There is also a convenient bus that runs from the complex to the beautiful Pantages Theatre near Hollywood and Vine - $3.00 per person. Lots of places to eat in the area - we enjoyed the decor and comfort food at Citizen Smith on Cahuenga Blvd. For an additional $30 per night, we had a huge, oversized room (1505) with a nice view of the "mountains" and the HOLLYWOOD sign. The room has a 1950's art deco motif that is typical of this hotel. We had a "living area" with sofa, two chairs, a desk and chair... and still lots of space left over. The bathroom is big, with a door separating the toilet and shower from the vanity and mirror (good for husband-wife combos who need access at the same time). The Moen showerhead made for relaxing shower massages. The front desk and concierge were all exceptionally nice and very competent. Room service for breakfast was quite good - we had an omelet and eggs Benedict, which arrived to our room still hot - a pleasant surprise these days). I'll definitely be back. This is a great place to stay in LA for work or play.

Reviews.Title: “Book it !!”
Reviews.Author: fhm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect... ideally located. Rooms were lovely, pool lovely, people lovely.. what more could you want. It's within walking distance to lots of attractions as everyone else on here says... and also the tube and bus routes are easily accessible and fairly easy to follow. You must go to Mel's Diner for breakfast, it's just fantastic. Don't deliberate anymore (like I did).. just please book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here recently and before I booked I didn't do a lot of research on where to stay - I just got a great deal through the Marriott website so I chose this one. I was SOOOO glad that I did. It is in a perfect spot for sightseeing, the location was incredible. Just a stroll around the corner to Hollywood Walk of Fame and Graumanns Chinese Theatre, loads of souvenir shops and clothes shopping. Also there is a subway station that is one stop away from Universal Studios which was fantastic. The room was on the 18th floor, no view of the Hollywood sign but we could see the El Capitan theatre. The room was clean and spacious with a big bathroom. The only little complaint was the airconditioning was pretty noisy if you turned it off, it made cluncking noises all night. But we travel with earplugs as we stay in hotels often and this eliminated the problem. Staff were really friendly and gave us a late checkout till 6pm on our final day for only $40 extra. I was so happy about this as our flight to Australia wasn't till 11pm and it would've been a long day had we had to check out at 11am. The Hollywood and Highland complex that is attached to this hotel has a lot of great dining options - we tried the Creperie and also the restaurant called The Grill which was really delicious and not too pricey. If I were to go back to LA as a tourist I would 100% stay here, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: GoodTravelers
Reviews.Content: I attended a 4-day conference at the Renaissance Hollywood, so the room rate was quite competitive ($175 for a double) to comparable nearby hotels. The location is ideal for walking to many quintessential Hollywood sights, as well as shopping, dining and nightlife. The moment I walked into the lobby to check in, a friendly staff member greeted me warmly and escorted me to the desk. The room was tidy and comfortably furnished in a modern yet welcoming style. Nice fluffy towels, and upscale toiletries. The bathroom floor had some stained grout, but was otherwise in good repair. Nice strong shower, with adjustable settings. Room insulation was excellent, as we could not hear anything from other rooms or the hallway, even though the hotel was at capacity. The bed was firm, the pillows ample, and the bed linens fresh and crisp. Housekeeping did an excellent job freshening the room each day. Another reviewer commented that it is more of a 4-star (vs. 5-star) hotel, and I'd have to agree. Maybe 4 1/2. Overall, it was a comfortable stay in a very nice hotel, and if you can get a great rate, it's well worth it Since the conference events were mostly in the hotel, too -- including breakfasts and lunches -- I must say that the food was OUTSTANDING and the wait staff impeccably mannered. The menu was imaginative, and the presentation magazine-worthy. Definitely NOT rubber-chicken meals, as so many conferences are.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lucksgirl
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate online. Easy, quick early check-in, no problems. Got upgraded to a huge suite with a view of the Hollywood sign! Room service breakfast was pretty good. Nice work out area, small pool. One of the best things about this hotel is the location- you can actually go right from your room to the Hollywood&Highland mall/Chinese theater. It's perfect! The bar in the lobby stays crowded. My fave place to stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Missed Connections”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: We stay in Marriotts frequently and are usually pleased. Even moreso with the Renaissance. But not this one. We had gone via Hollywood on the way out of California to see a good friend. Said friend was left waiting in the lobby for 45 minutes while the phone in our room went to VOICE MAIL, unknown to us! By the time we went to the lobby to check on things, he had of course left. The desk clerk didn't appear to know why the phone had gone to voice mail, nor care that we had missed our connection, with rescheduling impossible. Turns out the phones turn off when a guest checks out, and ours had not reset when we checked in. Separate issue: Breakfast was not included, and the restaurant jacked up the prices on the menu so that the $20 per person buffet was the cheapest thing available. Although the location is good for the Hollywood tourist must-sees, and the room was very nice, the experience was rather like booking a hotel in Europe sans breakfast [a no-no!], in a place where nobody speaks your language at all and you forgot your phrasebook! Of course, I expect to be gigged because this review tells some truths. But hey, c'est la vie! Maybe someone else won't miss their meeting, but if you check in here, call the desk and see if the phone rings when they call you back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Perfect Hollywood Location!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii6
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults & 3 teenagers) stayed 3 nights in 2 club level rooms on the 19th floor. We arrived at 11:00pm after a very long flight from Australia via Honolulu and check in was very easy. We were given 2 rooms opposite each other which was great as we had the benefit of 2 great views, one of the Hollywood sign and the other of the Hollywood/Highland Centre. Rooms were modern and clean with nice comfy beds. Having access to the Club Lounge for breakfast and snacks was great especially with 3 teenagers who are forever hungry. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Hollywood with easy access to all the sights - Kodak Theatre, Graumanns Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. The hotel is also adjacent to the Hollywood/Highland Shopping Centre which is great for shopping and dining. We caught the metro to Universal Studios. This was very easy as the station is just down the street from the hotel and you only have to travel to the next station. Definately worth a visit. This was our family's 1st visit to Hollywood and we had a fantastic time. Yes it's touristy and crowded but thats what it's all about. I did quite a bit of research on TA before booking the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel and I was very pleased with my choice. We would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Doughballs
Reviews.Content: Prior to my arrival I sent an email to the hotel with a couple of general questions. No reponse, so I resent. Still no response. A bad start...We picked this hotel for a holiday a) primarily due to the location, and b) I usually enjoy the Marriott/Renaissance chains on business trips. Location did not disappoint. It is smack in the middle of Hollywood Boulevard (Graumans, Kodak theatre) and in the middle of Hollywood and Highland complex which houses several eating options, from takeaway (one night we got a takeout from California Pizza and ate in room...) to formal. Also if you want to take any tours, many leave from Graumanns. But hotel did disappoint... Our first room, although a non smoking hotel, stank of smoke. Plus it was next to the ice machine on that floor which seemed to be leaking and smelt of gas. We asked to be moved which was not possible that night (we were in a suite, the quantities of which are limited). We were promised to be moved the next day and told just to leave our suitcases which would be automatically transferred. Next day before we left for the day I checked at reception re new room...and nobody knew anything about it. After a while they gave us a new room number. When we got back that night....no one knew anything about it.But we eventually did get the room. But communication and organisation seems to be a recurring problem. Even when we left, we had pre paid the travel agent, but the room charges were on the bill, and it took a lot of checking before this was rectified. The rooms itself, a 2 room suite was not great. It is billed as a chic boutique hotel, but in truth the (final ) room we had, while not exactly shabby, was just not great. Maybe the high rates are the privilege of being on Hollywood Boulevard, We took a 2 room suite as I was travelling with my 16 year old son, the sofa in the lounge folded down. But when folded down, it practically reached the TV, cutting the room in 2, so effectively when the bed was down half of the room was unusable. On the good side. A coffee/ tea machine, ironing board which made life easier. To be honest if I went to Hollywood again I might well stay in this hotel purely for location, but the whole experience left me a bit flat

Reviews.Title: “Four stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doledes
Reviews.Content: After finding a good rate on the Renaissance web site, I decided to book a 4-night stay at this hotel (180â‚¬ for a triple room). I have to say that the hotel met my expectations. This hotel is rated 5 stars but guests must be ready not to find that kind of luxury typical of a real 5 star hotel. I arrived at 8 pm but my room wasn't ready (although I informed them at the moment of my booking about my scheduled arrival time). Check-in staff told me my room would have been available in 30 min., so we went to the mezzanine bar in order to have a cup of tea (the lobby bar didn't serve hot beverages in the evening). The mezzanine bar is very big and there was a huge selection of different types of tea. The tea was very good and not pricey (about 3â‚¬ and it was served together with some complementary honey). After that we came back to the lobby at the scope of completing the check-in procedure (check-in staff asked my mobile number in order to call me once the room would have been ready). The time we waited was well worth because we had a room located on the 18th floor (one of the highest) with a beatiful view of the Hollywood sign (this was another request made when I booked the room). A bellman went with us and showed the basic features of the room. The room had two very comfortable queen beds and was quiet spacious (about 30 sq. mt)., no particularly luxurious and with no state of the art technology features (no plasma screen). The soundproof system wasn't exceptional but the BIG con I found in this hotel was the bathroom: it wasn't dirty but all the facilities looked VERY old and 1.000 miles far from what a guest can expect to find in a 4 or 5 star hotel. The location is great for people who want to stay in Hollywood or are not renting a car (two steps from the walk of fame and all the other Hollywood attractions). Finally, I colud check out directly through the TV system on the day I left the hotel; a good way to save some minutes. All in all the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is a good option who is not renting a car and looks for a good hotel with all the services a guest can need (spa, swimming pool, etc.). You'll be disappointed only if you expect a 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Hollywood Advetures”
Reviews.Author: SunSurferDevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to explore Hollywood. We stayed 6 nights in a large, quiet room overlooking the famous Hollywood sign. 2 adults and two kids in a room with 2 king sized beds. Top features are the fantastic 5th floor swimming pool, great in the early evening, location close to excellent public transport and excellent choices for food and drink all close to the hotel. A frige in my room would have made it even better. If you would rather spend your money on your holiday, park your own car, it cost $10 if you park it, about $40 if you use valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time here”
Reviews.Author: cwm_2355
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with our stay here. From the moment we pulled up to the hotel the service was excellent, and that continued throughout the entire stay. Literally every staff member we came across, from the maids and room service people, to front desk and concierge, was very polite and helpful. Location-wise, if you're there to experience Hollywood, it's the place to be. It's attached to the Kodak Theatre, which is where the academy awards are held. You are literally steps away from the heart of it all, the corner of Highland Ave. and Hollywood Blvd. We loved how we could just go out at night and walk around and there's so much to do, there was no need to cab anywhere. The room was fairly straightforward, not all the rooms are as funky and colourful as they are on the website. I was quite happy with the quality of the furnishings and the linens though. One complaint is for some reason our bathroom didn't have a vent fan, which I thought was quite odd for a hotel of this calibre. In summary, I loved our time here, and would highly recommend it to other travellers. It's a bit on the expensive side, but it's worth it for the location and quality alone. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: seasuzie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very touristy part of hollywood. The goodnews is if you like shopping, you are right on top of a mall. Also plenty of food court options. The first night we were interupted from our deep sleep by drunk guests trying to knock down our door. I was so tired from traveling that day that I couldn't even get to the door to tell them they were at the wrong room. Finally they went away. After that no incidents. The room wasn't cleaned 100%. Found wrapers on the floor that grossed me out! If I had to do it again I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Insight to Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: IrishSodaBread
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Renaissance. I loved this hotel and would highly recommend it. While it was out of downtown LA itself, it offered us the holiday we were looking for. It can be daunting staying in a city that you don't know sometimes as you don't know where to go, but there was enough on our doorstep to keep us entertained. The hotel room was fine, nothing overly fancy but a lot better than basic. We were on the 14th floor overlooking the pool. There was no noise whatsoever to be heard from our room. Another reviewer commented on the fact that there was no extractor fan in the bathroom. We stayed in 3 hotels on our trip and none of them had a working fan, which surprised me. The bathroom in this hotel was larger than our prevous hotel (Westin, Times Square, New York). The old-fashioned TV was a bit of a surprise but we ordered a movie all the same one night and no complaints. The lobby area was nice. You could get lovely ice-cold water from a dispenser which had lemons, oranges, grapefruits etc. in it giving the water a lovely refreshing taste. There was also a m&m dispensing machine, which gave free m&m's. Handy when you're waiting around the lobby! The hotel adjoins the Hollywood + Highland Centre which was just buzzing day and night. It was full of shops, eateries, cinema, bowling alley, the Grauman Theatre, Kodak Theatre. The Walk of Fame was right outside the Centre. The Centre offers an Elephant Card at the Information Centre on the ground floor, which offers discounts on a lot of the shops and restaurants. We ate breakfast and dinner in the Centre every day. We would head off an a trip for the day after breakfast. All trips departed from the ground floor of the Centre, which was practically on our doorstep. We walked the Walk of Fame as it was on our doorstep. We took the Starline trip to the Stars Homes, which was very good as it was only a small open top bus and the driver was very interesting. We took the Starline Hop-on-Hop-off bus which we didn't enjoy as it was a pre-recorded tour and was hard to hear. We took a train to the Universal Studios as it was just handier for us. The train is only a stones throw from the hotel. It only costs 1.25 for a on-way trip which is great value. Universal Studios was a fantastic day out. I would say that was the best money spent on our whole trip (having done New York & San Francisco also). We didn't have a car so we were very happy to have all the entertainment on our doorstep. We did walk up the street looking for somewhere else to eat but couldn't find anywhere. I wasn't taken by the area just up the street, but there was enough choice in the Centre for eating in, so it didn't bother us really. The only annoying thing along the walk of fame was all the people dressed up trying to get you to take a photo and then look for a tip. There were also people giving out free cd's, then looking for a donation for the cd!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location....but,”
Reviews.Author: LisaMcLallen
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel for the location!! I recommend any families or anyone interested in being Right by most Hollywood Attractions stay here even if it is a little more expensive. However, we did have a VERY difficult time getting our room. 2 1/2 hours we waited. We checked in at 3 and finally at 5:30 after we had been to the desk every 30 minutes after 4 p.m....they said oh, its ready. We'd been offered to down grade at the same expense and they could give us another room with a rollaway. Now, check the rates of this hotel and see if you'd like to sleep on a rollaway! As soon as we arrived we were asked to shop for an hour while our room was finished. We weren't happy about that, but agreeable and asked where to go and how to get there. So at 4 we returned and it still wasn't ready, that clerk asked about the rollaway and that it takes an hour and half to clean a room not just an hour. So we were asked again to go shop....we declined and said we'd sit in the lounge area not too far away. 4:30 came and went with no word on the room. I went back to the desk because we'd become invisible to all but the bellman who kept glancing at us while everyone else checked in and headed up merrily to their rooms. The new desk clerk said Sorry, it shouldn't be much longer. 5 p.m. (really 8 p.m. at home and in our brains and stomachs) still no room and the desk clerk called housekeeping and someone would physically go check on the room and see how it was coming. She assured me she'd come get me and let me know either way how it was going.....ready or not. Apparently she leaves at 5, so left without getting me or telling me anything. She did tell us our room was an Upgrade so she wouldn't change it if it were her....so not sure how the previous clerk thought a rollaway would be a great idea. 5:30, still no one coming to tell us anything and I went back to the desk...this time getting a room or we're leaving.....and was told your room is ready. Guess they didn't feel the need to come get us and tell us. There was no exceptional service at this hotel, no out of the way things done but we also didn't ask for anything. My goal after checking in was to never talk to anyone at the front desk again since 3 of the clerks I'd already met were no help. I will say that it was a Very clean hotel, very nice and you can NOT beat the location. Our shuttle bus driver from the airport stated the same thing that we had chosen the best hotel in Hollywood for access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood as a part of our Honeymoon July 16-19. ItÂ´s a very large and modern hotel,the room was quite large, nice and clean. ItÂ´s location right next to the Hollywood and Highland shopping center and Manns chinese theater makes it very convinient for a short trip such as ours. Staff was friendly and helpful, nothing more, nothing less. Liked the hotel, hated the area it was in, as soon as we stepped out of the hotel and away from the H&H center we felt like weÂ´d ended up in a slum area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Hollywood/LA Experience”
Reviews.Author: Borgata73
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hollywood is a great spot as a base to do all your Hollywood/Los Angeles sightseeing. Stayed here for 6 nites in early July right over the 4th of July holiday with my brother as were in town to visit family and do the whole tourist thing. Asked for a room with the view of the Hollywood sign and was given a wonderful high floor room overlooking the Hollywood Hills and sign. Room was clean and comfortable but our bathroom had no fan (my only complaint of the room). We choose to self park in the underground parking garage which is attached to the hotel and paid $10 to park overnite. U can reach the hotel by taking the garage elevator to the 3rd floor and briefly walking through the outdoor mall to the hotel entrance on the same level. The costs of going in and out during the day were anywhere from the $2 to $4 dollars but we never paid more than $10 so its cheaper than $29 valet charge. We ate breakfast several times at the hotel restaurant Twist and loved the menu - tried both the breakfast buffets and menu entrees and they are worth the price. Its also the same menu for room service from the restaurant so if you looking for something low budget there is Mel's Diner and IHOP within walking distance. Tried some of the restaurants in the adjacent Mall and found them to be very good. Especially The Grill (massive steaks) and Trastevere (upscale Italian). Went to both in shorts and polo shirts and saw people in t-shirts/shorts so although they appear upscale you can go casual and don't feel out of place. It's a Mall after all ! The hotel is within driving minutes of Universal and Burbank. (Burbank Airport is closer than LAX to the hotel so think about it if u can get a flight there from your hometown). West Hollywood is just minutes away down Sunset Blvd. and has lots of trendy bars, clubs and restaurants. WH is where the nightlife scene is - there is not much going on in Hollywood at nite. Santa Monica/Malibu beaches are about 30 minutes driving from the hotel and easy to reach. Beverly Hills is also easy to get too and about 20-25 minutes from the hotel. Tried Starline Tours for the movie stars homes tour and happened to catch Dr. Phil pulling into his driveway. Yes it was that Dr. Phil and he did wave back to all of us on the tour bus, lol For any movie buffs considering doing studio tours the best are Universal, Warner Brothers or Sony/Columbia Pictures. The guides we had were first class and knew the industry and studio lots well. We got to see many sound stages and sets. Paramount Studios was okay but way too historical and really were on a golf cart the whole time. I would stay here again but if you want a Southen California beach vacation go to Santa Monica or Malibu !

Reviews.Title: “Good Short Stay at the Renaissance Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one Friday night. He was booked a room here for part of a group booking for a work event. His work event was over at Hollywood and Vine and this was pretty close. For the last several years, his company would always book the Holiday Inn because their work event would be on a Thursday night and rooms would be around $150. But this year, the event fell on a Friday night and so the room rates were pretty close at the Holiday Inn so the event manager decided to book the Renaissance instead. I am glad they did as don't really care for staying at the Holiday Inn and chains like that. We arrived Friday early afternoon and valeted the car. I believe the rates for valet is around $20-25. Check in was fairly easy. In the entrance there's a lounge and little coffee bar. We got to our room quickly and since were were used to staying at the Holiday Inn, the Renaissance was a great relief. We had a view of the city and we could also see the pool. The room was nice, clean and modern. The bathroom stocks Lather products which are great. I know its handy when the products are good quality and smell nice. We were a bit hungry and I needed a pair of shoes for the event so we walked over to the behemoth Hollywood and Highland entertainment, dining and shopping complex. We had a Japanese cream puff at Beard Papa (awesome). There's tons of your typical shops in there. There's a movie theatre as well as a bunch of restaurants, Starbucks and a bowling alley. We only stayed a night and were out for most of our stay so I can't really talk about service, etc at the hotel. It was pretty good for our short stay. My husband used the pool in the morning while I went to Runyon Canyon for a hike with friends. The pool looked great and I wished that I had tried it. There were cabanas and a bar in the pool area so I am sure it can get quite lively. I definitely would stay again. There's obviously tons of great hotels in the LA area but if you want to be close to things like Hollywood, Universal Studios, etc. This is probably a good choice. Oh the only thing that was a surprise was the tv was not a flat screen. It might matter to some, it definitely matters to my husband. Haha.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Philrdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights at the beginning of June and it proved a great location and really nice hotel. We were really keen to get a room with a view of the hollywood hills and the hollywood sign and we certainly got it. We were on the 18th floor with fantastic view - well worth paying a little extra. We ate in the hotel every morning for breakfast. They had a really good selection of cold and warm food and I would say it was well worth it. Staff were really friendly, rooms were a good size (what you would expect from an American hotel) and the hotel bar was quite small but nice to have an end of evening drink. The hotel is located right next to a mall with a small selection of shops and a number of restaurants and eateries. You are also a stone's throw from the Kodak Theatre and Grauman's Chinese Theatre. As you are so close to these I would recommend doing these sights first thing in the morning. We went down at 7am and there was not another person about so we had the whole place to ourselves - fantastic. Everyone says about hiring a car but we found taxi's (and buses) worked for us. We used taxi's to get down to Rodeo Drive (about $20 each way) and then actually got the bus down to santa Monica Pier where we walked down to Venice Beach. The concierge in the hotel will be able to provide you details of how to use the bus and where to get it from. One of the highlights for us was having a tour of LA in a 1966 convertible cadillac. You get a private tour of the city and let your driver know where you want to go and he makes sure you see what you want to but then shows you some other sites that you may not have been aware of. Although this was $300 we thought it was one of the highlights of our trip. Another must is going down to Santa Monica Pier. We got the bus down here and then walked along the beach down to Venice Beach which is 'interesting' to say the least. One other think that we enjoyed was going for a early evening drink at Yamshiro's which is very close to the hotel. It is a Japanese restaurant set on a hill with great views over the city. We didn't manage to get to Griffith's Park and the observatory but you had great views of it from Yamshiro's.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: woodkd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Renaissance June 28th. The hotel's location was great, check in was easy but our room was noisy!! Our refrigerator kicked on and off all night, and when it was on it hummed loudly making sleep difficult. We could hear the people in the room above us walking around, also you could hear the person in the room next to us looking through their closet. We finally gave up and left the hotel because we just couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at it's best”
Reviews.Author: teri1225
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay while in Hollywood!! Check-in a breeze!! Friendly and helpful staff. Our room 1803 overlooked Hollywood sign. Really cool!! Room neat and clean. Wanted a refrigerator -- called front desk and it was there in minutes. We were there for the daytime Emmy awards. Really fun seeing all the movie stars walk the red carpet. Would return to the hotel in heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoot5743
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from June 15th to June 20th and loved it. I took my wife and two boys ages 8 & 6. First of all it is in a perfect location. Really close to the nice areas of Hollywood. Also close to Universal Studios and Farmers Market which has the Grove shopping area. Actually, we had heard not to go to Disneyland because it was a distance from our hotel. We decided to go anyhow, and honestly it was only 40 minutes from the time that we left. The key is to leave early in the morning. We left around 6:30 in the morning and got there around 7:10. The park opened at 8:00 but we were able to park our car go to the tram and by the time we bought our tickets it basically opened up. I recommend this hotel for families with young kids, because it has a really nice pool. The temperature for the pool was perfect and the deepest part of the pool is no bigger then 5 feet deep. Also my kids seemed to enjoy the fact that the hotel had free m&m's for the hotel guest.. My kids everyday picked up some m&m's and loved it. I felt like the staff really treated my family great. They made us feel very special and my family really liked that. The only members of the staff we didn't feel that really went all out was the concierge area. They did what they were supposed to do, but I didn't feel that they took the extra step to make us happy. They were still very good, but after tipping them, I feel that they should take the extra step, to make us happy. For example, I asked them to recommend a restaurant. They recommended one but they didn't call the restaurant and make the reservation for us. Most concierge that I have worked with in the past, would make the phone call and reserve us a table. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a beautiful room, with a view of the hollywood sign. I just asked them if they had the ability to accomodate us with a room that viewed the hollywood sign and they said no problem. Overall the saying goes you get what you pay for. If you have the money to pay almost 300 a night, this is the right hotel for you, because you are treated like royalty. Last thing that was kinda negative. They have a valet charge of 29.00 a night or a self parking charge of 10.00 a night. We ended up paying the valet charge because we would go somewhere, come back and then go back out somewhere. If you do that for the self parking, I believe that you have to pay each time you come and go, but I could be wrong. I hope this helps you with your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yorks_nameless
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the final 3 nights of our honeymoon. Check in was very swift and efficient and we had a room on the 16th floor (i had requested a room with a good view) with a tremendous view of the hills and the famous 'HOLLYWOOD' sign. We would sit and admire the view in a morning and evening. The room itself was large, light and airy and very clean. Tea/coffee facilites were useful. The main attraction of the hotel is its location, right on Hollywood Boulevard with the walk of fame, chinese theatre, El Capitan theatre, Kodak theatre and other tourist sites. The centre is part of the Hollwood and Highland complex with plenty of dining and shopping available. In terms of dining, the hotel restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced and was probably our best meal whilst staying there. We happened to be there whilst the 'Love Guru' premiere was on so caught a glimpse of Mike Myers as he went in to the chinese theatre. The following evening Warren Beatty was at the Kodak Theatre so no shortage of star spotting opportunities. The hotel is also well located for public transport as it is a 2 minute walk to the top of the metro red line, one stop from Universal Studios (we spent a day there and thoroughly enjoyed it) and a simple bus ride to Beverly hills and Santa Monica/Venice (be prepared for an hours ride on the 704). With more time we would have also gone on one of the tour buses and visited some more sights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moody79
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and see LA. Good location, nice attention to detail. Good, clean rooms, nice food and friendly serivce. I'd almost given up on US hotels - famed for their quality of service - but this place restored that faith. A great all rounder - which is what you want. Highly recommend. P.S. try to get a room high up room - the view is more than worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer below, I also stayed here on Memorial Day weekend. I too saw the cast of Entourage filming an episode (and grabbed a photo with one of the actors!) â€“ you really are in the centre of Hollywood when you stay here. The prime location is especially useful if you donâ€™t plan on driving â€“ you are steps away from sightseeing attractions and the tours depart from here. Taxis are also readily available outside the hotel. We used one to get to the Beverly Center mall which is about 5 miles away. The room was just as I had expected. Tea/coffee making facilities were appreciated, and the room was a good size. I booked directly through the Marriott website and there is an option to request a high floor which increases your chance of seeing the Hollywood sign from your room. You can also see it from the pool which we used a couple of times. It was very pleasant. I did not eat in the hotel or use the mini bar â€“ you donâ€™t really need to as there is a convenience store across the street and the old- fashioned Melâ€™s Diner for breakfast about 5 minutes away. I paid Â£530 to stay from May 22nd for 4 nights. I think this is a good price, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelafarToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's located literally right on the hollywood Walk of Fame. Also close to Universal Studios (one subway stop away), Chinese Grauman Theatre, Kodak theatre etc etc....We could also see the Hollywood Sign from our hotel room . It is also connected to this minimall which has many stores such as Louis Vuitton, Sephora etc...the hotel is also located close to a tourist info booth, which was convenient because they helped to guide our stay as well as we bought our tickets to Disneyland and universal studios from there and they sell them cheaper. Our hotel staff was also quite helpful. They also have a Hertz rental on location which was convenient and they gave us a good deal. The only thing about the location of this hotel is sometimes at night there would be lots of shady people around, which for a tourist can be a little intimidating. So just be careful in the evening/night. Overall this hotel was great and a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOCATION ~ TIPS FROM OUR GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay during Memorial Day Weekend. Although it was a holiday weekend, the hotel NEVER felt crowded at all. The staff always met our every need and were super nice. We would definitely stay here again. TIPS from our stay: 1) LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - you can NOT beat where it is located - Kodak Theater, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater are literally just right at the door! ..... 2) PARKING: Park for $10 per day vs. $29 per day valet plus tips in the lot that is connected to the hotel in the Highlands Center - the parking garage elevator will take you steps away from the entrance on the 3rd floor 4) FOOD - The Highlands Center connected to the hotel has tons of options!! 5) TOURS - you can walk out the side of the hotel to the Highlands center and book ANY tour that you want - we were amazed how CLOSE everything was 6) ROOM LOCATION - request high level with view of the Hollywood sign!!! GREAT VIEW! ........ 7) SUBWAY - If you aren't renting a car - the subway is located right at the hotel and a great option for arriving from LAX Enjoy your stay!! We sure did. Location can NOT be beat!! ........ They were also filming the HBO show "Entourage" when we arrived at the hotel on Friday night- how cool was that!! We saw the entire cast!!!

Reviews.Title: “RichnLin's Hollywood Stay”
Reviews.Author: RichnLin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at this property at least two to three times a year. We are also platinum Marriott members as we have four timeshare weeks through Marriott. We do not use our points as they are mainly used for international stays. However, with that in mind, this property is absolutely one of the finest available. The staff can not do enough for you. The valet service was also excellent. We never waited for anything. We always stay in Room 2005 or 2006 as 2005 faces the Hollywood sign and 2006 faces out over the city. We just came back yesterday, 5/12/2008, and again received the same excellent treatment. We planned to stay there a few months ago and had to cancel due to me having a knee complication. We canceled the reservation at the last minute and a few days later I received a note from the manager of the hotel stating that he was sorry that we had to cancel and hoped that I was feeling ok. What service! Also, the executive lounge is one of the finest Marriott has to offer. Our room was very spacious, clean and the staff was always knocking asking if there is anything we need. Absolutely no noise even though the hotel is right in the heart of Hollywood and right in the middle of all the action on the streets below. Just a wonderful hotel and the staff to match!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and Serious Security Problems”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0n1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice for business purposes last month and had a terrible experience both times. The check-in staff were rude and unhelpful and seemed to have no idea what was going on. They lost my reservation, gave me the wrong standard room, didn't activate my key and then 'lost' several important messages that were left for me later in my stay. The business facilities are terrible - old computers with slow 'pay as you go' internet connection that costs a fortune and repeatedly kept shutting down with credit on there which I couldn't get back once it switched back on. I lost about $40 over 5 days in this way. During my stay, a male member of staff knocked on my door at 1am saying that he'd brought me the blankets I had ordered and tried to gain access to my room. I had NOT ordered blankets, but he wouldn't go away. I got woken up the same time the following night with a different male staff member saying he needed to come into my room to fix the broken mini bar that I'd reported. I had NOT reported this. This was all very dodgy and made me feel uneasy about staying there alone in future. I was told on my 2nd morning that I couldn't eat breakfast as they'd closed the restaurant at 9am to set up for a private event. I was told that instead I could get a take-out breakfast box and eat it outside on the street, or pay for room service. Finally, on my last night, there was a party going on in the room opposite me at 4am which spilled out into the hall. With loud music, people banging on my door, prank calling my room and shouting just metres away from where I was sleeping. I called security and reception several times and they refused to do anything about this. I then noticed that several guests at the party were Renaissance staff. This went on until 6am and when I complained to reception, they hung up on me. I was quite frankly appalled by the problems and service levels of this hotel and would never stay there again. It is in a great location but is overpriced, run down, with rude staff and lapse security. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - good location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: rosbif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights having arrived into LAX before driving off to Scottsdale. As we'd never visited LA I read a lot of reviews of what district to stay in as well as which hotel. In the end, following reviews of this property here we booked club level rooms at the Rennaissance Hollywood. Firstly I would say Hollywood is a pretty good place to base yourself for a first time visit to LA. It pretty is what LA is all about - we did the bus tour, a limo tour of star's homes and the Madame Taussads and Guiness World of Records attractions, which are right on the doorstep of this hotel. So it is very well placed. Self parking was $10 a day in the big parking next door - where there were also loads of shops and a cinema. The check-in staff were very polite and helpful. Room itself was pretty good - quite small for a 'suite' - once a single fold out bed was up there wasn't a lot of room. Also the door to the bathroom opened outward which was unusual, and automatically closed which the kids didn't like. The blind which covered the window was a bit tatty but still worked well to shut out the morning sunlight. Beds were very comfortable though The club lounge was good - with good snacks in the evening and a very good breakfast. Not too busy either. There was one member of staff in there but he didn't 'interact' with anyone, just sat watching his PC screen. I was talked into booking a stretch limo by the concierge to see the 'homes of the stars'. This was a rip off however (Topline I think it was). The driver wasn't that interested - we didn't see half the houses mentioned on the blurb and we finished 30 minutes early! When you're paying that sort of money you expect better. I fed this back to the concierge who took my details and said he'd be in touch although he never has. Overall I mentioned some of the negative points but our overwhelming impression was of a lovely hotel with pleasant staff in a superb Hollywood location. Would I go back? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nicros
Reviews.Content: We satyed in a Club level Room for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. We were quite high up with a view of the hollywood sign in the far distance. Looking back, the free breakfast that came as part of the club room deal wasn't worth the extra money and we didn't use any of the other services so a normal room would probably been enough. We were only in Hollywood for 2 days so didn't spend much time in the hotel, but it is in a very good location near the Hollywood walk of fame and the Kodak theater.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Renaissance standards”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Renaissance for a weekend trip. It is a fabulous hotel, convenient to Hollywood attractions and near a light rail stop. The service was exceptional and friendly. Our room was a decent size on the 9th floor and looked out towards the Hollywood sign. There were wooden blinds, as well as a blinder to keep the early morning sun out of the room. We ordered room service one night, and the food was pretty good -- Twist has an eclectic menu with many things to choose. It only took 20 minutes for the food to arrive. I also took advantage of Spa Luce in the hotel, and it was incredible. The spa is beautiful, relaxing, and offers a diverse menu of treatments. Very impressed with the new spa. There is an outdoor pool on the 5th floor, which offers comfortable lounge chairs, as well as private cabanas. The beds in the room are the updated Marriott beds and EXTREMELY comfortable. The hotel is connected to the Hollywood/Highland complex, which offers a bit of shopping and restaurants (highly recommend Trastavere), and you can catch a shuttle to the Pantages theater from the complex. Valet parking through the hotel is $29/day, but there is a parking garage as part of the of the Hollywood/Highland complex for $10/day if you want to self park. Overall, it was an excellent stay. The only downside is the $9.95 charge for internet, which seems to be a common theme in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad workout facilities”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for about a week. The location of the hotel is good, and is right next to the Kodak Theatre. The hotel, however, is not very convenient to downtown LA, or to LAX. Hotel rooms on one side of the hotel look out over the Kodak Theatre, and the other side looks out at the Hollywood sign. I particularly like the free M&M's in the lobby (clearly a very important perquisite...). On a different note, the hotel charged $5 to ship a package that was already prepaid. The workout room in this hotel is sub-par for a hotel of this class. The workout room only has a couple of machines, and what it does have, is comparable to equipment you would have in your home. The concierge lounge is decent, and is on-target with other Renaissance hotels. It has the standard fare in the morning (continental breakfast, with an additional two warming dishes of hot items, which vary), and in the afternoon it has some appetizers. Overall I would stay here again, though I did think it was a tad pricy for a Renaissance (about $300 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with all the your needs catered for. Very close to local restaurants, hollywood and universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: Started a three week holiday with a three night stay in Los Angeles despite many of our friends trying to put us off. We decided to stay in the Hollywood area rather than downtown and found the Renaissance to be perfectly situated for all of the tourist/sightseeing areas. We booked a room with access to the lounge on the 19th floor which meant that we could have a free breakfast each morning and also gave us free access to coffee and soft drinks throughout the day. Our initial room was on the 20th floor but when checking in we asked to change to a lower room and was given an identical room on the 6th floor with absolutely no fuss. The room was very comfortable and had a large window looking out at the Hollywood sign. The hotel was very well presented and also had a Hertz desk which meant that we could easily pick up a car for the next phase of our trip. The hotel and surrounding area far surpassed our expectations and was a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Cathrynsrealm
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel provided an excellent stay for my friend and I during our visit to Los Angeles. They were very hospitable and thorough, but a few things were less than perfect. Allow me to explain. :) We stayed 2 nights. Upon arrival, I was very impressed. The decor of the hotel is fabulous - very modern and fresh. The rooms are okay as well, but not as nice as I'd expected from the pictures. Our room did have a very distant view of the Hollywood sign and downtown LA. Everything was clean and sanitary except for the tub, which had a grayish residue in the bottom of the tub. I think a little bleach and elbow grease would have taken care of that problem. Another thing that was frustrating is that high-speed internet was not available wirelessly -- only through an ethernet cord, and it's $9.95 per 24-hour period. Considering the price of the hotel room, I think internet should be included. And be careful if you do agree to those charges to pay attention to your bill. At first, they double-billed me, but I called the service desk (aka "Delighted to Assist") and they removed the charges. This hotel is in a great location. That's probably the best part. The Hollywood & Highlands shopping center is adjoined with the hotel. Grauman's Chinese Theatre is just around the corner, as is a Virgin Megastore, The Kodak Theatre, and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The Pantages Theatre (home of Wicked, the musical) is within about a 1/2 mile. Nearby restaurants include McDonald's, California Pizza Kitchen, Mel's Diner and the Snow White Cafe. The Twist (hotel restaurant) is very ritzy and I recommend making reservations if you wish to dine there. The hotel bar, located in the foyer, is nice and makes an excellent Long Island Tea, but its expensive as well. Also, transportation is readily available by cab. Cab drivers line-up out in front of the hotel, so you'll never have to wait on one! But fare can be very expensive if you're going to LAX airport -- something like $60 +/- depending on traffic. I recommend taking a shared-ride shuttle if you have some time to spare. It's $16/person. 1-800-blue-van or 1-800-red-vans. Make sure you make your reservations several hours ahead of time. Overall, I gave my experience 4/5 stars because everything was almost perfect. The desk clerks, concierge and valets were all very helpful, the facility was mostly clean, and it's in a good location for tourists. So if you're considering staying in Hollywood and have money to burn, this is hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKylie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, the location is fantastic, ask for room with a view of the Hollywood sign. We had a huge room with two king size beds. Arrived at lunch time and could check in straight away. Very quite hotel obviously has great sound proofing, staff very friendly, facilities great but we never used them as we were out all day. Booking with expedia we got breakfast included for the adults, my 5 year old was free and there was a small charge for our 9 year old. The buffet breakfast was probably the best we have ever had in any hotel. A chef made fresh waffles and omlets, and the quality of the produce was first class. The location is great for shopping and so close to all the hollywood attractions. Universal Studios is one train stop away. If you have time catch a taxi approx $15 to The Grove and Farmers Market we spent the whole day there, very beautiful place to shop and eat and there are free tram rides up and down the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place!”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott Rewards points to book two nights here on a trip that took my mom, neice, her friend, and me from San Francisco to LA. I chose this hotel due to its proximity to Hollywood attractions that I thought would interest my teenage neice and her friend. The hotel did not disappoint. The Mezzanine level of the hotel connects to the adjacent entertainment/shopping complex, so we could easily access restaurants, movies, and tourist attractions like the Kodak Theater and the Graumann's Chinese theater. We took a Starline Tour and walked the Hollywood Walk of Fame from the hotel. We were also several miles away from the Warner Brothers Studio VIp tour which we also took. The only complaint I had with the hotel was that upon check-in when I inquired about the rollaway bed I had requested I was told it would be sent right up. When time passed and it was not there and we were all wanting to go out I decided to go ahead with our plans and expected the bed would be there upon return. It was not. I called and this time I was told the person who would deliver the bed was on break, but that it should be there in twenty minutes. An hour later I called again and when the person on the other line said "At your service" I told them that he needed to answer the phone differently based on my experience thus far with the hotel staff. The bed was immediately delivered. When the man who delivered the bed saw there were four of us sharing the room he left and returned not only with extra towels, but extra coffee cups, shampoo and conditioner. I very much appreciated this attention to detail! We ordered room service one night and the food was delivered within the time promised and att he right temperature. The man who delivered the food said that the hotel was very busy and that we should just leave the table outside the door and not to call for pick-up. I was disappointed to see that the table stayed outside the room overnight and was removed mid-morning of the following day. The food itself was delicious and there were no complaints from any of us about it. The only problem we had was they only gave us two flatware services--despite it clearly being four distinct meals with four beverages, etc. Luckily, we had plastic flatware in the room from an earlier take-out meal so we "made do" using a spoon when a fork might have worked better, etc. The room was clean and the pull-down window shade blocked the sun nicely so we were able to sleep well even though we were on Eastern Standard Time and a bit out of sorts with the Pacific time schedule. All in all it was a good visit. The bell staff delivered our car in a timely fashion though I was a bit annoyed when at check-out two employees chatted away while we waited with our luggage needing to leave for the airport. The driver stopped, backed up, and then stopped so that we could not get to the car. I felt the reason he did this was that the bellman were busy loading the luggage of guests ahead of us and that if he pulled up we might load the car ourselves rather than waiting for the assistance of the bellmen depriving them of their tip. I don't know that this was the case, but it was annoying to me as we were watching the clock and anxious to get on our way. It was frustrating to see our car yards a way and the driver and another employee (the person who we had given our car receipt to for picking up the car) just joking around while we waited and waited and waited...... Other than that the staff was friendly and helpful. I used the concierge's service several times for directions and they were always on the mark. The gift shop at the hotel is very tiny and cramped, but almost anything you need is within walking distance to the hotel. There is a Starbucks in the adjacent shopping center and another right down the street, as well as another take-out place with fruit bowls, pastries, breakfast sandwiches, etc.-I think it was called Fatima's. This is a very good location for seeing the area. The hotel itself was very quiet and the view of the Hollywood sign out the window of the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: blondie63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel and absolutely loved every minute of staying there. We booked the club level, something I would have never considered had I not read the reviews here, and it was worth every penny. They provided very nice breakfast in the morning with a wide selection of choices, and a light snack in the evenings. Water, soda and coffee was available all day. Definately worth the extra $$ for my family. The room itself was impecibly clean, and I loved the California decor and incredible views. We didn't deal much with the staff but the view times we did were always positive. I will definately recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, and I don't hand out recommendations lightly. It was most definately a 5 star experience for us, from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hollywood Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissDHappy
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is quite the place! The location is outstanding....the unbelievable proximity to the Kodak Theatre complex, the Graumann's Theatre, tours.......I travelled without a car so its been ideal. My room was huge and the floor to ceiling window made for a gorgeous view of the Hollywood sign. It was clean, quiet and very comfortable. Being so close to the shopping isn't necessarily so good though! :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: writer_lady
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay in the heart of Hollywood, the Renaissance Hollywood has the best seat in town. It's located right in the Hollywood & Highland complex which features great shopping, dining, the Kodak theater (the very same in which the Oscars are hosted) Grumman's Chinese Theater, and a perfect view of the Hollywood sign. In a very car-centric town, this hotel lets you walk (safely) to a couple of the most visited, must-see sites. You can get over to see the famous "hands in the cement "at any hour. But enough about the location, the hotel itself was extremely comfortable. Modern, stylish rooms with extremely comfortable beds, top quality linens, and again, a view of the Hollywood sign. It had a nice bar downstairs, small convenience store for late-night snacks/toothpaste. I stayed for buisness, and the wifi was reasonably priced (but not free, which is a drawback). Plus there was a buisness center for last minute printing & collating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Jillymo
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, little smaller then expected but acceptable. Beds were very comfortable, views from any rooms were great. we overlooked kodak theater and swimming pool and loved it. Convenient location for seeing lots in a short amount of time. Was there a few days before Oscars and there were many late night parties, but wasn't bothered by noise. Would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCharity
Reviews.Content: We were there for just one night but the place was spotless and modern. They were working on the spa so we couldn't use that and the pool wasn't as warm as they said... but the food in the restaraunt, though it took forever to get and there were only 3 other couples in the restaraunt, it was delicious! The downstairs bar was busy and provided a fun atmosphere to kick back in. It was steps away from all the action and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but the beds are hard!”
Reviews.Author: happyundertow
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a beautiful hotel, very modern and clean. The room was spotless with a great bathroom. The service was a little cold, but very helpful, they never steered me wrong. The food in the club level lounge was very, very good and it was nice to have that quiet option. The location is great if you want to be right in the thick of Hollywood. My only real disappointment was the beds. They were hard as a rock, which maybe people generally like, but I had trouble sleeping. All in all, I would stay there again if I had to be in the area. Also, as a solo traveller I felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “lots to do in and out of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockchalk07
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better location. I had friends coming in from out of town and suggested that they stay there since it is in such a great location. I personally had never been in the hotel until they arrived. I spent one night there with them and was very pleased with my stay. Not only were the rooms awesomely decorated the hotel itself was so accommodating. Their restaurant Twist was delicious and their pool rocks. Now I hear they are opening a spa called Spa Luce and if you get a treatment there you can use the hotel pool for the rest of the day (even if you are not a hotel guest). That is perfect for me since I actually live in LA and do not need to stay at a hotel. I for sure give this place two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: marek1978
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to see Kodak theatre and star lane. Rooms are very nice with modern furniture, great views over the city, affordable valet parking ($27 if I remember correctly). Unfortunately if you make a trip by car and then want to return to the hotel in the evening you get stuck in traffic jams. So its best to stay there for one night see the oscars venue, star lane and escape :)

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance has service issues!”
Reviews.Author: AL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance hotel one night and we won't be going back! We had so many problems checking-in it was unbelievable! First, they lost our reservation and it took 45 minutes for them to find it (even though I had a reservation # and reciept from the internet). The lady at the desk was friendly, but made no attempt to credit us for the inconvenience. Then she wrote down the wrong room number, then our keys didn't work...etc. (All in all, it took us 1.5 hours to check-in from the time we walked into the doors at 4 p.m.) We had dinner reservations at 5:30 at Twist (in the hotel) which we were late for(food was just average). The location of the hotel is great and the room was fairly nice (except for a very strong bleach-type odor that overpowered the room). Overall, we will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hollywood Laocation”
Reviews.Author: mskudzu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for a quick weekend getaway and found it to be adequate for two nights. It is not a luxury property by any means, but it hits some right notes where it counts. The mattress is good, linens and pillows are fine, timely and decent room service as well as helpful concierge. I needed a razor and hair spray and both were delivered quickly. (The hair spray from the gift shop for a charge) They provide a computer at the concierge desk to print boarding passes and map quest maps to get around. They also provide free citrus infused water in the lobby each day. I was on the 17th floor over looking the Hollywood Hills and the view is engaging. Bring your binoculars and you can check out the homes! The bathrooms are modern but again not luxurious... clean with the exception of the air vent which was covered with dust and lint. This hotel is about location. It works for those who want to be in the center of the Hollywood attractions or are visiting someone living in the hills above.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: monikasz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for only 2 nights. My husband and I won a Hollywood Gateaway trip for 3 days and that's the hotel they put us in. Since the hotel was all booked for regular rooms, we were put in an Executive Suite overlooking the hills. The room itself was quite big, with huge windows, pretty views. The bathroom was nice too, with seperete shower and toilet. The room wasn't the cleanest. It was just ok. But we loved the location of the hotel, right in the midst of all the attraction of the Hollywood Blvd. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Hotel...Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: IJai
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from December 27-29, 2007. We were born and raised in California, but had never done the California "tourist thing", so we decided to go to Hollywood for a few days before a Mexican Riviera cruise and check out the scene. This hotel is fabulous! The staff was friendly and helpful. The check-in and check-out was quick and efficient, and we had a comfortable room with a wonderful view of the Hollywood sign and the Capitol Records tower. The complex that surrounds the hotel was great, you almost didn't need to leave the hotel complex if you didn't want to. There were restaurants, a movie theatre and plenty of shops to keep us busy. The Renaissance Hotel is a pick up spot for a lot of the tours of the surrounding areas. Also, there is a Metro Station on the back side of the hotel where you can catch a train that goes directly to and from Universal Studios for $2.50 round trip. We spent a day at the Universal Studios park and didn't have to worry about renting a car or taking a cab there. If you are going to take a Hollywood Stars Homes and City Tour, I would advise you NOT to take a Star Line Tour. The buses are filthy and unmaintained, they are unorganized, and the customer service is terrible. The half day tour that we took was so bad, we couldn't wait for it to be over. It was a hassle from beginning to end. At night the hotel complex comes to life with people strolling the streets viewing the stars on the Walk of Fame, taking snapshots of the Chinese Theatre, The Kodak Theatre, and watching the many street performers that come out at night to entertain and take pictures with the tourists. Our final night in the area, we went for dinner at a beautiful little Cuban restaurant called El Floridita. It was a five minute cab ride from the hotel and the food and ambiance was great. We had an excellent meal and enjoyed the live band and salsa dancing that the restaurant features on Saturday nights. All in all we had a wonderful three day stay. This hotel is close to everything, and the service is superb! I would definitely recommend it to friends, and if I ever return to do the "tourist thing" again, I know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mfaco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with my family and it was just perfect. Very good location with spacious room. The concierge was very attentive and kind as the rest of the personnel. It is also clean, with a very fast room service. I recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Always Welcomed at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Renaissance and it was just wonderful. Being able to stroll Hollywood Boulevard within ten minutes of leaving your room is definitely worth the higher price you would pay staying somewhere else. We swam in the pool, shopped in the mall the hotel is attached to, saw the movie "Enchanted" at Disney's El Capitan Theatre just across the street and had a great time. We only paid around $129 - it must have been a really slow night because it's usually between $200-$300. They really nail you with overnight valet parking of around $30 but the only other options are public lots around Hollywood which are less expensive but less secure. The Roosevelt Hotel down the street is making a name for itself as a place the paparazzi hang out looking for people to photograph people like Paris Hilton. It's a fine place to have a drink but it's dark and dismal compared to the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rennaisance”
Reviews.Author: howardjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and i, have just returned from a west coast tour of the USA. Los Angeles was our first stop, were we stayed at the renaissance. The hotel was excellent,we encountered no problems at all during our stay. The room was very clean and spacious,on a high floor with a nice view as requested. The location is fantastic,right in the heart of hollywood. All the attractions are close by,and easy to get too! We went to universal studios on our first day,which was fantastic. The second day we had a 6 hour tour of LA,very informative and took us to all the relevant areas. The only disappointing thing, was that we only had a three night stay before going on to Las vegas. A lot of people told me not to go to LA,hence the short stay. I am sorry i listened to them,maybe they stayed downtown! The concierge was helpful, and the breakfasts were great. All in all, i would recommend LA and the Renaissance. We had a great time,and just sorry we did not stay for longer. I have not commented on pool area,as we went in the winter! It did look a little small,i think this hotel is better if you like to sight see(rather than sun bathe).

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Matcham16
Reviews.Content: This is the best location I've seen in Hollywood. It is attached to the Hollywood and Highland center and Grauman's Chinese Theater. It was wonderful to be able to walk outside and see the celebrity hand and footprints. The subway station is also very close and we used that to get around Hollywood. We visited Universal Studios without having to pay for parking and we went to Union Station and China town all by the subway and train transportation. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Hollywood for the first time. Request a room with a view of the Hollywood sign on a higher floor and you won't be disappointed! Our room had huge windows with a splendid view of the city and the Hollywood sign. The hotel staff were also very friendly and happy to honor each of our requests. The hotel pool area was under construction when we went as they were adding a spa to the hotel. We didn't have any problems with noise or dust though. Wonderful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, nice staff...celebrity spotting :-)”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 neices and 2 children stayed in this hotel for 6 nights as part of our family trip to California, we had been at the Disneyland Hotel for 6 nights prior to arriving in Hollywood...see seperate review.
