We booked an executive king and a standard room with 2 doubles and requested connecting rooms and a roll away bed. All of our requests were met. The hotel is located atop of the Highland center with an array of shops, cafes, cinemas and restaurants to explore....fabulous spot. We were checked in efficiently and with a smile and told about the concierge floor offering breakfast for a $30 charge per room extra. We thought this great value and accepted this offer. Breakfast varied each day but there was cereal, fruit and some offering of either bacon, sausage and eggs each morning. They also had a variety of juices and starbucks coffee in the lounge. There were also breads and pastries on offer. In the evening there were snacks and during the day you counld pop up and grab a softdrink or water if you wanted also some pieces of fruit. Our rooms were very nice and clean, our executive king was also handicap accessable, so we had a huge bathroom and plenty of extra space. The room with the doubles had a smaller bathroom, but both rooms had mini bar, amoir and a large closet. We found the location to be perfect and used the train system which is located right in the Highland Complex, to get down to the Staples Center one night when we went to the basketball. It is a fast, safe and inexpensive way to get about, without the hassles of parking and LA traffic to contend with. An all day ticket is only $5 per person, and can be used on the trains or buses. When we finished with our passes at the end of each day we handed them on to some less fortunate folk, (which seem to frequent the Hollywood area)...who made use of them to get to where they were going. We booked tours through starline, which are just on the street in a kiosk at the bottom of the Highland center on Sunset. They will heavily discount for a family group...just ask, smile and be patient...we saved just under $100 for a family of 6. We did tons of walking and sightseeing around Hollywood and at all times felt safe. One day we walked from the hotel to the Beverly Center....we walked down Highland, onto Melrose and all the way to La Cienega and to the Mall....it took us 3 and a half hours...with stops for shopping, drinks and icecreams along the way...what a fabulous walk that was, enjoying Hollywood by foot is really something. ....I digress...back to the Hotel...we found the staff very friendly, the rooms spotless, the food delicious...even room service was very fast and arrived hot and fresh at very reasonable prices...so we took advantage of this a lot with snacks in bed while watching tv for everyone, almost nightly. The manager told me, when we were checking out that the rooms are due for a refurbishment, and that they were going to be fabulous, with flat screen tvs, new linens (nice already) and new pillows (which need changing), carpeting etc. The refurb is due to start early 2008. The spa is being built now too. Whilst there we saw, Judith Light in the lobby, we saw Tom DeLong from Angels and Airwaves checking in, we saw Jack Nicholson and Lindsay Lohan at the basketball, we saw the guy from Supersize Me...pushing his child in a stroller along Melrose and my husband saw one of the Baldwin brothers driving down Hollywood Blvd...but wasnt sure which one it was...so if you are into celebrity spotting....they really do get out and about in Los Angeles...we saw some and were kind of excited lol. We felt this hotel offered exceptional value for money, a wonderful location and very nice, helpful staff. The congierge is very good, we had several packages delivered to the hotel that my husband ordered online and all of them arrived in one piece and on time. Overall we had a wonderful time in Hollywood at the Renaissance. I would recommend this hotel to family, friends and fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelhelper1
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here and thought it was fine. Contrary to many postings, I found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Valet was prompt, room service was delicious and the room was great. (request a fridge, you can keep soda and beer from the corner drug store and save a few bucks). We had a suite with a view of the Hollywood sign. The shopping area connected to the hotel gives you a lot of choices for eating. You are in the heart of Hollywood for viewing the sights (freaks??). I'd recommend a tour of the stars houses. It seems a bit corny, but it was fun and you do get to see quite a bit. Avoid Rodeo Drive. . . over hyped and not worth the traffic headache.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay one night at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. My review is very limited because we only statyed 1 night. This is a very nice hotel but there some things that I didnt like about the hotel. Let me start out with the positives: 1) Location - Cannot be beat. Adjacent to the Kodak Theater, Mann Chinese Theater, and Hollywood and Highland shopping center. 2) Cleaniless - Hotel was clean and comfortable. Bed was really nice to sleep on. 3) Public Transportation - The LA's red line light rail is located about a block away. The Red Line can take you to Universal Studios, Pantages Theater, and China Town (via transfer). 4) Great views from higher floors. Here are some of the things that I didnt like about the hotel. 1) Location - Its tough to get in and out of this hotel because the entrance to the hotel is along a small driveway that leads to the parking structure for the Hollywood and Highland shopping center. Hollywood and Highland streets are very busy and typical of Southern California gridlock. 2) Valet Service - Very busy hotel. Valet service can take up to 5 to 10 minutes especially in the mornings during check out. Be sure to call ahead. Expensive! Try and get a rate that includes valet service. 3) Bathroom - pretty small and nothing pretty about it. just a standard hotel bathroom in their standard hotel room. Sink, vanity, toilet, and shower are all located in one room. Pretty tight accomodations. You pay for location here. This hotel does not have the luxury amenities and features equal to its price. The price you pay is because of location, location, location. Just keep that in mind if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased 100%. Almost. Until Delighted to Assist failed...”
Reviews.Author: Badang
Reviews.Content: We wished that we booked a room in last year's Queen Mary New Year's Eve Party. And so, that's what we did at this NYE Party at Hollywood Renaissance. My sister who has a medical condition and may get tired sooner is coming with us, so I upgraded to the best room they have available at the time of my booking which was a mini suite. The room was a little bigger than a standard hotel room, immediate view was an empty land and parking lots definitely not the Hollywood sign shown in their web site but the changing room for the performers for the event was also within our immediate view that caught attention and we get a good view of the entertainment on the poolside. My sister said that she was pleased and that's good enough for me. My husband and I and our daughter didn't intend to stay after the party because we only live 30 minutes away. My sister insisted that we stay at least until early morning when it is safer to drive. The king size bed was used by my sister and her husband. Our daughter and I used the sofa bed but the extra blanket found in the closet was not thick enough plus we needed one more for my husband who's contented with two seats put together. Anne from Delighted to Assist agreed to send up two blankets and two towels. We waited and waited and nothing arrived. My husband just wrapped himself up with the bath robes. Definitely not the kind of service we expected for $420/night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A few hits, a few misses”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this property earlier this December. The room was quite spacious, and the bed and amenities were fine. I also have to compliment the staff of Twist, which is a great restaurant. I have to agree with previous comments on here about hotel staff. From check-in and throughout the trip, many of the staff seemed uninterested and preoccupied. I felt like they were not trained at all by Marriott, as opposed to most Marriott's where there is a consistency of service. Quick tip: Parking is $10 a night at Hollywood and Highland complex. If you can walk a little bit and it is not much at all, this is well worth the savings over the valet and seemed very secure. Mel's Diner around the corner was a good meal option, as well as Vert in the Hollywood and Highland complex (which unfortunately shut down during the stay) and Trastevere for Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. One thing that I can say is that if you decide to stay here, definitely get a club-level room. The views will be much nicer and the breakfast, snacks, and desserts make the price difference well worth it. The breakfast - while basic - is more than adequate for a couple day's stay. The snack were pretty decent, and the desserts were quite good - although varied day-to-day and sometimes limited in selection. There are also water and soft drinks available throughout the day, which was convenient. However, don't count on the club during the weekend - from what I remember from the sign, it closes before noon on Friday and only re-opens Sunday night. The lounge also lacks a high number of comfy seats and also lacks internet facilities for guests (although staff seem more than determined to do high quantity surfing at their one desk while guests must ask for more food etc). The lounge was also strange in that many guests just came and grabbed stuff and took it to their room (presumably one reason is the lack of comfy-ness in the lounge). In other club lounges that I have been in, guests would relax and even mingle. In this lounge, that was totally non-existent. The room was fine. It was clean and I loved the natural light of the big windows. The decor was OK, but a bit "busy" and a bit non-functional (except the comfy chair) in my opinion. The bathroom was OK, but I hate the bomb-shelter feel that the heavy, self-closing door gives it. I also hated the "big brother" fridge - where you cannot put your own stuff in as it is completely slots... luckily at the club level, you can get free cold drinks until 10pm. There are a lot of wannabes staying and hanging around this hotel - this was a bit unpleasant, but maybe it does give you an insight into some people around La-La land. The staff are highly varied at this hotel. Some are quite good. Quite a few unfortunately cannot be bothered by guests apparently. Some of this is probably due to these kids having their heads in their star-life dreams.... things like bell-boys chatting about this-and-that while fully blocking the door for my wife who had to walk all the way around them and club lounge attendants surfing IMDB for endless hours while guest wonder if that is all the food there is. I also think that it must be due to poor training - this particular hotel seems so concerned about looking good that it gives the employees prepared things to say (e.g., saying "delighted" at the end of a conversation with guests) without concerning itself with whether the staff actually means it. I was subjected to so many fake canned statements that I wanted to puke...... I would say that it is La-La land, but we stayed at another hotel of the same brand and had such a different experience....maybe it is just Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood and fine .”
Reviews.Author: JamesBond0007
Reviews.Content: Hold on , it in Hollywood people. The area is a lot better then it used to be believe me. Its always busy even late at night and you will be fine. Firstly about some of the muppets who have reviewed the hotel....... why did you stay in Hollywood ? Its full of historic building and places , if you you love film and old forties film you will love it and this hotel. All you others please go to your theme parks and shut up. This hotel is of a high standard, top draw if you have to put up with the crap serviceand hotels in Engand, Have no worries on stopping here. Go buy a good Hollywood history book from Borders and enjoy the area, The Pig and Whistle is great, Bogart, Bacall, Hemmingway etc all used it in its day........ If you do not like that mixed in with the slightly tacky t shirt stands and all stay away, Santa Monica is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think you are paying for.”
Reviews.Author: Carltongirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights arriving on the 17th November and departing Wed 21st November 2007. We telephoned ahead from Cabo as our flight was delayed for 3.5hrs and to let the hotel know that we would be late and to ensure that we still kept our reservation. On our arrival we were told by the female checking us in that they had no king size beds, this is despite the fact that I had telephoned approx 7hr prior from Mexico to advise of our late arrival. We were offered a double room as there were no king rooms left and when my husband explained he is too tall for a double bed we were moved into the disabled persons room (with a king bed) next to the elevator. At this time I asked that my husband and I have a room change the next day to a king size room. The next day we were moved to a room with a king size bed on the same floor. Housekeeping - the room was very clean, however for 2 out of four days we arrived back in our room in the late afternoon to find that housekeeping had not been. On each occasion we called housekeeping (or delighted to assist button on the phone) and were told they would send someone up straight away. We waited and waited and no one showed. Eventually on our third phone call over a 2 hr period, housekeeping eventually showed up. A message was left on our room phone message bank from the hotel advising they hoped our room had been cleaned and they wanted to ensure that our stay was special! The next day housekeeping knocked on our door and we said we will be 10 minutes and housekeeping said that would be fine and they would clean the room in 10 minutes. We left the room and arrived back 5 hours later and housekeeping had not touched the room. We called 'delighted to assist' and explained housekeeping had not been etc, the same thing had happened yesterday, they said sorry blah blah blah and someone would be up right away. 2 hours passed again before my husband called up twice more and housekeeping finally turned up at 4.10pm explaining to my husband they were not aware the room had to be cleaned earlier. Another downside, there is no laundry for clothes washing. The only alternative is dry cleaning through the hotel which is expensive. The reception/check in staff were not friendly (perhaps a reflection on the management) however the hotel did provide us with two beverage vouchers to the value of $16 each on our last day, however the same cannot be said for the restaurant staff at The Twist Restaurant at the hotel. The Twist Restaurant staff were friendly, helpful and ensured that all guests had everything they needed. We ate in the restaurant in the morning (The chilled buffet $16 is healthy and nutritious and delicious, American Buffet is $20) and the dinner menu is superb and the food delicious and fresh. Their wine list is excellent. The staff will chat to you and show an interest in you. We really appreciated their friendliness and kindness. The bellhops were really friendly and always ready to answer any questions we had. The concierge on the day we asked the gentleman a question, Tuesday 20th November was disinterested and unfriendly. The location of the hotel is great for all the tourist attractions in the area. Shopping is limited at Hollywood and Highland although there is a great DWS shoe store nearby. At nightime the area is questionable and sleazy at night and we would not recommend hanging around the boulevard for too long. It would not be a particularly safe place. We recommend Mels Diner for dining for either Breakfast, lunch or dinner which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Weak on front desk sev. Incl Mgrs”
Reviews.Author: GQue
Reviews.Content: Just came back after two nights. Hotel and room very nice. Problems: Called Marriott direct and booked the room using the properties promotion (M11) for parking included (VS $29 per night) and had Resv in hand. Told system did not show what I had and I would have to pay for parking. Asked for Mgr. who came over and told me the same thing regardless of what I had in hand. Told not familiar with the promotion (even though it was on their direct website) After about 10 minutes of going back and forth I said let me get on the computer and I would show them their promotion on their site. First told I would have to go to the 3rd fl business center even though they had 6 computers with internet access 5 feet from me and only 2 being used. Finally allowed to use the system and even when I pulled it up and showed it to them at first they did not want to honor it. Finally manager said he would take care of it. When I checked out two days later they had still charged me $29 x 2. Which I then had to start all over again with another mgr to resolve. (Another 10+ minutes) -Valet parking often did not answer the phone when calling down. Twice I had to call front desk to complain to get my car. - Minus this good location for what I had to do.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: HeartisinIreland
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL place to stay - could not ask for a better location if you're there to do the Hollywood scene; one-half block from Hollywood Blvd and Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese, etc. and adjacent to a beautiful open-air 4 story mall. Very clean, very nice rooms; excellent beds; excellent service. Would absolutely stay there again without question!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: jazzalicious
Reviews.Content: I am at The Renaissance Hotel right now. 4 hours ago we came back to our room. I walked into the bathroom and the sink was filled with black sludge. Basically the sewer system had backed up into our sink and the sink was filled with human waste. I phoned down to the front desk and they said they would send up someone to fix it. I said that was fine but I would like to be moved to another room. I was put on hold for 10 minutes and then informed that there were no other rooms. I asked to speak with the manager. After waiting for another 10 minutes I was told that the manager was busy. I informed the front desk person that I found it hard to believe that a hotel this size would not have a room available. She told me that there were rooms availabe but none of them were clean. I told her that I was sure she would not want to stay in a hotel room with human waste in the sink. She put me on hold again. She then came back and said that she had found a room. She said that she would send up keys to the new room right away. I thanked her and told her I would still like to speak to the manager. 20 minutes later we were still waiting for the keys. I went downstairs and got the new keys myself. I still haven't heard from the manager. If you are looking for a hotel with good service I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel, GREAT SERVICE, Studio Suites are AWESOME, Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel for one night only and from the website thought I was going to be in IKEA land but was pleasantly surprised as the rooms were very comfortable, plush bedding, beyond friendly service (they actually walk from behind the front desk counter to hand you your keys....what other hotel does that I ask???) Safes in the room, really nice and clean and NEW bathrooms, LATHER bath products (SF company) in all bathrooms, restaurant was good, located next to a zillion things to do at Hollywood and Highland and very easy access off the 101, near Universal Studios and Hollywood Bowl. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel for fun or business in Hollywood or LA areas.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance again!”
Reviews.Author: weluv2vacation
Reviews.Content: I just received an email from someone who asked about parking and it reminded me that I have not yet wrote a review of my Aug. 2007 7 day stay at the Renaissance. This was our 2nd time at this hotel and it will definitely not be our last. We love this hotel and hope it does not change unless it is to become even better. You just cannot beat the location that is pretty much central to everything. Hollywood just outside your door, L.A (we love to go to the farmers market and Grove) and Beverly Hills min. away, Santa Monica- We love to just hop on Sunset Blvd. to the PCH, Universal about 15 min, etc. and there's even a metro stop just outside the door though we always use the car. Though Disneyland and Knotts were not the sole purpose of our trip, we did go one day each for those and the car ride there was not far either. In the 2 times we have stayed there, I have not encountered bad service. On the contrary, it has been quite excellent. The hotel and room are clean. We requested a roll away bed and mini fridge, extra towels and pillows and all came at no extra charge. Before your visit, if you book through them, they even email you a "request form" that includes things like early check in, fridge, extra pillows, etc. There's a pool area, at the time we were there they were adding a spa. It might be complete now. The Hollywood and Highland complex which the hotel is connected to is always fun with the shops, places to eat, bowling, and more. During this visit, one day walked out of the hotel and to our surprise Michelle Phieffer's Hollywood Walk of Fame Star ceremony was starting so we were up front and center! Actor Paul Rudd and Jeff Bridges were there as well and Jeff Bridges even took my camera and took a picture of the both of us for me! We travel to L.A. about twice a year and the Renaissance will be our choice again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bbuzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Oct 27-29th. The hotel is in a great convenient location. The beds were super comfy and the room and bathroom very spacious. We choose to use the self parking which saved us a lot of money but at times the parking garage is so large that we sometimes couldn't find our car. We had our children with us however we did not see any other kids as the area in Hollywood is probably more geared to adults. At night is is very colorful with all kinds of people. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thasez
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart of Hollywood. It's joined onto the Chinese Manns Theatre and is round the corner from the Walk of Fame. The hotel itself is clean, modern and has all the amenities including a pool area and gym. We had the breakfast buffett included with our room rate which we were pleased about because it costs $25! It's very nice though and they cater for everyone with cereals, fruit, bagels, eggs, bacon, sauages and fresh juice. The room was a good size and looked out over the hollywood sign and it was cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelley99
Reviews.Content: We (myself and my boyfriend)stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for 3 nights from 12th october 2007 and really enjoyed our stay. After a slight hiccup upon arrival, as in we didnt have a reservation even though i booked it 13 months ago! I work at thomas cook so i booked it myself, took about 15 mins to resolve, finally found my reservation in a totally different name!!! Anyway, got our room, really modern and spacious looking at Hollywood sign, lovely bathroom and everywhere clean and tidy. The hotel is attached to Chinese theatre and kodak so virtually on the doorstep to everything, apparantly alot of the celebs stay here on oscars night as you can walk through to hotel without having to go back outside to get mobbed!! didint see any celebs though! We did a tour through starline which was fabulous took us through beverly hills movie stars homes tour, rodeo drive, stars cemmetry and even up into the hollywood hills for a close up of the sign! after this we did a walking tour of the walk of fame, el capitan theatre and kodak/graumans, amazing day and leant alot!! next day we did universal studios which was really great too The hotel is definatly worth 4 star as it was just a fab place and the staff were really helpful too. pool was small but didnt see anybody using it, great views from there too, if you go, request a high floor as views are great and its quieter too, I would definatley recommend this hotel for its location and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and exellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: aussieitchyfeet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the US. Our first two nights where spent at the Hollywood Renaissance and it was exellent. I read about 6 months of reviews before deciding on the hotel and definitely made the right choice for us. We arrived at 9am after a 13hr flight and our room was ready. We had requested a high floor with a view over to the Hollywood sign this wasn't available at 9am but if we waited two hours that room was available.So off to Mels Diner for breakfast and a walk down the walk of fame and our room was ready. No problems at all. The week before the hotel had emailed and asked if we had any requests besides the view of the sign we also requestad a fridge to store drinks and some medication. It wasn't there when we returned later in the day and before I could followup the front desk rang to check if the fridge was in our room. It arrived 5 minutes later. The conceirge and porters couldn't have been more helpful with information and friendly and check in staff where great. I was travelling with my 2 children and I was a little anxious but my experience with this hotel made me feel safe and very comfortable. It is a great location ,our room was great We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale, Comfy Beds & Airy Room”
Reviews.Author: SeminarTrekker
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel because I need to be near a motion picture business and also planned to play golf nearby. I used AAA internet rate versus regular rates. The Hotel is located on Highland near Hollywood Blvd. I took Prime Time shuttle from LAX and rate was $15.00 via the interent. Check in at the Renaissance Hollywood was smooth and fast. My room was on the top floor which offered commanding view of of the Los Angeles basin. The room was good size and light and airy with plenty of sunlight. The bed was comfy and the room was quiet. The television offered plenty of local and cable channels. The room was clean and the bathroom was okay. The furniture seemed a bit odd for the Renaissance chain. I suggest the Renaissance team look toward the Bryant Park Hotel in Manhattan or Galt Hotel in Montreal for Hip, Mod & Super cool. The bathroom offers Lather products which I like. Plenty of light in the bathroom. Water pressure was good. The hotel had very good gym with plenty of equipment. I did not use the outdoor pool. The Hotel is right next to the Highland Hollywood shopping complex which is convenient to find a place to eat. I ate nearby at The Grill on Hollywood which was very good and ate at Mel's Drive in on Highland for breakfast. There is Long's Drugstore just West on Hollywood Blvd to pick up snacks, beverages and personal items. I was very happy with my stay at the Renaissance Hollywood in Hollywood, CA. I would choose the Residence Inn Los Angeles/Beverly Hills as my primary choice in the L.A. area (value and customer service) but this would be in my top five choices. The location is probably the properties best asset - in the center of Hollywood. I recommend the Renaissance Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: carouge
Reviews.Content: Aside from the location being near Mann's Chinese Theater and the Kodak Theater, the hotel itself is just an overpriced wannabe-chic hotel. The rooms are adequately decorated, but necessarily functionally if you have to work. One tacky feature is that they prominently display a note that anything removed from the mini-bar results in an automatic charge- first time I ever saw that. One other minus- the parking lot I used every day was a 5-10 minute walk each time to/from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of HollywoodO”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location for the Hollywood area, it is right next to a subway stop, but to get around in Los Angeles you will need a car. The room was comfortable with a great view of Los Angeles. We were placed next to the service elevator and the walls were on the thin side. So, be sure to tell them in advance if noise bothers you. The bed was comfortable. The food was expensive in the hotel. Though, there are a significant number of places to eat within walking distance. The lobby is somewhat chic and the neighborhood is a very typical Hollywood neighbor hood. It is safe to walk except take care at night. I would recommend the hotel for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oztraveller72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights last week and thought the hotel was fair and worth the price. There is not much to do in Hollywood apart from the shopping and Walk of Fame etc, but if these things interest you this is a convenient location to them all. The hotel was clean, bed was comfortable and I had a view of the city on the top floor which was nice. I think compared to the other hotels around the area that this one is the best and is fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vetten
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and were quite pleased with the hotel. It's location is absolutely what we found most pleasing. It's proximity to the Graumans and to some incredible shopping was big plus. We stayed in a deluxe room on 17th floor and it was decorated very nicely and very clean - especially the bath. Spectacular view of the city but would have opted for a hills view. We did not eat in hotel except for buffet breakfast which was excellent. Waiters were great. The service was very friendly and conceirge Allan very helpful. The only complaint is that there are not any bars open for cocktails before 4 PM. Only alternative was to order room service and with the room service charge and tip, it made a couple of glasses of wine ridiculously expensive. As I said though - it is the only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmimartins
Reviews.Content: After arriving at LAX, is a long way to the hotel but in LA everything is far away. The location is great ... even to get a LA tour. The shopping next door gives plenty of option on eateries... and the "circus" in the walk of fame is a must see Rooms have a simple and modern decor and the pool is small but great for a swim after a day of walking around

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunkyG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in August with my wife and 2 boys (11 & 15). Thehotel was ok, room had a view of the Hollywood sign, and very comfortable beds. We visted universal studios for 2 days with our Southern California City Pass- excellent value if you are touring LA, Anaheim and San Diego. Universal Studios was enjoyed by all the family - the queues were not too bad, especially if you get there early. The only problem we had was that our room was not serviced one day, despit the fact that we were out from 8.00am to 6pm. We asked for a service whilst we were at dinner. We asked an employee and housekeeping. Upon our return it was not serviced as promised. We eventually got the room cleaned and new towels at 10pm. Unimpressed, I complianed to the desk manager who answered a phone call without looking at me whlist I was in mid-sentence. The hotel amanger eventually cam e over and apologised and gave us a $50 refund. This did spoil our view of the hotel, which other than this was satisfactory, if not exceptional, and a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Sophie6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days and it was en excellent choice ! The hotel is 100m away from the chinese theater and the hollywood boulevard. The shopping mall is connected with the hotel (coffes shop, restaurants, shops), the breakfast is very good, the parking valet service is very convenient. Univesal studio is 5mn away. The rooms are big, colorfull and very quiet. I would come back and I recommend it to any family ! Sophie

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: K_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Great location for touristy stuff! I think its pricey for what it is but worth it for the location. Funky decor, mostly very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance for 3 nights on business in August 2007. Check in was smooth- I had a room on the 16th floor with a view of LA. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was nice as well and had all the amenities you would expect. My only complaint is that the TV had very limited channels. I used the valet service which was both prompt and courteous. I had room service breakfast one morning and I highly recommend the fruit smoothie. Checkout was smooth as well. I would consider staying here again- the only reason I would is because there are so many choices.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: KB1955
Reviews.Content: My 13-year old daughter and I made a mother/daughter trip to Hollywood and decided to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. We have absolutely NO complaints! Our room was fabulous. We asked for a view of the Hollywood Hills and had a perfect view. Our room was so spacious and clean and well-appointed. It was nice to have a separate bathroom and dressing room. The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Twist every morning - it was worth the cost for fresh food and fruit. We would DEFINTELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to pay a bribe”
Reviews.Author: travelfromheretother
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a beautiful property in a great location. But if you're checking in late at night, be prepared to pay a bribe. Seriously. David, who works the front desks some nights, will outright ask you for money to secure a reservation. When our group arrived, with a verbal but not confirmed reservation, he said he could only give us the room if we gave him $50 cash. We're not the first this has happened to.

Reviews.Title: “A fab hotel to base yourself in.”
Reviews.Author: lou-leighwilliams
Reviews.Content: When we go on holiday, one of the most important things for us is the location - this hotel is great! Used 'Supershuttle' to get from the airport [nice and cheap] and was very impressed with hotel as soon as we stepped inside. Check-in was fast and room was fab! Had asked for a high-floor room having read previous reviews and one with a view of the Hollywood Sign. Got both requests. Only thing we didn't get which we had asked for prior to arrival was an in-roon fridge. I'm sure if I had chased it up, it would have come, but didn't actually need it anyway. Location is great. Walk through precinct and right next to Graumann's Chinese Theatre. This is where lots of coach trips leave from. Really close to the subway too. I was a little worried about travelling on this, but it was great. Only one stop away from Universal and cheap. Hopped on a bus from outside the subway station too and went all the way to Venice Beach. Its a fair journey, changing bus once, but very cheap and easy. We asked at the Tourist Info point by the precinct and they were very helpful. Day pass cost Â£5 each. Definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round!”
Reviews.Author: Mowzer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel exhausted after a huge flight and extra long transfer to be greeted by very friendly staff on reception who upgraded us to a suite. Room was amazing, absolutely huge, 13th floor with spectacular views across LA. Location was also spot on. You couldn't be any closer to the walk of fame and the shuttle to Universal Studios is practically on the doorstep along with loads of shops and eateries! Concierge are really helpful. Pool is small but nice and you can see the Hollywood sign whilst you sun bathe!

Reviews.Title: “Totally successful 2-night stay”
Reviews.Author: MmePoppy
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our two rooms on the Club Level of this hotel. The Club Room offers a good free breakfast and copious snacks and goodies at happy hour, in addition to a light array of desserts later. Quite a good value, making it well worth the extra cost of these club level rooms. The room decor was fun and fresh with a sort of "Jetsons Go Hollywood" feel which we liked a lot. The hotel adjoins a shopping mall with movie theater, the Kodak Academy Awards theater (we took the tour and loved it!) and many places to eat. Our best meal of our whole California vacation was right there in the mall at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant "Vert" -- sublime food and not even all that expensive for what it was. We paid more elsewhere for much less interesting offerings. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to this location on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheWalkersWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights 23rd July 2007.We are a family of four with two children 10 and 6 years.This is a brilliant hotel.The location is excellent and the view from our room on the 15th floor was breathtaking.The Mall underneath the hotel is perfect for eating and shopping.You could not be any closer to where the stars all left their mark on the walk of fame.As for the hotel, the staff were very welcoming and polite.The swimming pool is excellent for a cooling dip in the LA heat.Also the views aren't bad!! Stay here if you are stopping in LA for any time whatsoever, whether for one night or a week.. Eat your breakfast at Johnny Rockets in the shopping mall.There is a great diner over the road from Hollywood boulevard called 'Mels Diner' eat there, fully recommended.Also do the starlines tour of the celebrity homes..Brilliant.All in all we stayed 4 nights and were able to visit Santa Monica, Rodeo Drive and we drove to the Malibu beach areas.A dream stay to start our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bdagal
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Renaissance Hollywood. Check in was quick and the Front Desk personnel were very friendly. Also when we arrived by Taxi the bellman opened the door and greeted us like the "stars" we are. When making the reservations, we asked for fridge and by the time we checked in and went for a walk and came back the fridge was there. by 9:30 the maid was there to clean the rooms. Hotel is very convenient especially for people who don't have their own transportation. We took tours and we were able to go to Universal as the Metro Station was right there. I will go back to this hotel again and hopefully it won't be too long away.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Surprise! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in an executive suite on the 15th floor with amazing views of the Hollywood hills/sign. The room was large with expansive windows. Overall service in the hotel was exceptional as well. Don't worry about the spa renovation warning on the hotel's website. This in no way interferes with the hotel overall and noise was not a problem. Location, location, location....a walkway leads to the very nice shopping center connecting all the major Hollywood tourist sites for great pictures. This is an above-average property. One suggestion: go early if you plan to have the breakfast buffet. The line/layout of the buffet gets long due to the setup. I would stay here again without hesitation. I have stayed at numerous hotels in the area including some very expensive 5-star properties in Beverly Hills, and the Renassance Hollywood ranks at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: elsiekate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance from 19th-23rd July. Check in was incredibly quick, taking literally 1 minute to complete, which was a blessing as we were meeting friends for dinner less than an hour later and were pretty stressed out after a long drive through rush hour traffic from the airport! The hotel sends an email in the week before your stay asking if you have any specific requests, and we had requested extra towels and a refridgerator in our room. The pleasant receptionist noted this and said that they would be delivered to our room promptly. They arrived less about 10 minutes later. The room was reasonably sized and very clean, the bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Our view from the 14th floor was of the pool area and into the Hollywood and Highland Center was pleasant enough. The bathroom was good, if nothing special, but the water pressure was good and the bathroom amenities were nice and replenished daily. Unlike some hotels the hair dryer was also moveable, and I was able to take this into the bedroom to use the mirror there whilst my husband was using the bathroom. Housekeeping was good, but there is a notice in the bedroom that says they clean rooms between 9am and 5pm, which meant that often when we returned in the early afternoon the room had not yet been cleaned. Nevertheless, they were efficient and unobtrusive. One of my few complaints with the room was that it was not particularly well sound proofed (although I am quite particular about noise levels). I never heard a thing from outside, or from the rooms either side of us, but people in the corridors could be heard as clearly as if they were in the room itself! Not that it happened regularly or was lengthy, but I was awoken twice by such noise. The air conditioning was good although, again, too loud for me, so I did turn it off during the night. We didn't use many hotel facilities, and didn't eat there. We did eat at Wolfgang Puck's Vert in the shopping complex attached which had a lovely ambience, great service and good food. One thing we did use was valet parking. It may be $29 per day, but for the convenience, speed of service and pleasant staff it was perfect for us. We also used the minibar for bottles of water, when we ran out, and they cost around $2 per bottle, which in terms of hotel minibars, isn't that bad. The hotel always seemed busy during our stay, with many conventions or events going on. There were all sorts of different people from business men, regular tourists to women in amazing evening gowns in the lobby and as such the elevators were slow and sometimes crowded. Overall, the Renaissance Hollywood is a reasonably priced hotel with good amenities in a great location for tourists. As a tourist who was meeting friends that were staying at different hotels around Hollwood, I can honestly say it was perfectly placed and of a better standard than many of the other hotels around the area. Literally a minute's walk through the H&H complex and you are on Hollywood Boulevard and right by the Chinese theatre. A very pleasant stay indeed, and we'll probably be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit soulless”
Reviews.Author: Snowangel30
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with great rooms with great views. The pool was very welcome in the heatwave that LA had while we were there. They are currently doing some bulding work around the pool so I don't think there is a much space as normal and there was quite a lot of noise from the building works during the day which meant that you didn't want to spend too much time in the pool. My only complaint about this hotel was that you felt like an anonymous guest. This hotel feels more like a large conference hotel than a holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good vakue”
Reviews.Author: bmarshall
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews . Great location ...as LA is so big this is about as close to tourist facilities as you can get (except the beaches). Our room had a view of the Hollywood sign. Good pool As for the comments about transport they have massive traffic problems in this city. Still the four of us found taxi travel good value

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: laura2111
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Hollywood Renaissance. I will get the negative point out the way first, which is i found the hotel staff quite impersonal, un-enthusiastic and non-smiley. Apart from that, our stay was super. The room was surprisingly spacious and modern. We had an amazing view of Hollywood from the huge window in our room. The room was also imacculate however, the hairdryer was broken but i didn't bother asking for another as i had my own anyway. The surrounding area of the hotel was a little intimidating, especially to walk about. However, there are many tourist attractions next to the hotel. I visited Grauman's Chinese Theatre and did the tour which was interesting and worth the $12 it cost. We also went on the tour of the star's homes, which I really enjoyed even though i mostly seen a tour of the stars gates. This cost $30 pp.

Reviews.Title: “Awaiting Urban Renewal”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: Hotel - Yes Neighborhood - No When I walked into the lobby of the Hollywood Renaissance and looked at the curving steel staircase, the modern art, and the expanse of shiny marble, I thought it was a brand new hotel. I was not dissuaded from this view after seeing the guest rooms and meeting facilities. I was very surprised to learn that the hotel was a renovated Holiday Inn. It seemed to me that every surface had been replaced, renewed, or reworked effectively obliterating every trace of its former incarnation. My room was comfortable and attractive with all new furniture, bedding and carpet. It is a nice set up for business travelers with a large repositionable desk and comfortable desk chair. Unfortunately like many upscale hotels they charge for internet access ($9.95 per day). The bathroom was average size but had a nice marble counter and massaging showerhead. Tub, tile and all fixtures appeared to be brand new. The hotel is large - more than 600 rooms - and seems to cater to conventioneers. There are three floors of meeting rooms and most of the folks I saw around the hotel seemed to be wearing name tags. I was surprised not to see more tourists during my stay as the hotel is near the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Grumman's Chinese Theater. The attractiveness and newness of the hotel was in stark contrast to the surrounding area. As you sit in one of the Eames chairs in the sleek lobby and look out the front window, you see a run-down strip mall with a liquor store, tobacco shop and "JuJu's Brand Name Fashions for Less" as tenants. In fact, with the exception of the Highland/Hollywood shopping center next door, the area surrounding the hotel is primarily tacky souvenir shops and low rise apartments/"residence hotels" dating from the 1940s/50s. The Highland Hollywood block includes the hotel, the new Kodak Theater (home to the Academy Awards) and the attractive open-air Hollywood Highland retail/dinning complex. Unfortunately this new construction was not an impetus for any new development nearby and outside this one block, the area is very run-down. To be clear, the area is not blighted - we are not talking about abandoned buildings or broken glass - just tired, old, scruffy buildings. I did encounter homeless people sleeping on Hollywood Blvd, only a few hundred feet from the hotel. Dining options are limited. There is only one restaurant in the hotel - Twist - which is open for all meals. I had breakfast there and it was tasty but fairly expensive at $20 for the buffet or $12 for a simple quesadilla. The restaurants in the Highland/Hollywood center are primarily chains and fast food with the except of Wolfgang Puck's Vert. For a fine dining meal, you will have to travel a considerable distance. I stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance in mid-July 2007 for three nights in order to attend a business conference at the hotel. I paid $169 which was the negotiated conference rate. I thought the hotel to be a great value at this price. My interaction with the staff was minimal - check in was quick and easy, maid was pleasant, and waiter was cheerful. I was concerned that I was never notified that I had received a FedEx package. If the sender had not contacted me, prompting me to inquire with the concierge, I would have left the hotel without getting the package.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of All of the Action”
Reviews.Author: AustinTexan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and our three children, spent two nights in the Renaissance Hollywood hotel (July 1st and 2nd). I booked the room on [--]for $279/night. We got a "Club Level Rate" with two double beds. Staff brought a rollaway up at our request for the fifth sleeper. The club level access allowed us to eat a hot breakfast before setting out each day, as well as, provide dinner snacks, desserts and beverages. This lounge was very nice and greatly appreciated. The room was great with a view to the south. The hotel abuts an upscale shopping venue that is right on Hollywood Blvd. and convenient to Grauman's Chinese Theatre (with the handprints of major Hollywood stars) and the wackiness of the area. We saw Live Free or Die Hard in the main theatre. This is the way movies used to be shown! The hotel was very convenient to Universal Studios. The pool area isn't the greatest but space is at a premium and my kids never complained. We enjoyed our stay and felt that I had booked the right place for my family. As with all of my bookings, I am dependent upon the TripAdvisor reviews. Thanks TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel in the middle of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: City99
Reviews.Content: There are signs in the public areas of the Renaissance that say they are about to have a makeover. It is a bit like saying " we know it looks tired but maybe it will be better next time." It never ceased to amaze me that celebs stay here as it is not exactly luxurious (there is a high chance of seeing some of them as you are practically on top of the Kodak theater). Part of the blame must go the designers- I love IKEA but the hotel and room was dressed like an IKEA designer had suffered some sort of breakdown- where did all the money go that I read they spent on this place? Perhaps it was all spent on the original art that adorns some of public areas? Anyway, the hotel is part of the Hollywood and Highland retail complex, in the tourist heart of Hollywood. There are plenty of nearby options for food, including a nice little Italian restaurant on the 4th floor of the shopping center and even a little Starbucks at ground level where they will remember your order if you use it enough. Part of the problem is that the shopping center next to the hotel is not quite as glam as you might expect- too much concrete- and this detracts from the hotel itself. We self-parked our car which was less than the half the price of valet parking; drop off your bags first before parking though as it is a bit of a trek through the shopping center. The room style was cheap and cheerful; not particularly large but OK. The bathroom was a little drab but again OK, no separate shower though and a worn bathtub. Our view across the LA skyline was great and on a smog free day or evening was quite impressive. Security wasn't much in evidence and I recommend barring your room door before bedtime. Also check that the connecting door to the next room is locked (no that is not a closet!). Room service was on time and not bad. On balance,this hotel is really very 3 star and not especially great value but it is in a handy location for first time tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: teamom01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance in June at the end of a trip down the PCH. Maybe we were just ready to go home, but we didn't really care for this hotel. Traffic was TERRIBLE getting to the hotel. We pulled into the driveway and once my husband told the valet he would self-park we were ignored. No one even offered to help me get luggage out of the trunk. The room was nice and had a great view, but every time we had an interaction with staff we got the feeling we were bothering them. It took 3 calls to get extra pillows brought up to our room. The hotel is connected to a large mall which is convenient, although we only ate there and didn't shop. The area was pretty disappointing. Overall, the hotel is modern looking and has a cool feel, but the staff were not at all welcoming or helpful. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mole
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Renaissance at the beginning of June. We had booked via their website for $199 per night and decided to pay $30 extra per night to upgrade to the Club Level. We arrived at the hotel at 9am after a 14 hour flight. Check in was very easy and quick and fortunately we were able to go to our room immediately.The young lady at the counter was extremely well mannered and helpful. We were allocated a room on the 18th floor which unfortunately didnt have much of a view. However, the room was well maintained and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was average and on the small side but the bath amenties (soap, gel etc) were very good. A coffee maker was in the room which was supplied daily with coffee bags. The Club Lounge was ok, but personally do not feel it is worth the $30 per day (we are used to travelling in Asia where the Club lounges are open 7 days a week and offer amazing choices of food, cocktails, internet etc ect ). Breakfast was continental with some hot choices including Bacon, french toast etc. The staff were very slow to replenish food when it ran out and coffee & tea were only available at certain times of the day. The location is what this hotel is about and it is great. We loved being so close to the Metro station and also used the Dash buses to access the Beverly Centre, The Grove etc. We were also lucky enough to be around for the Oceans 13 premiere and got some great video of Brad Pitt & Matt Damon walking past the crowds. There are some good food outlets in the Hollywood & Highland Centre and we enjoyed the burgers at Johnny Rockets, and the desserts at Beard Papa. Some good shops in the centre including a huge Sephora and a Virgin Megastore. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance and the location was perfect for us. Would we return ? Yes but mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “i will stay no where else!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkabell22
Reviews.Content: I was set up there by RCA during the American Idol Finale and it was amazing. When I first arrived and saw cameras everywhere I was wondering how they were going to keep the fans away! The security were so friendly and we had NOT 1 PROBLEM!!!! The room was beautiful we stayed on the 16th floor and our view of the hollywood sign was amazing! You never need to call a cab because everything is near you. You have the walk of fame, graumans, wax museum, world records museum, all the pick ups for the tours, hollywood and highland and list goes on!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabe31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of June. Very easy to reach from the freeway. We had requested an early check in, but when we arrived at 15.00hrs our room was not ready. They offered to look after our luggage while we had a wander around. Area around feels a bit scruffy, not quite what you think Hollywood would be like. We went through to the Hollywood/Highland complex which is connected to the hotel, plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. Graumans Chinese Theatre is also just outside and luckily for us, it was the premier of Oceans 13, so we waited around and got to see Brad Pitt, George Clooney, Al Pacino, Matt Damon, Angelina Jolie and Andy Garcia. They seem to have lots of premiers there as they had another two nights later, so excellent place to see some stars. Finally checked in around 7.30pm, room had city view, wonderful to look at in the evening. Room was very clean, a bit smaller than we had previously stayed in but had everything we needed. Nice restaurant for buffet breakfast and the children loved the fourth floor swimming pool, although while we were there they did close both the pool and the restaurant for private functions a couple of times. Universal Studios is one stop away on the Metro, which is underneath the Hollywood/Highland complex. Also there is a cinema El Capitan right across the road which only shows one film at a time, several showings a day, we saw Pirates of the Carribean and downstairs they have the props and costumes to go & look at afterwards. It's a bit pricey but worth a visit. We took a star house tour with Starline, good fun, get to seem some interesting sites and homes. Visited Santa Monica pier and beach which is only eight miles away, unfortunately we got caught in rush hour coming back & took two hours to drive to 8 mile return trip, so beware of travel times. Overall we had a great stay and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: Senor_Schmutzig
Reviews.Content: We're in the midst of a six night stay at the Renaissance Hollywood and couldn't be happier. Originally, we had reservations for three nights here and 3 nights at another location but after the first night, we decided that the location of this hotel couldn't be beat. As mentioned by previous posters, the hotel connects to the Kodak Theater and Grauman's Chinese Theaters as well as the Hollywood and Highland shopping/entertainment complex. Considering the length of our stay, having the convenience of a Starbucks and multiple other restaurants allows for us to make quick restaurant runs after long days "out and about". We got two joined rooms on the 14th floor with a view of the Hollywood sign and downtown L.A. Our 3-year old son liked looking out of the windows and seeing the variety of characters (literally) making their way over to Hollywood Boulevard. Apparently they park in the parking lot across the street and walk the two blocks to "work". We saw Spiderman, Charlie Chaplin, Elmo and a few others make their way over to entertain the crowds in front of Grauman's Chinese Theater. The service has been excellent and responsive. We called for more wash clothes and towels on two occasions and within 10 minutes, there was a knock on the door with delivery. The pool is heated and also has a nice view of the Hollywood sign. They are currently increasing the size of their spa and part of the pool deck is blocked off, but this didn't hinder things in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay... but iffy Concierge”
Reviews.Author: atllocal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a night at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel - overall a great experience. Good location and not far off the 101. I did find the Concierge here to be... uh... a bit of a novice. I asked for some recommendations for nearby sushi or fushion food - he rattled off 2 places and then sighed... I then chose one and he then said... okay. I then asked if the place requires a reservation and he said yes. I had to then ask him if he could make one for me. He then called the restaurant. Then I had to also ask him for directions. It was as if he had no idea what a concierge is supposed to do. Oh well - I lived. Just don't expect the best ideas/service from the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; wonderful for 2nd time and getting better!”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the 3 day Memorial Day weekend; we had last stayed there in November. The place is getting better. They are putting in a new spa; the service is very good; and the pricing we received for a king size executive suite was an excellent price. We had a great view of Yamshiro (looked like we were in Japan) and also of the Hollywood sign; the combo made Hollywood so wonderful. We continue to be very happy with the excellent location of the hotel; great for visitors who have only a couple of days to see all the sights in Hollywood. We enjoyed being able to walk out to Hollywood and Highland Mall; taking the shuttle ($) to Griffith Observatory; the short walk to the Graumanns Manns Chinese Theater. Its easy to see the Walk of Fame and perfect to go to an event at Kodak Theater (note: if Hollywood Bowl is happening, good location for that too.). We were happy to find it a short drive to Melrose Avenue where there are several wonderful restaurants. The baths are larger size compared to other LA hotels; the room was quite large and very comfortable. The executive king we stayed in came with 2 large very comfortable king size beds - this place would be wonderful for a family stay. All in all, Renaissance continues to be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a change!”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Sue
Reviews.Content: We previously stayed at this hotel when it was the Holiday Inn 10 years ago - and when they say it has been revamped they aren't kidding! It is barely recognisable (a good thing!).. Very modern, very spacious, just a really good feel to it. The staff were very helpful too - our guy who brought up the bags insisted on getting us ice as we were a bit jet lagged & I'd lost my voice. (small things make a big difference). Hollywood itself is still what it is - quite tacky, but if you go there to see the sights, you know what to expect. We wanted a base to drive around & do the tacky star homes tours - this was perfect for that (you literally walk out of the lifts into the back of the Hollywood & Highland shopping centre beside the Kodak theatre into Manns Chinese theatre without even going on the street - to pick up the tours etc. A hint- I received an email the week I was to check in from the hotel asking if I had any special requests - I asked for early check-in and a refridgerator (very uncommon in U.S hotels).. The fridge was great. We got take out both nights, some wine & drinks etc.. No need to touch the super expensive drinks fridge already in the room! The only negative is the price of the valet parking - it was about $30 for 24 hrs.. you can pay about $13 for 24hrs to self park in the same carpark - but if you leave, you pay on re-entry, so if you're doing a bit of touristing and driving around - the valet is the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Ikea anyone?”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: I love the renaissance parc55 in San Francisco, so I anxiously booked get away weekend in LA. We reserved the largest suite and traveled 30 miles North to the high rated Renaissance Hollywood hotel. What a bust. The lobby was gorgeous, check in was seamless but when we walked in the room...we were disgusted. 2 positive things...the view of the hollywood hills was goregous and the room was huge. But it stops there. The bed was so old, that when my husband sat down next to me, i rolled into him. The bedding was very 80's, the sofa and chairs were Ikea quality. It was bizzare. There was tons of floor space but the design was so poorly laid out and full of wasted space. We turned on the cheesy tube tv ...took one look at each other and walked out. They courtously refunded our money with no charge and we drove back to the OC and saved our money for our next trip to the Signature Hotel at MGM in Vegas. Now that's a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “True 4-star service, rooms, and facilites”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is exactly what you'd expect from a Marriott-managed 4-star property -- comfortable rooms, friendly service and good facilities. Rooms are totally functional -- very comfortable beds, nominal internet charge ($9.95), a mini-bar (careful of the automated charges), floor to ceiling windows, good TV channel choices, etc. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping are exceptionally friendly and eager to please. The fitness center is clean, bright and well-equipped. The mall next door is easily accessed direct from the hotel's 3rd floor and offers a great choice of restaurants and shopping. If you want to be in the heart of Hollywood, it would be hard to beat this hotel for choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent notel”
Reviews.Author: sureLondon
Reviews.Content: It was really hard choosing a place in LA since it is so spread out and I had limited time. This hotel was amazing and I will go back on a next visit. The decor is modern and new. Rooms are excellent, airy, bright and clean. I had full views of the Hollwood sign. The staff are very friendly. The bar and the Twist resturant are excellent. Location amazing. Can spend hours at the Kodak theatre/Graumman theatre antics on the street. The shopping centre attached has great food. Johhny rocks there has the best burgers ever. Also, the tour buses leave from the Chinese theatre- very convenient. Must do the Star homes/city/universal studio combo tour for $100- worth every cent. The only annoying part of the trip was the awful low life taxi drivers that were always a problem to deal with. If in LA- this is one of the best hotels to stay if you have a short time and want to see the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Renaissance.”
Reviews.Author: JD17
Reviews.Content: This is definetly one of the nicer, cleaner, and more happening hotels/areas in Hollywood. To begin, the Renaissance is definetly a great place to stay as it is situated within walking distance to all the Hollywood sites such as the Kodak Theater, Grauman's Chinese Theater, Walk-of-Fame, etc. The hotel is connected to the these sites as it is a part of the "Hollywood & Highland Complex". Shopping and Dining are also available within the complex. Compared to other areas of Hollywood (very close to the Renaissance) it is one of the nicer and cleaner areas. The neighbouring streets can be a little scary to walk through at night, I was with a group of guys and it was still a little intimidating. The complex itself was very safe, and had security on duty 24/7. The hotel room was a good size and came with 2 queen beds, which were amazing to sleep on. Ask for a room on a high floor for a view of the city and the Hollywood Sign. The staff were very friendly and courteous as well. The Renaissance is pretty centrally loacted within L.A. and is within a 20 mintue drive to all of the sites. The Beverly Shopping center, a major mall, is about a 15 drive from the hotel, and Rodeo Drive, which I highly recomend a visit to, is about 20 minutes from the Renaissance. If you decide to do a holiday in L.A. definetly visit Santa Monica Beach/Mailbu/Laguna/and Beverley Hills. I would also highly recomend a car rental to take you to these areas as the taxis are expensive. You can do self-underground parking for $10 a day. Before I end the review, I would HIGHLY recomend a drive up the coast of California. Our group decided to fly into LAX and fly out of San Fransisco (about 10 hours driving distance from each other) but the drive was WORTH IT!!! Amazing views of the mountains and ocean. Absolutley beautiful. IT IS A MUST! Overall, if I ever returned to L.A., I would be happy to stay at the Renaissance again. The location, quality, and staff are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSF.IN.UK
Reviews.Content: To start with, the hotel didnâ€™t have the 3-day romance package reservation for my wife and I. We were on honeymoon. We had booked online with Expedia.com and had no problem with the other 3 hotels, flights to and from USA and the car rental sections of the itinerary. Having given a copy of our booking reference to the front desk we were allowed to check in and went straight to the pool. It was horrible â€“ towels, half empty drink glasses and food left everywhere â€“ no one was maintaining the pool area. I asked for a pina colada at the poll bar and the barman just laughed and said he could not make one â€“ didnâ€™t know how. He also had to write out a check for me to sign so I could charge the drinks to the room. There was no noticeable hotel security, no room key needed to get to the pool and most of the people by the pool seemed to live locally and were not hotel guests. The next day we returned to our room at 6pm and it had not been serviced. I called housekeeping. When we returned to our room the bathroom was not cleaned, coffee not replaced and a heap of old sheets had been left in the room. An hour later there was a bang on the door and a voice yelling â€œWhat time are you leaving!â€� I explained that we were booked in for 3 days. Later that evening we had a drink in the hotel lobby bar which closed at 11pm, even though there were many hotel guests still drinking. The following day being a Monday, major construction work around the pool level re-started early morning â€“ the loud drilling noise made it impossible to sit by the pool. On checking out, the cost of breakfast (which at best was average) had been added to our account each day in error â€“ itâ€™s an inclusive deal as part of the romance package. Isnâ€™t it strange how errors on the hotel account are always in the hotels favour? Overall the only advantage of this hotel is the location which is ideal for the Kodak and Graumanâ€™s theaters and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. If you stay at this hotel, I hope you have a more enjoyable stay than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, v. easy access of US 101”
Reviews.Author: draig_cymru
Reviews.Content: The Rennaisance was an excellent hotel for the price. The room (a twin double) was large, and easily accommodated four of us. The decor was fairly stylish and the windows were floor to ceiling and we were lucky enough to get a 17th floor room from which we could see the Hollywood sign, Capitol records tower and the L.A business district skyline. A selling point for us was the fact that as Brits we were driving on the "wrong" side of the road and didn't want to do too much driving in the hustle and bustle of L.A. This hotel was 1/4 mile off US 101 (which were travelling on from the North) and was really easy to access. Valet parking was reasonable, worked out as Â£15 per night - but where else are you going to park?! Great shopping centre attached to the hotel, and the Manns Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre make up part of the complex. The area itself isn't as glamorous as you'd imagine (considering it's where the Oscars are held) but it's just one of the places you must see if you're on a driving holiday of the Western USA. Be sure to check out the small eatery/deli in the Highland shopping centre owned by Ken Davitian (Azamat Bagatov in Borat). We got a taxi from the Renaissance to Universal Studios - BE AWARE- the taxis (not affiliated with the hotel) that park up outside the lobby are expensive: were charged $30 (inc tip) to go the 3 or 4 miles to Universal. We got a far more honest taxi driver on the way back which was $16.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but not quite my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: ladycascadia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from April 18 through April 21. It was a "working vacation" as I was attending a songwriters conference. Yes, indeed the Renaissance is "hip" happening and abounds in just amazing modern art everywhere! The lobby bar is pretty nifty, and they have complimentary lemon water that was very refreshing on a hot day. My room overlooked the pool and shops of the nearby shopping complex. The lucky ones get a view of the Hollywood sign. The guest rooms have an brightly colored "Austin Powers-esque" decor scheme that while some may find exciting, I found it somewhat gaudy...but then I prefer my hotels on the "homier/cozy" side...and to me "mod" is simply not cozy. Because there are so many people around, I found the hotel to be somewhat noisy at times. The hotel's strength? Customer service. The staff was ready, willing and able to answer even the dumbest questions with friendliness and professionalness. I found the staff people very helpful...and despite the fact there were well known celebrity guests present, they treated everyone as a VIP. Now what I wasn't prepared for was that they add a $50 incidentals fee when they freeze your card, so plan ahead. It is removed from the bill if you don't use any incidentals, though...but still...a person ought to be warned when they book a room of that extra amount. The hotel's weakness? Housekeeping was not as meticulous as I thought it would be for a hotel of its caliber. At any given time there would be room service plates on the floors and I thought that was tacky looking for a hotel of this calibre. I had to call housekeeping to do my room on the 3rd day because they skipped it almost two days in a row and I had NOT put up any do not disturb signs, so i don't know why my room was ignored. While the hotel does have provisions for families, it is my opinion that this hotel is set up primarily for business travelers and those 20-something tourists or aspiring entertainers who want to experience the Hollywood "scene." The only reason I would return here again would be because it is geographically convenient and in a reasonably safe neighborhood compared to other parts of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller7
Reviews.Content: Visited Hollywood for a 2 night stay in April. Upon arrival, checking in was flawless and fast. I had a great room (room number 2019) on the top (20th) floor, with a view of the Hollywood sign (as requested). The location is unparalleled for tourists - the Hollywood Walk of Fame is practically right outside. There is a metro station in the shopping complex next door, perfect for exploring downtown. The staff were mostly very friendly and helpful. One minor complaint was that staff in Twist weren't very attentive, but tthe breakfast was delicious (and lots of it) - the eggs benedict with smoked salmon comes recommended. In my opinion, the area was fine (not as seedy as some previous reviewers made out) - certainly no problem to go wandering around after dark, alone, on a Saturday night. For an experience that is different and fun, try a walking tour, given by Red Line tours. They really do great schtick and you learn so much about the history of the area. And you don't have to walk too far!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hollywood hotel”
Reviews.Author: moondust7
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is an excellent place to stay. I was there for 4 nights last week. It is not a sparkling new hotel, but is very clean & comfortable and the art-deco touches are nice. The service was top notch. My only real gripe would be the price of valet parking ($29) - don't do it! Just park in the parking garage attached to the hotel - it's only $10. That's where the valets take your car anyways. The Hollywood & Highland complex at the hotel was great to walk around - it was nice to be so close to places to eat and shop. And it's great that it's an outdoor complex b/c you can walk around and enjoy the weather. Even more fun is the fact that you are right outside the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The best "feature" of the hotel for me though was all of the history associated with it - I have a couple friends who live in LA who filled me in on several events throughout the year that take place there (events for the Oscars, Grammy's etc.). I had room service for breakfast 2 mornings - the lemon souffle pancakes and the cinnamon roll french toast were tastey. The prices were what you would usually pay for room service - about $15 total. There is a French crepe eatery in the Highland complex that my friends and I went to the other 2 mornings, and that was great. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel. It's expensive, but any nice hotel in LA is going to be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeJCartwright
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hollywood Hotel 14 t0 17 February A large hotel in central Hollywood. There is only one restaurant but the hotel is close to the Hollywood and Highland complex with a choice of restaurants Italian, American, Japanese and sort of French. Large well equipped bedrooms. Twin room means two double beds. Staff were friendly and helpful. The situation is walking distance to tacky, tourist Hollywood Bvd. Taxis are required for down town and the business district. Must see Getty Centre and the Grove shopping road. A limo tour of Beverley Hills, Bbelaire and Rodeo Drive starts from Hollywood Bvd. Tip choose a floor above the tenth floor for great views. Hotel breakfast buffet was good value and American.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robjoy
Reviews.Content: We travelled to L A by Greyhound bus from Las Vegas,and stayed at the Renaissance in Hollywood.The room was not ready when we arrived at 4.30pm and were told it would be at least 2 hours before one would be ready.So we went for a walk round and a bite to eat before returning and being presented with our room key.The room was very nice with all the usual facillities and very clean too.It was also nice and quiet too.The hotel staff were nice and friendly and the concierge was particularly helpful.The location is superb with all the famous sites on the doorstep.There are a lot of street performers out on Hollywood Blvd always out to make a few dollars from the tourists and also a lot of homeless people begging but they dont cause you any trouble.There are some excellent tours to choose from,but make sure you do one of the tours of the movie stars homes,its very good.When you come out of the hotel front door and turn right there is an excellent little chinese restaurant just down on the left.Not quick service,and be prepared for a wait if its busy but the food is superb and very reasonable in price.We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, crummy area”
Reviews.Author: KIDSMOM95
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from March 9-12, 2007. It is a very nice hotel, although I found the whole "Hollywood and Highland" complex a bit confusing. I was impressed with the "virtual concierge" email I got prior to our arrival. We were able to order extra feather pillows, extra towels and a mini fridge in advance, at no extra cost. The actual front desk staff were a tad less helpful, although a quick call to the night manager proved very effective and he was very helpful. We all found the rooftop pool very nice, especially the cabanas! We did not try the restaurant, but the adjascent shopping and dining complex had lots of options, although most are high-end. The funniest thing we saw was that there is a small restaurant that specializes in French Dip sandwiches, (I think it's called The Dip) and it is owned by the guy who played Borat's manager in the movie...anyhow there is a very funny autographed poster of Borat in the front window. Beware, the Valet parking is $30 a day but you can self park for $10. The surrounding area is still pretty seedy but there are lots of tourist attractions like the wax museum, the Chinese theatre.
