If you are into "Old Hollywood" then this is a good place to stay. My kids, however, found all that stuff a little boring. Next time I would probably stay in West Hollywood or Beverly Hills or Santa Monica, but everyone should see this place at least once. Another bit of trivia about this hotel is that it is where the stars stay for the Oscars, they close off the whole city block for two weeks during Oscar time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, rooms, views and location (even for pedestrians!)”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicer Renaissance city hotels - located in the middle of the Hollywood action and conveniently built atop the Hollywood and Highland mall, with many dining and shopping options. We had a room at the front of the hotel with floor to ceiling windows views of the Hollywood hills (and sign), Capitol records tower and downtown LA. The decoration of the property and rooms have a certain Hollywood retro style which I found nice. Room was very clean and spacious. On the disappointing side the beds weren't the Revive type (but still OK) and the executive lounge had uninspiring breakfast and hors d'oeuvres and no free internet access. If you are visiting LA and are not renting a car this is a great place to stay as the Metro runs just under the hotel. If you are renting a car (which I cannot recommend enough) you can selfpark in the Hollywood and Highland mall for only $10 a day (no in/out). Do make sure you drop off your luggage first in front of the hotel though as it is a bit of a trek from the parking to the front desk. This hotel is in a convenient location for tourists. First time visitors will have the Hollywood attractions at their doorstep and could use the hotel as a base for the other LA attractions as you're only a 20 minute drive from Pasadena, downtown LA and the Getty. Universal Studios are only a 5 minute drive away. In summer the Hollywood bowl is only a mile away. Overall I'd recommend this hotel especially if you're doing a lot of exploring in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AlexNyNy
Reviews.Content: This is a great vacation location with the nicest staff I have encountered in years of staying at Marriott hotels. The staff actually enjoys being helpful and has a policy called "Delighted" to serve you where they respond with friendly good attitude service to all requests (valet parking, room service and front desk included). The in room food was a cut above regular fare. They have a signature dish for breakfast - lemon souffle pancakes with raspberries and pine nuts - that is truly special. As far as the location is concerned - it is less than one block from the Walk of Fame and the Kodak Theatre. Be wary of the night crowd on this famed walk, however, we found it to be chock full of prowling aggressive characters who really will mug you if you let your guard down - one woman wanted to get my purse - and she looked wholesome and clean enough at first sight but was way too interested in my bag. Be alert and maybe skip the after dark action at Hollywood and Vine.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: orp
Reviews.Content: The hotel features the "normal" smooth service and super clean and well kept properties of Rennaissance / Marriott. This hotel is a little bit more local in design than most chain hotels, with an emphasis on local designers like Eames and nice touches so you dont forget that you are in Hollywood. What really set this property apart is the location within the Hollywood and Highland compleks. Everything you need in Hollywood is right in front of the hotel, the open Highland mall, kodak theatre, Manns chinese, loads of restaurants, freaky activities all around you, movie look alikes and the Hollywood sign, in short everything that is Hollywood. Stayed here for one night, but the next time I am in LA I will stay here again due to location.......the rest of LA is within easy reach by car or the Metro right under the hotel, YES...the Metro in LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchmavel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference for 3 days. Ask for a room on a high floor, the views are outstanding. The pool is located on the 5th level and has a view as well. Service was excellent. All around it was a great experience. Pros: - Great for business travel, celebrities, and even for a family vacation - Attentive and excellent service - Outstanding views (not all rooms apply, you need to ask) - Connected to the Highland Mall and the Kodak Theater Cons: - The surrounding area is limited for recreation options, but okay if you have a car - Extras can be expensive (Internet, room service, etc., so not for the budget traveller)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - suitable for vacationers and business travelers alike. The hotel is located in the heart of Hollywood - connected to a large mall which contains the Kodak theater where the Oscar awards are held each year. It's also steps away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Hotel has a modern feel, with a lrage lounge area in the lobby. Rooms are well appointed with modern decor and nice bathrooms. I must say the hotel did feel a bit soul-less. If charater is what you want, it feels very chain and you'd probably be better off in a more classic Hollywood hotel like the Roosevelt or the Chateau Marmont, but they have nice rooms, good service and fairly reasonable prices, so all in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but surrounding area disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood from Dec. 1-5. The hotel is a long way from LAX and will run you around a $50 taxi fare. Check in was quick and efficient. Was assigned room 623 which was much smaller than the pictures on the property web site, but still very nice and clean. View was of the Hollywood hills with some of the interesting homes perched on the cliffs. Also in view was the back alley with various homeless rummaging through dumpsters, drug deals going down, and ladies of the night parading back and forth. Ordered room service several times and while service was quick, the quality was lacking. One evening ordered a filet from their upscale Twist room service menu and what was delivered turned out to be what I would call two small "minute steaks," definitely not a filet. The near area around the hotel certainly doesn't live up the the glamor image of Hollywood that is often portrayed. The attached mall is strangely designed and difficult to find your way around in. The area in front of the Chinese theatre is jammed with tourists and people hawking tours. Walk outside this area in any direction and you will encounter boarded up shops, cracked sidewalks, cheap souvenier stands, and numerous homeless folks. Of course, this is not the hotel's fault, but rhe area definitely detracts from the otherwise fine features of this hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Style at its Finest - Excellent Location, Service & View”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is one of the hotest hotels in LA and captures Hollywood style at its finest. The hotel is right in the center of the Hollywood and Highland Complex. If you want to see Hollywood, this is THE place to stay. Indeed, it is the hotel where stars stay before and after the Oscars, movie premiers and the like. Indeed, we learned that the Governor's Ball for the Oscars is held at the Renaissance. OK, so on to our review. We checked in late after being caught in traffic and were able to have the car valeted very easyily and were warmly greeted at the desk. The lobby is a popular spot where the everyone feels comfortable and you might see a star or three. The desk clerk was genuinely welcoming and made us feel at ease and relaxed after our long commute. Our room (on the 19th floor) had a commanding view of LA and out to the Pacific. We could also see the roof of the Kodak Theater (reccomend the tour) and Grahmann's (highly recommend the tour), the Disney Store (also recommend). The room was modern and very comfortable. There are plenty of dining options in the area, and we really enjoyed Mel's Dinner (right down highland). If you are not familiar with the institution, it was featured in American Grafitti and many other movies. Good food, good service and the like. The rest of our stay at the Renaissance was wonderful and it was a great place to come back from sightseeing of just to hang out. I stay at dozens of hotels every year and this one is one of the best run that I have seen in a while. Rooms are hard to come by at this property for good reason. We had the chance to stay at the Four Seasons Beverly Hills are are glad that we stayed here. If you want to experience LA and Hollywood, you must stay at the the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little overrated, a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance may be the best option in Hollywood, because of its good location, but it isn't really a luxury hotel, just a pretty good Marriott. On the late Saturday afternoon when we checked in, there were lots of leftover room service trays in the hallway, and when we opened the door to our room, we smelled old, stinky, stale air. I went to the windows to throw them open for fresh air, but the windows don't open. We stayed in an executive room and spent about $300 for the room. It was a spacious room with a good sized bathroom, much bigger than the regular room we looked at. The room was pretty clean, but for a newer hotel, it showed some wear, especially the carpet. I don't want to be overly critical, because it's in a great location, lot of places within walking distance and close to the subway, and it is fine, it's just that the tripadvisor reviews make it sound so wonderful when really it's an average, fairly comfortable 31/2 star hotel, and for $300 a night, it should be at least that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Caro_Z
Reviews.Content: We went to Renaissance for a business trip. Great service, great view - we actually had a room on the 19th floor. The Club Level VIP lounge was perfection - enjoying some wine and cheese while looking at the hollywood homes was quite an experience. The hotel was well decorated, we loved the contemporary pieces throughout the lobby. The bedroom was great, the radio was turned on when we arrived, we felt like dancing while enjoying the view for the first time. Location, location, location - great shops, cute restaurants, a lot of extravagant people. Could we have asked for more ? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as the first part of a "road trip" around southern California last September. The drive from LAX to the hotel was interesting to say the least. It was my first time in LA (although not the States) and I couldnâ€™t get over the time it takes to get anywhere by car. The hotel is in one of the best locations in LA if you want to be based around Hollywood. The hotel is part of a huge complex, which includes a shopping mall and restaurants and opens right out onto the Hollywood Boulevard. One exit actually takes you down onto the Chinese Theatre forecourt where youâ€™ll find sight seeing trips and film stars handprints in concrete. There are also countless impersonators hoping for you to have your picture taken with them for a few bucks. One evening we listened to a Nirvana tribute band playing on the boulevard. Whoever they were they kept us entertained for half an hour with a good rendition of Seattleâ€™s finest. All this is within 5 minutes walk from the hotel reception. The hotel itself is nothing special but it is a nice modern well-run hotel with comfortable rooms and a great pool area. The only criticism I would make is that the internal design seems a little bland, especially in the lobby bar area. But hey itâ€™s no big deal. The hotel is also about 5 minutes drive from one of the freeways, which means itâ€™s easy to get out to the sights of LA even if it takes a while to get there. We had a room looking out the side of the Hotel directly onto the hills and the Hollywood sign â€“ fabulous! PS â€“ If you want reasonably priced food you canâ€™t do better than the Hollywood Grill in the Mall attached to the Hotel â€“ try the meatloaf.

Reviews.Title: “re views!”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: The views from high floors at this hotel make up for its rather high price!The bedrooms are airy, roomy and beautifully decorated. The beds are comfortable and bathrooms have plenty of very pleasant smelling bath products etc. The concierge was very helpful with our excursions to Universal Studios and the tour to see the stars' homes The reception staff were friendly and efficient. Thought the car parking was too expensive and did not like the lay -out of the car park, but at least there were plenty of spaces. This is a very busy area and if you have a car the roads are jammed especially if you need a left turn along the Walk of Fame. There is plenty to do where the hotel is situated , however. We were lucky to have two rooms, one on either side of the hotel so saw both views. Always try to get a high room., the elevators are good.

Reviews.Title: “Hoped for best and got it!”
Reviews.Author: norfolk3
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel for our all-important family holiday after spending many hours on this website. What a pay-back! after six days of touring LA and area, seeing and thinking about other locations, we were convinced we couldn't have done better. We toured everyday in the car, except for the one stop subway trip to Universal which was a bonus of staying here. It was always a pleasure to come back to the hotel. which was fresh and new and welcoming. So handy to walk just outside the door, restaurants, entertainment and all that Hollywood offered in a safe and clean setting around the Hollywood/highland Centre. Since this was important to us, should mention the the centre itself is quite up-market as far as the shops are concerned. We ate on a budget at Johnny Rockets which was fun another night had an excellent treat at the Steak House which wasn't too bad at 120 dollars for three with wine. We saw two premieres being set up and a new star being placed on the walk of fame Can't imagine you'd get anything like this outside another hotel. Our room was huge and modern, had an unbelievable view. Bathroom well designed and spotless. Parking was easy at 10usd a day. We used the Club room(extra 30 dollars a day for 3of us) which, as has been said before, was convenient and just worth it. (especiially as we stocked up and small sodas to take out for the day trips!! Only used pool once and we were the only ones in it, but it was lovely. We consider ourselves lucky to have made this choice for a perfect base to tour LA

Reviews.Title: “pricey perfection”
Reviews.Author: skinnedknee
Reviews.Content: ...if you're looking for a hotel that is clean, modern, classy and right in the heart of hollywood, this is your place. It is expensive, but the location is wonderful (the corner of Highland and Hollywood Blvd), the views are all nice (you can choose from the adjoining shopping complex, the hollywood hills or the city view of hollywood.) The rooms were clean, modern and had a few nice extras...like a lighted make-up mirror and a rolling table that made it so you could have breakfast anywhere! we were on the 15th floor above Highland Ave, and although it was the Saturday before halloween (BUSY party/traffic night), the room was quiet. Check-in is 4pm, checkout is 11am, so plan your stay accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon_Ultra
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i've ever stayed in. The overall experience was fantastic. Checkin was fast and friendly. The staff were polite and helpful. It has a nice pool & gym and the room i stayed in was fantastic too. It really is in a superb location with fabolous things to do outside your front door. You can go to the Cinema, Watch a Show, View a T.V show, Dine, Dance and much more all on your front door. It even has a metro stop as part of the complex to make getting around easier. The key to this hotel is Location, however it has the complete package in my opinion. If i ever get the chance to go back i definitely will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hairloos30
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent if you want to look round Hollywood and this has to one of the main features of the hotel. Check in was fine - a little business like but then it is full of business people/conference facilities. Not sure what people expect from a check in but after a 10 hour flight you just want efficiency. Room was nice - we were on the club level which was nice - had a good view of the Hollywood sign but to be honest as soon as you walk out of the hotel you can see that. The room was clean and had everything we needed/wanted (no turn down though). As for the club level - you get breakfast which was ok and hot snacks in the evening. As far as I was aware there was no alcohol available and if it was then it was not obvious. Fruit and cold drinks available throughout the day. I would say it is worth it - just but only just. Gripes of our stay:- I had asked for a fridge in our room and also a bottle of champagne to be delivered after we arrived (I received an e-mail before we arrived asking if we wanted anything upon arrival). After 2 hours neither had arrived so I called and was told that I had to request them when I checked in as they wouldn't know when I would arrive (except at the point that I checked in surely!!!!!!!!!!!!) Rubbish answer to a simple request. I called the bell boy to help with luggage but there was no reply but by the time we got to the ground floor and fell out of the lift weighed down with 6 bags we were asked if we wanted any help. That would be the help for the remaining 10 yards that didn't answer the phone and also wasn't around as I walked from my room to the lift and down. Bar was nice in the eveningbut didn't try the restaurant, gym small but well equiped and swimming pool is clean and with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with some services and staff”
Reviews.Author: hertfordshiremember
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for six nights in late September. Sady, our experience is different to that reported by some others. We were rather disappointed with the standard of some of its services and staff who seemed poorly trained and/or supervised, over-stretched or plainly inefficient. It has a good location. Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame etc are all only a few hundred yards from the Hotel. There is also a Metro Train Station and several Metro Bus stops behind the Hotel. (A 'Metro Pass' for one day costs only three Dollars and allows unlimited travel by Metro Trains and Buses. We went by Metro Bus to Santa Monica and the Getty Museum; we went by Metro Train to Long Beach to visit the Queen Mary). The guest bed-rooms and the public areas of the Hotel are spacious and comfortable. Our room had clearly been very recently refurbished; it had grand views of the Hollywood Hills and Sign. The Venetian blinds were easy enough to pull up but tricky to let down fully. The room safe was also difficult to open and we decided not to use it. As the first room we were given had not been properly cleaned (there were nail clippings on the carpet and the safe was broken) we were given another room. Reaching for a towel after a shower, I discovered that the neatly folded towel on the rail was in fact soiled and had what looked like blood stains. That was disgusting. When I complained, we were sent a new set of towels. We were also sent a bottle of Champagne, compliments of the Management, which we politely declined. (Incidentally, the Champagne was brought into our room by a swaggering waiter who addressed my wife as 'my love' and seemed taken aback when we declined the gift; in case we had misunderstood, he said it was free !) Having settled our account prior to checking out, we noticed that we had been charged substantially more than the actual amount for laundry services. As we had the two original invoices in the room, we produced them to the dour woman at the Front Desk who examined them and said she would amend the charge she made earlier, but offered no apology. On the two occasions we had a look inside the Hotel's Restaurant ('Twisters') we did not notice any diners there but only the staff; its somewhat restricted menu choices may have been a little discouraging. We too decided to have our meals elsewhere. There are plenty of well patronised eateries nearby. This was in fact the last of several Hotels (in California and Las Vegas) we stayed at during this trip and we had no complaints regarding the accommodation or services at any one of those other Hotels. After allowing for the fact that the Renaissance has a rating of Four (not Five) Stars, we are still of the view that the incidents regarding the soiled towel, unclean carpet and (attempted ?) overcharging are unacceptable whatever the Hotel's rating.

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for nice and convenient...”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in September 2006. We arrived late in the evening and no one offered any assistance with luggages. Check-in service was slow as they only had two person at the front desk dealing with all sorts of inquiries. Room is nice and spacious with all the amenities that one would expect from a good hotel. Booked a weekend package that came with breakfast which was excellent. The location was convenient - near the Mann's Chinese Theater and Kodak Theater complex - with lots of shops, restaurants, etc. as well as metro stop. Overall, it is a good and nice hotel but I expect that given the price.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but great location”
Reviews.Author: 808traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Hollywood, the only other "major" hotel is the Hotel Roosevelt. Having read bad reviews of that hotel, I decided to stay at the Renaisssance Hollywood. First off, if you absolutely have to stay in Hollywood, this is the best location. It is connected to a shopping center with places to eat and shop and is right off of Hollywood Blvd. making a trip to the Kodak Theater, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and Grauman's Chinese theater a quick walk. All included, I paid almost $1000 for a three night stay. On top of that, expect to pay either $24 for valet parking, or $10 parking in the adjoining parking structure with NO in and out passes. Everytime you leave the parking structure, expect to pay $10. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked flawless and we had a pretty nice view of LA from our 12th floor room. For the price, I would suggest staying somewhere else and driving to Hollywood to see the attractions (there are very few things to see and do in Hollywood itself).

Reviews.Title: “No Car? Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for those without a car. Ideally situated in the heart of Hollywood and attached to the lively Hollywood and Highlands shopping centre and just 2 minutes walk from the Metro. We had a very large room with 2 king beds overlooking the city and the Hollywood sign (you can hardly see either as the're in the distance, but nevertheless, the view was great). The beds were fantastic and so comfortable. The bathroom was small, but nicely done and adequate. The decor in the rooms was lovely and really different and to have large chunky wooden blinds instead of curtains was another nice touch. Very nice pool area, which was never busy. The gym looked good as well, although that's not exactly my thing! Had no real contact with the staff, except when we checked in and out and both times they were very helpful and polite. There is a restaurant, but there are so many nice eating places in the shopping centre next door, we never even looked in. Hollywood was great and the 3 nights we had there from 1st to 4th September was the perfect amount of time. Go on one of the Starline Tours of the houses of the rich and famous - I never fancied it, but was really glad my other half talked me into it, as it was definitely worth it. Universal, which is only one metro stop away, is definitely worth a day at, but I suppose it depends on what floats your boat. All in all, I would definitely recommend this great hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spot!”
Reviews.Author: NJMotherof2
Reviews.Content: You want to see Hollywood, this is the hotel to be in. Everything is at your finger tips! Shopping, attractions, Universal Studios and much more. Our room was huge, Executive room..with 2 kids it was great to have the extra space. The view of the Hollywood sign was a blast...

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: SouthOCtraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had tickets to the Foo Fighters concert at The Pantages, so we decided to stay at a nearby hotel so we wouldn't have to drive home to Orange County. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose The Renaissance. (We paid $300 for a Thursday night.) Everything about the hotel lived up to its reputation. The valets were extremely friendly and helpful. Check-in was no problem--they had a room available for us an hour before check-in time (4:00 p.m.) and the check-in guy was perfectly friendly and helpful. The room was nothing spectacular, but it looked exactly like the photos on the website and was perfectly clean. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel with a very nice view of the Hollywood Hills and The Magic Castle. My boyfriend and I both travel extensively all over the world for business and pleasure and this was the first time either of us had seen a toothbrush holder in a hotel! The pool area is great; it's on the fifth floor and has a great view of the city. There are plenty of lounge chairs and several private cabanas. I would say the only negative thing was that the pool bar closed at 4:00 p.m. (But the bartender made a great mai tai.) The hotel is located in a small mall that has a lot of restaurants. We had dinner at The Hollywood Grill, which was fantastic. It was pricey but had excellent service and delicious food. We had a caramel brownie ice cream dessert that was insanely good. We had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, Twist, which had very friendly, attentive service and delicious food. We both had the buffet and especially enjoyed the fresh Belgian waffle. The buffet had a pretty good selection of both healthful and decadent foods, and it was a bargain at $18 (including beverages). We're over-the-top finicky and critical about hotels and restaurants, and we had a great experience at The Renaissance and would recommend it to anybody who wants to spend a night or more in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for location and service, 4 stars for room”
Reviews.Author: yogarunner
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at the Hollywood Renaissance after reading tripadvisor. Tips from previous reviews on this website allowed me to get an unbelievable rate using a promo code, and info on 'club level access'. Shortly after I booked online, I received an email from Marriott confirming my reservation and asked for any additional requests. I then requested 2 double beds, a fridge, extra pillows, a room on the highest possible floor with a view of the Hollywood sign, and club level access for an additional $30/night. We arrived on Sunday afternoon at 2pm. Upon arrival, the doormen/valets eagerly helped us with our luggage and led us to the registration desk. The desk informed us that we did get a room on the 19th floor w/ a view of the Hollywood sign, but it would not be ready for another hour. They gladly stored our luggage and gave us information on the shopping complex next door. The Hollywood&Highland complex is pure fun for first time visitors to Hollywood -- Walk of Fame, the El Capitan, street vendors, Batman/Wonder Woman/Capt Jack Sparrow and other characters all at your doorstep -- made our 1 hour wait quite entertaining. While the hotel lobby and public areas are furnished in modern leather furniture which can be found in any department store, I was truly disappointed by the room itself. The brightly upholstered furniture and bed covers screamed cheap 10-year old Ikea and the moveable desk straight out of Staples. Also, while the pictures on the website showed floor-to-ceiling windows, our 19th floor windows were large but only half the height. Also, I didn't like that the lights in the room were very bright and your only option for a 'night light' is to prop the bathroom door open. The bathroom was also quite small. This is not what I would expect for a hotel which normally charges over $250/night (even if I paid much less). However, this is only MY opinion. Our room did have a great view of the Hollywood sign, so I did not complain. My husband and 2 kids didn't mind or notice the furnishings and lighting and found them more than acceptable. The best part of our stay was the club level lounge, which happened to be 2 doors down from our room. My kids and husband found a variety of hors d'oeuvres and drinks served at the lounge shortly after 6pm that evening, and desserts and coffee served until late that night. In the morning, coffee, fresh juices, huge buffet breakfast and several newspapers (LA Times, NY Times, USA Today) were available for us to enjoy while we watched the morning news. Also, bottled water, soda and juices were available for us throughout the day. My kids were in the lounge constantly, and the staff was always friendly and accommodating. It made the hotel feel like home for only an additional $30/night, which is a fantastic deal for a family of 4 with hungry, growing children. You'll never have to wait long for an elevator at this hotel, as they are very fast. The service we experienced during our stay was stellar -- in addition to everything I already asked for, I called for extra robes and toiletries and received them promptly. There was a computer and printer designated for boarding passes at the concierge desk that we could use for no extra charge. The doormen, staff at the concierge, check-in and especially the club lounge were always very friendly and helpful. We got a great deal at this hotel, and it was great introduction to Los Angeles and Hollywood. I highly recommend the Hollywood Renaissance and look forward to staying there again soon -- especially if they decide to refurnish the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if you are staying in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the same spot many years ago when it was the Holiday Inn and returned again for an anniversary trip with my partner. This time the hotel has been rebuilt and is now the Renaissance with the Holiday Inn moving further up the road. As yo may know all hotel rooms in the USA have a copy of the bible. It seems the Marriott chain also carry a management book from their founder. It came as a surprise to me that of the 2000 plus hotels in the Marriott group, they actually only own about 20 or so hotels. They actually run hotels on a long lease. You can be sure that they know how to manage a hotel. The check in was a breeze and there was a genuine welcome. I was given a city view but I requested a view of the Hollywood sign and I got that without a problem. In fact my room also had a city view as well. The downside is that as it was an anniversary trip (and I am also a Marriott reward member) I got no offer of an upgrade or flowers or chocolates for my partner which was disappointing. The room was wonderful, modern and spacious. The bathroom was nice. The only strange thing was locating the safe which is located below the mini bar. The bell boy was very friendly and he not only suggested places to visit, but places to eat for breakfast as well as calling for a complimentary fridge so we could store our own food and drinks. Special mention must also go to the Concierge who was eager to help and assist. We wanted to take a bus to the Beverley Centre, and he downloaded the route and the numbered buses to take. It may not mean much to other people but just think of the amount of time where you are just given a leaflet at other hotels and told to go away. We had buffet breakfast at the hotel on several occasions. The range and quality was excellent. At $18 per head it was expensive. The restaurant service was good and attentive. As the weather was hot we used the pool everyday. I do believe it was heated because it was still warm in the evening. You can have good views of the H&H complex from the pool level and the Hollywood hills. I did think the pool's shape could be better. It could look crowded very easily with just a few people in the pool and I wished it was just had a rectangular shaped. They also needed to make sure that the towels were replenished during the late afternoons. They also had a good gym which was rather busy. The hotel tries to cover a lot of bases which it does very well. Its a family hotel for people on vacation, to a business hotel holding conferences to people having functions such as private parties and weddings. If there were negative points it was the valet parking attendants. Anyone entering the hotel forecourt were being moved on by the parking attendants rather brusquely even if they were just dropping or picking people up. The attendants are franchised to an outside company. If I have a friend picking me up (and remember I am a paying guest of the hotel) I do not one the attendant harassing my friend to move on. Remember we have visited from the UK to meet up with them. By the same token you can go to the H&H complex via the swimming pool level. There are security guards about who prevent shoppers from the complex to enter hotel premises. What I found strange that the security guard stopped me and another guest from walking the grounds just outside the hotel because he claimed it was the property of another restaurant. All we tried to do was take photographs of the view (there is a vantage point at another level but is crowded with tourists visiting the H&H complex) and we showed our key passes as proof that we were guests of the hotel. Its this type of pettiness that the hotel needs to look into and improve. Overall this is the best hotel you can stay at if you want to stay in Hollywood area. Its advantage is that it is part of the H&H complex. There is shopping nearby, food courts, bus stops, the metro station as well as lot of the other Hollywood attractions. There is a lot of hustle and bustle at Hollywood Boulevard and the area has been revitalised since our previous visit many years ago.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 days here on an "in-town getaway". The hotel has a great location connected to the Hollywood and Highland shopping complex that also houses the Kodak Theatre (home of the Oscars) and is adjacent to Grauman's Chinese Theatre. Used the AAA package--a great weekend deal that includes valet parking, discount card to various Hollywood and Highland stores and restaurants, and a voucher for 2 tickets to the Kodak Theatre tour. My needs for the weekend were very simple--I was a native Angeleno who simply wanted to explore this part of our metropolis in more detail for the weekend. As such, I did not need the services of the concierge desk, bell captain or valet, so I cannot attest to the quality of these services. i did not eat in the restaurant or use room service. I can, however, say that check-in was fast, efficient, friendly. I was given a room on the 18th floor with a great view of the pool, H & H complex, Hollywood Blvd., Kodak Theatre. The hotel has 20 floors, with floors 19 and 20 being the Club levels. Room decor was modern, Charles and Ray Eames-influenced. Great movable desk with adjustable chair. One main reason I stayed in this area was because the Los Angeles Times recently called Hollywood the "epicenter of the new hamburger explosion", and I wanted to try the 3 places mentioned for the best gourmet burgers in town. All 3 places make a similar type of burger: brioche bun, arugula, 2 kinds of cheeses (usually a blue and a swiss), caramelized onions, garlic aioli, bacon. The meat may be Kobe. My personal rankings are: 1) Lucky Devils "Lucky's Favorite" 2) The Hungry Cat "Pug" burger 3) 25 Degrees (in the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel) Burger #1. Horrible service at 25 Degrees. The Hollywood Roosevelt is across the street from H & H. This is a historic hotel that has been revamped into a hip, clubby Chateau Marmont wanna-be, complete with a pool area that becomes a nightclub with high security. The HBO series "Entourage" filmed here, and unless you are an "Entourage" type, you will probably be more comfortable at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay at a Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor ratings. I thought it was very good. It is modern, extremely clean, and well located. The pool has a fun view of the Hollywood-Highland mall entrance with an fun arch and a huge elephant statue. We did hear some noise one night that there was a concert at the mall. But we enjoyed the Hollywood location and took a very easy one stop ride on the subway to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Frosty53
Reviews.Content: This was the only 'bum steer' I got from this web site - all the other advice was spot on and we has a great holiday. Because it was so highly rated I decided to book it - when we arrived I was unimpressed with the foyer - the welcome was non existent and it was down hill from there - it represented really poor value for money and I would advise people with loads of cash to go upmarket and budget travellers to save their money and try the Holiday Inn up the road ( we called in and they were friendly and helpful even tho' we weren't staying there) there are lots of Comfort Inn type places. Back to the the hotel - the air con was faulty and the bathroom ended up like a sauna - to be fair the room was clean and the British concierge on day 2 was brilliant but the rest of the staff needed to learn to smile - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its reputation. Flawless checkin, spotless, roomy and quiet room, fantastic location, in other words - wow! I parked the car in the self park, and didn't move it so the price was an affordable $10/day. With all the traffic it was much faster to ride the subway or just walk. The complex where the hotel is located has some great restaurants. The pool is very good. The Highland/Hollywood intersection has some fascinating buskers dressed up as movie and cartoon characters (warning not to walk in the area at night with young kids who will be scared). The Diney store is nearby and serves great food/ice cream. Ten out of ten.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying here”
Reviews.Author: Vinolover2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Renaissance because of the reviews. Well, it didn't start off so great. When we booked the room we asked if we could possibly get an early check in and were told that shouldn't be a problem, so we drove in from Huntington Beach and arrived at around 1:00 pm and were told that it would be at least 2 more hours before our room would be ready. That is regular check in time, well our room was not even ready then. It was over 100 outside but we walked around the mall near by had some lunch, etc.. finally we got our room. It was a studio suite at $315.00 per night. It was okay, the view was of the street in front of the hotel, not so great even though they told us we would have a great view. We were on the 3rd floor. I booked a limo with the concierge to take us to dinner at Spago for our 19th anniversary. He made the arrangements, gave me the price and I in turn gave him a nice tip! Well after our 3 hour limo trip to dinner, I was over charged $104.00 The next morning I talked with the staff who made the arrangements and he said he would take care of it. Today it is 9 days later, I have made over 8 phone calls to the staff and nothing has been done!!!! My credit card was charged $408.00.............when I called this am the staff answering the phone was completely rude! I was told the staff who made the arrangements would call back in 5 minutes, still haven't heard a word. At 4:30 am we were woken up by banging and sounds of moving furniture behind our wall in the bedroom area. It went on for a couple of hours. We could not figure out what the sounds were, but needless to say, we were awake very early that day. I called the front desk and ended up speaking to the night manager. He said he didn't know what it could be, but offered 2 breakfast vouchers- WOW, that was really nice LOL!!! We were suppose to stay another night, but opted to check-out. They couldn't even offer another room because it was sold out. Come to find out, behind our room was a conference room and they were setting up for an early morning meeting, too bad for us. There was one staff person Lisa who was so wonderful!!! She knew it was our anniversary, had champagne, strawberries, cheese, etc.. sent to our room with a card. And she really was a doll! She really tried to make everything right and her customer service skills were great! Everyone at that hotel should take lessons from her. I work in the Special Events industry and supervise staff that work directly with the public. I would never allow my staff to respond and react to customers as some of these people did. Advise to those who want to stay there, go to Beverly Hills or LA, it is close and you will get so much more for your money. We spent our last night at the Four Seasons...................need I say more.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood & Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellabelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance with my wife and teenage daughter for 5 nights. Everything was A1. We even got upgraded to the 19 floor, great views of city and sign. Staff very pleasant, everything spotlessly clean. Great location, walking distance to many sights, only one metro stop to Universal Studios. Highly recommend this hotel, hopefully we'll return some day. Loved Hollywood,surprisingly. We're from Ireland where people are friendly but Californians are every bit as pleasant. Hooray for Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jaknix
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the best luck at Marriott's but I was so impressed by this hotel. The location is wonderful and close to everything. Park your car ($24 valet) and you won't need it again. Stayed here with my young daughter and felt very safe. Our room, king on the 18th floor overlooking the pool, mall, Kodak Theater and Hollywood skyline was huge. Internet is $10.99 per day which is high speed with the cord hanging in the closet?. Mini bar stocked with everything and computerized so if you touch it you buy it and they warn you that you can't keep your own things in there which is a drag for me as I like to keep water cold. No coke machines but I guess with the mall and more food choices then you would ever need they feel that takes care of a machine. Pool was tiny and packed with teenager crowds most of the day and evening. Hotel walks right into an outside mall and then onto Hollywood Walk of Fame. I will definetly visit again and would highly recommend. Received a great deal with the AOL promo code.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: TootsieWiggle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was rated number 1 on trip advisor however we were not impressed at all with the hotel or its service. Rude and cold employees... Being in the customer service industry for 20 years this is about the poorest experience I have had.. Will not stay here again. We stayed at the Fairmont in Newport prior to staying at the Renaissance and that hotel to me was 100% nicer and friendlier..

Reviews.Title: “Always reliable...........”
Reviews.Author: winechick1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for 3 times now, and it is always very consistent. It's a perfect location when visiting Los Angeles for business or pleasure. Its adjacent to a mall that has plenty of shopping, and terrific places to eat. Its in the middle of all the action, yet the hotel itself is pretty quiet, and removed from it all. The check in was flawless, and even accomodated my request for a room on a higher floor with an awesome view of downtown, and the Hollywood sign.Quinessential Los Angeles. The rooms are well appointed, and have ceiling to floor windows, to allow for the best views. The pillows are also very comfy. All in all, for the price, it is a great deal. I'll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: fiftystates
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, safe hotel close to all the Hollywood action this is the ONLY choice. I had our family booked at another hotel which was within walking distance to the Walk of Fame trying to save $$ but changed our reservation to the Renaissance Hollywood and I'm so glad I did. We drove past the other one and although it was in walking distance it was in an "undesirable" location. You just can't beat the Renaissance Hollywood for safety and cleanliness. Pay the extra $$ and enjoy your stay - I'm so glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCbella85
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a wonderful location close to shopping and restaurants. It's right near Hollywood Blvd. It was super clean and the staff was very courteous and helpful. They have cabs right there pretty much all the time too. It was really safe too. I was a 21/f traveling alone and I never felt unsafe. Highly recommened!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints .........”
Reviews.Author: joviscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days recently and the location was wonderful. Very central and close to the attractions. On the recommendations of someone here, we ate at Mels Diner just down the road instead of at the hotel. Its a lovely place. Prices are reasonable and the place is clean and the food is good. When we wanted directions to various places in Los Angeles, the hotel staff would look up the details on the computer and give us print outs and tell us what bus(es) to take or train to take. Nothing was too much bother for them. There is a business centre on the 3rd floor which you can access using your room card. You can use your cc to access the internet ($3 for 10 minutes or so) or buy credit from them. We had a "Hollywoood" sign view. The room was quiet. Would recommend it and if I am in LA again, I would most certainly book a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-April at the end of a long holiday to New Zealand & Fiji. I wanted to choose a hotel that was not too expensive but that would end our holiday on a high point. I was very pleased with my choice. The beds were almost too comfortable !! Rooms nice and spacious, we could see the Hollywood sign from our window. Bathroom relatively small but smart and clean which is fine by me. My brother was suffering from sunburn after our stay in Fiji and my 10 year old son had slipped in the shower on our last night in Fiji and hurt his ankle. We arrived at the hotel after a long and painful 11 hour flight, we were all tired and a bit miserable. At check-in the guy behind the desk asked 'how's your day been so far?' - poor guy, he asked the wrong people !! I gave him a quick summary of my walking wounded, he checked us in very quickly and politely. We went up to our rooms, the next thing I know Room Service are delivering my son milk & cookies and an ice pack for his bruised ankle !! - to my sunburnt brother they sent a pot of tea and some noodle soup to try and cheer him up - all complimentary with a note from the reception guy. That is one of the nicest things anyone has ever done for me/us at any hotel anywhere, very kind & thoughful. I can't remember his name now but top marks to him. Hotel has great location, didn't eat in hotel restaurant but did get some room service which was pretty good. Loads of places to eat within easy walk, Chinese Theatre just around the corner, all Hollywood sights and good shopping just steps away. I would agree with a previous review that information from concierge was a bit hit and miss but overall we loved this hotel and would have no hesitation in returning next time we go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in the Hollywood area. It is within walking distance to all the major attractions that you'd want to see. Try the museum right down the street, has three levels of items. Its in the old Max Factor bukiding. The whole hotel is decorated in mid century modern. Its a good touch. The beds are so comfortable. Pay extra to stay on the executive level. They serve some really good nibbles. They had some scrumptous pot stickers. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FelixStowe10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here for 2 nights at the end of May. Without doubt the main selling point for the hotel is its location - central Hollywood and close to the metro for accessing the rest of the city. Our room was of a good size and well furnished. I also used the outdoor pool on the 5th floor which had great views of the city and welcome cooling breezes. Valet parking is expensive at 24 dollars a night. There are lots of eating places nearby. We choose Mels Diner for our breakfasts and ate at the Pig and Whistle in the evening - both had character and served good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lelewillis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. My husband and I stayed for four nights. We were treated extremely well. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. We loved the location. The hotel is connected to lots of shops and restaurants. We even saw a celebrity at the hotel. If you like hotel bars, this bar looked like a lot of fun. I worked out in the gym, which was clean and nice. The pool area is great for kids and lounging. We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner. Both meals were excellent and exactly what we ordered...we also had a view of the HOLLYWOOD sign from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aero1
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 7 nights stay at this hotel, and would like to recommend it to anyone wanting a hotel right in the middle of Hollywood. Travelling with 2 kids (8 &11) we were looking for somewhere clean, safe and in a good location for the sight seeing we wanted to do, the hotel was perfect. Our room (9th floor, overlooking Highland) had views of downtown LA on clear days and the Hollywood sign to the north, was large even for the 4 of us, with ceiling to floor window. The bathroom was pretty small (but didn't spend too much time in there!) and was immaculately clean. Turn down service on return after our first hard dayof sight seeing was a perfect touch. Didn't try the buffet breakfast as a little pricey for the whole family. Instead went to Johnny Rockets which was right next door in the shopping complex, which the kids loved! Fantastic location to wonder round and do a bit of shopping after dark and still feel safe. Always something going on outside Graumans theatre, wether it was street entertainers or Captain Jack Sparrow lookalikes(who was charming!). Disney took us about an hour in rush hour to get to, 15 mins to Universal, 30 mins to Venice/SantaMonica. Valet parking was 24 dollars perday, so better off using self park(same place) with the max charge of 10 dollars per day! Couldn't fault this hotel, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: GerrardFamily
Reviews.Content: it's a 5* hotel, so it's going to be good. when we arrived it was chaos out at the front, no one around to take our bags, so we ended up putting them onto the trolley so they could valet park the car to get it out of the way! rooms were large, clean, lots of wardrobe space, and we had a view of the hollywood sign check-in was a breeze, location was great, nice friendly staff close to metro line, 1 stop to universal studios for $1.25 each way great corporate, impersonal hotel, if that's what you like.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Renaissance for 4 nights during our familly trip to the USA last year and it has been a great experience. Very nice room, nice view over the city, great location, nice restaurant, helpful employees... everything positive except maybe the swimming-pool that was a bit "sad looking" compared to the general impression given by the hotel. Worth the stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: rmartens711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Renaissance the end of March. It was a great stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived to the hotel around noon and we had no problems checking in early. The elevators in the hotel are amazingly fast, never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator. The room was unbelievable, the view was great, especially at night. There was always a lot going on in the hotel but it was quiet at the same time. I kept my eyes open for any celebrities, but I didn't see any. The shopping center that is attached to the hotel is great, lots of places to eat that are cheaper than eating in the hotel, especially Johnny Rockets. We were able to see the Chinese Theater, the walk of fame, the rock walk and go on a tour. We took the bus to Santa Monica and then rented a tandem bike and rode to Venice Beach and we did that all in 2 days!!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again, I have no complaints at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “I just loved this hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while on vacation in L.A. last summer. I was extremely pleased with everything about this hotel, there is not one thing that I could complain about. Ideal location, extra clean, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast buffet, beautiful rooms, etc. This is one place that I would return to over & over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: poppy_popster
Reviews.Content: PROS: Fast and easy check-in. Clean and nicely decorated rooms. Clean bathroom/good water pressure Comfy beds. Friendly and responsive staff Fast elevators Great centrally located location Quiet room Powerful air conditoning In room safe. Great view (Hollywood sign!!!) CONS: Maid service didn't replace little bottle of mouthwash until it was empty. (some "con", huh?) COMMENTS: We stayed for 4 nights. Quickly checked in around 11:30 PM and confirmed an earlier requested non-smoking king bed w/rollaway bed. We were given a room on the 16th floor, but it did not have the extra bed. When the bell desk brought up our luggage a few minutes later, I mentioned the rollaway bed and the polite young man said he would take care of that for us. I also mentioned that we had requested a refrigerator online. He said he would take care of that too. Within a few minutes both the extra bed and refrigerator were delivered to our room! The next morning the room darkening blinds and shades were lifted to reveal a perfect view of the famous Hollywood sign! I didn't want to pay a zillion bucks for a hotel breakfast, and we hadn't yet signed up for the "Club Level access" (more on that later) so we ate at "Mel's Diner" around the corner. Great food and very reasonable prices at Mel's! In fact, we ate there two more times for lunch and dinner during our stay. We poked around the immediate area and saw Grauman's Chinese Theatre with all the hand/footprints of the stars, saw the Hollywood walk of fame, went into a few souvenir shops, and explored the multi-level shopping complex attached to the hotel. We ate at Johnny Rockets for lunch (also decent food and reasonably priced for a touristy area). Back at the hotel I inquired at the front desk about the "Club Level" access. For $30 more per day, you can get a continental breakfast in the morning...hors douvres in the late afternoon/early evening...and desserts around 7:30pm. Only guests with "Club Level" privleges can access the 19th floor (via a card slot in the elevator) and the associated "Club Level room. The hotel upgraded my room key and we went upstairs to check it out. It was too early for "free eats" but the "Club Level" room (also acessed via a card slot) has a larger TV, newspapers, magazines, sitting area, and a fridge full of various sodas and bottled water. I went back down to the front desk to sign up for a day of hi-speed internet access at $10 per 24 hours (noon to noon). You can sign up online or in room for internet access for your entire visit, but I only wanted one day's access. They also have some type of Intenet keyboard access via the TV for those without a laptop. After a jet-lag induced nap for me, we went back to the club level for the hors douvres. They had chicken skewers, coconut shrimp, fruits/veggies/dips/nuts and cheeses. Not bad! Later that evening they had assorted pastries for dessert. The room was darkened and lit with candles for effect. The next morning we had the club level breakfast which consisted of bagels/breads/english muffins, fruits, yogurt, assorted cereals, tea, coffee, danish. muffind, etc. They also had a hot dish which was normally some type of scrambled egg ( rotated each day to including western omelet, egg quesadilla, soggy omelet "mcmuffins") All in all, I felt the "Club Level" access was well worth the $30 daily room charge (especially for a family) considering the decent breakfast selection and other food and beverage choices. Afther breakfast we were kind of in a hurry to get to Universal Studios. We had booked the Universal Studios Hollywood VIP Experience and our reservation was for 10:45. For some reason, I couldn't open the safe in our room, so I called guest services and they sent security to our room within a minutes or two ( I told them we were running late)! The security guy was very pleasant and helpful! The LA Metro is right next door to the hotel and Universal Studios is only one stop away. Very convenient! When we got back from Universal Studios around 8:45pm, we went to the Club Level for dessert. Unfortunately, all the dessert was gone and there were just a few people there watching the end of American Idol on the TV in the room. One of the people watching happened to be one of the America Idol contestants. It was Chris Daughtry! He was very nice and posed for a pic with us! The next day we did the "Movie Star's Home Tour" with Starline Tours. I was less than impressed, but my wife seemed to like it. I can't compare the tour to other tour companies, but our tour guide, Brian was fun and informative. Don't pay full price, though. When we were solicited to take the tour, the price dropped by $5 per person while we "thought" about taking the tour. All in all a fun vacation and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kiara1620
Reviews.Content: Great view, great location, great restaurant, great decor, I loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_SnobinSeattle
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay to the hotel (one night) on business. Nice rooms, with great views of the city - full wall windows with shutters (which I liked). Friendly, helpful staff (future entertainment celeb's, very attentive, well mannered and well groomed). Fantastic location if you're wanting to be in Hollywood -- near to downtown, West Hollywood, and probably one of the best locations near (but not in) the SF Valley. I didn't try the wireless (understanding that was not available?). It would be a big drawback if not available. Best thing: Starbucks right next door, a nice casual bar. Worst: I didn't care for the room lighting - cold, stark and too bright (no understatement, or decent recessed lighting). Simply my preference -- I'm a huge hotel snob, so this will stop me from staying here again if it's my choice, but other than this, absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabrice_75002
Reviews.Content: People very nice. Beautiful room with a view on the hollywood hills. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tomtom333
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend, looking for a good location to explore Hollywood, Universal Studios and on from there to other parts of LA. I looked at Trip Advisor comments for this Hotel and glad that I did. The Hotel indeed has a great location. As advised I requested a high room and was given a room on the 18th floor overlooking the Hollywood sign. The service was good and friendly. The concierge is always happy to give knowledgeable information on trips and restaurants. The rooms and bathrooms seemed recently refurbished and were very comfortable. The beds were great. The bar area is a bit soleless and the restaurant was good for breakfast, but there are better options in the attached shopping centre for evening food. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: alturner007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for several nights while working a conference, which was held at the hotel. The hotel is exceptional. Room service is reasonably price compared to other similar hotels. The staff was very nice and helpful. I used valet parking and had no problems. The several valet attendants were always available to get your car at anytime and provided fast service. The hotel's location is amazing. Many restaurants and shopping are close. The Hollywood Walk of Fame and Grauman's Theatre are one block away. You can't beat the location! The conference facilities were great. The conference staff were always present. The conference setup crew provide everything my coworker and I needed (my company had a booth at the conference). The food provided by Wolfgang Puck's restaurant was amazing! For me, it was the highlight of the conference. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Again, but left with lower expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the third time in March 2006. I enjoyed my stay, but for the first time at this hotel, I had several disappointments. I was there for 5 nights for both business and leisure. I stayed in a one bedroom suite on the thirteenth floor facing "southish" so I had a view of the city instead of the Hollywood Hills this time. The view was okay (the roof of the Kodak Theatre was right in front of me, though) and I missed seeing the Hollywood sign from my room, so I asked immediately if I could move. Even though the hotel was quite empty (compared to my prior two visits) they could not accomodate my request. That isn't that big of a deal, but I don't think the staff really tried. Also, I requested a refrigerator in my room online two days before I arrived and it wasn't there upon my arrival (another reason I felt like asking for another room). It took me three calls to the front desk to get one in my room after that! I also had to make more than one request for extra soap and towels. Immediately upon my arrival I noticed a light bulb out in my bathroom. It was quickly replaced, but you think whoever prepped the room for arrival would have noticed it. Also there was gum stuck in the bedroom carpet, which was also quickly cleaned up after I reported it. Also, the housekeeping staff varies in capability at this hotel. I tipped the same everyday, so I know that wasn't it. But on my last day the housekeeper took off the extra blanket I had put on the bed and left the heavy comforter wadded up on the floor. That night I also noticed gray marks on the edges of my bed sheets. I was too tired to report it and wait for the bed to be remaid, so I just went to sleep. I don't think the sheets were dirty, but worn sheets like that should not be put on a bed in a hotel like the Renaissance Hollywood. The housekeeper had to have noticed the marks. I valet parked everyday, which is the most convienient thing to do here. However, I ended up being charged $24 dollars a day instead of the $22 quoted. Not a big deal, but I hate suprises. The valet staff and bell-hops are extremely friendly at this hotel, unlike some of the staff at front desk. Not that anybody at the front desk was rude, just less friendly. And the concierge staff is even less friendly than they are. I think if they just think you are a tourist, they treat you a little less nice. Also, the food at the hotel is average. Whoever raves about the room service at this place must work for the hotel. It is simply ok. If you want to eat closeby you will fare better in the Hollywood and Highland Courtyard. There are good restaurants there both expensive and moderately priced. And lots of fast food choices out there also. I will stay here again because the location is EXCELLENT. However, I have lower expectations now.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Me007
Reviews.Content: The trip started off bad (wrong flight time from a web-booking service, error with exact dates of reservation at hotel) so I assumed the rest of it would be dreadful too. I was wrong. Renaissance is a great hotel, both in service and atmosphere. Check-in took all of 5 minutes (AND we were 6 hours early). The meeting halls (I was there for a conference) were large and quiet. The room was clean and decorated professionally. The resturant was large, had great food with a simple menu, and had very helpful waiters (look for Jacob; a blonde haired, thin fellow with a constant smile and some excellent tips on navigating the city). The downside to this place (which may not be bad for everybody) was both a very small gym and a smaller pool. Speaking of tips, take the Metro whenever you can. If you can't do that, rent a car (warning: Parking stinks in LA). Do NOT depend on taxis, which I did and I don't think I ever paid under $45 a trip (not including tip). Finally, if possible, avoid LAX. Without a doubt, the worst airport I've ever been in and I travel a fair amount.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and slick hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with a colleague in Jan 2006, primarily on business. Tripadvisor was the main reason for choosing this hotel and it did not disappoint. First of all, by the official rates it is not a cheap place to stay but you will probably be able to do what we did and get a really good deal. Marriott have a "look no further" price guarantee where they will beat any other room rate assuming you've already made the booking direct on the Marriott website. It is not too difficult to find a far better rate at one of the travel sites and this is what I did. You have to send a screenshot as proof but I ended up getting a 60% discount on the published rate which I was very happy with. However there was a mixup, when they applied our discount they also erased all the requests on the room type/beds/smoking etc. Luckily I spotted this a few days before departing and I must say that Marriott customer services were really excellent in getting the problem sorted out. Just be aware... So we arrived at the hotel and I'm glad that I read someone else's review because you definitely should just park at the front, check in, drop your bags off and then move the car. The car park is a little inconvenient from the hotel but we got used to it and it is absolutely HUGE with spaces always available. The 17th floor room was superb, just as expected. We were on the north side of the hotel which overlooks the hills and the Hollywood sign and it is quite a sight to wake up to. The decor and bedding were in excellent condition. We used the high speed internet access which worked great. Beds are REALLY comfortable and big which gave me a great night's sleep. Bathroom is just the same as you'd find in any hotel of this class, nothing more, nothing less. We went to breakfast in the hotel for 2 or 3 times just out of convenience. It is expensive but good. Service was not very attentive though. One morning the waiter admitted that he couldn't find our bill and kinda shrugged his shoulders! Of course when I checked the bill at the end of our stay, he had managed to find it after all. Funny that! In the adjoining mall there are several restaurants (Burgers, Italian, Pizza) which we went to in the evenings, these were fine for what they are. As you'd expect the area is touristy which isn't really my thing, at night outside the mall there isn't really that much to do so you'd probably want to drive to another part of town. So to sum up, a very slick and comfortable hotel. I would stay there again but will probably try something a little smaller and intimate next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Renaissance, the entire place was great. The rooms were beautiful, service was excellent, parking was not a problem. Very easy access to all attractions. We stayed in Feb. with two kids...couldnt ask for a nicer place, the attached mall area had anything and everything you could possibly need. I would HIGHLY recommend the Renaissance to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler3
Reviews.Content: no problems for me very quite room, clean exceptionally clean very good location. parking is reasonable close to the excitement in hollywood really nice mall adjacent to hotel which offers alot of eateries. nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: M1799999
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in December and had a great time. We got a one bedroom suite with an adjoining bedroom for our family of 6. The hotel is right next to the chinese theater and attached to the mall. The pool area was very pretty and my son actually swam because the water was nice and warm. The rooms are clean and modern. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: ClareZ24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two boys aged 10 & 8 and our friends from New Jersey stayed at the HR. We loved it found the staff helpful, fantastic location, beautiful rooms, fantastic pool, couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but horrible parking”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently next to the Kodak Theater and Grauman Chinese Theater as well as a shopping mall (on the corner of Highland Ave and Hollywood Blvd.) The rooms are very spacious with interesting decor but had a strange smell of pipe smoke (nonsmoking room) that never went away. Negative aspect: The parking situation is horrible. First, when you get into the garage you must find the elevators up. Upon reaching the third floor, you find you are in a shopping mall and must take your luggage through the mall to the side entrance of the hotel. You then must find and enter the elevator in the hotel(M level) and go down one floor to the lobby to register. You can then access your room via the same elevator you just left. Parking costs are as follows: $10 per day for no re-entry, $15 per day for unlimited re-entry, and $22 per day for valet (tips additional). I would recommend the valet service to save yourself A LOT of exercise (and don't forget something in your car or you will spend 15 minutes getting it). The pool, although we did not use it, was beautiful. Noise was not a problem except for the three gunshots we heard from a nearby nightclub shooting at 2:30 AM. Yes, the neighborhood is a bit risky. Tours: We made the mistake of taking the Starline tour of the Hollywood homes. First, the van seats 13 tourists plus driver. The windows are very low so you must slouch to see out. The person on the aisle seat sees next to nothing. Second, the stars want their privacy (understandable) so almost all homes are obscured by high gates and shrubs. This was a very long and back breaking 2 hours. My husband nicknamed it the front gate tour. Consider a limo tour before spending $35 pp on this one. Great breakfast spot: located on Highland Ave. between Hollywood Blvd and Hawthorn Ave is Mel's Diner. Reasonable and good and only a block walk from the hotel. Don't miss the Cold Stone in the mall for ice-cream. I also recommend the Warner Brothers VIP Studio Tour. The cost is $39 pp ($3 discount pp with AAA). Very interesting. We even had the pleasure of a conversation and pictures with Martin Sheen, a very gracious and entertaining man. Information Center: In the mall, next to the entrance to the Kodak Theater on the second floor is the information center. Great for maps and brochures. Pick up a map of the stars located on the Hollywood Walk-of-Fame for ease in finding your favorites if interested. This hotel is certainly one of the better ones in LA. I would stay here again regardless of the parking inconvenience because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at it's BEST”
Reviews.Author: peachberry7
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in Hollywood for Labor Day Weekend and decided (after countless hours of hotel research) to splurge and stay at the Renaissance. Needless to say, we loved the hotel! It was in a fantastic location, we had an incredible view of the LA skyline/Hollywood Hills and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. We ended up booking the Universal Studios 2-night package which basically consisted of everything we needed: accommodations, park tickets, hotel parking, and breakfast all for $469. My ONE AND ONLY complaint is that when we got the bill, the hotel had charged us DOUBLE so our bill was over $1000!! Talk about having a heart attack! The front desk lady was not too knowledgeable about the package deal, so we dealt with the issue when we returned home. I made one phone call to explain the situation, and LUCKILY there was absolutely no problem getting the money refunded. Everyone has their own hotel experience though... whether it be good or bad! So, aside from being overcharged, we had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance. I give it an A+!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here from 5th November for 7 nights. The best thing I would say about this hotel is it's excellent location. The hotel forms part of a huge complex called Hollywood & Highlands - there are shops, restaurants, bars etc all connected to the hotel. This is good as if you just want to wonder round in the evenings there it lots going on right here and it's quite safe!!! The hollywood walk of fame is right here, along with the Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre and along hollywood boulevard there is lots of street entertainment and various filming etc so there is lots to see. We had a hollwood hills view room - if it's a clear day you can see the hollywood sign from your room which is great! The room was nice - we have stayed in many luxurious hotels (such as Burj al Arab) - but we were not expecting this to be anything like that - but the room was just fine. We ate breakfast in Twist a few times at $18 per person for a breakfast buffet. It was nice but if you are looking for something cheaper go to Johnny Rockets (one of the restaurants on the complex) and you can get the ususal cooked breakfast for around $6 per person or just around the corner is Mel's Diner which does breakfast at around this price as well. For evening meals we just ate at different places around the complex, had room service a few times and just ate when we were out shopping of at Univsersal Studios. Most people say that you need a car to get around LA - however we pretty much used the buses/train the whole time we were there. You can purchase an all-day bus/metro pass for $3 per person - this is soooo good!!! We bought these nearly everyday to get around. There is a metro underground station and a bus stop (directly opposite the metro station) just around the corner from the hotel which was perfect. We used the buses and metro to get to Universal Studios (only 1 stop on the Metro - about a 4 minute journey!) - you then have to get a shuttle that takes you directly to the park itself. Next to Universal Studios is Citywalk - here there are loads of restaurants and clubs etc. It's a good idea to go to Universal Studios for the day and then go to Citywalk after to spend the evening. We also used the bus to get from hollywood to Santa Monica (Bus number 217 was our main bus - but you do have to change). It is a very good idea to get some good maps and you will start to get used to the names of the streets where the buses go. It is very easy to get around but there may be a fair amount of walking involved too! Santa Monica took about 1hr 30mins to get to - if you tried to get a cab there it would cost you a fortune - but we used our $3 bus/metro pass to get there. Of course if you are hiring a car - that would be easy too. From Santa Monica you can hire bikes at about $6 per hour and then cycle down to Venice Beach which is great - they have got Muscle Beach & basketball courts etc. We took in a lot of studio tours: Backlot tour at Universal Studios (doesn't cost anything), Sony Studios tours (paid for this in combination with a LA tour) - this was a really good tour and we bumped in Steven Speilberg on this tour!!! And we also did the Warner Brothers Studios tour. These are really good if you are into your movies and you never know who you may bump into!!! The highlight of our holiday however has to be the LA LAkERS game that we went to. The game was great and we also saw Justin Timberlake, Jack Nicholson and Matthew Perry!!! Other places to go is the Farmers Market - there is also a shopping complex behind it - this is a good place to go in the evening - has restaurants there and a cinema. The Cheesecake Factory is also located here - the food is great here and portions are massive - oh yes and the cheesecakes are fab too - they have all sorts of varieties!!! Again you can get here by bus (around 15 mins) Sunset Boulevard is another place to head too - especially at lunch times - this is when you are likely to bump into stars - we saw Holly Valance having lunch. Oh yes you have to eat in Clafoutis (I think that's how it's spelt) - this is on Sunset Boulevard and there are a couple of other little restaurants/cafes near it. I have to say the food was absolutely delicious - we ate here twice! We had things like lamp chops, garlic spagetti, spinach quiche, mushroom soup. You think it would be expensive - but we had meals for around Â£25-Â£30 in total with coffees and a desert between us!
