All in all it was a fantastic trip and we would definatley go back and we would probably stay at the Renaissance again, mainly due to its location and easy access to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood ... Renaissance!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrank
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! From the early check-in, to the clean, stylish and QUIET room. Great city and Hollywood Hills views and the best location ever. The room rate included a full breakfast at their restaurant Twist and free admission to Universal Studios. Also the restaurants in the complex (Vert and Trastevere) were excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a hotel employee myself, I know how a hotel should be operated, and this hotel has missed the boat. Other than the pool and the great location (the hotel is connected to the Kodak Theater) I cannot think of one good thing about it. Firstly the staff were not friendly and gave off a very pretentious attitude, I guess that goes with the Hollywood surroundings. Secondly when asking a young female concierge for some directions to Staples Center she was very snappy and simply exclaimed that it would take me 25 minutes to get there. Now I am not an LA expert, but I do know that getting anywhere in LA when there is a movie premiere on the same block and 50,000 people trying to get to the same arena is not going to take me 25 minutes. Luckily I followed my insitinct and left early, as it took me 50 minutes to get there. Thirdly there was no hot water in my shower, and 30 minutes later when it finally got luke warm i realised there was no fan in the bathroom and the door to the bathroom does not stay open! Its shuts automatically. So I was totally unimpressed witht the bathroom. Finally after attending the event at Staples Center, my guest and I were a bit hungry and decided to order room service, it was 11.56pm. We were answered by a recording that says that room service closes at 12pm! What sort of a hotel in downtown Hollywood closes food service at 12pm! So I called the front desk and was told to order a pizza. So would I recommend this hotel no. Unless you want pretentious people and bad service, dont take the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: rockchick
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay Oct 19-22nd. Location can't be beat...Walk of Fame, Guitar Centre, Hollywood Bowl all walking distance, and Universal Studios a quick drive, bus,shuttle or cab. I've been to Hollywood before and stayed at one of the less expensive hotels on Highland before. But found great rate here for $135/nite gov't/military rate this time. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. Check-in was excellent, and had a room with a view of the Capitol Records building and the HOLLYWOOD sign, when we could see through the smog. Room was excellent, tho near the elevators, but noise was not a factor. Comfy bed, good internet (for fee) ample towels, robes, iron, coffee maker, blow dryer, mini-bar etc. Pre-ordered room service one day. A little pricy, but service and quality were wonderful. Best meal I had in L.A. (I had little faith that it would be delivered on time nor did I expect them to get the orders correct, but they did everything right.) We had other meals at the adjacent Hollywood and Highland Complex, and Mel's. Service was almost perfect. I'm picky, so this is why I rate the place above average rather than excellent. I don't expect perfection, nor do I expect or want to be catered to by overbearing staff. But I do expect competence, effort and courtesy. As a whole, they aren't overbearing like some other more upscale hotels which is fine with me. But I should't have walked into my room to find the maid sitting and watching her stories on the tv, no matter how brief it was. Also, bellmen and valets had us running late for an important event because when we needed a cab and there was a huge crowd of people waiting outside, they told us everyone was waiting for a cab. After waiting around 10-15 minutes we realized there was an available cab waiting in line, and that the others were not waiting. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this place, and if it is in my budget, would love to stay here again should I need/want to be in Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional, great staff that made you feel very special. I have traveled extensivly and this is one of the best hotels ever. The "Twist" restaurant was wonderful, the breakfast buffet out of this world. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: velvetcrush
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA and we chose this hotel based on the rave reviews posted on Tripadvisor. Fantastic choice indeed. The check-in was quirky and friendly, as we played a "Magic Ball" game and got upgraded to an executive room on the 17th floor for a 3-night stay. We were overwhelmed by the size of the room (with a separate shower and dressing area). The view of the city from the room was lovely in the day and at night-time. The bed was so comfortable that we found it really difficult to wake up in the mornings. The bonus was the direct link to the Hollywood & Highland shopping mall with the requisite stores and restaurants, the walk of fame, Kodak Theatre and the underground Metro train (1 stop from Universal Studios), which made travelling without a car more convenient (although a car is still much recommended). We managed to take a direct bus to The Grove and Farmer's Market at a stop just outside the Gap store. Overall, this is definitely the hotel to stay for the out-of-this-world room and location. I definitely hope for a return visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Single Complaint!”
Reviews.Author: mkhollis1
Reviews.Content: This was one my favorite hotel stays by far, and I am a very picky traveler! I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would even stay here again (not something I tend to do). I went to LA on business and did a few "touristy" things in the evening. I was very pleased with the hotel and their service -- be SURE to request the fabulous turn-down service. The whimsical carpet and funky flair to the traditional furniture was a treat. Hotel is in a great location with tourist stuff in walking distance (Chinese Theatre, museums, etc.), but also several restaurants right outside door. Nice being able to go to my room after dinner, and then run downstairs to have an ice cream and stop by the oxygen bar for a pick-me-up :-) Self-parking was fine, but it is a bit of a walk to hotel if you are in a real hurry. The view from my room was also nice. Fitness center was small, but I didn't use so not sure what equipment they have. Of course, free internet is alway great to have. Thanks to the staff for making my stay so wonder!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 1 night, but it was THE best place we could have stayed! We mainly wanted to see the Chinese Theather and then go to Universal Studios the next day. (We did the 1 day Universal Package through their website.) The hotel is beautiful, and it was so conveniently located! Our hotel was connected to a really nice outdoor shopping area w/restaurants and shops where we spent our evening. It's also right next door to the Chinese Theather, where we explored all the famous handprints. It's also right on Hollywood Boulevard with all of the stars along the sidewalk, which is pretty cool to see for the first time firsthand. Hollywood Boulevard, besides these attractions, is kind of sketchy at night, so we mostly just stayed in in the outdoor shopping area, which was just fine! Our room was very nice, so we were quite pleased with that. We also had brunch in Twist - very nice atmosphere, great service..food was ok, but it did the trick. Regarding parking - if you choose to self park, it's easy to do but BE SURE to FIRST CHECK IN so that they can give you the pass to park in their section of the garage!!! We made the mistake of trying to self-park first before checking in and were thoroughly confused as to why we couldn't get into the Renaissance gated-off parking section until we decided to check in and that's when they gave us the parking pass. When we were there also, a pipe burst and they had people using the service elevators. While they did an excellent job managing this very challenging situation (which was out of their control...), I wish that they had informed the guests that if they needed to take the elevator, that they needed to locate a service elevator. We only found out because a fellow guest, who had been out in the hotel before us, told us of the situation and led us to the service elevator he'd found. But like I said, they did manage the situation rather well and were very nice and helpful in redirecting guests. I loved this hotel - one of my favorites on our 9 day CA trip - and would absolutely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: opiedro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in september after the good reviews from here. is an excellent place to stay. hotel is perfect. service very good, we asked for a fridge to be brought to the room and it was brought up very quickly. valet parkin is 22 dollars a night which isnt too bad, and they get your car quick. bed was incredibly comfortable. location is good, no real nightlife here though. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat!!”
Reviews.Author: martdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood on 9/5/05 as an overnight stop between San Diego and Las Vegas. Our goal was to get a quick taste of Hollywood and this location perfectly suited our needs! As many have noted, the hotel is located within extremely close proximity to all Hollywood Boulevard attractions. Located in the Hollywood & Highland complex, it was well kept and felt extremely safe, with the open air mall, funky bowling facility, and plenty of restaurants to occupy your time in the evening when the world outside the complex gets a bit sketchy. Valet service was lightening fast and pretty reasonable at $22, which was surprisingly cheap considering what we've paid in other metropolitan tourist areas. Front desk check in was quick and pleasant. The room itself was a typical king hotel room setup with bath, bed, tv/armoire, and desk. We had a view of the city which was very nice both at night and during the day. The decor is sort of retro, reminiscent of 50s contemporary styling. The bathroom was roomy with plenty of towels and bath products available. Everything was very clean and in good shape with the exception of the bedspread and pillow shams, which seemed a bit worn (not a big deal as we just throw it all off the bed when we sleep anyway). All the public areas are clean and have wonderful artwork on display. We had the breakfast buffet at Twist, the onsite restaurant and found it to have a good selection of quality hot & cold items, including cooked to order eggs and waffles. The service was top notch and we thought it was a pretty good value for $16 or so, even though we didn't eat a lot. All in all, this was a great hotel providing us the perfect home base for our one day visit to Hollywood. It is a great option for anyone looking to stay in or tour the Hollywood Boulevard attractions, as well as other attractions reachable by Metro as the station is extremely close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay as long as..”
Reviews.Author: Purpleguardog
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in Los Angeles, really convenient location, lovely decor, great valet service etc.etc. as long as you can deal with the unbelievably offhand reception staff. My children and I were put in a smoking room when we'd asked for no smoking and they couldn't change us, nor could they change travellers cheques and were generally pretty rude. If you can get over that (which we did) it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It Lived Up To It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at the Renaissance was pleasant. This place really lived up to it's rep. I had read all the good reviews and thought "Why not give it a try!". The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location couldn't have been better. All the brand name shops were adjacent to the hotel. It is was within walking distance to Mann's Chinese Theater, The Kodak Theater, Disney Soda Shop, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and many other popular attractions were all just steps away from the hotel. This place was worth every penny of my two nights stay. Oh yeah...I forgot to mention that heavenly bed. It was soooo comfortable I could have just stayed in bed all day watching movies. Our view was of the city skyline and believe you me it was something to see at night. The room decor was very modern contemporary-they did a fantastic job. I just made my reservations at the Renaissance for 4 nights- I was so impressed I plan on doing it again for my birthday in October. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: KayDas
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be a strong contender if you are looking for a hotel in Los Angeles. My fiancee and I stayed here for only 2 days, but the hotel has such a great location that we felt that we saw most of the key attractions. The hotel looks out on to the chinese and kodak theatres and the walk of the stars. We could see the "Hollywood" sign on the hills from our hotel bedroom, and the Universal studios is only one metro stop away (the hotel is right next to the metro). The location is central, yet absolutely peaceful and immaculately clean inside. Felt very safe here compared to some of the other areas and other hotels we saw on our visit. The room was clean and large, with internet access and complimentary coffee/tea. This hotel is really in the heart of things in Hollywood/LA and I would stay here again if I was in LA.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay If You Want To Be In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: I had a day to kill at the end of a recent business trip to LA, so I elected to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. First word of warning--try to arrive outside of rush hour, as traffic on North Highland Avenue approaching the hotel moved VERY slowly at 5:30 p.m. Upon arrival, I handed my car over to the valet ($22 a day with in & out privileges) and was immediately greeted by the front desk clerk. She quickly checked me in to my room on the club floor, but it was only after I walked away that I realized that she did not give me any information on the club floor lounge (open 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.). The room had a nice view of the LA smog--downtown was barely visible, although the Hollywood sign could be seen off to the side. The room itself was clean and decorated in a style that is intended to be modern and hip. To me, however, it came across as austere and cold (although the room does include a fish in a small bowl so as to ensure that you have a friend away from home). The room and bathroom also seemed a tad smaller than typical, although they were certainly big enough, and the all-important bed was comfortable. Room service was fine, although the hallways were lined with dirty trays--one stayed outside my room the whole time I was there. As for the hotel's location, it can't be beat--the Kodak Center is just steps away, and virtually all of the sites of interest along Hollywood Blvd. are within a convenient walk. While Hollywood is not the nicest part of LA, the Renaissance is definitely the place to stay if you want to be close to the Hollywood attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible location”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 14 and 10 year old on vacation in Hollywood, and I don't know how you could have a better location. You are right next to the Oscar theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and right on the walk of fame. Restaurants are nearby. From our room, facing the mountains, you looked right at the Hollywood sign. The rooms are large and nice, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Beautiful pool, great workout room. We actually switched to this hotel after one night somewhere else, and we were very glad we moved. You are on Hollywood BL, one block from Sunset, and a subway ride from Universal. Valet parking is very expensive ($24?). A great Hollywood experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nvelardi66
Reviews.Content: Hotel: - 1st class - excellent customer service - decor is beautiful but a little too modern for me (and i love contemporary decor!) -- everything is crisp and fine lined...just felt a little cold and not homey at all - very large spacious room (i was in an average room) - very very clean Location: - wonderful location - centrally located to everything you need! Metro train is right next door - LA is surprisingly easy to get around - Metro train only $1.50 (and that's on the honor system!!) and you can take that all the way down to Long Beach!! 1 1/2 hour lovely ride - subway system is incredibly clean and safe (i'm from NYC!) - no problems at all and everyone was very helpful --- one stop to Universal. Walk to all hollywood sites - warning: DO NOT visit the Hollywood Wax Museum! HUGE disappointment and WASTE of $14 per person - the "wax" figures look more like my 10 year old was experimenting with playdoh! horrible! - Definetely take the Starline Tours - Johnny Rockets for eats, Mels Diner, lots of free TV show tix available from street vendors right on Hollywood Blvd. FUN FUN FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lem69
Reviews.Content: Having been to many parts of the states I was always filled with trepidation about visiting LA and it never really appealed. Saw the reviews on trip advisor which commented on the standard and location of this hotel and although it was a little more expensive than we wanted to pay it turned out to be absolutely worthwhile. When we arrived we only waited at reception for approx 30 - 45 seconds before someone spoke to us and they promptly apologised for the wait !! Check in was smooth and we went off to our room to find one of the best standard rooms I've stayed in. It was superb, the furnishings were very modern and the room overlooked the pool area. The location is the real winner though. The complex that the hotel is part of is right on Hollywood boulevard, adjacent to the walk of fame. There are shops and eateries a plenty and views of the Hollywood sign and hills. On the Saturday night we went to a night club on Hollywood blvd called 'Garden of Eden' which was very cool (and is also recommended.) What made it even cooler was that when we came out of the club we were only a 10 minute walk along the blvd to our hotel. I can't praise this hotel highly enough, it made our stay in LA an excellent one and if I return I will definitely stay there again. By the way the pizza shop across the street is open late and is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!! ***Reommended*** ”
Reviews.Author: sammie66
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel!!!!!!!! We had an absolutely fantastic time in Hollywood and the Renaissance hotel was the perfect place as it was right in the centre of all things Hollywood. The rooms were very good in size, clean and air conditioned which is great after a long day in the sun. The staff were friendly, the pool not huge but never busy and the view of LA form our room was fantastic!! As for positioning you walk out of the fifth floor straight into the Hollywood and highland shopping complex which is linked to the Kodak theatre (where the oscars are held) and near Manns chinese theatre. If you go down to the ground floor level of this complex you can walk straight out onto hollywood boulevard. You are literally 3mins from all the action particularly all the premieres which are great for star spotting. You may even see a star or two in the hotel!!!!! We saw Penny Johnson Jerald, who played Sherry, President David Palmerâ€™s ex-wife in 24 on the same floor as us and Raven-Symone who played Olivia on the Cosby show and now has her own show in the states in the lobby. Plus while we were there they were running the BET music awards from the hotel - the lobby was absoultely packed with people of which some were stars although American holiday makers were recognising them but we weren't!!!. What is also nice is the majority of visitors there are American so you don't feel like part of the UK has just been moved with you on your holiday!!!! As for going out at night yes you do need to be weary in LA but this is exactly the same as if you were in London or probably any other city only difference being more gun crime but I felt safe in the vicinity of the hotel. The actual part of Hollywood boulevard outisde the Kodak and Mann's theatre I felt very safe in, even at night. One evening my boyfriend was ill and I went out on my own around 10pm to get some food and I felt completely safe!!!!! This part was quite packed with tourists every night til around midnight. All in all recommend to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: francais8900
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that our experience at the Renaissance Hollywood has made me look for Renaissance hotels in every city I visit. My husband and I spent 3 nights there in March and we booked our trip through American Airlines Vacations. Our huge picture window gave us a great view of the Hollywood sign as well as downtown LA. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was decorated in a really modern and colorful style. The lobby bar was amazing and the hotel staff were the friendliest I've encountered in the Los Angeles area. We saw several TV and film stars in and around the hotel, and the Kodak theatre is connected to the back of the Renaissance. There are shops and restaurants just outside the hotel and of course, the famous Walk of Fame. The Renaissance brings back the glamour of the golden days of Hollywood and I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grammy5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from attending my husband's conference which was based at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel at Hollywood and Highland Avenues. The hotel itself was phenomenal ... the most comfortable beds and pillows we've ever had at a hotel!! The staff was excellent and any time we talked to them about places to go and how to get there, we were given complete verbal instructions and also printed instructions! Our conference food was catered by Wolfgang Puck and it was the best ... not sure how they serve hundreds of people with piping hot food but it was perfect every time. If you have a chance to eat at one of his restaurants, do it! The food is great! The hotel is directly connected to a mall which has some high end restaurants and also some more moderate eateries. You can also walk down the famous Kodak Theater stairway and to Grauman's Chinese Theater to see the hand and foot prints of the big stars! The stars with the names on are all along the sidewalks. Having said all that, you have to realize the location you are at. The streets seem to be tourist friendly during the day, but I would be careful at night. We didn't venture too far after dark. One morning we took the bus (very reasonable!) to The Farmer's Market/The Grove for breakfast and a little shopping. We also took the bus one afternoon out to Warner Bros. studio for the VIP tour. There was some walking from where the bus left us off but it wasn't bad. (that is a great tour!) I think you just have to be prepared for the expense and also the time it takes to get to places from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gemsstock
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a stay at the Renaissance Hollywood and we have really liked it very much, the rooms are spacious, we had a view on the Hollywood sign, it was clean and the breakfast was excellent. Great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Teriffic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the start to our 5 night stay in Hollywood was awful. My fiance and I had driven to Hollywood from Las Vegas and en route stopped off in a random town half way in between Hollywood and Las Vegas called Victorville for something to eat. What I didn't found out until we had reached the Renaissance in Hollywood was that my fiance had left our passports, tickets and money on a seat in the restaurant!!!! As you can imagine I wasn't best pleased and we both started to panic. The staff on receiption at the hotel were SUPBERB and located the telephone number of this restaurant and rang around a few places and eventually located our passports. They arranged for a courier to collect our vaulables and 4 hours later we were reunited with our things. As we didn't have our room voucher the reception desk were under no obligation to check us into our room. However, i think they took pity on us and checked us in very quickly. Rooms are very modern and contemporary with a lovely comfortable bed and plenty of space. Mini bar was also a nice touch and the bathroom was also very big with very modern fixtures and fittings. The hotel restaurant "twist" is very nice and definitely worth a visit. Overall i loved this hotel and its location (right on Hollywood Boulevard) and would definitely recommend this to anyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood ! ! ! ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: smb0903
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel after a long ride from the airport by one of the shuttle buses which I would not recommend by the way, I was very impressed by the sheer style of this hotel. Our room was available right away and we were more than pleased with our room which we paid Â£115 ROOM ONLY. I can highly recommend the breakfast buffet which was an additional $12 per person. It is ideally situated in the Hollywood & Highland shopping complex as well as the usual tourist sights of Hollywood. A $3 a day bus ride will take you to Santa Monica & Beverly Hills which were great to see and a lot nicer than Hollywood which we found to be a little bit risky if venturing out on a night out of the touristy areas. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carcar_06
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the renaissance Hollywood for a short family vacation and to go to Universal Studios. I had checked a ton of different hotels, but it turned out that the Renaissance was the best pick. We got a rate of $135.00 per night with the military discount. The hotel was great! it was very clean, nice size bathrooms, great views and in a great location of the top hollywood sights! The metro is also located right outside te hotel and that is what we took to universal studios. It only took 3 min to get there, and it was only $3.00 for the entire day. The Hotel was great I could not have asked for anything else!

Reviews.Title: “High Price - High Attitude.”
Reviews.Author: gregjohnson19
Reviews.Content: I am very familiar with Marriott products and service and was extremely dissapointed with the extremely poor service I recevied at this property. The clerk was belittling and very rude, with no reason I can think of to provoke such an attitude. The service from him was, truly so disgusting I checkout that afternoon and moved to the Residence Inn Beverly Hills. Renaissances are kept to a high standard, and this property - although dark - met my expectations for a nice quiet hotel with a great location. Regardless, such an awful front desk experience has made up my mind never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service and great room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm 18 years old, and was able to experience the city of LA for 2 days, i read many reviews about many different hotels, but the R.Hollywood stood out. And i'm so happy i got to stay in such a eautiful hotel. Stayed on the 18th floor and had a beautiful view, and the room was very spacious. Great service! Stayed there for two days to do a bit a shopping in LA and the first day i shopped right nextdoor at the Hollywood + Highland centre, and also got to stroll along the hollywood walk of fame whilst shopping!! It was a fabulous location! Loved the decor. Comfy bed, especially after a long flight, and brilliant facilities. Gym, pool, internet service, and lots more! Recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone! I may be only 18, but i know style! lol. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: You'll have a hard time finding a better hotel to stay at if you are a tourist with children. Just don't let your kids venture outside of the hotel complex after dark; it doesn't feel like the safest area. Still, the Renaissance Hollywood is a great place to stay with its direct connection to the Kodak Theatre, Chinese Mandarin Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and an expanding shopping mall. The room size was just right and comfortable; the bathroom was clean, too. They're experimenting with providing a Dell home pc with Internet access, which we did not have time to use. I think I saw a Sony Play Station, too, next to the television. Again, if you are doing the Los Angeles tour thing and you have kids, then this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, more business guests than tourists”
Reviews.Author: caliwanabee
Reviews.Content: the renaissance is perfectly situated on hollywood blvd on the hollywood walk of fame. There is a metro station outside which is only one stop away from the Universal studios theme park, and the complex is right in the hub of the tourist area of hollywood. Rooms are very comfortable, and view of the hollywood sign from the pool area leaves you in no doubt of where you are. Would have loved to be able to open our window onto a balcony, to enjoy the street atmosphere from on high! (Although perhaps we wouldnt have enjoyed letting the smog in!) Taxis and food seemed to work out quite expensive, although we ate many times in Johnny Rockets 50s diner, and would thoroughly recommend them for service and value. Overall the hotel cleanliness was excellent, but we didnt use the twisters restaurant in the hotel as it looked a little above our budget. Also, if you want to email whilst away, try the internet cafe immediately across the road from the hotel entrance, we found it very cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: angelasmom
Reviews.Content: This review is very overdue, but felt I had to write for any families that are considering doing Holllywood. We stayed here on the first leg of a 12 day trip that included Hollywood, Yosemite and finally San Francisco. We had nothing planned ahead of time, and just decided to play it by ear. My husband and I traveled with our 14 year old daughter and 11 year old son. We stayed here in August of 2004 and had a great time. First of all, if you are interested in doing the whole Hollywood thing, this is the place to stay. The hotel is beautiful and clean and has a very nice workout room right off the pool area. We upgraded to the concierge level which I was glad we did, because the rooms are a bit on the small side, and the concierge lounge will give you more room to stretch out. Breakfast is served in the lounge which saves time and money, and they had snacks and drinks in the evening. The small room did not bother us, because we were on the go from morning til night taking in the sights. Keep your eyes open for stars staying in the hotel. We saw Jack Black and Will Farrell. Right outside the front door is the Walk of Fame. You can check and see who might be getting their "star" while you are there. We picked up free tickets out on the sidewalk for a taping of the Wheel of Fortune. If you have a few days, I would recommend buying the Hollywood City Pass, which gives you tickets to Universal, the Kodak Theater tour and the StarLine Movie Stars' Home Tour and the Max Factor Museum. Some of the things we loved were the Kodak Theater tour, the Graumanns Chinese theater tour, and your kids will love the Warner Bros. tour. We were able to go on the sets of several shows because they were on hiatus (Gilmore Girls, etc) and the stars' homes tour. We packed a lot of fun into four days before we took off for the calm of Yosemite.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base when in LA...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of only two properties you should consider in the central Hollywood area, should a good standard of accommodation be important to you, as well as a very central location (the other being the Roosevelt, reviewed elsewhere) I have stayed at both hotels on several occasions and each time I have visited my stay has been excellent. The Renaissance is a new-build property, visible from several miles away, just up from the junction of Hollywood and Highland. It is actually part of the Hollywood & Highland complex, which is a 4-floor collection of small stores and restaurants. This is where the only negative comment I have about the location comes in - the parking. Parking your vehicle involves using the cavernous car park serving the shopping complex. You have to drive underground 3-4 levels and park up then make your way to the elevators or the escalators and make your way up again (with your luggage, of course) to the third level of the complex, then cross through the stores and enter the hotel (still at the third level) then take a hotel elevator down to the lobby, check-in, then back up in the elevator to your room...quite a trek! Seriously consider the valet, as I do now. Once you have recovered from the parking ordeal, you will quickly concede that the hotel is amazing. The views are spectacular. Either you get the Hollywood sign or the City of Los Angeles, either view is a winner. As several other people have commented here, the windows in the rooms are floor to ceiling and several nights I went to sleep with the curtains open so I could see the city spread out below. Beautiful. Bathrooms are large and have all the amenities you would expect. There is always plenty of closet space and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. Be careful of the mini-bar though - removing an item to even look at it seems to automatically charge it to your room! The pool area at this hotel is underrated also, a good sized swimming area, plenty sun loungers and several cabanas for those really hot days. The restaurant in the hotel I have not tried in the evening however the buffet breakfast is more than adequate - plenty choice of meats/ eggs served to order, cereals, pastries and fruit and currently $16 which is not so bad for the quality of the food and surroundings. As for surroundings, the immediate vicinity can be rather seedy at night although not unsafe. And the location is terrific - you could walk uphill to the Hollywood Bowl, the Hollywood Walk of Fame runs along the front of the shopping complex, the Kodak Theatre is actually part of the complex itself, Mann's Chinese Theatre is next door to the Kodak and the Hollywood Sign looks down on the hotel from the rear. Any negative points to this property? Just the parking - if you have trouble walking, it may be an issue. However bear in mind the hotel offers a rate of $15 a day with in-and-out privileges, whereas the carpark itself only offers $10 rate per entry with no in-and-out so book with the hotel, it should work out better for you. If you are expecting class from Hollywood, do not be too disappointed. If you are expecting class from the Renaissance Hollywood, you are in luck.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Star!”
Reviews.Author: Criticaltraveller
Reviews.Content: Ceiling to floor windows ensured that the view from our room was the best it could be. The Hollywood sign and downtown LA was what we saw. It was stunning. The Venetian blinds on the windows are a different touch - nice. Everything that you would need to see in Hollywood is at this hotel's doorstep. Very convenient! The bathroom is very small, however, and that's really the only "complaint" that I would have. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! Food was great! I can't wait to return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmWest
Reviews.Content: On Wednesday, March 23, 2005, we rolled off the 101 onto Highland heading to the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel with our New York relatives - I'm a native from OC, of course, but still cynical about the whole "Hollywood" experience. However, I am also the one who invested in reading Trip Advisor reviews and actually going to the Chamberlain Suites (formerly Summerfield and being remolded at the time) and the Hyatt (the Riot aka Led Zeppelin) Hotel on Sunset, but finally choosing the Renaissance over all of them, including the Best Western across from the Hyatt and the Roosevelt across the Chinese Theatre. The bottom line is that the Renaissance is all about service and location, location, location. For starters, we had a 12th floor suite connected to a regular double standard looking out to the streets of Hollywood. Fortunately, we upgraded to use the "Club Lounge" on the 19th floor and that's where magic unfolded. Yes, we had the Hollywood sign to look at on the 19th floor, but also a cool lounge with a great plasma tv and music system not to mention this place serves breakfast and afternoon-evening dishes. But, this is also a place to meet people and where two young girls from Ohio told us about the Sandra Bullock premier that Wednesday night for Miss Congeniality at the famous Grauman's Chinese Theatre next door. We also found out that Sandra was returning the next day for her Walk of Fame Star on Hollywood Blvd right in front of the Kodak Center. We got pictures, autographs, and even spoke directly with Miss Congeniality, who, by the way, is not only nice, but also quite stunningly beautiful in person ... but Jesse James kept his back to us. George Lopez was great, too, so were all the co-stars, including Captain Kirk, William Shatner. The pool on the 5th floor was awesome for the kids, too. It's long, but not too deep, and very spread out with a huge patio area with about 4-5 cabana's and a bar area. It also had an incredible view. The work-out room was just inside on the 5th floor, too, and had 180 degree views as well. Kids, and parents, will love this hotel, the Kodak Center, and all the dressed up characters that patrol Hollywood Blvd near the center. This is not the Hollywood I went to in the early 80's to go clubbing. There are still plenty of clubs nearby, but also a great enclave for family fun and Hollywood history. The shopping is superb and first class and the ining in the center and hotel are fine, too. The "Grill" on the 4th floor of the Kodak Center is cool, too, and where the Warner Bros and entourage dined after Sandra's Star ceremony. I have to say that we were able to be flexible, but so was the hotel staff especially the manager on duty that Wednesday afternoon. We arrived early, like 2pm, but the hotel said we have a suite available at no extra charge if you don't mind smoking. Needless to say, we did, but we liked having the suite more with connecting rooms. These folks at the front desk, housekeeping and lobby area, including bell and valet, were awesome and friendly. We got calls from the front desk asking if we received our extra tooth brush and rollaway. If you have a family, it's probably the best value for the buck and the best value for entertainment within a walking distance. Check with the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce, too, for upcoming events like a premier and Walk of Fame Star. Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Hotel Hollywood Feb. 19, 2005. This hotel is fabulous! The staff was very friendly with speedy checkin. The location is great, right next to the Kodak Theatre. We had the breakfast buffet, which was superb. The hotel has self parking which is reasonable. The rooms were very nice and beds very comfortable. We even had a view of the Hollywood sign. Being a travel agent, I look for any kind of flaw a hotel might have, whether it be the hotel itself or their staff. I must say, if this hotel had one, I didn't see it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kwalsh79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renassance 3/6-3/8/05. The rooms were clean and pleasant. Check in and out was fast. The location was excellent. It was right at a mall, the Kodak theater and the famous Hollywood Blvd. The parking was easy and relatively inexpensive, you could go in and out all day long. I would definately stay at this hotel again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kingpap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel during the Academy Awards. Overall the hotel was excellent, the room was very good with a great view. Even though the hotel was completely full, and very busy due to the special event, the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: eblkcat
Reviews.Content: Got a room on short notice for the weekend of Feb. 5-7 - best hotel in Hollywood - can't beat the location. Every room has a view! For a large hotel, the staff is wonderful (especially Raj!) The decor is cool and very cool! Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Renaissance Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pool area was large and looked nice but unable to use due to weather. Gym is standard i.e. 4 treadmills, 2 elliptical & 3 cycles, minimal nautilus low end hand weights. No continental breakfast. Radio in room has cd player. Rooms really small in floor space and in height. My husband 5'11 hit the ceiling w/ his hands while putting on his shirt. A bit claustrophobic. No ventilation. Had a smoking room and couldn't stand it. Went outside to smoke. Internet $9.00/day. DO NOT even touch the mini bar. If you even pick up an item to look at it, your electronically billed for the item. If you use the item and replace, you will be billed 2x. Area is major tourist and safe during the day. A homeless guy works the corner by the hotel everyday. Very awkward to pass him daily. You will be asked for money buy vendors and homeless. Area is extremely expensive. Went to a little grocery to buy cokes and a 6 pack of coke was $5.99. Went to lunch at average place got 2 hamburgers, 1 iced tea, 1 appetizer and bill total $39.00 plus tip. A $45.00 lunch. So be prepared to spend. Lots of tattoo places, erotic clothing, sex shops for s&m, porn clothing/shoes, leather clothing and drug/smoking paraphanelia . If that's your thing, you'll have a great time. In summary, hotel was average and area was rated R.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at this hotel and really enjoyed our time there. The hotel's location is wonderful -- near all of the Hollywood sights, but with easy access to the rest of the city. Being adjacent to the Hollywood and Highland complex is a huge advantage as there are a number of wonderful restaurants and shops connected to the hotel. The rooms are large and some have great views of the Hollywood sign. The decor is minimalist/modern, but still comfortable. Our room had a separate dressing room and bathroom and a small seating area. The bath towels are very soft and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigibebek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 day meeting and it was perfect. I checked in early on a holiday(8 AM) and they had a great room available. Corner room with nice decor, clean and quiet! it would be great for a vacation to sightsee in LA or business.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: HGC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a family vacation during the Christmas break based on reviews I read on this site, and its close proximity to public transportation. My cousin who is from LA cautioned me about the Hollywood location. Based on her safety concerns, we decided to rent a car, parked at the hotel with in and out privileges for $15/day and found it to be a great central location to all the LA sites. Everything was at our finger tips. The connecting mall which has a visitors information center, great restaurants and shops met all our needs. The rooms may not be plush by Beverly Hills standard, but the decor is retro chic and not meant to be. Most important, our room was clean, huge, and had the Hollywood Hills for a view. With the many tourists in the area and the connecting upscale mall, we didn't feel threatened by any safety concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for $75.00 a night over Thanksgiving, thus we paid half of the lowest price we could find ($149) anywhere online. We were a bit unsure of how we'd be treated since we had gotten our room for such a bargain, but we were treated by the most courteous of staff from the valet to the receptionist, to the maid, and were given a very nice room with a beautiful view. Our room overlooked Hollywood Hills and it was breathtaking at night and by day you could view the Hollywood sign. When we arrived a film crew from DreamWorks was filming a scene for an upcoming movie. It was incredibly cool to be able to watch it all. The movie crew and hotel staff were very open to let us watch as long as we wanted. My son even got an autograph from the film director, Wes Craven. As far as ammenities, the workout gym is nice, however we wish there had been a sauna and jacuzzi. If there was one, we couldn't find it. The pool was outdoors, so it was too cool to enjoy that. The room was extremely nice, with beautiful furnishings. The hotel is connected to a shopping mall, which is connected to the Kodak Theater (Academy Awards) and is right in the middle of the Hollywood Walk of Fame. We had one problem, with a bar bill for liquor we never used from the in-room vending machine, but the hotel took it off our bill without any questions when we told them we had never used the vending machine, and had kept it locked. They really could not have been nicer to us. I would go back to this hotel again. I was not crazy about Hollywood itself, but since we were visiting relatives in the area, it was not the city we were there to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: mdvip
Reviews.Content: What this hotel does well, it does really well - quick and friendly check-in, and a beautiful, large, airy and nicely decorated room. Good bathroom and dressing room, large TV, quiet and effective aircon and 'same day' laundry service that really was same day. The restaurant was also good for breakfast, if a little pricey. Location was fine - handy for Universal Studios - but be aware that Hollywood is pretty seedy. Downsides? Well the maid cleaned the room OK, ie. she dusted, vacuumed and changed the towels, but someone really ought to teach her that making a bed involves more than just ensuring the top cover looks straight. Empty mineral water bottles seemed to offend her as well, as these were left to build into quite a considerable collection by the time we left. The bar was fine, but really would have benefited from staff with a slightly better grasp of English who knew how to smile from time to time. Think we'd try something around Beverly Hills next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am stunned by the positive reactions about this hotel. The rooms were very basic and everything that could be broken in my room, was. The phone, the TV, Internet access, and no hot water. The hotel management had every engineer in my room at one time or another and when they TWICE offered to move me to another room, I packed up and then they told me the other room had already been taken. Appallingly horrific experience, they comped my entire stay, and I will *never* stay there again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: sherjoe
Reviews.Content: I know this is very late, but my husband and I stayed at this hotel in Jan 2004. Our first night we stepped outside the hotel in to a movie premiere at the Chinese theatre for "Along Came Polly" I saw so many celebrities including Jennifer Aniston, Ben Stiller and Matthew Perry who strolled right in front of me to get to the red carpet. The service was great, room very clean, great view of the hollywood sign. And the location was perfect. It is connected to great shops and restaurants also the Kodak theatre (where the Oscars are held) and the Chinese theatre as well as the Walk of Fame. We took a tour of the stars homes from the Chinese theatre and had a car as well so we could take our own ride through the hills. Very close drive to Universal Studios and and to CBS studios and Warner Brothers studios where we went to tapings of 2 sitcoms, Still Standing and Everybody loves Raymond. Also not a long ride (depending on traffic) to downtown LA where we went to a Laker game. I would hightly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bilti
Reviews.Content: Brilliant loved the place, myself, my wife and 14 year old son arrived at about 9.00PM after a long drive having spent the previous night on a ranch in Arizona and looking like the Beverly hillbillies we were welcomed and shown to our room which was great, in the morning looked out of the window and there was the Hollywood sign up on the hill couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an exciting property. Fashionable, vibrant, interesting. Right down to the goldfish in the rooms. But location is not good and traffic is miserable. If you are a foreign tourist and want to see all the Hollywood sights, you will enjoy this hotel. If you are a family on a California vacation, you may be put off by the location. Stay somewhere where it's easier to park. If you are a business traveler (not in the movie industry), avoid at all costs. Too much hassle getting in and out. Self parking is a confusing hike through a big, bloated mall. I've stayed at the Manhattan Beach Marriott and recommend it as a home base. Close to LAX, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Inside, Wild Outside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In short - great hotel but a difficult location. Location: Hollywood & Highland complex was a little TOO central for my taste. The action - especially on the weekend I was there - was nonstop. This could be invigorating if you're in your mid-20s and seeking adventure. For me, the constant noise and traffic was a real disincentive to leave the hotel. Trying to get back into the hotel at 10 p.m. Saturday night was an exercise in futility - it took 75 minutes just to get through two blocks around the hotel due to the pedestrian & auto traffic!!! Couldn't get back out once I got in - so the location really adversely affected my flexibility in using it as a home base. Hotel: GREAT. Staff was super friendly, the TWIST brunch was one of the best ever - selection and quality - and the room itself was well appointed. Blinds and black out shades are a nice touch to keep the room appropriately lighted. Be careful of the silly snack bar mechanism - it will charge you for simply moving or adjusting the items on it. Also - at this level of hotel, high speed internet and/or wi-fi should be included in the rate, rather than an add-on charge. Overall - great place to stay if you don't plan on seeing much else of the city or its nightclubs. The clubbing crowd is at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good - not as good as we thought it would be...”
Reviews.Author: ekerr19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for a wedding... room was nice. Asked for non-smoking was on a smoking floor, though hotel says otherwise - the smell of smoke was overwhelming. I highly recommend the valet parking if you have a car - very worth the money. The staff are the best part of this establishment, though the room service food is a close second. There were a couple of minor glitches, though nothing to prevent us from staying here again. One other note: The hanging bar in the closet is really low for some strange reason - because we were in town for a wedding, we had floor length gowns, they did not hang properly (dragged on floor by about 6-8 inches), nor was there any other place to hang them.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: writerguyfl
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research and finally decided on the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. It is located in the Hollywood & Highland complex, which makes it a great spot. The complex includes many restaurants, shops, as well as the Kodak Theatre and the studios for Ryan Seacrest On-Air. There are many positives about the hotel. The staff was very professional. I especially appreciated that the Housekeeping staff all said hello in the hallways. That is always a plus in my book. The rooms are good sized. I was in a king bed room with a view towards Downtown LA on the 10th floor. The design of the hotel is modern, but not to the extent where anything is too weird. The windows have wooden blinds and nice blackout shades. The linens on the bed could be softer, but the bed had 7 pillows. Since the hotel is relatively new, I expected more from the bathroom. It is nothing special. I had hoped for a separate water closet or even a separate bath/shower. Also, it is odd that the bathroom has no active fan so the mirror instantly fogs. The one vent in the shower doesn't do enough to exhaust the steam. It is important to note that the hotel and Hollywood & Highland in general are NOT in the best area. I've lived in Downtown and urban areas most of my life. The run-down buildings that surround the complex didn't bother me. However, I walked about seven blocks to the Pantages Theatre and saw my share of homeless, hookers, and many boarded up storefronts. Not everyone will fell comfortable walking off the complex. If you are used to suburbia, you may want to consider another area in town and make a day trip to Hollywood Blvd. All in all, I will stay at the Renaissance Hotel Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: chemicalsuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and it is a fantastic hotel. We had a room on the 23rd floor, state of the art, with a view of the "Hollywood" sign and also downtown LA, visible thru a huge window at one side of the room. The service was excellent, if a little mechanical and LA- manicure style (and thats just the guys!). Great location next to the Kodak theatre (home of the Oscars) and Manns Chinese Theatre, walk of fame etc, and the historic Musso & Frank's grill is just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood is a pretty hotel in a trendy, glitzy sort of way (a friend of mine found it pretentious). Because it's the tallest building in Hollywood and sits at the base of the hills, you can get tremendous views--my room overlooked the city as well as some enormous movie billboards. No complaints about the service, though staff's apparently been told to say they're "delighted" to do things, which comes out sounding mechanical and silly, as any formula would. My room size was adequate, not tiny, not huge. I came for a conference and the room rate averaged $180 per night (+14% tax). Unless you're routinely in the luxe bracket that's too much to spend--there are better bargains in LA. The location is interesting and unusual, especially for LA. Hollywood Boulevard is very walkable, block after block of storefronts, even if a fair number are tatoo and lingerie shops. In many cities, you'd take that walkability for granted, but not in LA. The neighborhood is a remarkable mix of culture and sleaze. The percentage of "regular people" on the street is much higher than it used to be, but you are likely to encounter some street people. It's probably the leading entertainment location in LA now--plays, movies, clubs. The nearest substantial grocery store is about 3/4 mile away, a real drawback. As some previous posts have mentioned, public transit is excellent. There's not only the subway which goes Downtown, but a slew of nearby buses to take you along Sunset Blvd., over to the Farmers Market and County Museum, and into interesting nearby neighborhoods. You may still want a car or you could save money by renting a car part of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: nevermissBoston
Reviews.Content: We arrived before check in time. We had plans to check our bags and come back later to check in. They told us our room was ready and we could check in at noon!! We were exhausted from our flight and this was a welcoming gesture. The rooms are large and clean as is the bathroom. There was a "Star Trek" convention taking place at the Hotel. The hotel is so large we did not see or hear the crowds. The service is outstanding. All those at the front desk went out of their way. My only complaint was due to the Star Trek convention, they closed off the drive way. We were not informed of this and had some challenges getting our ride to find us to go to our daughters wedding!!!! Communication is everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie90210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of September for 3 nights and is a lovely hotel, large rooms, helpful staff and very clean and modern. Unfortunately we got a room on the 4th floor with barely a view to speak of, but thats minor really. The best bit was breakfast in the Twist bar. Pancakes, waffles, danish , toast, fruit, cereals, all the fried stuff and a complimentary smoothie. Fantastic. OK, so the hotel is great but the location if you dont have a car is not good at all. Do not go to LA if you dont have wheels because its so large and spread out and the public transport is pointless. Although you have the chinese theatre outside, thats it. I wouldnt walk about in this area alone, especially at night and to get anywhere else is an expensive cab ride away. If you can afford it, stay in Beverly Hills. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow... what an experience. We all commented that we have NEVER been treated so well by a hotel staff anywhere! Everyone was so helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and fully supplied (with a whole extra basket of towels... oh, the luxury!), the valet parking attendants retrieved the car instantly and even handed us cold bottles of water every time we headed out... it was wonderful. The location couldn't be better, especially if you're going to an event at the Kodak Theatre, which you can access without even going out on the street. The AAA package included our valet parking AND the "continental breakfast" buffet, which had everything you could possibly want! The ONLY negative thing I could possibly say is that there were no refridgerators in the rooms for keeping our own drinks and doggie bags (fortunately with the small portions the L.A. restaurants serve, that was rarely a problem!). The fridges in the rooms are completely stocked with drinks and snacks for sale, but be sure to read the fine print: If you take something out to look at it, you get billed for it! Otherwise, an awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, but don't request a cot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near all the tourist sites, this is the hotel for you. It's connected to the Hollywood & Highland shopping complex, so Starbucks, Johnny Rockets and a Sephora are a stone's throw away. The hotel has very nice rooms and a decent swimming pool which we never used because we were too busy exploring LA. The only downside to this hotel is that while guests can request a cot when making reservations, they do not guarantee a cot. My 19-year-old son had to sleep on the floor the first night because they failed to locate a cot after promising us one at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! The rooms are so clean and well kept. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Wonderful.. I stayed there as part of a trade show, and it was perfect. Service was great, view was great..

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: SusanCoh
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons and I just spent 2 nights of our California vacation at the Hollywood Renaissance. What a beautiful hotel...an awesome location...and a great experience. Our two room suite was perfect. Plenty of room for all of us to spread out. The location of the hotel in the Hollywood and Highland complex was wonderful with plenty of places to shop and eat. The accesibility of tourist attractions was also a plus...you're right in the middle of everything. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly, we were made to feel very comfortable in every way. The pool area was also very nice. One afternoon my husband and I were enjoying the pool and as I relaxed in one of the chaise lounges sipping my Wolfgang Puck Mai Tai I turned my head to the right and I was looking right at the famous Hollywood sign. All I can say is, "WOW"!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Judee512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel for three nights during July 2004. I can't say enough about this great hotel and the exceptional staff. The valet service was the best. Our view of the Hollywood Hills was breathtaking. The rooms were very spacious and extra clean. Everything about it was wonderful. I'm so happy that we chose this hotel, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Renaissance Hollywood over the Beverly Hilton (after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor) for our honeymoon in LA, and I'm really glad that we did!!!!! This hotel is superb. We had a speedy check-in and were helped by a team of really keen and enthusiastic staff. We were greeted by a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room which had a view of the Hollywood sign, Geffin Park Observatory and the Capitol Records tower - such a lovely treat after a 10 hour flight from London Heathrow!! What can I say about the hotel that hasn't already been said in all the other reviews?... it's clean, spacious, virtually brand new, the rooms and the hotel in general are really well equipped and the staff are always "delighted" to help in any way they can. Can it get any better?... well to top it off you're right smack in the centre of everything with the Kodak Theatre, Manns Chinese Theatre, The Walk Of Fame, the excellent Hollywood and Highland Shopping mall (with some great eateries!!!) right on your doorstep - literally (just to mention a few of the many attractions that are within walking distance!!). The Metro underground rail station is pretty much on your doorstep too and you're only one stop from Universal Studios!! We packed loads of stuff into our honeymoon and we found the Renaissance to be the perfect base to allow us to see all the attractions and landmarks that we wanted - all within either walking distance or a reasonably cheap taxi fair ($5 - $25) away. We found the hotel and the Hollywood and Highland complex to have a really pleasant atmosphere to come back and relax in after a day of sightseeing. We felt like the Renaissance was our "home" for the fortnight and we were really sad to be leaving it behind after such a fantastic stay - definitely the trip of a lifetime and a honeymoon to remember! If you want to see the landmarks of Hollywood - this is DEFINITELY THE HOTEL FOR YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: North_Wales_Lass
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting LA, this has to be the place to stay! The hotel is gorgeous, spacious rooms, a fabulous view of the Hollywood sign, comfy beds and well air-conditioned rooms. The staff were helpful and friendly (apart from the lady in the shop, she tried to short-change me in the shop, and she wouldn't listen to me. Took my mum to persuade her otherwise!), especially in the restaurant. Lovely food there, but a bit pricey and the menu isn't exactly varied. Although, there are lovely places in the Hollywood and Highland complex, which you can get into through a short walkway in the hotel. Some evenings there are VERY LOUD bands playing different music, and there is a very relaxed and safe atmosphere there at night unlike Hollyowwd 3 years ago when we never ventured out of the hotel after 8pm! The metro is about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel, and it's extremely cheap to get a train to Universal Studios, then it's just a short walk to a shuttle stop to get to the park. If you do decide to visit Universal, it may be worthwhile buying a queue-jumping ticket which allows you to get in the front of the line of every ride and show, and gives you reserved seats at all shows, although it may be worthwhile getting to shows a little while before it says to get there on the ticket, especially if it's a busy day. Although it's $50 more than a standard ticket, it's definately worth the money!!! Chinese Mann's Theatre is a short walk away, as is the Walk of Fame and the Kodak theatre. If you wish to visit the latter, visit the leaflet stand at the hotel, as there is a discount voucher there. When we went, it was a quite day so we got to sit in the chairs that celebrities sat in, and we also got to stand on the stage! This hotel is definately worth a visit once!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend there in June for my wife's birthday. We have lived in California all of our lives but never did the "Hollywood Thing". So I found a great deal on their website that included two nights and two day access to Universal studios. It also included breakfast each mornging and parking. It was a great deal. We got to the hotel late and I asked if there was any room upgrade. They were able to bump us up to the deluxe room which was great. We didn't have a great view but that was ok. The room was big and had a nice sitting area. I loved the decor. IT was modern and very unique. The room was very clean and looked very new. The bed was really really comfortable with more than enough pillows. I could have slept all day. I loved "Twist", breakfast was really good. You must try the smoothies. The enviornment is great for a weekend getaway. Lots of good places to eat nearby. My only complaint was that I wanted to take advantage of the free shoe shine. I called multiple times and they kept promising someone would pick up my shoes but then never came. I complained about this and got free drinks instead. Otherwise a great/hip hotel to spend the weekend at. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance was great”
Reviews.Author: Nell23
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was great - fun dÃ©cor, great view, great toiletries. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful with information. The location is wonderful just because you have easy access to everything. From what I saw of LA, it's not a walking town anyway so you may as well be close to the things you want to do. There are lots of food choices at Hollywood and Highland, Ryan Seacrest is right there (although we didn't get in as it was Ashley Simpson day). The pool area is great and we were able to see Ryan Seacrest filming promotional stuff in the courtyard from the 5th floor pool. Graumann's is right next door. Great view of the Hollywood sign. Loved the Warner Brothers tour (15 min. drive). Great hotel but glad to leave Hollywood after 2 days (traffic is a nightmare).

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: ClaireR
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here recently and was incredibly impressed with the hotel. Funky and modern throughout it was a wonderful place to stay. It's right next door to the Kodak theatre shopping complex and the Graumanns Chinese Theatre. Rooms are all very well appointed and the higher up you are the better the view of the city and the Hollywood hills. The pool is also a massive plus especially with the warm weather of LA. It's a good place to do some star spotting, Avril Lavigne was there at the same time as us. The only problem is that without a car it was very difficult to get around LA. To get most places you will either have to walk or take several buses. However, the hotel was a lovely place to relax and take things easy and get a taste of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Modern fun and funky decor. The entire Hollywood and Highland complex is a great edition to the Hollywood area. As a return visitor to LA what a change this area has undergone. Whilst it is an area clearly catering for tourists its a good location for a first timer to base themselves in spreadout LA. The rooms were huge and I had a great view of downtown LA and the Hollywood sign from the 19th floor. I nearly drowned in bath towels - so many were supplied in my bath room. My only complaint I couldnt store anything in the hotel fridge, if you took anything out of the mini bar you were charged. I like to have real milk in my coffee not the powdered stuff. So that was a bit of a pain. If you are into American Idol this is the place to be. The 12 days I was staying coincided with the American Idol finals and whilst I am not a fan of the show (wrong age bracket) if you are a fan you would have seen many of the Idol contestants and the judges coming in and out of the hotel. In fact if you are into doing the whole "Hollywood" thing celebrity spotting etc this is the hotel for you. The premiere of Raising Helen with Kate Hudson was across the road at the beautiful El Capitan theatre while I was staying. Transport has improved tenfold since my last visit with the Metro being built. There is a stop at Hollywood and Highland. Its one stop away from Universal Studios. I found it was a clean safe and easy way to get around. Apart from the non existent personality of the guy at check in, I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. (Maybe he was having a bad day or was rehearsing his starring role as Marcel Marceau!) A great place to stay in a good location. I note the comments of others about the area being seedy after dark I cant say I noticed anything unusual when I was out and about in the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Room was exceptionally nice; amenities, bedding & furnishings first class. Several movie stars were in the hotel along with us! It is adjacent to the Kodak Theatre and a mall. Although a high touristy area, it is rough at night. Stay in after dark.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property should be listed as a flagship of Renaissance properties. As a Marriott Rewards member..I look forward to staying at all their brands because of the consistancy. This property is a shining example of what a hotel should be. Location, friendly staff, great design (loved the tashen lamps in "twist". Parking is a nightmare and I suggest self parking at the ramp the connects the Renaissance, Manns Chineese, and the mall. It's 12.00 a day with in/out priv. versus the valet parking at 28.00 plus tip! The food is gteat at "Twist" and is worth the cost. There is, hoever a huge mall connected to the hotel and provised fine dining and fast food fare for those of us who are on a budget. FYI the pool area is cool but is NOT owned by the hotel. Wolfgang Puck owns it and rents it out for parties. While I was there the noise was so loud into the wee hours of the morning due to a HOOTERS convention. I was assured that this is not a regulat occurance and adfter a call to the front desk, it quieted down. Views of the city are great, vast, and plentyful with help of the panoramic windows in every roon..but beware they do not open so one is forced to breather dry, recycled air :) Guess thats a positive considering it LA! DO STAY at this hotel, you'll love it! Oh the subway stops right below the hotel so getting places like Universal are easier than ever and cheaper considering that parking at Universal is 12.00! The subway is 1.25 one way and brings you right to the Universal City stop where a shuttle brings you to the theme park. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but had something a little strange”
Reviews.Author: davsyd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are very modern, spacious and have a very clean feel about them. We also had a great view of the street and the hollywood sign. The only strange thing that happened was when we first arrived to our room there was old room service plates, cups, trays etc.. outside our room-door. We just ignored it and then went out for dinner and came back about 4 hours later and it was still there. Apart from this little hiccup the hotel is wonderful. The location is excellent with direct access into the Highland Shopping Complex, that also leads staright to the new metro system that got us to Universal Studios in about 5 mins. The hotel is expensive compared to say the Holiday Inn up the road but it is worth it. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while your away in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a chance to see stars, stay in a location that allows you to take inexpensive (public) transportation and don't mind small shop food, this is the perfect location. Check out what previews are happing at either the Kodak or Mann Theaters. Take the train to Universal Studios for the day. Rent a car for 1 day and go to Warner Bros. Studio (A MUST SEE). The small food shops in the Mall had good mexican food and pizza and the coffee shop on the second floor was excellent. They also offer a great fruit salad. You can take a bus to the Farmers Market and Rodeo Drive and the LeBrea Tar Pits/ Art Museum. All in all - Burger King and McD's were short walks for Breakfast and the many unique characters at night made for a most entertaining stay. We were also in a filming of JAG (in the Mall) and we were almost run over by the many stars from "The Rock"'s Walking Tall movie premier, including Michael Clarke Duncan & Natasha Henstridge. WOW. If we go back - my wife and 2 teenage daughters, we would certainly stay at the Renaissance. Did I mention that the view from the hotel of Hollywood Hill was incredible and the the room was clean and service exceptional - everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful - pros outnumber cons”
Reviews.Author: Foxpro
Reviews.Content: We (my girlfriend and I) stayed at this hotel from 4/6/04 to 4/9/04. I booked online through swa vactions so basically, it was about $200.00 cheaper than booking the flight/hotel separately. When we got there, I asked about upgrading to the executive suite since it has an "oversized" bathroom. They upgraded me for free (even after I said I would pay the difference). Our room was on the Hollywood Hills side (where you can see the Hollywood sign from your room). The reception group (bellmen, concierge, the entire staff) could not have been nicer. We are not rich by any means, and I'm sure the staff at the hotel could tell that, but they never looked down upon us. Some people have said some things about the service, but I can't complain at all. We tipped housekeeping $4.00 a night (I don't know how much you're supposed to tip - I usually just do $2.00, but since we had a bigger room...) Even then, I don't know if that's high, low, good enough??? We planned on going to Universal Studios, seeing Ryan Seacrest On-Air, and hoping to catch a glimpse of stars (The Whole Ten Yards premiere was at the Graumann's Chinese Theatre while we were there). If you go to see Ryan, get there by 7:30. We went 2 days and barely got in the first day (7:30 arrival in line). The next day, I got in line at 7:00 and was 6th in line (sat front row-make a creative sign and they'll sit you up front). Ok, back to the hotel. The bathroom in the executive suite is oversized, but basically, they just added a table along the opposite wall from the sink. The problem is this: I was hoping for 2 sinks - there was plenty of room for 2. Plus, I was hoping for a separate shower. Once again, there was plenty of room for this. This suite was definitely bigger than a regular room, but no big deal. In order to watch TV, you basically had to move the couch to be in front of it; otherwise, you had to watch it from an angle (from the bed or the couch). They had a chair that faced the TV, but if more than 1 person wants to watch TV, then this layout is useless. Still though, it was great, and in the end, the 2 sink thing and separate shower thing didn't bother me. This hotel is in an absolutely perfect location. We did not rent a car since we didn't need to go sightseeing outside of the area. Some people say you should rent a car, others say no need. If you don't mind spending $20.00 a day to park your car at the hotel plus the rental fees for the car, plus paying for parking many other places you go, then go ahead and rent a car. We ended up spending $100.00 total for a cab. The subway ($1.25 per person per trip or $3.50 per person all day) is 1 stop (5 minutes) away from Universal Studios - and it's not "scary" to ride. All in all, the money spent on this hotel was well worth it. We planned this trip perfectly. The Whole Ten Yards premiere was on 4/7/04 at the Graumann's Chinese Theatre (right by the hotel). We saw Bruce Willis, Matthew Perry, Natasha Henstridge, Amanda Peet, and many others. Matthew Perry even gave us his autograph. We also saw John Travolta and Uma Thurman shooting on the set of Be Cool (they were shooting in front of the Graumann's Theatre). Like I said before - PERFECT LOCATION.Pros: Many things are very very close by: The walk of fame Graumann's Chinese Theatre (where premieres are held) Kodak Theatre Numerous shops and restaurants (best eatery is Fresh Fire Kabobs - don't miss it!!!! Johnny Rocket's wasn't all that good. Metro Railway (subway) - goes to downtown LA, Universal, many other places - even within free shuttle distance of LAX (we used it for Universal only) Ryan Seacrest On-Air Cons: 1. Twist Restaurant at breakfast. We ate there on our last day - $16.00 each for the buffet (including drinks). Unfortunately, our waiter never came back to refill my OJ - he actually didn't show up again until he brought the check. He didn't care that we were there. We should have gone across the street to get donuts. 2. $40-$50 for the cab ride to/from the airport (LAX). This is true, of course, for anything since LA is 30 miles away from LAX. Burbank Airport is closer, so you might want to look into that airport.All in all, I give this 5 stars - You can't beat it. It is absolutely the best hotel I've stayed in (of course, it costs more than any other hotel I've been in). We don't stay in $60 hotels any more - they suck. I find hotels that cost $90 or more. This one is $200 a night. Well worth it. When I go back to Hollywood, I have no doubt where I'll stay. Make sure and tip the guys (bellmen, housekeeping, etc.) - It's not that much money, and they remember you! The receptionist (Gerald) that checked us in even remembered my name 3 days later - awesome job!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: canadianvacationer
Reviews.Content: Wow, We were upgraded to a suite (due to a pre booking expense charged in error) and were quite happy to find us in a large 1000 sq foot suite overlooking the pool and kodak theatre. We found the location superb you are really only 10 minutes from Universal Studios / Warner Brothers etc. Grohmans Theatre with it's movie stars hand imprinted concrete displays along hollywood blvd. is attached to the hotel via a hugh shopping complex. Great place to shop and eat. The 2 day Universal package was a great deal and you can upgrade it at Universal for a slightly higher fee. The hotel staff were friendly and responsive. The only thing I did not like is all the bell hops and car staff are always looking for tips. By the time we got to our room 4 different people handled our luggage and each expected a tip. I didn't tip them all. Watch if you wander around Hollywood blvd after dark as the strip turns seedy. During the day no problems. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a few little things let it down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here in February. This hotel is just gorgeous - very clean, modern and unique, great view and HUGE comfortable beds. One of the loveliest actual hotels I've stayed in. There were only a few minor things that made it a little less than perfect. 1. After our first night we did not tip housekeeping (it was our first night in the USA, we'd arrived late, were very jetlagged and unaware of this custom) and when we arrived back that night our TV was unplugged, toiletries were not replaced and one of the bathrobes was missing (which I was almost charged $55 for!). Could be just a coincidence though... 2. Messy room service trolleys from neighbouring rooms were not cleared for at least 12 hours. 3. Front desk were not exactly friendly and definately below US standards. 4. The neighbourhood is still a little seedy after the tourists have gone. We went into McDonalds after hours and were in the presence of some 'interesting' people. One other little thing - beware of the sensored mini bar that registers a charge if you pick something up to read it (although it was not that expensive).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really hate staying at hotels, because, I'll admit it, I'm a germophobe. Hotels always give me the creeps, because they're never REALLY clean. But this is the CLEANEST, most bright and sparkling hotel I have ever been to. The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are new, everything was perfect. I will definitely stay there any time I go to Hollywood. I am so glad that I came here and read all the reviews, becuse now I have found a gem.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Hollywood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1755 N Highland Ave, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
